Cannon Ball is a classic Comic Book War Game with a Civil War theme. The Comic Book Ad claims the game was dedicated to the "Fighting Heroes" of the Battle of Chickamauga,where "34,400 troops were killed or wounded." Cannon Ball seems to have included 64 3D Toy Soldiers representing Blue & Grey Civil War Troops; as well as a Playmat and multiple Accessories such as "Exploding Bridges" (these were small hard plastic pieces which were triggered by rubber band tension, similar to the Tank Trap War Game's "Exploding Tanks.") The Troops of Cannon Ball were evidently made by GIANT in Hong Kong. However, it has also been suggested that some versions of the Game featured generic/non-brand-name Troops clearly made with the same GIANT molds but not stamped with the GIANT logo.

name: 200 Miles from Moscow
description:
By September, 1919, Denikin's elite Volunteer Army armed with the latest technology for its time ( Mk V, Whippet Tanks, DH9A bombers, Armor Cars ) had reached the infamous city of Kursk. The next stop was Orel. Then Tula and finally, Moscow! Its 25,000 well trained soldiers were equal in training to a British infantry division were opposed by the Bolshevik 13th and 14th Armies. A collection of polyglot men with dubious training and questionable morale. Some 60,000 of them. Time was running out as the Fall weather set in, both sides knew it. Lenin and Trotsky began the ultimate propaganda campaign to stir the emotions of the peasant workers. Free food and clothing was the lure to fight. Thousands enlisted. For Denikin, he instinctively knew time was short for a variety of reasons and thus launched the, "To Moscow" offensive on Oct 6th. The White player will also feel the pressure of time. The Red player will toss anything and everything to delay and play for time!
200 Miles covers this epic offensive in a unique game design capturing the essence of the battle and the differences between the forces. Use of supply and command is important. The technological edge of the White forces is fragile, yet potent, if it can be harnessed. Cavalry remains the fast moving forces for both sides.

200 Miles contains 280 counters, one 11x17" beautiful map, and rulebook. The game scale is 4-5 miles a hex, aircraft counters = 4-6 aircraft, tank units = two tanks, infantry regiments and brigades. Units include: MkV, Whippet tanks, DH9A Bombers, Re 8 Fighters, Armor Trains, Artillery, Armor Cars, Cavalry, Machine Guns, Engineers, Headquarters.

name: Stocking Stuffers
description:
A rummy-like game with an element of "push your luck" and a Christmas theme. Players start with a card-drawing phase in which they try to draw as many cards as possible without drawing a duplicate. A player can stop and keep the cards at any time, but if a duplicate appears, the cards must be given out as gifts. After drawing cards, the player must lay down one set, scoring points. "Days of Christmas" provide a timing element.

Stocking Stuffers was intended as a 2004 Christmas gift to the gaming community by the author, and is available to play with a Creative Commons license.
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Switch
description: Switch from the initial pattern to the final pattern is as many jumps as indicated underneath each puzzle diagram.
mechanics: Area Movement, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition

name: Queerbeet
description: The board has hexes. Every player owns pawns. There are also blockades. The goal is to get your own pawns to the opposite side of the gameboard. On your turn roll a die and move. You may jump over other pieces. You can not move over blockades. It costs you 2 movement points to move over an opponents pawn.

name: Gundam 0080 Cyclops Attack
description:
Tactical level wargame based on Japanese mecha animation Mobile Suit Gundam & Gundam 0080: War in the Pocket.　New Gundam game with emphasis on command.

Players control small size forces with 1 to 9 “mobile suits” (giant robots).

At the beginning of each turn, players assigns one of thirteen commands to each squad, such as reorganization, suppressive fire, covering fire, advance, or coordinated maneuver.
Then, initiative is determined, and players activate their units in an order specified by their opponent. During activation, the unit can benefit from assigned command.

The game contains five scenarios based on the story, with the general goal being the destruction of enemy forces. However, a campaign game is also included where players manage their own force by appointing pilots and purchasing mobile suits. The battles are resolved as normal. In between the battles, the abilities of the pilots progress by combat experience, and mobile suit must be repaired and maintained.

As a small drawback, fighters and tanks are not included in this game.

The sequel game Psyco-Gundam updates the rules and includes stats for mobile suits from Z Gundam.

name: For the Masses
description:
For the Masses is a complete fantasy mass-combat wargame system, designed for use with 15mm miniatures, although any line of miniatures from 6mm up can be used for play. But it is also much more: The flexibility of the system allows players to use any fantasy setting and armies to play out famous fantastical scenarios and ancient epic battles.

Several sample army lists are included in the book but the real strength of For the Masses is the unit creation system. This system encourages players to be creative, use their imagination and have fun, which is the way wargaming should be.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Variable Phase Order

name: Brain Chain
description:
Brain Chain is a trivia game with a twist. 2-3 teams compete to answer questions- when correct, the team places a "link" of its color (red, green or blue) on the corresponding space of the large 10X10 grid that makes up the playing board. To win, a team must get six "links" in a row- horizontally, vertically or diagonally.

The twist is that all teams move the same yellow marker around the edges of the board through the use of movement cards and "brain pills" (bonus cards gotten by answering questions correctly). A team can ONLY attempt to answer a trivia question on a square that is in the same row or column as the yellow marker. However, the yellow marker itself can be used to complete a row of six for the win!

The four corner spaces that have special powers: remove an opponent's token, place a free token, move any token, or attempt to answer a question on any square.

The trivia categories are: Business, Entertainment, Geography, History, Sports, Science, Potluck, and Oddball (you must figure out what trait 3 of the 4 items listed share in common).

It's Trivial Pursuit with a Go-Moku win mechanic and a dash of Pueblo added in.

Available at www.brainchaingames.com

name: Battle of the Planets
description:
Be the first player to capture three monsters, then return to Earth.

The game characters and artwork are based on the Battle of the Planets (Gatchaman) cartoon series from the same time period.

In the television market where I lived as a child (Western Massachusetts, Northern Connecticut, USA), this show was known as G-Force (a re-worked series, which put back the missing content from Gatchaman, but included a dreadful back-beat in every scene).
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Hoppit!
description:
Hoppit! Is a Halma variant where each player has 6 toadstools and 5 frogs. Toadstools move like a chess queen, frogs move by hopping over adjacent toadstools of any color.

The objective is to be the first to get all of your frogs to the opposite end of the board.

Contents:
6 toadstools in each of 4 colors
5 frogs in each of 4 colors
13 x 13 board

name: Gear Krieg: African Theater
description:
An expansion for the Gear Krieg Wargame base game that extends the system to the North African Theater. Includes:

- Alternate Historical Background for the Desert Conflict.

- Table Top Rules for fighting in the Harsh environment of Africa.

- 7 detailed desert scenarios with maps.

- Basic TO&E (Tables of Organization and Equipment) for the expeditionary forces of Germany, The British Commonwealth, the United States, Italy, and France.

- 50+ vehicles and variants from all nationalities.

Expands:

Gear Krieg Wargame
categories: Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II

name: Sea Lion
description:
Operational Level portrayal of Hitler's planned but never executed 1940 invasion of Great Britain. Scenarios include summer and fall invasion schemes, air domination, and Royal Navy presence. 22"x28" mapboard.

A Brigade and Regimental level game which portrays both the summer and fall invasion schemes of the planned-but- never-executed 1940 German invasion of England. It is played on a 22x28" two-color mapboard with land, sea, air, partisan, parachute, and supply rules, as well as 3 levels of British preparedness. 3 invasion scenarios are provided, to reflect the varying degrees of air dominance and opposition possible.

name: Chilkat: The Indian Warrior Game
description:
Chilkat is a Canadian game about Native Americans and is played on a replica of the ceremonial blanket of the West Coast tribes. Represented on the blanket are 10 symbols which North American Indians used as clan or family crests. These crests were usually inherited or gained by conquest. The more crests, the greater the prestige of the family or chief who displayed them; consequently these titles were very jealously protected.

Using strategy and luck, together with their chiefs and warriors, players will roll the dice for positions, move warriors for offense and defense, and challenge opponents in “fights to the finish” for possession of the symbols on the blanket. The winner is the one whose chiefs control all 10 symbols.
categories: American Indian Wars, American West, Fighting, Wargame

name: Maze Wizard
description:
Designed by a 12 year old as a school project, and illustrated by his father.

A strategy-based, card-battling board game, complete with movable barriers to prevent an opponent from reaching
their goal.

name: L'échappée Infernale
description:
This is another roll and move cycling game where each player controls a team of 3 cyclists. The twist here is that you can divide results of the dice thrown over your cyclists as long as they stay together in one group.

As usual in the genre, there are some cards with positive effects (burst of speed) and negative effects (flat tire, having to take a leak)...

The system allows multiple races with an overall ranking.

A neat aspect of this game is a semi-"collectible" element whereby for a modest sum you can buy teams in each of the team strips of the major pro-cycling teams. Whilst not as satisfying a game as, say, Um Reifenbreite, it does make for a good visual recreation of the peloton in action.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Jouer avec Richard Virenque
description:
This is a cycling game about Richard Virenque - the former cyclist. The aim of the games is to become the best cyclist - Richard Virenque (a little chauvinism comes naturally to the French)

There are 6 different races that have to be run (time trial, mountain, cobblestones,..) Depending on the race you roll 1 or 2 dice and move that many spaces. There are (as usual) black spaces where you draw penalty cards. You can also collect bonus cards on the yellow spaces. The bonus cards can be used to counter the penalty cards.

There is a set of extra cyclist figures available.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Ten Grand The Dice Game
description:
Ten Grand is a geometric progression dice game. Geometric progression refers to the way you get double the points for throwing 4 of a kind as you do for throwing 3 of a kind and so on to 6 of a kind.

You play to 10,000 points, hence the name, but the first one there does not necessarily win. The time it takes to play is about ten minutes per player. Even the very young can play – with a little help. You score points by throwing 100’s, 50’s, or 3 or more of a kind of anything. Every game is different and fun because the dice thrower must decide whether to continue to try for more points at greater risk.

The game comes with 6 custom dice, rules, a points card, velour carrying pouch and packaged in a beautifully embossed TEN GRAND box.

This game is similar to Dice 10,000 and Farkle. It originated in the 1930s (Hugo Kastner: Die große Humboldt Enzyklopädie der Würfelspiele. Humboldt 2007, pp. 205-208).

name: Team Out! Hockey
description:
In this hockey themed card game, each player attempts to build a starting line-up of NHL players (1 Goalie, 1 Center, 2 Wings and 2 Defensemen) while hindering their opponents attempts to do the same. The game is played over a series of hands building up points until one player reaches at least 400 points and is declared the winner (or Team Out! Champ).

The game comes in a small box with a set of rules and a 60 card deck. The cards consist of 30 NHL Player cards, 3 Power Play cards (which is a wild card allowing a player to substitute one for a starting player), 18 Action cards (which hinder opponents), and 9 Protection cards (which protect players against Action cards).

name: Choo Choo: The Number Color Train Game
description: All players start with an engine and a track. Players spin for a number, take the corresponding car and place it behind their engine. If the corresponding car is at the end of another player's train, the car is removed from the opponent's train and placed on the player's track. The winner is the first player to get 5 cars on his track behind the engine.

name: Pillage & Plunder: The Viking Longship Game
description:
A game supposedly reminiscent of Viking games of old, this game was first available in museums with the "Vikings: The North Atlantic Saga" traveling exhibit.

From the publisher's web site (edited):

Pillage & Plunder are two Viking brothers roaming the High seas in their Longship looking for fame and adventure. Pillage & Plunder is a game of luck and skill. Players take turns loading barrels onto the deck of the Longship.

Be careful! Keep the load balanced or you will dump all of the hard won treasure right into the Sea. Play Pillage & Plunder alone as a skill toy and see how many barrels you can fit on deck. The movable men and thousands of barrel positions will provide hours of entertainment for yourself or a group of friends.

Pillage & Plunder is a fun toy and game for the whole family. Easy set up and rules make it an instant hit with young and old alike.

Viking children played with many types of toys that we would recognize today. Lifelike toys such as dolls, toy animals and especially wooden toy boats, were extremely popular with children in Scandinavian lands during the time of the Vikings.

Natural materials like wood were the obvious choice when it
came to making toys in those legendary days and Acorn Games strives to keep that spirit alive today. Each Pillage & Plunder game is made out of solid wood and stained in natural, earthy tones to evoke the warmth of the early toy makers and to give you years of pleasure and a game that you can pass along to future generations of game players.

Each Pillage & Plunder Game comes with:

* Decorated wooden Dragon Longship
* Wooden Pillage and Plunder pieces
* 18 hardwood "Treasure" barrels
* 1 color coded wood playing die
* playing instructions parchment
* felt lined box with clear-vu lid

name: General Glen's: Combat Rules for Toy Soldiers
description:
General Glen's Combat Rules for Toy Soldiers is the set of rules you need to get your dusty old toy soldiers out of storage. Whether you play in 54mm scale with exquisitely detailed soldiers, or with small 20-28mm plastic soldiers, you'll find these rules bring the focus of WWII skirmishes back to what it should be: detailed yet fast paced, balanced yet fun.

The scope of these rules pretty much allows a maximum of a platoon per side for a 4-6 hour game, with maybe a dozen per side for a 3-4 hour game. For us, this means we can run the games in our big 54mm size, because we don't have that many minitatures to bring with us - only about 30-50 soldiers per side, if you include all the different poses - standing , kneeling, prone.

Our rules encourage the use of actual postures of your miniatures, so that line of sight and actual cover are used to determine whether a toy soldier can "see" another. The exclusive use of a d12 for all die rolling has caused us to dub our game the "d12 system", long before those other guys came out with their "d20 system".
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Take 12
description:
Boxed set of two red dice, a green playing field, and twelve white cubes numbered one through twelve.

Object of the game is to win as many of the cubes as possible by rolling the dice and matching the total of the dice with the numbers on the cubes. It's a just very slight riff on Shut the Box.

I wonder if the name of the game is a play on the jazz song Take 5, which was a huge hit starting in 1959. The art direction on this game is great. It feels so very "cool late 50's," like a Rat Pack movie.

name: Robinson & Freitag
description: Robinson & Freitag (Robinson & Friday) is a bluffing, bidding and building game by Michael Palm. As Robinson, landing on an isolated island, the players try to collect materials to build various things on their islands. Eventually, events such as wild animals, droughts, tidal waves (even Robinson had to deal with natural disasters) occur. The player who is best prepared for these events is ahead, and when Friday comes for the second time the day of departure for the player with the biggest raft is nigh.

name: Adua 1896
description:
The Battle of Adua, 1896: Italy against the Abyssinians.
"Alea Iacta Est" Italian wargaming magazine, issue 4.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Simulation

name: Amnesia: The Short-Term Memory Game.
description:
From the Publisher's Instructions Sheet:

Amnesia is a short-term memory game where you can score if you remember ... and score if you forget. To WIN, just start on START and make it around your triangle to the center of the board.

name: Sword & Spear
description:
Sword & Spear - Individual Man-to-Man Combat in Ancient and Medieval Times

"Sword & Spear is a set of wargame rules for small skirmishes in the millennium before effective gunpowder weapons. Each player commands a small detachment (two to ten figures) in a battle of close-range missile and hand-to-hand combat. Although most attractive when played with metal or plastic painted figures mounted on stands, various substitutes or just the stands can be used instead." Includes section for "mythological gaming" of battles against creatures featured in myths and fantasy fiction.

24-page rulebook, including tables, for miniatures game.
categories: Ancient, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Mythology, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Corduroy's Birthday Games
description:
Synopsis:

Ten activity games that can be played inside or outside the house. Truly a party in a box. Find the red triangle, then the blue party hat, then the square birthday cake. The last one there will be too late. This is your invitation to FUN, FUN, FUN.

The game pieces are incredibly durable and the pictures are cute! If you are familiar with the storybook character, Corduroy, than you know the cute bear sketch that I am referencing. In addition to the bears, there are party hats, cakes and presents. The floor tiles assist toward shape and color recognition. I enjoy observing which/how many children count the candles on the cake(s) (there are five). And because there is a connection, via the character, to books... it is my belief that this game inspires reading...this set is best suited, for day care, preschool or kindergarten aged children. It would be great in the classroom; especially with the storybook, as a compliment.

Out of the 10 activity games 3 are non-competitive while the other 7 are competitive in which case the winner receives prize tokens.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Party Game

name: Mesopotamia
description:
"Crawl into the skin of a Mesoptamian ruler during the age of the great Hammurabi of Babylon. Relive how kings managed to secure their power and gain the respect of their tribes. The construction of temples and canals, agricultural development and military victories can all spread your fame and secure your rule. Make constant decisions on how best to govern your land: rely on the rule of law and the gentle persuading powers of the Ishtar priestesses and strife for a blossoming agricultural system, or turn to the fanaticism of the Marduk priests and the battle strength of their troops. However you choose to exert your rule - you can only win the game if your rule is so successful that your fame, in the eyes of your subjects, has acquired a god-like status, making you the undisputed ruler of Mesopotamia."

This is the first game from Hilmar Möhlmann and has undergone several years of development. Its final version was made available to the gaming community through his website and ebay. Having acquired a copy it is obvious that this is a labor of love. The design of board and cards is beautiful - the rules are well tested, clearly presented and relatively short for such a ambitious game. Ongoing support for players is in place through website updates and direct communication. And having just acquired my copy, I wonder if the price asked actually covers the materials provided. An impressive entry for this budding designer and a one to seek out for players who enjoy games like "Settlers of Catan" but yearn for something a bit meatier and with a stronger theme. With an Arthurian themed game in the pipeline, this one-man act might be an interesting one to follow.

The aim of the game is to have the most military units and construction works of your color on the board. This can be done over 2 to 5 rounds. Resources can be acquired through natural growth, trade and military conquests. Trade takes place along caravan routes. Players can trade freely with their trading partner, pay toll to players whose territory is crossed en-route, or exchange resources against a set course with the bank. These resources can then be used to generate new buildings or units. Each turn a player can use an influence card, adding flavor and variety without unbalancing strategic play. A nice twist is that players who allow toll-free trading between other players if the caravan route passes their territory see a generous windfall from the opening of this trade route in the next round, when some resources are added to the storage in that province. Each year round ends with construction and military campaigns. Conflicts are settled by dice rolls which are modified by markers on the board.

This game appeared in 2 versions:

The self-published "2D" version (quality is at the very high end of desktop publishing).
Some assembly is required, mainly joining the 8 pages that from the superbly produced full colour game board. In total you get 39 multicolour A4 sheets, including several photo-quality prints, six pages of clear and well presented rules, and lots of event cards, markers and game aids.

The wooden case with the handmade "3D" version of the game board is fit for a king, and for those with a rather large game budget.

name: A.O.I. (Africa Oriental Italiana)
description:
"A.O.I. (Africa Oriental Italiana)" is a wargame about the fighting in Italian East Africa in 1940-1. It has a jigsaw map (approximately 20"x20") depicting Ethiopia and the surrounding area (Somalia, Yemen, and at least parts of Kenya and Sudan). The scale is 80 km per hex. There are 12 one-month turns.

Victory in the game is based on control of key cities. Supply is important, particularly for the Italians; among other issues they have only six supply units which allow attacking and one is removed after each attack. The Italian player must also contend with deserting units starting on turn 7.

name: Schnapp zu!
description: Where is the pelican about to fish? To guess where, the players put down one of their location tiles. Then the pelican is placed. Whoever has guessed right, gets the fish lying on the corresponding place. The pelican only gets the prey if nobody has guessed correctly. Who, with their shrewed guesses, will collect the most fish? For 2-4 players Ages 4 and up. Includes variant for elder players.

name: GO mental SACRAmental
description:
From the Publisher:

"GO mental® SACRAmental is more than just a Bible version of the classic game! It brings together a cunning compilation of scripture and community, sacred purpose and secular practice in a spiritually focused family board game that embraces everything from Holy writ to church history; from public veneration to private contemplation; from the specifics of observant belief to religious experience in the everyday world.
As with the entire GO mental® family, GO mental® SACRAmental is more than just a game. It’s a mini encyclopedia of information. Complete with extensive chapter and verse references, historical, geographical and scriptural information on a wide range of the world’s religions, GO mental® SACRAmental doesn’t just give you the answer. GO mental® SACRAmental tells you why it’s the answer."

name: Twist Tac Toe
description: It's really just tic tac toe but after your turn you have to rotate the rod that you just played into. So if you don't pay attention, you could turn up your opponent's color and give them the win.

name: Zambeln
description:
Zambeln is a game supposedly played by teddy bears and other living toys. It is an extra to the Plüsch, Power and Plunder (PP&P) Role-Playing-Game in which toy pets come to life, and comes with the scenario "Plüsch, Drugs & Rock'n Roll."
Effectively, it is much like Uno, where every player plays a card per turn, which has to match the card played before; with some special card effects added, and two discard piles. First player to lose all his cards wins.

name: Professor Noggin's Earth Science
description:
Learn about the volcanoes, thunderstorms, and the crust of the earth as Professor Noggin tests your knowledge on Earth Science.

Card topics include:
Continental Drift
Rivers and Streams
Oceans_&_Seas
Peninsulas
Mountains
Sedimentary Rocks
Lakes & Ponds
Prairies
Canyons
Metamorphic Rocks
Desert
Rainforests
Glaciers_&_Icebergs
Igneous Rocks
Hoodoos
Erosion
Islands
Volcanoes
Earthquakes
Minerals
Caves and Caverns
Precious Minerals
Atmosphere
Rain
Snow
Clouds
Earth‚s Core
Hurricanes
Tornadoes
Weather Forecasting
publishers: Éditions Gladius International, Inc., KENSHO Kft., Outset Media

name: The Armies of Tekumel, Volume I: Tsolyanu
description: This 24-page booklet is a supplement that can be used with either the "Missúm!" or "Qadardalikoi" rules for 1:100 figure scale 25mm miniatures battles set on the fantasy world of Tekumel (the setting for the original "Empire of the Petal Throne" role playing game and the more recently published "Tekumel: World of the Petal Throne"). This volume contains statistics for the roughly 80 legions of the Empire of Tsolyanu and a miniatures painting guide.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
publishers: Adventure Games, Imperium Publishing Company, Tita's House of Games

name: Quick Jump It's a Skunk!
description: This is a fast reaction game where you try be the last one with all your marbles in your upper ramp zone. A motorized skunk runs around a track and will bump your character if you do not push a button down fast enough to have your character jump out of his way. If he bumps you, the marble will roll down to the lower zone; once all your marbles are at the bottom, you are out. Last one with marbles in the top zone wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Electronic

name: The 1879 Zulu War and Boer Zulu Conflict
description: These are miniatures wargaming rules for the 1879 Zulu War and Boer-Zulu conflicts. These rules are designed to be used with either 25mm, 15mm or 5mm figures with 25mm driving infantry bases of 20mm x 20mm for the British/Boers or 20mm x 30mm for the Zulus. Largest base would be for a field gun at 60mm x 80mm. Each figure is supposed to represent 15 men. There is information on how to manage a campaign and on the British OoB.

name: Battle!
description: Assemble your army cards and try to win more battlefields then your opponent. But watch out as some battlefields have special abilities which your opponent may be able to use against you. Battle! is fast paced and does not use any dice.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Fighting, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Maselino
description:
Maselino is a game of speed. 40 Colorful bamboo discs are distributed by color to players who pretend they are mice looking for food. The players turn the tiles over until their pictures match. When they do, the players rob the piece of food from the plates in the middle. Only the quickest one can keep it. The winner is the one who gets the most pieces of food.

Age: 4+

name: Bezoek aan de dierentuin
description: In this game the players are visiting a zoo. The goal is to go through the zoo and reach the exit as soon as possible. In the beginning of the game 10 zoo tiles are laid out at random on 40 available spaces on the board. On each turn a player rolls the die and moves up to 4 spaces on the board. The die is numbered with 0,1,2,3,4 and a plume. When 0 is obtained, the person doesn't move, on a plume one has to draw a plume card. Players are not allowed to stand on the same space. Whenever one stands on a space with a zoo tile, this tile is turned around. Winner is the player who reaches the exit first.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Where On Earth
description: Description by publisher: WHERE ON EARTH is a game which not only entertains but also adds to your knowledge about geography, history, people and culture of the world's continents and countries. Yet WHERE ON EARTH is more than a game of knowledge since strategy and chance are employed and can influence the run of play.

name: Käpt'n Pedro
description:
It is particularly hot, but fortunately Pedro has a good idea. A boat trip would be fun and it would certainly be somewhat cooler in the water. All that must be done is to divide up the animals into the boats, but that is easier said than done! Excellent dexterity game for small hands.

Ages 4 and up.

name: Spy
description:
This is a 'small' card game where each player represents a specific planet but as it goes with this type of games (and comparable to the games Mafia and Werewolves), this info is not passed on to other players. So, it's up to you to try and keep this a secret while trying to reach your goals...
What's your goal anyway? Eliminate each and every other 'foreign' player [meaning : players who don't belong to your planet] and try to end up with a group of players that all hail from the same planet.

Presented at Essen 2006.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Infinity: the Card Game
description:
From the website:

Be the first to play all of the cards in your hand. It's that simple. or is it? When it's your turn, lay down cards in your hand that make sets (3 or more of the same value) or runs (3 in a row of the same color) or play cards on another player's piles to get rid of your cards faster. For those who really like to explore all their possibilities, transport cards from other piles to combine with new cards, and make new piles. Just remember, each pile must always have at least three cards. The possibilities are out of this world!

The Action Cards make INFINITY even more fun. Give every one of your opponents three extra cards when you play the Re-Fuel card. Get new cards to replace the ones in your hand with the Re-Entry Card. Or play the Countdown Card to force someone to make a play and gain control of the board. Don't wait for your turn, either, play any of these any time you want!

name: Dark Dungeon 2: Lair of the Spider Cult
description:
This is a Heroquest-like solo boardgame, with tiles, counters, and rules for movement and actions.

From the publisher:

Trisha stopped as the rest of the party moved down the dark hallway, she was sure she had heard a “Clicking” sound. Sure enough there was a flash of light off a gleaming blade as the trap sprang open, the two warriors in front of Trisha screamed as they were cut in two. As these two died, the young elven mage leaped for her life, rolling as she hit the hard, cold stones of the dungeon floor. Coming to a stop in the corner, Trisha thanked her ancient ancestors for once again aiding her in her quest. Looking over to the rest of the adventures, she could see that they were in various stages of death or dying, the trap having cut most of them down at the knees. Standing Trisha eyes grew wide in horror, for as her companions all lay in terrible pain and agony, coming up the passage was a carpet of crawling spiders, each the size of her hand.

This is Dark Dungeon, Lair of the Spider Cult. The newest Dark Dungeon adventure for the solo system by Bad Baby Production, can you gain the glory and treasure that awaits you in the dark passages under the greatest city in the world. Do you dare even try?

Note that this is not a stand alone game, you need a copy of Bad Baby's Mini-Game #18, Dark Dungeon to play this expansion.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Print & Play

name: Dark Dungeon 3: Crypt of the Damned
description:
This is a solo Heroquest-like boardgame with tiles, counters and rules for movement and combat.

From the publisher:

Freddo pulled his sword out of the rotting corpse of the zombie and watched the thing died for the second time. The hard warrior wiped his brow and took a moment to catch his breath before he and the rest of his group continued on down the dark passage. He had signed up to aid this group of young adventurers as they took their first steps into the dangerous work of dungeon delving. The group was already down by three members, a deadly trap claiming the two dwarf brothers and the young elven mage. As Freddo walked cautiously down the hall, he could hear the screams of someone far off, no doubt the last cries of some other adventuring fool, meeting his end here in the deadly halls of the crypt of the damned.

This is Dark Dungeon, Crypt of the Damned, the newest Dark Dungeon adventure for the solo system by Bad Baby Production. Can you gain the glory and treasure that awaits you in the dark passages under the greatest city in the world, do you dare even try?
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Print & Play

name: Bellhop
description:
Bellhop is a strategy game where players play as competing shift managers in a hotel. The year is 1939, in New York; the guests in the hotel are leaving for the World's Fair. Each player controls a team of bellhops in the hotel and attempts to earn the most tips by helping the guests off of the elevator and with their luggage as they arrive in the lobby.

You can backstab your friends' bellhops and reduce his/her tips by stopping their elevator. Be careful, though, as you might not be able to get your guests to the lobby without help! The player who has received the most tips at the end of the game wins. Maximize your points by collecting guests of all types. Try to get a bonus by helping the most guests of any one type.

Bellhop plays with 2-5 players and lasts between 45 and 60 minutes. The photos are of an unpublished prototype and the designer is actively looking for a publisher.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement

name: Naviplouf
description:
A board game for children (5+ years).

This is a simplified version of Battleships. Instead of numbers and letters the coordinates are specified in colors and forms (for example: "Red Fish"). The grid is smaller and instead of choosing the places for the boats, there are cards where they are already placed in a random manner.

From the publisher:

"A magnetic naval battle game specially designed for budding young sailors."

name: Stellar Wars
description:
This is a game of tactical space combat, with each counter representing a single ship. It includes a ship design system, and a set of pre-designed ships.

In flavor, it seems to feel somewhere between a slightly more complex Starfire and a simplified Star Fleet Battles.

name: Alexander: The Card Game
description:
Very basic card wargame with a Alexander the Great theme. There are two types of cards: difficulty cards and solution cards. You use the latter to overcome the first.

This is a free PnP game from Warpspawn.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Word Chase
description:
From the Press Release:

The goal of this game is to familiarize children with “sight words,” the 25 most commonly used words in the English language. It includes a game board, 50 word cards, four game pieces and rules. It features only lower-case letters, and accommodates children younger than 4 who are learning to identify letters. The game printed with soy-based ink on recycled paper.

name: Dark Dungeon 4: Tower of Magic
description:
From the publisher:

Mordenhelm is well known for the many wizards and sorceress that call the city home. Among those magically adapt folk one stands out above all the rest, the Arch Mage Zoon. Zoon is a legend in his own time, a master of magic, and a true hero to the lands. Stories are told day and night of the many adventure the great wizard has had over the years, defeating dragons, tricking demon princes and battle foul necromancers. Yes the stories and song offered by the city’s many bards about the mages' exploits have turned him into quite the local hero.

The Arch Mages' days of travel though, are long over, for he now sits alone in his great tower of white stone, working on magical treaties and concocting strange magical brews. Few can say they have seen the great mage leave his tower, and fewer still can say that they have even met him. There are stories of course, stories that he is dead, that his tower lies empty of guardians, waiting for the brave thief to enter and take his vast treasures and magical toys.

Dark Dungeon 4, Tower of Magic is the newest adventure for the Dark Dungeon solo game system. Do you dare enter the Tower of Zoon and seek your fortune.

Dark Dungeon #4 is not a complete game, and requires that you have a copy of Bad Baby's Mini-Game, Dark Dungeon.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Print & Play

name: Montebello: First Step to Freedom
description:
This small, but very competitive game on the first clash between the French-Piedmontese army and the Austrian one in May 1859 during the first phases of the campaign known as the Second Italian War for Independence, is an almost skirmish battle fought on the country roads and the fields near Voghera, on the road from Piedmont towards Milano. It was an harsh battle, where the Austrians got the numerical advantage but didn’t have the confidence to use it as it was due for a victory.
The simple, but not simplistic rules integrate movement and combat, several readiness status for the various leaders and troops present on the field of battle, fire and melee rules, morale, territorial gains and so on. The sumptous graphics for both the map and the counters make this one a joy for the eyes.

Components:
1 8.5" by 11" map
64 counters
Rulebook
Charts

Released as Print-n-Play in June 2007.

name: Flying Thunder
description:
The game is played on a 16-square foot playing mat with an electronic helicopter placed in the middle and controlled from a remote that runs under the mat. Players choose to be either Blue or Red (teams can be created if there are more than 2 players)and alternate turns. The object of the game is to collect bomb tokens totaling 6 or more points before the other player(or team).

The tokens are spread out on the mat with the point value face down and the player must pick up the tokens with the helicopter(the points become visible once picked up)and dropped onto the designated headquarters. There are also bomb and spy tokens that need to be dropped into the bomb bunker or the competing players headquarters, respectively.

That is the main play, there are also solo mission and time variations.

name: Maindealer
description:
A very unusual and interesting adaptation of real life car sales/trading translated into a boardgame.

You start play as a normal everyday person, a "punter", whose compelling ambition is to become a car dealer. Through life's ups and downs, you must collect the 5 cars you need, of any make, to become a garage owner.

Once a garage owner, you move to the next level on the board, with the opportunity to buy & sell additional cars, and also to aim for a main dealership - if you have sufficient stock of one make of car.

A very clever and absorbing game- easy to pick up as you go.

name: Gallic Wars
description:
Gallic Wars is a cardgame for two players. One player will play with the Romans, the other with the Gauls.

The game consists of rounds. Each round, both players draw eight cards. They may then discard up to four cards and draw replacements. After that, they calculate the score for their hand. The player with the highest score wins the round. After that, all cards are discarded, and a new round is started.

Cards are divided in four basic types: Strategy, Tactics, Resources and Morale. Each of these cards has a value between 3 and 10. When scoring, a player may take two cards from each category and add their values together. Two special types are present: Leader cards, who can be counted as any of the basic types, and Disadvantage cards, which lower a players's score.

The first player who wins three consecutive rounds wins the game. If neither players has won by the end of the eight round, the player who wins the eight round wins the game.

Available for free download (http://www.webalice.it/alecrespi/warpspawn/FreeGames/GallicW...).
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Party & Co: Gramola
description: This is a game from the Party & Co family. The players will participate in teams, trying to beat the other teams in 5 great challenges. All the challenges are Music themed: songs, singers, music groups … Participate and show the others how much you like music.
categories: Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Acting, Memory, Open Drafting, Singing, Team-Based Game
publishers: Diset S. A., Nordic Games GmbH

name: Witches Cauldron: The Oosterbeek Perimeter – Arnhem 1944
description:
Witches Cauldron—The Oosterbeek Perimeter is a historical module for ASL that allows you to recreate the classic struggle of the Battle of Arnhem at a house-by-house, 50 yards, scale.

Witches Cauldron—The Oosterbeek Perimeter puts the gamer literally inside the Hexenkessel, hammered by two Waffen SS panzer divisions day after day. There is no escape nor respite and this game is not suggested for the faint of heart. The games takes you back in time, to recreations of the very places in history where most of the Arnhem Victoria Crosses were earned in pitched combat, while staring down the dark menace of massive King Tigers, Sturmgeschutz, and a smörgåsbord of captured AFVs ranging from Dutch armored cars to French flame-throwing tanks.

Ownership of Beyond Valor: ASL Module 1 and West of Alamein: ASL Module 5 OR For King and Country: ASL module 5a are required to use this product.

Expands:

Advanced Squad Leader
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Surfer's Life
description: The goal of this windsurfing game is to surf faster a row of regatta's than your competitor on some of the most beautiful beaches around the world. The conditions to participate in certain regattas depends on the skills and the surfboards that a player has obtained. The surfboards can be obtained in auctions and they can be exchanged as well. He handles this part of the game the best has certainly got an advantage to win Surfer's Life.

name: Dead Man's Island
description:
Print and play micro wargame. From the ad copy on RPG Now:

Pirates & Treasure & Zombies, Oh My!

When pirates defile graves just for some easy gold, you know there will be trouble, especially when it's a witch's treasure buried in a graveyard for the most notorious of sea dogs.

Easy gold it won't be with other pirates after it and the dead raising to take you to their side. Will you become rich and retire to a life of leisure or will the grave you are digging up become your own?

Dead Man's Island is a strategy adventure for 1 to 4 players Ages 10 and up
categories: Adventure, Dice, Exploration, Fighting, Horror, Nautical, Pirates, Print & Play, Transportation, Wargame, Zombies
mechanics: Action Points, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection

name: 1 on 1 Adventure Gamebooks: The Dragonwand of Krynn
description: The tenth game in the series of 1 on 1 Adventure Gamebooks is set in the world of Dragonlance. One player plays Lord Ariakan, Dragon Highlord. The other player plays Lord Patrick, Knight of Solamnia.

name: Spy Kids: Mission Master
description:
Objective 1: Be the first to finish all missions.
Objective 2: Avoid the Thumb Thumbs!
Objective 3: Become the ultimate OSS spy!

In this advanced Spy Kids board game, you are working as an OSS spy to help solve important missions.

Control the OSS operatives as they work their way around from mission to mission as quickly as possible. This is no time for fooling around. The Thumb Thumbs are a serious threat to take over the world! They have stolen secret documents, planted booby traps, invaded sensitive buildings, and have created chaos everywhere. The OSS team needs YOU to help stop the Thunb Thumbs!

Be the first to complete every mission and become the ultimate OSS Spy! Work quickly and find the fastest route to each targeted mission. Be on the look-out for the evil Thumb Thumbs, who have been sent out to stop you from saving the world.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Spies/Secret Agents, Travel
mechanics: Area Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Car Wars Deluxe Road Sections Set 3: Straights
description:
From the expansion pack:

This package contains 9 straight road sections to expand your Car Wars track layout. 27 color counters showing trees, bushes, hedges, and green paint clouds.

Expands:

Car Wars

name: Omega Warrior
description:
From the back of the book:

"By the year 2750, the 150 year old galaxy-wide war had escalated to the point where casualties were measured in millions per day. Entire populations were wiped out and planets made uninhabitable by the fallout of warfare. Faced with annihilation, both sides (the United Democratic Planets or UDP and the Republic of Soviet-Socialist Planets or RSSP)developed an alternative method of waging war. Their solution was the Omega Suit.

"The Omega Suit represents the ultimate development of military technology. Each suit stands over 7' tall and is manned by a genetically superior soldier called an Omega Warrior. The Omega Suit is a fully enclosed system which enhances strength, reflexes and senses of its wearer. Omega Suits can withstand tremendous amounts of damage and can carry enough firepower to lay waste to an entire division of conventional armored vehicles. Instead of sending tens of thousands of infantry to fight a battle, the same goal can be accomplished with a handful of Omega Warriors.

"Now, in the year 3000 AD, the war continues. Big armies, while maintained by the larger factions involved in the war, are seldom used. Most battles are fought by the Omega Warriors and where they go the ground trembles and the skies burn, for no target is out of their reach.

"Omega Warrior is a miniature rules set for creating the battles of the future using 6mm-28mm figures. Omega Warrior is a complete rules system, including rules for conventional infantry, vehicles, robots, AIs, and of course, the Omega Warriors themselves. Also included are army lists and a campaign system."
categories: Adventure, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Birds and Animals
description:
Flex your brainpower to collect matching sets of birds and animals in the fast-paced game of Birds and Animals. Learn the names of 96 fascinating creatures plus the geographic regions where they live.

This card game consists of 12 sets of 4 cards each of similar categories of birds and animals. The object of each game is to secure as many sets as possible. Skill in playing is acquired by remembering.

Ages 6 and up.

name: A Lover's Touch
description:
"A romance game for your body, mind and spirit."

From the back of the box:

"A Lover's Touch offers the opportunity for the two of you to experience a wide variety of both physical and emotional intimacies and have fun too! The game activities have been specially created to progress from affectionate sharing and touching to bolder and more intimate activities that lovers partake in with each other. For night after night of love, discovery and romantic adventures the game play integrates the 85 intimate game board activities and 54 passionate scenarios from The Lover's Touch Card Game-TM"

From the rule book:

"Object of the Game
-To share with your lover a variety of sensual, intimate, and affectionate delights.

Purposes of the Game
-To have fun developing a deeper understanding of what you and your lover like and want in your intimate relationship.
-To engage in an extended session of love making that builds on anticipation, creativity, adventure, and a progression of physical intimacy.
-To expand you sensory awareness through activities using sight, hearing, taste, smell, and... touch."

The first player to reach the "Final Play" space on the game board ends the game play. Both players are most definitely winners!

Game components:

-1 game box
-1 rule book (which contains a list of 16 recommended items for use with the game)
-1 advertisement for "www.theromancesuite.com";
-1 game board containing 1 "Begin Here" square, 85 activity squares including 12 "Pick a card." squares, and 1 "Final Play" square
-56 activity cards
-1 red, six-sided die
-1 yellow pawn
-1 white pawn
mechanics: Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: 1 vs. 100: The Puzzle Game
description:
First, assemble the 100-piece mob puzzle.

Then answer the questions in the booklet correctly to knock out the mob, done by turning over the puzzle piece. You win when you beat the mob.

The booklet contains 14 games with 10 questions each game.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Puzzle, Trivia

name: Party Time
description:
In Party Time the players play in two teams. One player draws a card and has to explain/describe, draw, pantomime or knead up to three words/items. Depending on how many items his/her team guesses the team's pawn may advance 0, 1, 3 or 6 steps along the board. On the cards you have clusters of three terms per action to be taken. The action a player has to take (explain, draw, pantomime or knead) is decided on the field the pawn is situated on.
You also have a flash symbol on the board. Whenever a pawn starts its move on the flash symbol, this goup must take an special card and one player has to do whatever is written on the card (e.g. "non-sense" like explain terms using a certain slang, stand and one leg and put off your shoes and socks, keep your breath for 90 seconds...).

Game No. 71245.0 from F.X. Schmid, published 1994 (1993 ParaDice)
mechanics: Acting, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Storytelling, Team-Based Game

name: Dios Patria y Rey The Carlists Wars, 1833-1840
description:
Alea Magazine #32.

Dios Patria Rey (For God, Country and King) is a system simulating several battles of the First Carlist War of 1833-1840.

The Carlist Wars in Spain were the last major European civil wars in which pretenders fought to establish their claim to a throne. Several times during the period from 1833 to 1876 the Carlists — followers of Infante Carlos (later Carlos V) and his descendants — rallied to the cry of "God, Country, and King" and fought for the cause of Spanish tradition (Legitimism and Catholicism) against the liberalism, and later the republicanism, of the Spanish governments of the day.

Dios Patria Rey uses a beefed up and revised Libertadores system (Soldados y Estrategia n. 10) to simulate eight of the most decisive battles of this war: Arquijas, Luchana, Oriamendi, Barbastro, Maella and the 1st and 2nd battles of Perecamps.

The game features the several foreign units which fought in Spain in 1833-40 including the British, Portuguese and Belgian legions and the French Foreign Legion. There were also French, Prussian Austrian and Russian Absolutist fighting on the Carlist side. In fact, the Carlist pretendant died in exile in the Austrian Empire. He is buried in a church at Trieste, now in Northern Italy.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: 1st Newbury
description: 1st Newbury is the third game in TCS series of games on the English Civil War, the first to add artillery, facing and command radius rules to the previous set of rules. Easy to play, fast and furious see-saw battle, perfect for solitaire and competitive lunch hour game.
categories: Civil War, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Party Time
description:
Party time is a dutch game from the Big Six series from Nova Carta.

You have to form two teams. Throw a coloured dice.

Every colour corresponds with a theme on a card.

Red- Say uuuhh
Player has to tell a story about the subject on the card without saying uh for 30 seconds

Blue- Pantomime
Player has to use pantomime to let his team guess the word on the card

Yellow- Illegal words
Player has to tell about the word on the card, but cannot name some words (shown on the card)

Green- No yes or no
The opponents get to ask questions about a subject on the card for 1 minute. The player may not answer with yes or no

Purple- Say what?
The player can mention the three underlined words on the card. His team has to guess the saying by these three words.

When a guess is correct, the team gets a chip with the corresponding colour. Collect all colours and your teams wins!

This is a light party game, suitable for players with a minimum age of 12.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game

name: Flohzirkus
description:
Flohzirkus (="flea circus") is played on a board with 12 x 12 dots in 4 alternating colours. 5 colour dice and 2 large wooden fleas per player complete the game components.

Each flea is marked with 4 colours: 1 yellow dash at the head, 1 blue dash at the tail, 1 red flea drawing on the right side and 1 green flea drawing on the left.

Each turn, a player throws the 5 dice, which enable him to make 5 moves. Yellow, blue, red and green lets a flea jump to the 4 directions as marked on the flea, white and black enables a flea to turn in place or to shift to an adjacent dot.

Object of the game is to achieve as many points as possible, which is done by jumping over as many other fleas as possible. Winner of the game is the player with the most points after a predefined number of turns, or the one who reaches a predefined number of points first.

The game reminds at Alex Randolph's game family including "Corona"(1974), "Moonstar"(1981), "Harun"(1984), "Orbit"(1993) and "Ricochet Robots"(1999). Opposite to those games, each player has his own playing pieces in "Flohzirkus", but the lack of a time limit can be a serious problem here.

name: Little Storm in the Bathroom
description: Help Little Storm find his potty, sit on the toilet, brush his teeth, have a bath, etc. “Little Storm in the Bathroom” helps children learn the words they need to describe everything they do in the bathroom.
publishers: 999 Games, Dr. Wood Challenge Centre, Four Esses, Kärnan

name: Mooks, Mobs, and Men of Honor
description:
Mooks, Mobs, and Men of Honor is a PDF-only release for the .45 Adventure: Crimefighting Action in the Pulp Era game. It contains over 55 pre-generated characters (pulled from all three of our current titles) with backgrounds to help players get started right away. The backgrounds are all centered around the city of New Commerce, the fictional mid-western, US city where many of the heroes and villains of .45 Adventure: Crimefighting Action in the Pulp Era do battle. But don't think they can only be used there. Many of the groups have back stories that can put them anywhere in the world.

And to top it off, there are previews of two new half-grade archetypes (Mook and Graduate Student) that will appear in the next book to be released The Gargoyle: Death Soldiers of the Jade Hood

Expands:

.45 Adventure: Crimefighting Action in the Pulp Era
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor, Mafia, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Elephant Match
description:
This is a special game from the publisher of Tipp-Kick, Mieg Sport+Spiel. With a mechanic in the art of Tipp-Kick, we can play Basketball with elephants.

The mechanic allows the elephants to pick up the balls with their trunks. The goal is to put the ball into the basket.

name: Iuka: Hollow Victory – September 19, 1862
description: This is a simulation of the Battle of Iuka in September of 1862 between William Rosecranes and Sterling Price. The game uses a hex movement system and counters with infantry, cavalry, and cannon icons. Combat is based on a single d10 combat chart and bombardment chart with die modifications for terrain and odds. The game looks similar to SPI's old Blue and Grey Quad Series. The Federals try to cut off the escape of the Confederates as the Rebs victory conditions are based on leaving the board after inflicting some losses on the Federals.

name: John Carter: Warlord of Mars – Adventure Gaming Handbook
description:
One of only a handful of licensed games based on the John Carter of Mars saga by Edgar Rice Burroughs. Published by Heritage Models in 1978 and now very rare. Supported by a line of 25mm lead miniatures, also released by Heritage. The Handbook includes a miniatures painting guide, descriptions of the different races of Mars, and a set of man-to-man action rules for recreating battles on the savage world of Barsoom (whether as independent scenarios or as part of a role-playing campaign).

Also released around the same time by Heritage was a Barsoomian Battle Manual that provides rules for fighting out large-scale battles using miniatures.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Fighting, Miniatures, Novel-based, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Events, Impulse Movement, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Sports Dice: Basketball
description:
Small travel basketball game. 3 standard dice (1 white "shooting" die, 2 blue defensive dice), and 2 red offensive dice with roman numerals 2-7. 1 red pawn to mark ball position. 1 dry erase marker to keep score on "board", 1 plastic coated card with image of basketball court.

Rolls of the dice determine court position, turnovers, blocked shots, rebounding, steals, fouls, and scoring.

name: Alphabetor
description:
Translation form the French box:

You enjoy playing with letters and doing crossword puzzles? Then you will love ALPHABETOR!

54 letters on 54 cards, including 2 jokers, with wich you can create words by joining cards in more than 50 different games: this is ALPHABETOR.

name: Ritter der Zahlenrunde
description: Would you like to become a real Knight of the Round Numbers? A thrilling contest awaits you: go to Queen Kasimira's castle! On the way you have to compete with other knights and work out tricky sums. Wizard Mathicus checks all of your answers. If you can correctly answer a few sums and be first to the castle, with a little luck of the dice, you will be named a Knight of the Round Numbers!

name: Hideyoshi's Battles at the Summit
description:
This game utilizes a hybrid card-driven/area-impulse system. The game covers the Battles of Yamazaki and Shizugatake in 1582 and 1583 respectively, in which Toyotomi Hideyoshi's victories established his position as successor to Oda Nobunaga.

The game comes with two separate A2-sized maps for the two separate battles, 198 counters and 32 cards.

name: Storm Trooper
description:
Storm Trooper is a solo card game where you control a squad of 9 German storm troopers crossing a section of the Western front eliminating all enemies encountered in the trench-covered, debris strewn landscape of World War I.

There are 3 card decks that you must make:


A terrain deck of 50 cards to create the 5 row, 10 column "board" that you must cross to eliminate all enemies. Terrain cards have a defensive modifier and show start positions of enemy units.



An enemy deck of 20 cards, representing units of 1 to 16 men. Eliminate all enemies to win the game.



A storm trooper deck of 45 cards that modify your squad's combat, defense, or movement.


As with all Warp Spawn games, every card has a historically inspired title to draw you into the theme of the game and serves as a good description of its function.

Believe me, when you've got an enemy "Platoon" ahead of you, you don't want to be drawing "Wire Cutters"!

Your squad is represented by a single pawn or token. You may begin at the foot of any column with a hand of 4 storm trooper cards.

Each turn, after you draw 1 card, your squad advances to any adjacent space and if in range of an enemy first they attack and then you have an opportunity to attack them. Enemies range in strength of 1 to 16 men. Pennies, tokens, or scrap paper should be used to keep track of men. Some battles may last over several turns or you may want to leave some battles unfinished until you get the cards and the confidence to return to them.

To play the game with 2 players (or more), field two squads of storm troopers playing cooperatively, but competing to be the first to capture an enemy HQ space (say, one of the "blockhouse" cards) agreed upon by the players before beginning the game.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Print & Play, World War I
mechanics: Hand Management, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement

name: Game of Politics, or Race For the Presidency
description:
The Game of Politics, or The Race For the Presidency was first published in 1887 and patented in 1888. Unlike the later game of the same name by Oswald B. Lord, candidates in this game play cards against each other to reach the office of Mayor, Governor, Congressman, and Senator before moving on to a battle over each state's Electoral votes for the U.S. Presidency. 201 votes out of the 401 for all of the states are required to win.

While the game is listed as being for 2, 4 or 6 players, in fact there are only two candidates competing for the Presidency. When there are more than two players, the sides form two teams that play in turn to advance their respective candidates.

Few intact copies of the game seem to have survived to the present day. However, the patent application -- which lists the game's rules -- and surviving game boards give a good indication as to what the components were for the W.S. Reed Toy Company's release. These include:


Rules
Game board
Two "wads" (pawns) to move on the board's tracks; one red, one blue
23 pins for use in the left and right columns
At least one pin to mark the last bypassed state during the first pass through the state list
A deck of 48 cards, containing eight each of the following values: 1000, 2000, 3000, 5000, 7000, and 10000.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: Conquistador
description: “You (Cortez) control a band of Conquistadors seeking Gold in the New World. Conquistador Points: You start with 20 Conquistador Points (CP) (1 Point = 25 Men). If you are ever reduced to zero CP you automatically lose. The Deck: There is one deck. There are 2 main card types: Conquistador cards and Indian cards. Conquistador card types include: Expedition, Diplomacy, War, and Disease. Indian card types include: Aztecs, Tribes, and Settlements. Scoring: The game Ends when there are no cards left in the Deck. At the end of the game put all your Ally cards into the Gold Pile. Your score = the total point value of the cards in the Gold Pile.”
categories: Card Game, Exploration, Print & Play, Renaissance

name: Know Me Fast!
description: Players write down what they believe will be the other players' answers to four questions on a card (such as favorite horror movie, number of piercings, "first or last"), with cards for everyone rotating such that one card will be associated with a particular player. All other players having guessed, the particular player will give their own answers, and matches are scored.

name: Victory at Stalingrad
description:
"Card game for 2 players. Theme: WWII Eastern Front Battle of Stalingrad. One player is the Soviets. The other player is the Germans."

Each player uses a unique deck of cards. There are five suits marked 1 through 10 in each deck. The German suits are Firepower, Objectives, Morale, Tactics, and Forces. The Soviet suits are Defense, Locations, Morale, Tactics, and Forces. The cards depict elements of the historical campaign.

The players attempt to play the highest ranking card combination each hand. "Victory: The German Player must win 3 Hands in a row (Ignore Ties) to win. If the German player has not accomplished this by turn 10 the Soviet player wins."
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, World War II

name: Soccero
description:
From the official website:

"Soccero is the football boardgame that delivers the most exciting and realistic football experience! The game consists of two players or managers moving the player figures and the ball on the game board using dice. The player who has scored more goals by the end of the game wins. The game is designed to serve the skilled and strategic mind - but just as in real football, luck can always bring an unexpected challenge!

The Basic Rules make it easy and fun to get into the game. Later the managers may choose to follow the Extended Rules. The extended rules will add more realistic football features to the game turning it more challenging. The extended rules contain special situations such as goal kick, corner kick, throw-in, free kicks and penalty kick."

Re-implements

Die wilden Fussballkerle: Das dampfhammerharte Fussball-Spiel


Re-implemented in:

Soccero (Second Edition)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Lauras erste Übernachtung
description:
What Laura experiences when she visits her aunt has been experienced by almost every child - waking up in the middle of the night in a strange room. Nothing looks right in the dark - you try to figure out what the furniture is in vain...

It's a good thing to have a star nearby - Lauras star, for example, which has helped many children with the books & films of the same name. The star helps Laura overcome her fear of the darkness.

In the game, the children use a shining staff under a dark foil "tent" to find different items - and all they can see are the outlines. Additionally, they move Laura carefully from space to space. This is an innovative game idea in
which the children need a good eye and a calm hand.

-- paraphrased from a Babel-lation of the description at the Spiel des Jahres website

http://spieldesjahres.kiratec.eu/cms/front_content.php?idcat...;id=520

name: Da stimmt was nicht!
description: Da Stimmt was Nicht! (Something is Wrong!) is an educational game based on the fairy tale "Snow White and the Seven Dwarves". The game includes a story book of the tale, and a set of cards that correspond to pages in the book. Players match the cards to the book pages and try to find the differences, and win one a wooden dwarf when they are the first to recognize the mistakes. A player wins when they collect two dwarves, but you can lose them too so the game as not as easy as it might sound! The components are excellent in the game as well.

name: Synapse
description:
Synapse is a high-spirited game of teamwork and laughter. Form a sentence to get your team's Guesser to say a word. The Guesser has 60 seconds to get the answer...the faster you answer the more points you score. Sound easy? The catch is that team members must take turns adding one word to the sentence without consulting each other. Your synapses might not match your neighbor's. That's when the hilarity begins! Be ready for surprised looks, unusual sentence structure and outbursts of laughter as connections are made...or not! Once you start, you won't want to stop!

Description from the bottom of the Synapse box.

Home Page: http://www.synapsethegame.com/
categories: Educational, Electronic, Humor, Party Game, Word Game

name: Silk Road
description:
"Board game for 2-4+ players. Players are caravan merchants carrying goods back and Forth between China and Arabia."

"The Board: The board consists of a track 9 spaces long. The leftmost space is Arabia. The rightmost space is China. Arabia and China are referred to as destination spaces. The 7 intervening spaces are called road spaces."

"The Deck: Players share a common deck. There four main types of cards: Imports (Goods from Arabia), Exports (Goods from China), Road (Terrain along the Silk Road), Special (Obstacles and Opportunities)"

"Money in the game is counted in units of coins. The first player to accumulate 25 coins is the winner."

name: Polemos: American Civil War
description:
Polemos - American Civil War

The American Civil War was fought between two fledgling armies with little experience, over a vast area and with little knowledge of the technologies that would be brought to bear over the course of the war.

Inexperienced armies and generals, state driven mobilization and a belief that with one battle it would be over added, to the mixed and muddled beginning to the war. However with the emerging use of mass production for weapons, ammunition and supply there were some compelling reasons why this would not be so. With both the Union and Confederate governments aiming to mobilize, train and arm the volunteers and militias to the field within a few months gives us the opportunity to re-construct battles that were, in the main, very unpredictable.

This mixture of inexperience and technology would directly affect the course and length of the war. Both forces involved were made up of Regulars, Volunteers, and Militias that varied in size, experience and term of service. The protagonists also relied on conscription to add more troops to their armies as the war progressed and the volunteers began to dry up.

With Polemos, American Civil War (ACW), the opportunity to produce two sets of rules in one book is irresistible. This set of rules will allow the war gamer to re-fight the larger battles of the period such as: Lee versus Meade at Gettysburg or Bragg versus Rosecrans at Chickamauga fighting with armies of well over 50,000 men each.

The other allows the war gamer to fight Division or Corps sized actions and re-create smaller engagements within larger battles like Breckinridge’s final assault on the high ground at the Battle of Stones River (Murfreesboro) in January 1863, or the battle that lost Arkansas to the Confederates, Prairie Grove in 1862.

Polemos ACW is therefore produced as two sets of rules in one book. The first set, On They Came will allow the wargamer to fight battles with armies of up to corps size. The second set, Crisis of Allegiance will allow the wargamer to refight the BIG battles of the period.

The same wargames figures may be used in both sets of rules, as the basing system is universal - only the nominal scale will differ.

Polemos ACW aimed at enabling the wargamer to fight large scale actions; actual battles, rather than small scale skirmishes. Systems for firing, melee and morale are straightforward and easy to learn, but allow your troops to emulate the tactics used by their historical counterparts.

Basing and Representation:
The basic unit of manoeuvre in Polemos ACW is the Base - a group of wargames figures mounted permanently on a single base of a given size. The actual position and number of the figures on the base is not important, nor is it important that the base sizes given below are adhered to. So long as both armies use the same basing system, the rules should not be affected.

A 60mm x 30mm base of infantry represents an infantry regiment - about 300-500 men.
A 60mm x 30mm base of cavalry represents a regiment of 300-500 men and horses.
A 30mm x 30mm artillery base represents two batteries each of 4 to 6 guns.
A 30mm x 30mm Officer base is use for Generals, Corps and Divisional commanders

In Crisis of Allegiance, 60mm square bases are used. These can be formed by using two OTC bases, butted up one behind the other or a single larger base which allows a more creative and dioramic approach.

A 60mm square base of infantry represents an infantry formation of between 1200 and 2000 men. This may represent a brigade or division, depending on the size of the army being modeled.
A 60mm square base of cavalry represents between 1200 and 2000 men. This may represent a brigade or division.
A 30mm x 30mm artillery base represents 16 to 24 guns,

All distances in Polemos games are expressed in Base Widths (BW) and Base Depths (BD) in order to allow the use of differing base sizes. A BD is half a BW.
This system means that any size can be used for bases, so no rebasing is required so long as both sides are consistent. We believe that a 60mm x 30mm base gives the best results in terms of both practical use and visual impact. All Baccus 6mm Polemos army and booster packs are organised on this basis.

name: Warwick the Kingmaker
description:
Warwick the Kingmaker is a game for three to four players in which the players play feuding lords trying to get the most prestigious status in the realm.

In the game, the victor is the player with the most prestige points. Prestige points are earned in two ways; by the actions of the player's house and by supporting a candidate house.

Since the player's royal family is not a viable candidate for the throne the player must invest his resources to the right candidate for the succession.

(Note: the Earl of Warwick is a historical English lord but the game remains abstract and no particular elements of the War of the Roses enter play.)
categories: Civil War, Deduction, Medieval, Print & Play, Wargame

name: The League: the Football Card Game
description:
"Some people believe football is a matter of life and death. I'm very disappointed with that attitude. I can assure them, it is much, much more important than that." - Bill Shankly

In The League players take turns playing cards to attempt to build up an attack culminating in a shot on the opponent's goal or to foil that attack with a well placed tackle or save. The two-player game pits the players head to head where the 4-player game has two players per team working as a partnership. Each player starts with 7 cards, replacing cards played with cards from the deck and the game comes to an end after one run through the deck.

The cards are divided into attacking cards eg. Pass, Dribble, Shoot, defending cards eg. Tackle, Save, referee cards, eg. Offside, Penalty, and wonder cards, eg. Wonder Goal, Wonder Save. The side with possession aims to build up a series of attacking cards leading to a shot thundering past the opponent's keeper, the defending side tries to get possession with a tackle or to get the keeper on the end of the shot with a save card. Tackles have the risk of being countered by a referee dishing out a yellow or a red card or even a penalty which can only be saved by a Wonder Save.

The game plays in under half an hour and makes for a good filler especially with football fans.

name: Domino 32
description:
DOMINO 32 are playing cards based on Chinese Dominoes. There are 32 cards in 16 pairs, which then can form a 4x4 matrix. They are available in gold and silver decks. As is the cards can be used to play Pai Gow, Tien Gow (Sky Nine), Bagchen or any other game played with Chinese Dominoes.

Also available is a booklet called Domino 32 Card Games which includes the rules for 9 additional games: 16 Pairs, Bigger/Smaller, Cosmo Turtle, Dragon Dance, Heaven #9, Fair Lady, Pyramid, Concentration, and Challenge.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement

name: La Battaglia Aeronavale del Mediterraneo
description:
LA BATTAGLIA AERONAVALE DEL MEDITERRANEO

Second World War in Mediterranean Sea theater

in the box:

1 big map
22 Axis counters
15 Allied counters
Rules-Booklet

The target of the game for both Allied & Axis players is to permit own convoys to arrive safely in North Africa.

name: Baptism at Bardia
description:
Baptism at Bardia is designed as a solitaire game of the 3rd of January 1940 attack by the 6th Australian division on the Italian garrison of Bardia as part of General Wavell’s Operation Compass. The attack was the Australian army’s first division level operation in WW2 North Africa.

The player takes on the role of Australian Major General Mackay while the game’s system of priorities guides the player in controlling the individual Italian units under General Bergonzoli’s command in a manner designed to appropriately reflect the locally focused nature of the Italian defense.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Lónegan
description:
"The game of Lónegan: Hooray for Imagination!"
Imagination is imperative for winning in Lónegan. Logic, strategy and knowledge are also required, but are not as important.
(From the manufacturer's description back of the box).

Lonegan is a variation of a classical game where knowing the definition of a given word is less important than inventing one which sounds real for the rest of your gaming mates.

Home page: http://www.lonegan.es
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Point to Point Movement, Voting

name: Galaxy Express
description:
Galaxy Express is a rules set for a scifi board game that uses the Piecepack. It is freely web published and can be downloaded from the following address.

http://www.piecepack.org/Piecepackgames.asp

The theme is that you are controlling a spaceship(pawn) and have to move around the map (tiles) investigating planets(coins) to discover those to which you must deliver packages(coins). The difficulty comes through your limited choice of thrust(coins) and braking(coins). You can refuel but these are limited(dice).

name: Deukalion: Theseus – Conqueror of the Minotaur
description: This expansion for Deukalion brings the Greek hero Theseus into the game, where he can serve as a powerful warrior on your ship, fighting twice as well as normal figures. Just watch out for opponents poaching him for their own crews.
