The cards in this booster were originally released as part of the Munchkin Bites Halloween DVD set, which is now out of print. The DVD set, unlike this booster, includes the rules on how to run the demo.

The 3 new cards are:

Armee des Finstersinns
Dart Angel
Haushaltswarenverkäufer-Lakai


Note that 2 of these cards (Dart Angel and Haushaltswarenverkäufer-Lakai) have been re-released as part of the Munchkin Sammlerkoffer, but the icon is the Sammlerkoffer icon, not the jack-o-lantern.

Part of the Munchkin series.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Humor
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Time Zone
description:
How Much Do You Know About New Zealand?

Time Zone is the quiz game that’s both historical and fun. Developed in conjunction with the New Zealand School Curriculum, Time Zone will have you racing to complete a time line of events and placing New Zealand in a historical perspective as you do so. Do you know which came first, regular television broadcasts in New Zealand or Sputnik 1? Was the Great Depression before or after Jean Batten’s flight to New Zealand? These and other challenging questions will have your mind racing.

Time Zone includes ten different game variations so you can play for hours. You can choose to play with all the cards, just the New Zealand event cards, or just the world events. Play against others or race the clock to place ten event cards in a time line to win. Time Zone is great for challenging friends, and since it’s appropriate for ages 9 and up, the whole family can join in.

name: Trikk 16
description:
Trick taking game with three suits (red, green and black).
Each suit has 18 cards (1-18). The 16 is a negative card (-8) but in green -16. The game is played without trump.
All cards are delat to the players, but the leftover 6 (or 4) cards are turned up and will be awarded for the last trick.







Stichspiel mit drei Farben (rot, grün und schwarz).
Jede Farbe hat 18 Karten (1-18). Die 16 ist eine negative Karte (-8), in grün sogar -16. Das Spiel wird ohne Trumpf gespielt.
Alle Karten werden an die Spieler verteilt, die übriggebliebenen 6 (oder 4) Karten werden aufgedeckt und für den letzten Stich vergeben.

name: Cozmica
description:
Cozmica is a 2-player abstract strategy game. The theme of Cozmica is about relocating Earth life in DNA form, to a new world in the cosmos for survival. Both players sit on opposite sides of a 9 x 9 line grid board similar to a Go board.
Each player receives either 18 black or 18 white “Go stone like” playing pieces (Bio-ships). Playing pieces are marked with either an Animal, Plant, or Microbe symbol. The pieces interact with each other similar to the mechanics of Rock, Paper, Scissors, i.e.
Animals eat Plants, Plants absorb Microbes, and Microbes infect Animals.
All pieces move the same way…1 or 2 places, Horizontally, Vertically or Diagonally.
The objectives of the game are:
1. Surround and capture opponents Bio-ships.
2. Intercept and eliminate opponents Bio-ships.
3. Cross your own Bio-ships to the other side and off the board.
4. You acquire colonies by capturing opponents Bio-ships or crossing your own to the other side and off the board.
5. To win the game, you must establish at least one colony. They may be mixed [your’s and/or your opponents as long as they form a colony.
A colony is: 1 each of all 3 DNA types, 1 Animal, 1 Plant, 1 Microbe.
Playing time is about 30 to 60 minutes.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Point to Point Movement, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Set Collection

name: Scene It? Harry Potter Second Edition Deluxe
description:
The Scene It? family of games are popular-culture trivia games built primarily around viewing video-clips. Players roll the dice, move around the board, and answer trivia about anything from television, sports, or movie slogans to popular music and the romantic lives of celebrities. Two categories, however, allow you to watch questions presented on a DVD. Some questions have everyone racing to fill in the blanks. Other questions let players watch a movie or TV clip, then answer questions about the clip, the movie or show, or the actors/directors involved.

The Harry Potter versions of Scene It! feature film clips, puzzlers, and questions based on the Harry Potter movies. Player test their knowledge of this world-famous book and movie series, and challenge each other to see how much they really know about Quidditch, Transfiguration, or the Dark Arts.

From the publisher: “Fun for wizards and muggles! You don't have to be a Fifth Year at Hogwarts to do well at Scene It?: Harry Potter. On-screen challenges test your powers of observation, word play and puzzle-solving skills, so even if you don't know the first thing about how to brew a Polyjuice Potion, you'll still have a great time playing Scene It?: Harry Potter.”

The Deluxe 2nd edition of Scene It!: Harry Potter includes new movie clips and puzzlers from the first five movies about “The Boy Who Lived,” new Question Cards, two new Tokens, and a set of 4 exclusive Harry Potter Trading Cards. Packaged in a Collectible Tin.
categories: Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Party Game, Trivia

name: Armalion: Zauberey und Göttermacht
description:
From the back side of the box (translated from german):

Zauberey und Göttermacht is an expansion box for Armalion, the miniatures game in the world of The Dark Eye (Das Schwarze Auge). The box contains:
- A 64-page book with the full magic and consecrated rules, twenty-six new types of heroes (twelve magic and fourteen consecrated casters), 53 new creatures (animals, magical creatures, demons, undead and golems) and more than 50 new spells. All special varieties of magic are presented: Anti magic, rituals before the battle, summoning magic, Unitatio spirit covenant, Reversalis, Forbidden Gates, magical artifacts, elixirs, etc. Plus, there are rule additions and explanations, new rules for ranged combat, rules for ordnance, rules for flying creatures and much more!
- 72 magic cards with all new and old spells are explained in a handy shorthand.
- 11 different templates with which the effects of spells can be represented in the game.
- 16 unit cards with new heroes and creatures for Armalion.
- 117 magic markers, which spells can be represented in the game.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Minden World Cup Football
description:
The designer adapted his tried and trusted his soccer game rules and researched statistics for every world cup team from 1930 to 1983.

As usual with statistical games, you throw dice and check the roll or rolls against various charts and tables. It is fairly quick to play and allows a complete World Cup competition to be replayed in an evening.

name: Monopoly: Oviedo
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Oviedo, in Spain.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Zippers
description: Zippers is a fast-paced communication quiz game. On the game cards are two sentences each, each one describing a different word. But the two sentences are, like a zipper, intertwined and at first make no sense. But if you look closely, you can possibly find out the answer. If you think you have the word, hit the reply card as soon as possible and receive the points.

name: Jää Sulaa
description:
The game is situated in the southern polar ice cap, on an ice float which the heat of the sun is melting. Baby penguins traveling on the ice are trying to reach their mother before their way is cut off.

The game board depicts an ice float constructed of many ice tiles laid face down. The players move their penguins one at a time, trying to bring their baby penguins A) next to their own mother or B) next to an opponents mother. Every turn starts with the active player flipping and removing an ice tile from the board, possibly revealing a special action for that turn, and consequently making the ice float smaller.

The tile special actions are:
Scorching Sun: Flip and remove an extra tile
Belly Slide: Extra move
Empty: Nothing happens
Ice float moves: You can move an ice tile with a penguin on it.
Whale: Move an opponents penguin anywhere you like on the board (it gets scared).

The game ends when the last free ice tile is flipped, and the scores are calculated. You get positive points for every penguin of your own colour next to your mother penguin, but also negative points for every penguin of an opponents colour next to your mother penguin.

name: Scrabble: The Hobbit – An Unexpected Journey Edition
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Are You Ready for an Adventure? Take an unexpected journey with The Hobbit Edition of Scrabble and discover a new way to play America's favorite word game. Choose between traditional Scrabble game play or add a Hobbit twist with bonus word plays and custom Adventure cards. Comes complete with custom letter tiles featuring The One Ring as the letter "O," a richly decorated tile bag and a Hobbit inspired game board.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Word Game

name: La alegría de la fe
description:
ENGLISH:
Why can we choose between good and evil? Would you be able to explain "Christmas" without mentioning the words "white", "birth" and "Christ"? Want to try to draw the Holy Family? We propose a funny way to learn the faith, while playing mime, answer questions, draw, or you guess words.
The joy of faith is a board game inspired by the Catechism "Jesus is Lord" On a 67 squares board, you can play with your family or church groups or school, for testing the knowledge of the first childhood catechism.

Designed for adults and children from 7 years old, "The joy of faith" is a game that can discover and teach the basics of the Christian faith.

SPANISH:
¿Por qué podemos elegir entre el bien y el mal? ¿Serías capaz de explicar la "Navidad" sin mencionar las palabras "blanco", "nacimiento" y "Jesús"? ¿Te atreves a dibujar a la Sagrada Familia? Te proponemos una forma divertida de conocer la fe, mientras juegas en equipo a hacer mímica, a responder preguntas, a dibujar, o a la palabra tabú.
La alegría de la fe es un juego de mesa, inspirado en el Catecismo "Jesús es el Señor". Sobre un tablero de 67 casillas se puede jugar en familia, en los grupos parroquiales o en la escuela para ir poniendo a prueba los conocimientos del primer catecismo de infancia.

Pensado para adultos y niños a partir de 7 años, "La alegría de la fe" es un juego con el que es posible descubrir y aprender lo esencial de la fe cristiana.

name: Arcane Legions: Han Army Pack – Infantry
description:
From the box:

The emperor of China has dispatched Himiko, sorceress queen of Japan, to lead an army to punish those in the west responsible for the magical chaos that has swept over the land. Himiko commands an army not conceivable before the Night of Mists, composed of animated terra-cotta warriors, vengeful spirits, and powerful magic users, but is she really serving the emperor - or herself?
categories: Ancient, Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Mythology

name: Heart Attack or Escape from the Old Folks Home
description:
You are an “Old Folk” whose evil children have placed into a retirement home. One night after an average day you drift off to sleep as usual. In the morning you are awakened by the loudspeaker system, this is very much not usual. It appears to be a recording. A young insulting voice is outlining the victory, which his group achieved overnight. You realize he is part of the youth movement, which has been threatening the establishment, as usual. The voice declares that they have taken over the government and the first new law has been set into motion is nobody over the age of 30 is worthy of life. However, the law had been quickly modified to allow for one “Old Folk”, as they are to be called, to be allowed to live per retirement home. The first Old Folk to make his or her way out of the home will receive the pardon for life. Be aware however, the entire home has been booby trapped and there will be no medical teams sent in to help the fallen. The recording starts again.

Victory Conditions:
Players should agree to a victory point total before play begins, 20 points is a short game, 30 average and 40 long. Points are scored

How to score points:
After playing some room cards you may play a Passkey. This will do two things, 1) will allow you to move to another Quad if you wish to. Once the points are calculated the scorekeeper should note the player's new score and announce to all players what the score is. There are four scoring positions, position one, two, three, and four. The first room you play is in “Position One”, the next card your play will be in “Position Two”, then next “Position Three” and finally the fourth in “Position Four”.

name: Five Points: Gangs of New York – Flophouse
description:
This official Mayfair promo expansion was included as a retail give-away on a tile sheet titled: Limited Edition Promo Expansion Set #5.

Expansion consist of one extra building tile. If you control this buildings' space at the end of the round, then you can remove up to three of your rabble from any neighborhood tile and return them to your headquarters.

name: Diggin Deep Boxing
description: Welcome to the world of Diggin Deep Boxing!!! With Diggin Deep Boxing you can experience all the majesty and drama of boxing on the tabletop. Diggin Deep Boxing is a round by round simulation of the game of boxing, complete with everything you would find in a real life boxing ring. You might even find a few surprises as you would in an actual boxing match. Maybe you suffered a vicious cut above your eye. Will it heal? Will it affect your ability to continue to fight? Maybe one of the judges is paying off a gambling debt. Will he be scoring the bout in your favor, or in your opponent’s favor? Anything is possible with Diggin Deep Boxing. A full bout takes as little as 20-30 minutes to complete. There is also a quick play option where bouts are decided in one throw of the dice.

name: Devenez Président des états unis: too close to call
description:
Devenez Président des états unis is a game about the American presidential elections.

The goal of the game is to become president of the united states.

Each player can decide if he wants to throw one or two dices. The result is a number of votes he can assign to any state.
If you accrued the exact amount of votes requested in a state, you win the total of votes of this state, while your opponents get nothing.

The winner is the one getting a majority of the electoral college.

name: Mighty Heroes and the Monster Zone
description:
Mighty Heroes and the Monster Zone (MHMZ) is a game of strategy and chance utilizing cards, dice, and miniatures. Each player controls a faction (Spies, Ninjas, Robots, or Pirates) consisting of a faction deck of 8+ cards, a miniature representing a Hero, and a display tile. They will advance up the game board with their Hero by attacking fellow players, slipping by uncontested, or by battling monsters. As they move up the board they are hindered and helped by random Special FX cards. Each faction has a unique special ability to aid in their advance. Heroes will also level up as they make progress. The first Hero to make it into the wormhole at the top of the board wins.

Basic Premise: An evil mad scientist has merged our universe with that of the Monster Zone. As is becomes more and more corrupted a wormhole to an alternate dimension opens and all the Heroes desperately attempt to make it through to safety before it closes.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Miniatures, Pirates, Science Fiction, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Role Playing, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Sancak Beyi
description:
Collectible Card Game about Anatolian History and Mythology. New game mechanics are adding new excitement to your game experience.

Sancak Beyi is a card game for two players.

Both players begin the game with the title Sancak Beyi. The General purpose is to complete the two Tuğ of the Flags before the opponent and to win the game with the title "Beyler Beyi". During this process, to avoid the opponent to complete

The game is played with specially prepared 60 cards for each player on a special prepared game area. When starting the game both player has to shuffle their card decks and pick up 9 cards from the top of the deck. The players have to agree who begins the game.

There must be 2 Tuğ cards, minimum 4, maximum 5 Cengaver cards, minimum 6, maximum 20 Asker cards. The rest of the deck may include depending on the players choice, any numbers of Ganimet, Olgu and Bilgelik cards.

name: Damage Report: Problems with Puffballs Promo
description:
A careless crewman on board the Endeavor has brought aboard an unapproved pet, and now the crew must deal with an infestation of adorable, purring balls of puff, before their rapidly multiplying numbers flood the ship.

In Problems with Puffballs, players must contain the threat of multiplying cute aliens called Puffballs. Buy yourself time by releasing a few out of the Airlock, or permanently solve the problem by Teleporting them away onto a nearby alien ship. And do it all quickly…your Chief Science Officer’s calculations put the Puffballs’ multiplication rates to uncontrollably dangerous levels in only 21 minutes!

This promo includes 24 puffballs and a sheet of rules.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Real-time, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Fourplay Checkers
description:
An adaptation of Checkers for 3 or 4 players, Fourplay uses a 10 x 10 grid of squares for its board, with four corners of four squares each left off. A border surrounds the central 6 x 6 "Field." The outer portions of the board are called "Bases." There are four colors of pieces; each player begins with 6 each and places them on the dark squares of their base.

The game plays essentially the same as English Draughts, but with a few differences. Once players move into the Field, they may not move back into their own or any other player's Base, unless it is as part of a multiple jump that ends back in the Field. Once a piece is in the Field, it moves as a promoted piece, in any direction. Captures are compulsory, and a player's own pieces may be captured.

Variations are provided, either for last-man-standing victory conditions, or for scoring points. Also a more challenging variation called "DUBL-CHEKRS" is described.

The board itself is reversible, with a standard 8 x 8 checkerboard on the reverse.

The board and instructions feature small diagrams of variations of the Fourplay board, with larger Base areas; it is unknown if the game was ever published with these alternate boards.

name: Beatrix Potter's Peter Rabbit Race Game
description:
From the box -

A fun race game for all the family between Peter Rabbit, Squirrel Nutkin, Jemima Puddle Duck and Jeremy Fisher.

In the game each players (2-4) takes one of the famous Beatrix Potter characters from their starting square to the party being held in the woods (centre of the board), by throwing a die and moving the number of squares, drawing cards when indicated by the board with instructions (i.e Miss 1 Turn or have another go etc). First to the centre wins.

name: Drag Ball: The Game
description:
In Drag Ball: The Game, players play as one of twelve drag queens, developing her skills throughout the game to try to outlast the competition to win the crown. You need to be the one with the most sass, sophistication and aesthetic to reign victorious.

Drag Ball: The Game plays in fast-paced rounds, with one player being eliminated each round. Each round consists of a mini-challenge, a main challenge, a runway look construction, critiques in which players are ranked, and finally the "fish or filth" phase when the bottom two players face off to see who continues in the game. In addition to managing their hand of cards and creating a cohesive runway look, players will compete in minor physical challenges such as lip-syncing in order to gain advantages in that round.
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Set Collection, Singing

name: Motörhead
description:
Game description from the publisher:

The riffin', the loudness, the drinks, the girls, the songs, the lyrics, the fights, the fuck-ups and the wins, plus much, much more...

The Rock Science Motörhead Game includes 1,600 questions on the band's history from Lemmy's first steps into rock 'n' roll to the awakening of the monster that Motörhead is today. Round up your friends and play the loudest trivia game in the world. Three levels of difficulty — Poser, Fan and Scientist — and tense betting means that the novice can give the hardcore fan a fair fight.

name: Russian Empire 1912 (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
A fan expansion of the popular board game Ticket to Ride designed for 2-5 players. Contains a large map of the Russian Empire back to 1912, 54 destination tickets (48 regular routes and 6 long routes).

To play the components from the original game are required, be it Europe, USA or any other genuine edition with train cars and stations as well as illustrated cards of wagons and locomotives.

The basic rules of the Europe edition are applied to the game setup and main principles concerning Tunnels and Ferries. Double routes are used only with 4-5 players, otherwise only one track is accessible. Please note that some drastic changes were introduced into the scoring system. To evaluate your progress and receive earned winning points it is recommended to use a new scoring table, presented at the right bottom corner of the board allowing to assess built tunnels and regular routes separately.

At the end of the game some bonuses +10 might be awarded for players' achievements such as the longest route, the biggest number of visited cities or any other trophy at your option.


NOTE: "Ticket to Ride" and "Days of Wonder" are registered trademarks of Days of Wonder, Inc. This fan-created expansion map is not a Days of Wonder product, but has been created with permission of Days of Wonder, Inc, solely for unpaid, non-commercial use. Some of the text and illustrations used herein may be Copyright © 2004-2014, Days of Wonder, Inc. All Rights Reserved.


В основу данной версии игры легла гипсометрическая карта Российской империи лохматого 1912 года, содержащая не только опыт изображения рельефа нашей необъятной Родины, но и основные ветки железнодорожных перегонов того времени. Разумеется, существовавших в начале 20 века путей оказалось недостаточно для создания более менее сбалансированной игровой карты, а потому были добавлены несуществовавшие, а частично даже сейчас несуществующие маршруты, тоннели и паромные переправы (то есть на особую историчность и реалистичность не претендую). За неимением сколько-нибудь крупных городов в северо-восточной части Российской империи в качестве игровых узлов были взяты либо губернские центры, либо военные посты, основанные еще при освоении Сибири. Часть этих поселений в наши дни практически неизвестна и представляет подчас еще более жалкое зрелище, чем тогда, в царское время - счет населения в некоторых из них ведется не то что на тысячи, а лишь сотни человек.Постарался выдержать оригинальный стиль игры. Поле довольно большое, рассчитано на 2-5 человек. Для двоих даже великовато, но это, как с Европой и Америкой. Маршруты довольно разветвленные, но имеются и узкие места. Для игры рекомендуется использовать базовые правила Европы - двойные маршруты только для 3+ человек, классический принцип строительства туннелей и переправ, то же число вытягиваемых и оставляемых коротких/длинных маршрутов. При желании можно и похоумрулить. Внесены, на мой взгляд, логичные изменения в механику подсчета очков - туннельные ветки стали несколько ценнее, что нашло свое отражение в таблице подсчета очков, приведенной в правом нижнем углу поля. В конце игры возможно добавление участникам стандартных бонусов +10 очков за наиболее длинный маршрут или максимальное количество посещенных городов.


ВНИМАНИЕ: "Ticket to Ride" и "Days of Wonder" являются зарегистрированными торговыми марками компании Days of Wonder, Inc. Это любительское дополнение не является продуктом Days of Wonder, но создано с разрешения Days of Wonder, Inc исключительно для безвозмездного, некоммерческого использования. Часть текста и иллюстраций, использованных в дополнении, могут являтся объектом авторского права Copyright © 2004-2014, Days of Wonder, Inc. Все права защищены.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Trains, Transportation, Travel
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Cards Against Librarianship
description:
A library-themed spin on the popular Cards Against Humanity.

To begin, each player is dealt 10 white cards, and one player (the judge) begins the game by flipping over the first black card. The other players then put down one white card each that fill in the blank on the black card. The judge then decides which submission they think is funniest. The player who submitted the winning card gets to keep the black card.

The game is free to print and share online.


Cards Against Librarianship by Emily Lloyd is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 4.0 International License.

name: Monopoly: Swindon
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Swindon, in the United Kingdom.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Rund um Pony Peppermint
description:
Peppermint is a pony which every child would like. A pony to love! But a pony needs to be taken care or regularly. It needs to be groomed, fed and its saddlery and cleaning utensils needs to be looked after.

The aim of the game is to collect the most peppermint medals.

In order to get those the player needs a set of 5 different tiles. The tiles are acquired by rolling the colour on a 6-sided dice with the horseshoe acting as a joker. A player can keep any colour that is rolled on his turn but whenever a colour comes up a second time he loses all tiles collected so far in this turn.
In addition players can trade coloured tiles among themselves in order to complete sets.

So children will learn about risk management.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Trading

name: Town of Enchanted Mist
description:
Once upon a time, there was a little town covered by enchanted mist. Different people lived in this town with a problem of always be confused about the identity of each other. Eventually, they hated each other, separating into two parties. No one wanted to give their profit to another party. Hence, each party wanted to make sure that their the power of their people is greater than another. We accidentally come to this town, and we do not want to get into the trouble of two parties confrontation. Therefore, we have to figure out which party is prior than another, and make sure that we do not choose the wrong party to give our friendly greetings.

In the enchanted mist, players are trying to figure out which party is more powerful than another by secretly check out some people's identity, changing position with specific character. Once your figure out the situation over the town, you and all opponents may speak out how powerful is the party that take control over the town. The player who accurately speak out the power might be the one bless by goddess of victory. After few rounds of game, the winner will be the one who collect the most power points.

This is a game painted by MS Office 2010 PowerPoint
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Memory, Secret Unit Deployment

name: TV Boss
description:
TV Boss is a game of television battles for ratings.

Each player has a television channel. Players roll dice and move their pawns around a board with spaces that trigger various events:
- collects money of his tv shows (depending on the share)
- buy new tv show
- auctioning new tv show
- draw a event card

At the start of the game the players agree a quantity of money; the first player who obtains that amount, wins.

Is a family game with low complexity.

name: Rock Science: Festival
description:
Rock Science: Festival is a travel version of rock and metal trivia game Rock Science. The game covers hundreds of bands, from Classic Rock to Nu Metal via Trash Metal and many others.

Players compete to collect most point chips through answering questions. Question categories include rockers, albums and songs, and players may also be asked to hum riffs. All questions have three different difficulty levels - the higher difficulty a player chooses, the higher the possible reward in point chips. Other important game mechanics are betting (you constantly bet on the knowledge of co-players).

The game includes question cards (around 800 questions in total), die, point/betting chips and rules.

name: The Wheel of Time Collectible Card Game: Dark Prophecies
description: The first expansion to the Wheel of Time CCG, Dark Prophecies consists of 154 cards (50 common, 50 uncommon, 54 rares), distributed in 9 card booster packs. This expansion introduces a new card type, Prophecies, allowing players to establish and then fulfill Prophecies in order to gain a major advantage over their opponent.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Novel-based

name: The Wheel of Time Collectible Card Game: Children of the Dragon
description: The second expansion to the Wheel of Time CCG, Chidren of the Dragon consists of 150 cards (50 common, 50 uncommon, 50 rares), distributed in 9 card booster packs. This expansion contains new characters and troops for all allegiances in the game including Children of the Light, Aes Sedai, Andoran, Dark One, and Dragon, but with a major focus on the Aiel, featuring all twelve clan chiefs.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Novel-based

name: Wordplay
description:
Wordplay combines the fun and challenge of creating new words with the high speed, card-playing dynamics of gin rummy. Use the cards in your hand to make new words or add to the words already created by other players. Be creative and accumulate points to win the game.

For the youngest student learning to read, Wordplay is a challenging and stimulating educational tool. Wordplay is also a perfect family and party game, and a creative challenge for mature minds. It is just the right amount of action-packed word creation and fun. Wordplay never plays the same way twice!

—description from the publisher

name: Alchemist of Five Elements
description:
Story:
Long ago, the power of five elements was operating in the whole land. Metal manufactured tools. Wood bred creations. Water moisturized lives. Fire warmed world. And Earth created land. Five elements mutually generated and overcame each other. In this circle, all creations within heaven and earth never ended.
In the vast land, only a few people could master all five elements. People called them “The Alchemist”.
One day, the empire held a competition of five elements to find the best alchemist. And you are one of them.
You have to follow the secret book, and use your magic spell and ancient artifact to collect specific element stones. Once you succeed, you will be the best alchemist in the world. But be careful, all your element stones may suddenly token by other alchemists. And your soul and body may be torn apart because of wrong element stones…



Introduction:
In the beginning of the game, players choose their target cards. And in each turn, player moves on the five element map and uses the function card to collect element stones or to do the special function. Players have to reach the alchemy condition on his target card. Once a player reaches his target, then he wins, and the game is over. But if someone reaches the soul-broken condition on his target card, then he has to restart.So, hide you target carefully. And start to enjoy the magic power of Chinese five elements!
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Long Zhong Strategy 隆中對
description:
During the Three Kingdoms era in China, three major States (Wei, Shu and Wu) contested for the unification of the country with other local warlords and among themselves. The name of the game is the strategic plan given by the adviser of Shu to his King at the place called Long Zhong.

In this game, players can play the roles of one of the three major States or as misc. warlords power. A player can take two actions each turn. The options for the actions include:
1. occupy neutral city;
2. transfer of armies;
3. recruit armies;
4. attack an enemy city; or
5. use a strategy card.

Players would vie for control of different cities on the game board, with their General and Army cards, the exact contents of which are hidden from the view of other players to create a fog of war. The bulk of the game lies in the action of "attack an enemy city", where two players would lay down their Army cards in formation and reveal them at the same to compare the strength and decide the outcome of the battle.

The first player who conquers all other capitals is the winner of the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Przepustka
description:
Po licznych bojach i heroicznych wysiłkach, dla każdego legionisty przychodziła upragniona chwila wytchnienia. Zasłużony urlop – PRZEPUSTKA – w czasie której, można było odwiedzić rodzinny dom czy też stęsknioną narzeczoną. Łatwiej powiedzieć, trudniej wykonać. Trwała wojna, wszędzie zniszczenia, pociągi przepełnione, po drogach grasują Kozacy a na wszystkich maszerujących z frontu, podejrzliwe spoglądali austriaccy żandarmi. Nasza Przepustka obowiązywała jednak tylko 7 dni - 7 krótkich dni i nocy. Legioniści musieli więc się spieszyć i liczyć na łut szczęścia.

Przepustka to gra przeznaczona dla 2,3,4 bądź 5 graczy. Otrzymują oni pod kontrole dwóch legionistów. Gracze muszą starać się tak poprzez zagrywanie kart ruchu sterować swoimi legionistami by ci dotarli do swoich rodzinnych domów narzeczonych i nie wpadli w tarapaty. Gracze za osiągnięte cele otrzymują punkty zwycięstwa. Te można również zyskać dzięki kartom lub odwiedzeniu miejsc pamięci. Wygrywa ten gracz którego legioniście zdążą uzbierać najwięcej punktów zwycięstwa


After numerous battles and heroic efforts, a much-desired rest aould arrive for every soldier. Well-deserved leave - Furlough - during which it was possible to visit home or a fiancée. Easy to say, hard to accomplish. The war continues, and there are disuptions everywhere and overcrowded trains. Cossacks are prowling along the roads and suspicious Austrian military policemen are looking on marching from the front soldiers. Our Furlough is in force only for the week - 7 short days and nights. The soldiers must act quickly and count on a bit of luck.

Przepustka (A Furlough) is a game intended for 2, 3, 4 or 5 players. Each of players controls two soldiers - using movement cards they help them reach family and friends safely and don't get into trouble. Victory points are awarded for visited destinations. It is also possible to gain these points thanks to cards or by visiting storage locations. The winner is the player whose soldiers manage to gather most victory points.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, World War I

name: UNO: Phineas and Ferb
description:
Classic UNO with Phineas and Ferb artwork on the cards.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO:

Agent P Card - Play Agent P Card whenever someone plays a Draw 2 or Wild Draw 4 on you and that person must draw the designated amount of cards from the discard pile. The Agent P Card is also a wild card where you choose the color that resumes play.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – U.S.S. Pasteur Federation Expansion Pack
description:
The U.S.S. Pasteur is an Olympic-class hospital ship from an alternate time line. These ships are equipped with minimal weaponry and can reach a speed of Warp 13. Under the command of Captain Beverly Crusher, the Pasteur entered into the Devron system and scanned for a temporal anomaly before it was attacked by two Klingon warships.
This expansion comes with one new ship and a new set of cards for Star Trek: Attack Wing.

U.S.S. Pasteur Federation Expansion Pack is part of the Wave 16 expansion packs from WizKids Games.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Flippin' Fruit:  Bonus Fruit Basket Cards
description:
This expansion consists of 6 Fruit Basket Cards that can be added to the deck.

These cards must be played immediately after drawing them and are designed to bring a little more chaos into the game.

name: Character Quest: Heroes The Card Game – Game Pack #1: King's Guard
description:
Goblins are pillaging the countryside. Heroes are lining up to gain loot and fame. Which player will have the most successful hero tavern in the land?

In Character Quest: Heroes The Card Game – Game Pack #1 – King's Guard, up to four players take turns collecting heroes and sending them out to gain victory points for your tavern. From the mighty Paladins and Wardens of the King's Guard Tavern to the powerful Great Wolves and Berserkers of the Savage Beasts Tavern, each player will try to create a powerful combo of heroes to defeat even the toughest locations.

Only one deck is needed for up to four players; extra decks can be used separately by each player or shuffled together for everyone to share. Despite the "TCG" in the title, the components of the items in the game are fixed, not randomly distributed.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Particle Accelerator
description: Particle Accelerator is an educational dexterity game for 1 or more players. Particle by particle, you must create (in order) hydrogen, helium, lithium, beryllium, boron, carbon, nitrogen, oxygen, fluorine, and neon, by flicking protons, neutrons, and electrons into the atomic structure. At every step of the way, what you create must be a stable isotope (although it could be an ion), with electrons in the correct electron shells, or — BOOM! — nuclear meltdown, game over.

name: Epicycle
description:
A 2-player pure abstract strategy game using a single stash of Looney pyramids. Each player has 3 pyramids in hand, and 9 pyramids are arranged lying in a circle with a gap for a 10th pyramid.

On your turn, place one of your pyramids into the gap and remove a pyramid of a different size, n spaces clockwise or counterclockwise from the gap, where n is the pip-count of your placed pyramid.

If you have no legal move, you lose. If all 3 of your pieces in hand are the same size, you lose.

name: Trick or Trick
description:
Players are dealt cards depicting girls, ghosts, or fairies. On each turn, one player selects an opponent and plays a card face down to "visit" that opponent for Halloween, saying "Trick or Treat." The opponent must decide whether to hand over a piece of candy or suffer a "trick."

The results of the "trick" are different depending on the identity of the card. If the card is a girl, the opponent receives two pieces of candy. If the card is a ghost, the opponent must give two pieces of candy to the card's owner. If the card is a fairy, the opponent and the card's owner both must give up half their candy to the supply.

If the opponent elects the "treat" option, the active player may request a second piece of candy...but if so, the opponent may choose to turn the played card back on its owner. The game ends when all cards have been played. The player(s) with the most candy wins.

name: Advanced Title Bout
description:
Advanced Title Bout is the next step in the evolution of the classic board game that debuted over thirty years ago as an Avalon Hill/Sports Illustrated board game.

Like its predecessor, Advanced Title Bout is a simulation of the sport of professional boxing; and like the original game, Advanced Title Bout provides the speed, unpredictability and excitement of the fight game.

However, Advanced Title Bout makes use of over twenty years of additional research and innovation, making the rated fighters the most accurate rendition to date. The newest iteration of the classic boxing board game also includes completely revised tables, as well as new ones to add even more realism and accuracy to the simulation. Fighters are now rated in the prime and past prime of their careers. Normal and fatigue mode across 17 categories!
In Print and for the first time PDF! A new game board design! Still using the same FAC deck idea.

This title was discontinued in 2014 and became Title Bout 2 by Straight Jab Media in 2019.

name: Uprising
description:
Uprising is a game for two players that depicts, in a very abstract way, the growth and development (or containment and suffocation) of a popular movement in revolt against an oppressive government. The Rebel player, who starts the game with little apparent power but a great deal of information, is in conflict with the Government player, who has power (with his assortment of Agents) but very little information on the Rebel’s resources and capabilities.

The pieces represent small groups (Insurgents and Agents), support organizations (Sympathizers), and nonexistent things or misleading information (Dummies).

The map (a field of 91 hexes) is perhaps the most abstracted part of the design, in that it does not represent physical distance, but something more like organizational proximity. With the Rebel pieces starting on the outer perimeter, and the Agents starting in a tight group around the Nexus, it can be displayed how far the revolt must go and how much larger it must grow in order to challenge the government for ultimate power. However, being out in the margins allows time to organize and gather strength....
mechanics: Action Points, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Most Glorious Comrade
description:
Most Glorious Comrade is a light card game with variable player powers in which 2-6 players are vying for the affections of the Proletariat.

Comrades (players)start the game by choosing who is the Greatest Comrade (first player) based on clothing and knowledge of Communist buzzwords.

Comrades choose one of six leaders: Lenin, Stalin, Mao, Trotsky, Castro, and El Che.

Comrades start with one card in their hand.

Every turn, Comrades draw 1 card and play 1 card.

The first Comrade to 10 Million Proletariat wins. Proletariat cards are distributed from 1 Million to 4 Million. Good luck, Comrade!
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Evasive Action Resource
description:
The Evasive Maneuver Action Template is a participation prize given to players who participated in Month 1, "Encounter at Farpoint," of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Storyline Organized Play Event, Q Continuum. It is considered a Resource, and costs 5 Squadron Points.

Each round, one of your ships may use the Evasive Action Maneuver instead of a normal maneuver by selecting a red or come about maneuver on its dial. You perform the maneuver using the special template.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: A Game for Good Christians: Why We Can't Have Nice Things
description:
The Why We Can’t Have Nice Things Expansion Deck includes such biblical gems as:

Your father being your grandfather and uncle (Genesis 19:30-38)
Being liable for morons falling off your roof (Deuteronomy 22:8)
Loving God while not being a dick to everyone else (The whole sum of the Law, the Prophets, and the Gospel)
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Religious

name: Dreamstarter
description:
User summary:

Dreamstarter is a simultaneous action selection investment card game.

Players have a hand of money cards numbered between 0 and 12. Each round, a venture card is drawn with a specific difficulty. Each player invests a hidden amount, which is then turned up, and dice rolled to see if the venture succeeds, with a higher probability if enough people invested. If the venture succeeds, each investor gains a certain amoung of VP. It takes one round for the used investment cards to return to the hand of the players, and even longer if the venture failed. Event cards throws in other unexpected factors in the game.

Most VP at the end wins.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: 王的使用人 (King's Game)
description: Who will take the throne in the King's Game?

name: Doctor Who Co-Op Adventure Game
description:
The Doctor Who Co-Op Adventure Game is a 1-5 player COOPERATIVE exploration and adventure game set in the crazy universe of the Doctor Who TV series. This game was hand crafted by Sean Patten as a gift to his family. Now you can print your own copy and take it for a spin!

The DWCOAG is scenario based game where you take on the role of the Doctor and his assistants. Encounter tiles reveal items, enemies, minions, traps, and alarms, all which have to be dealt with using character skills (fight, wit, and run). Event cards cause enemies to regroup or advance, doors to lock, or even your Tardis to get stolen. Avoid capture and complete objectives to win the scenario.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Flip MMCG
description:
Straight from minimalist Japan, FLIP MMCG is the ultimate resolution system. Flipping a coin... without the coin. Rock, paper, scissors... without the scissors. FLIP MMCG is a drawless system with immediate results. No table space required, plays completely in your hand. It also is a massive multiplayer card game, that only takes 1 minute. Awesome ice breaker at conventions, classrooms, parties, game nights, road trips, and picnics.

FLIP MMCG is a quick and simple competitive game for 2 or more players, by Charles Ward. The goal of the game is to gain as many FLIP cards as possible or be the last player in the game. Ignoring turn order, 2 players face off against each other. One player holds out a card, the other flips it over. The person on the blue side of the card wins, and takes a card from the loser.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Print & Play

name: Travel all over Thailand
description:
Getting to know Thailands provinces, its sights, traditions, as well as local specialities.

Game-play: Fun and strategy game in rounds from 2 to 9 players.

Goal of the game is to to be the first to have no cards left in hand, or if not possible to have the lowest amount of scoring points on hand.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Travel

name: Minirail
description:
A network building game for 2 to 4 players. Each card depicts a black and/or a white railway line and possibly a station. Players try to build the highest scoring pair of railway lines, gaining points for longer lines, more stations and closed loops.

Each player is dealt 12 cards and divides them into groups of 3 or 4, depending on the number of players. Everyone then selects groups of cards from each other player, until all players have a new set of 12 cards. Finally, each player tries to lay out their cards to form a black railway line and a white railway line. The player with the highest total score from their pair of lines wins.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Open Drafting

name: BattleTech: Technical Readout – 3150
description:
(description from game publisher)

War has spread across the Inner Sphere, shattering and shifting alliances both old and new. As the Clans once more close in on humanity’s homeworld of Terra, the walls of Fortress have come down, revealing the return of Devlin Stone. Desperate for any edge, the Great Houses, Clans, and Periphery states of the Inner Sphere have unleashed a flood of new war machines, rushing them into battle on every front.


Technical Readout: 3150 collects the latest generation of battle armor, vehicles, ’Mechs, and aerospace units from around the Inner Sphere in a single print volume for the first time, complementing the Republic-heavy units shown in Technical Readout: 3145. Featuring new technologies found in Era Report: 3145 and Field Manual: 3145, with new variants and notable pilots, this volume provides players with a glimpse into the twilight years of the Dark Age Era.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Star Wars: Duell der Mächte
description:
A simple Star Wars themed Card game.
Each turn a villain card is revealed and players use their 8 hero cards to bid on them. Different villains give different points; Darth Vader, however, gives negative points.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Der kleine Rabe Socke: Das große Rennen
description:
Who can get his vehicle over the finish line first in Der kleine Rabe Socke: Das große Rennen? Along the way, you need to pass carefully because skillful lane changes are required in order to avoid unforeseen obstacles.

In more detail, each player drives one of the five racecars along the curvy racetrack through the forest. On your turn, roll both dice, then reroll one of the dice if you want to. The result on the number die moves your car forward along the racetrack; the result on the action die allows the nimble racecar drivers either to move an obstacle on the track, which you otherwise would have to avoid, or to make a lane change — to shift to the inside lane of a curve, for example. The good news: A lane change can be made before, during, or after the number die's movement. The game consists of two laps, and whoever first completes the second lap wins the big race.

name: Sakura Boys and Girls
description:
The players have to create the best couples of Sakura High School.
They start at the middle of an area made of 54 cards(27 males and 27 females).
At his turn, a player can use 0, 1 or 2 actions(similar or different) among 3:

move one of his 2 pawns towards a card or an empty space.
reveal a hidden card.
make the union of a boy and a girl with his 2 pawns on their cards.


The distance between the boy and the girl and the quality of the couple can be rewarded by any white tokens(each turn, one can be used to play 2 more actions).
Each union and each white token worth 1 victory point.
The winner is the player who has the higher number of victory points or white tokens if there is a tie.

name: India (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This map is an unofficial Fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.


This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop. You can use stations if you wish.

There is an extra set of cards for the "cities", each with a value to be earned by visiting that "city". These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules. Some of the cards give you extra facilities to complete your tickets. There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks, though there are limited selective options for these.

The main new rule is the option to discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn. This is very useful if you are desperate for engines or a particular colour card. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Scrabble NHL Edition
description:
From the back of the box:

Lace up your skates and prepare to face off for the NHL Edition of SCRABBLE. Assist yourself and score high with an exclusive NHL dictionary as you power play your way through the most action-packed SCRABBLE game ever!

In Scrabble, players draw letter-tiles to form words on the gameboard. Each word earns points based on points of the tiles, and any bonuses. A word can only be played if it uses at least one already-played tile or adds to an already-played word.

In Scrabble NHL Edition, the board looks like a hockey rink with many NHL symbols on it and a grid pattern. The double letter spaces have the NHL logo, the triple letter spaces have the Western logo, the double word spaces have the Eastern logo on it and the triple word spaces have another NHL logo.

There are also Bonus Words that are allowed that are hockey related (NHL, Wild, Pads, Net, Save, etc.) that are worth an additional 5 points.

There are also terminology and team names that are allowed as bonus words for 10 points (Kings, Senators, Hockey, Coyotes, Faceoff).

Finally there is a section of special rules : Pre-Season, Trades, Trade Deadlines, Delay In Game, Too Many Men On The Ice, Pulling the Goalie and Offsides, designed to make the game feel more like hockey.

name: The Check Deck
description:
From the publisher:

Have a Checkers board? When is the last time you played it? Renew the fun and enjoy-ability of Checkers with The Check Deck! The Check Deck is a card game that accompanies and enhances that dusty Checkers board in your closet and reawakens the excitement! It's fun for the whole family and easy to understand and play.

The rules are simple.

1. Each player is dealt seven card.
2. A player can either play a card or make a normal checkers move. Examples of cards are: Move two pieces one space each: Switch one of your pieces with one of you opponents piece: Turn any of your pieces into a king.
3. As per checkers rules, a move is defined as moving a space, a jump, a double jump, etc.

Each deck contains two each of 17 individual cards for a total of 34 playing cards and one rules card.

name: Karacterz
description:
A new epic fighting card game to experience! Build your own fighter, complete with weapons, armor, masteries and origin stories and fight to see who built the best one! Karacterz features 77 unique artworks of 63 artists from 23 countries. Play with a fresh experience every time.

Build your character to specialize in either Magical, Agility (martial arts) or Physical (medieval warfare), have a combination of two of them or all three! Players also build up their character's combat deck to fight with and buff them up with stats. There is no Life Points or Maximum Health in Karacterz so deal as much damage to your opponents as possible! Player with the least amount of damage on them is the victor.

Karacterz is a great game for gamers of all styles and skill levels. This is a perfect game for skilled gamers to play with more casual gamers. Karacterz features many small game mechanics that interact with each other, perfect for experienced gamers, but not necessary a must to win. Those who find the depth of Karacterz overwhelming need not play with every feature to have a great time and beat up their friends!

Playing with a large group? Karacterz features a Teamwork/Betrayal system that guarantees to make group play interesting and more fun! Wanna check out more about Karacterz? Go to our links!

name: The Foreign King: Riots Expansion
description:
Europe is up in arms, the revolution is everywhere. The people rebels against their monarchies to have a Constitution.

Do you think it will happen also in our country? I do not see why, majesty. You are a great king and Belgium already has a Constitution. But there's always someone unhappy and Belgium is no exception; riots will happen here as well and we will have to intervene. You will not want to use weapons against your people, majesty! Yes of course, my weapons will be firmness and justice.

In February 1848, Leopold I helped to maintain peace remaining neutral during the revolutionary events that upset Europe between January of 1848 and spring of 1849. He also played an important role in stopping the spread of the Revolution into Belgium. These riots were a series of political upheavals throughout Europe, that remains the most widespread revolutionary wave in European history, but within a year, reactionary forces had regained control and the revolutions collapsed.

With the Riots expansion, players have to manage riots in the provinces of Belgium and use them for their purpose ruining the plans of the opponents. They can also use the King Leopold I not only to get victory points by majorities and factories, but also turning off the hotbed of revolution in the country.

Contents: 10 riot tokens, mini-rulebook.

This exclusive expansion was supplied to Kickstarter Deluxe participants.

Note: The description is taken from the Kickstarter stretch goal text, the contents here have been corrected from the originally stated 8 to the final number of 10 riot markers.

name: Heads Up
description:
The objective of the game is to stack plastic books on your own hat and hope to be the one with the best balance. When everyone else have dropped their books only the winner is left.
Each player places a "student hat" on her or his head. The top of the hat is flat and slightly rubbery. You roll a die and get to do one of six things:
Remove 1 book from your own head
Add 2 books to your own head
Everyone adds 1 book to their own heads
Everyone adds 2 books to their own heads
You pick a player who gets to remove 2 books from their own head
You pick a player who gets to add 2 books to their own head

There are two different sizes of books, big and small, you pick yourself which ones you want. And, you are only allowed to use 1 hand when you add and remove books from your head.

name: MAH!
description:
The abridged card game of the centuries-old game mahjong!

A rummy-style card game based on the classic game of mahjong. Be the first to complete a hand by collecting sets, runs, and a pair. Play to win, but also play to not give up the winning hand!

name: Go, family, go!
description:
From the publisher:
The goal of Go, family, go! is to foster a greater relationship between the members of the family, a passage of information (such as, for example, the discovery of little secrets, sharing of memories and desires, the confession of our own fears, etc.) and a new-found complicity.
Go, family, go makes available to participants (2 to 6 players) some cards depicting typical family experiences: watching a movie at the cinema, a picnic in the countryside , football game in Tv, stadium or in the garden.
All the experience cards have multiple interpretations.
At the beginning of the game the family chooses the most eligible candidates experiences, but only one will actually be one you will live; in essence, then, the game goes beyond the same time to perform it and continue with the won experience sharing.

From the publisher (Italian):
L’intento di Go, family, go! è quello di favorire una maggior relazione tra i componenti del nucleo familiare, un passaggio di informazioni (quali, ad esempio, la scoperta di piccoli segreti, la condivisione di ricordi e desideri, la confessione delle proprie paure, etc.) e una ritrovata complicità.
“Go, family, go” mette a disposizione dei partecipanti (da 2 a 6) alcune tessere raffiguranti esperienze tipicamente familiari: dalla visione di un film al cinema, al picnic in campagna, alla partita di calcio da vedere allo stadio o semplicemente da giocarsi in cortile. Tutte le tessere esperienza hanno molteplici chiavi di lettura.
All’inizio del gioco la famiglia sceglie le esperienze più papabili, ma solo una sarà effettivamente quella che si andrà a vivere; in sostanza, quindi, il gioco travalica il tempo stesso per svolgerlo e continuerà con la condivisione dell’esperienza vinta.

name: Bird of Happiness
description: Bird of Happiness is a simple deck-building game in which players try to collect happy birds, some of which will provide special help to the players. Watch for the four-leaf clover as well since those can also aid you...

name: Kallat
description:
In the beginnings of times was Keberadaan, and he decided to release the energy whose expansion created all the known planes. The tenth plane is the one of Kallat. A summoner society that uses the energy form Keberadaan to bring life to incredible creatures and fulfill the missions that are imposed.
Now you can be a Summoner from the Kallat’s universe, start your training and fight against others who are trying to enter in this world.

'Kallat' is a strategy game in which you are a Summoner that materializes different creatures to fight against a rival or between teams. You have the possibility to choose your own Summon’s grimoire that will contribute Life and Existence Points to your Pyre. These points are the ones you need to take care if you do not want to lose your battle.
At first, you will take 6 Tactic/ Strategy Cards and place your Monolith in the board. Now is the moment when you can start summoning the creatures that will represent you in the battle field. In the second turn, your Summons will be able to move around the board as well as they can attack using their weapons, skills, spells, etc. in the quest to reduce the Life of the opposite party and wind the encounter. There are certain attacks with altered states that produce extra damage and there are others in which magic is involved; therefore, they not only consume your Action Points but also your Existence Points. So be careful when you use them! Even though they are very powerful, excessive use of them can put your creature in a high risk since loosing all your Existence Points will make you loose the battle.
Tactics and Strategy Cards are not only to summon a creature since they can also bring you extra help that, if you use wisely, can turn around the outcome of the game.
Another way of winning the game is with special attacks meant to destroy all the enemy creatures by removing their Projection Points. Each eliminated Summon gives you one Victory Point. At the beginning of the training, the party can decide the maximum number of Victory Points needed to win the game (usually 3 to 5 points).
Furthermore, you have different boards to create sceneries in the shape you want. Also, you can determine the weather and lightning of each territory. Notice that each feature comes with its own consequences.
Kallat is thought for you, as Summoner, to feel part of a world full of energy and action in which your battle expertise and the knowledge of the creatures you choose from your Grimoire can make you the best Summoner of all times.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Time Jockeys: Myths and Legends Expansion
description:
A small expansion that adds the following items to the game:

Video Confirmation of Bigfoot

Excalibur (Taken)

Video Confirmation of the Loch Ness Monster

Baba Yaga's Hut (Taken)

Video Tour of The Lost City of El Dorado (Taken)

Water from the Fountain of Youth

Video Tour of Atlantis

Robin Hood's Bow and Arrows
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Three Little Ducks
description:
Three Little Ducks is a card game in which the players cooperate and compete to build a path out of "danger" and move their three baby duck cards along it to the safety of home. Players take turns to pick up a card from the deck which will either help them build a path or move one of their ducklings along it. Watch out for the big bad wolf card! He will send your duck back to the start. The first player to get all three of their ducklings home is the winner!

The Three Little Ducks game consists of a deck of 52 cards.
It is for 2 to 4 players and takes 30 minutes to play.
It is suitable for young children even if they can't read yet.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: Most Incorruptible Patriot
description: Most Incorruptible Patriot is the sequel to Most Glorious Comrade. You are playing as notable democratic Cold War leaders vying for Voters. Whoever reaches 10 million first wins! This is an easy to pick up draw one play one style game.
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Draw Blood: Remix
description: Draw Blood: Remix is exactly that - a remix of the Original Draw Blood, which was a Rummy-style card game. This revisit to the Draw Blood concept, brings back discarded elements from the earlier versions of the game, while also creating a completely new game with cards already familiar to Draw Blood fans. The result is a fast-paced game where players draw and discard their way to an empty hand, laying down a variety of Monsters that can hinder your opponent’s progress. Strategic hand management, card awareness and fun ways to stop Monsters (and your opponent) are the essence of Draw Blood: Remix.

name: My Feelings
description: My Feelings is a children's game. The game features seven basic feelings (happy, sad, angry, excited, frustrated, scared, and tired) that players will first identify, then explore by drawing cards. The players moves on a board by spinning a spinner, giving them steps to move. If the player lands on a blue spot on the board, they draw a blue "happy" card, and must tell the others what make them happy, by choose from two printed answers on the blue card. If the player lands on a read spot, then they draw a red "anger" cards, and must tell the others that they do I they get angry by choose from two printed answers on the red card. There is also some purple spots, if a player lands there they need to draw a purple "act" card, and do what the card say, eg. "act like a chicken". The winner is the player first to the goal on the board.

name: Baantjer: Plaats Delict
description:
This game is based on the Dutch TV series "Baantjer".

From the publisher:
There have been a number of killings in the city and you are put on the case as a detective. The case consists of a suspect, a motive, a weapon, a corpse and a trace. Gather evidence at the scene as quick as possible, and trace the fingerprints of the suspect. Subject your opponents with some hard cross-examination and try to discover important information. Write down your findings with precision and finish the crime.

If you succeed as the best crime detective, you can call yourself "baantjer".

Both players play the role of a detective and a murder. The murder that everyone did consists of five hand cards. Those five cards are a suspect, motive, weapon, corpse and a trace. Every player tries to find out which cards the other players have in their hands. In a players turn, a player is allowed to ask a question to another player that can only be answered with "yes" or "no". If answered with "yes" you are allowed to ask another question, if answered with "no" the turn moves on to the next player.
Asking questions is done with the cards laying face-up on the table with all the case items in a pattern. Every player writes down what he thinks is helpful for his investigation and tries to score points with the right questions.

The game ends when there is only one player left with cards in his hands and a murder that has not bin solved.

name: Exposed: Character Pack – Tools of the Trade
description: This is a pack of twelve alternate Character cards that were given away to backers of the Exposed Kickstarter campaign. They are labeled Item #37 through Item #48.

name: Scoops
description: Tease your taste buds with this family-friendly card game for up to 6 players. Mix and match your favorite flavors, toppings, and cones to build the ultimate ice cream creation! Play ice cream cards on your cone to score huge combos, play toppings to keep your chain going or break your opponents combos, and surprise someone with a "Cherry Bomb!" blowing their ice cream right off their cone. Scoop up as many points as you can before someone plays the “Cherry on Top” to end the game!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Take That

name: 2016.A
description:
Description from the designer:

Players take turns to swap a card, then predict where an arrow will travel to. It's critical to not only remember what the face-down cards are, but also consider what you're swapping, what cards you're giving to the other player, and what they could swap.

Setup: make a 3x3 grid of cards. Both players see the middle 3. Each player looks at the 3 closest to themselves. The remaining 3 cards are given to the start player, along with the arrow.

Each turn:

the arrow is placed in front of the central card on the active player's side.
the active player swaps a card on the table with one from their hand, then gives the 3 cards to the other player.
the other player swaps a different card on the table.
the active player predicts which side of the grid the arrow will exit on
the other player chooses a different side
cards are turned over, one at a time, to reveal the path that the arrow follows, until it exits the grid
if either player predicted the exit side correctly, they get a point.


First to 3 points wins the game.
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Maze, Memory, Print & Play

name: Domino Castle
description:
Domino Castle is played on a 7 x 8 grid with standard domino tiles. The game is for two players. At the beginning in two opposite corners is one tile the 0/0 and 6/6. Tile 0/0 is the starting tile for a player and tile 6/6 for the other player. All other tiles lie face up on the table.
In your turn you choose one of the open tiles and put it at your starting tile. One side of your new tile have to fit to your starting tile. If you start with the 6/6 tile you have to choose a tile with a 6.

In the second round you can choose where you place your new tile. It is not allowed to place a tile with different numbers close together; at the corner it is ok. If it`s possible you could place a new tile in the second (or even third) level. In this case both sides of the new tile must fit with the sides of the two tiles beneath.

A player who can't move passes. The other player continues. To determine the winner, the numbers of stones in the first level are multiply with the number of stones in the second level.

name: Apocalypse Frenzy
description:
Description from the designer:

In Apocalypse Frenzy, aliens have come to destroy the world in a humorous way! Let cats take over the Earth for example, or cover the planet with lava. Players have a secret alignment card that determines whether they want to destroy the world or protect the world from destroyers. Complete missions and play cards to earn points, but beware: both the missions and the card values depend on your alignment. Each player plays one of four unique characters, each with their own special abilities and even their own cards. If you don't have the cards you need, you can trade, but remember: lying about the cards you want to trade is allowed...
mechanics: Set Collection, Take That, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Mythic Wars: Cthulhu Rises
description: Mythic Wars: Cthulhu Rises, the first expansion set for Mythic Wars, adds 16 new cards (8 gods and goddesses, and 8 creatures) based on the writings of H.P. Lovecraft. When combined with the Clash of the Gods base set, 4-8 players can join together and try to defeat the invading Outer Gods, including Azathoth, Nyarlathotep, Cthulhu, and many others.

name: Comboids
description:
Comboids is a card game where you can build your own team of combat androids and use them to fight against your opponent.
Your objective is simple, destroy them all!

You start by building yout team of combat androids. Then you enter the fight where you can you use various tactics and effects, but your android robot has a battery and you must certify yourself that she doesn't run out, or you can't continue fighting.

In the end you must be the last one standing!

name: Carcassonne: Nikolaus-Zählleiste
description:
The Saint Nicholas Scoring Board is a Scoring Board for Carcassonne II that was sold by cundco.de exclusively on Saint Nicholas Day. It was limited to a number of 150 items.

The game rules for the Saint Nicholas Scoring Board:

If your scoring meeple ends or crosses the number 6 as last player or the number 24 as first player (numbers are marked with a sticker), you will immediately get an additional turn.
This means, that after this scoring phase, you immediately draw another tile and take another turn. Once your action is finished it's the next players turn.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Territory Building

name: Trick-Taking: The Trick-Taking Game – Clairvoyant promo
description:
Promo pack of 7 Clairvoyant cards for Trick-Taking that were included as part of the Meta Games II Kickstarter. These should be put in the deck at the start of the game and 7 random cards removed after shuffling.

When played, the Clairvoyant card effect allows the player to look at three random cards from another players hand.

name: Mah-Jongg Card Game
description:
This 1923 publication was designed to transform Babcock Rules Mah-Jongg into a card game. (As the rules book notes, Mr. J. P. Babcock "originated the name Mah-Jongg, adapted all that was best of the Chinese forms of play, and added the Arabic numerals".) The rule book credits Douglas Lawson for having "correlated" the Babcock rules with card play.

The 164-card deck replicates the mix of tiles in the classic game. It includes four cards for 1-9 for each of the three suits (Dots, Bamboo, Characters), as well as four each of the North, South, East and West winds and Red, Green and White Dragons, plus the 8 Flower cards. As in the classic rules, players try to collect sets or 3 or 4 of a kind or in a sequence, with bonuses for various combinations and special tiles.

Instead of ivory or bone scoring sticks, the card game uses thin colored wooden rods for scoring. The game includes 40 short green sticks worth 2 each, 32 medium-length yellow sticks worth 10, 36 longer red sticks worth 100, and 8 long blue sticks worth 500.

While the rule book focuses on the Standard and Royal games for four players, it does include variant rules for 3, 5 and 6 players. (The Babcock rules were largely superceded in North America in the 1930s by American Mah-Jongg rules.)
publishers: (Unknown), Mah-Jongg Sales Co. of America, Parker Brothers

name: Bullyparade: Der Film – Das Brettspiel
description: Bullyparade: Der Film – Das Brettspiel is a game. More to follow.

name: Skatter
description: Slide your pieces across the game board in Skatter and hope to land them in the right holes to score.

name: A Defiant Stand: What If the Japanese had landed at Midway
description:
What if the Japanese had landed at Midway?

A Defiant Stand is a hypothetical game exploring what might have happened if the Japanese won the naval battle of Midway and carried out their plans to invade the islands.

Ziplock game, includes 11*17 mapsheet with rules, and 5/8" counters.

Players will need a standard deck of playing cards and one six-sided die to play the game.

Also includes a small expansion scenario for the TPS game The Battle of Midway 1942 AD (1 page of color rules and additional counters)

name: Pandemic: Survival Promos – Crisis Mitigator/Relocation Specialist
description:
Z-Man Games gave away two promotional cards (two roles) to participants in the Pandemic Survival tournament.

Roles:

1. Relocation Specialist
When you leave a city by any means, you may take:

up to 3 Disease cubes and/or
1 other pawn with you to your destination city


2. Crisis Mitigator
Take actions each turn according to the number of Disease cubes (of any color) in your city at the beginning of your turn:
0-1: 4 actions
2: 5 actions
3: 6 actions
4+: 7 actions

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Mutiny Resource
description:
The Mutiny Resource is a participation prize given to players who participated in the "In a Mirror, Darkly" episode Organized Play Event. It is considered a Resource, and costs 10 Squadron Points.

When using this resource, you place 3 Mission Tokens on it at the start of the game. Once per round, during an opposing ship's Perform Action step, if your opponent declares it is performing an action from it's action bar, you may spend a token to prevent it from performing that action or any other free actions for the round. Once all three tokens are spent, the resource is discarded.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Bitcoin Empire
description:
In the super-fast competitive card game Bitcoin Empire, you are a plucky, pioneering entrepreneur trying to collect and keep as many bitcoins as possible in storage. Bitcoins are represented by face down cards. The game ends when the last card is drawn from the deck and whoever has the most face down cards at that point in storage is the winner.

Every player gets a character card. Characters have ranks on three different skills: law, coding and marketing. You also have a bitcoin storage rating which determines how many face down cards can be stored underneath the character.
