The main deck of cards is shuffled and each player is dealt two cards. There are several different types. Exchanges can be played down as places to store face down cards based on the bitcoin rating. Hack, Lawsuit and Smear Campaign are attack cards that can be played against an opponents Exchange or character is your ranks in law, coding and marketing respectively are greater than the targets. If successful all the cards in that storage are discarded without looking at them and the Exchange card is taken to the hand of the attacking player. Alternatively these attack cards can be played underneath the character as extra ranks of the applicable icon. Internet Meltdown cards can also be played on the characters to increase their ranks but the Satoshi card will wipe them all away if played. Also, Head Hunter cards can steal an opponents skill cards. Bribe cards can be played to cancel any attack or the Head Hunter.

So keep your wits about you as you take on the fledgling crypto-market and build your empire.

name: Amnesia Heroes
description:
An adventure is beginning. Only you can save Goldfish Kingdom. You have to accept the challenge and face countless monsters with skills. Unless you are a forgetful goldfish, there's no one who can defeat you. Come on! Our savior~~AMNESIA HEROES!

SETUP
1. Shuffle challenge cards and skill cards separately. Place these two decks in the middle of the table.
2. In the beginning, draw a challenge card and place it in the middle of the table.
3. Place damage marks and goldfish marks aside.
4. The player who looks like a goldfish goes first.

COURSE OF PLAY

There are four stages in this game. The leader in this turn executes the action.
Learning skills: Through this stage, the leader deals the skill cards to each player. During the process, the leader has to remember which skill cards are in whose hands. It is the key to defeat the monster at the next stage.
1. The leader deals the skill cards face-up to each player clockwise.
2. Two options to deal cards:
A. Each time deal a skill card to each player clockwise.
B. Deal the skill cards to a player one time. Then deal the skill cards to the next player clockwise.
Tip! No matter which option you choose, the process of dealing the skill cards can help you to find the best way to remember these cards.
3. Each player chooses a skill card from your hands. Then places it face down in front of you as a skill you can't remember.

※ The leader doesn't have to execute this action.

Select a monster: The leader selects a challenge card from the table or the deck.

Attack:

According to the attack sequence shown on the challenge card, the leader has to play skill cards from the left to the right or use goldfish marks to attack the monster.

※ Remember the skill cards you dealt? Who has the skill card you need?!

name: Three Cheers for Master: Phil A. Minion
description:
A promo card for three cheers for master

A new minion giveaway in conventions.

name: Muckinos
description: A racing and memory game - get your figure across the field by flipping pairs of tiles. Do not flip a tile with a Muckino, since that will not only end your turn, but also move you backward.

name: Monopoly: Guardians of the Galaxy Volume 2
description: This game is a version of Monopoly with the theme from the 2017 movie Guardians of the Galaxy Volume 2 directed by James Gunn. This game has custom game board features characters from both films, 6 collectible custom tokens, and custom houses and hotels that are renamed as "gear" and "equipment".
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Temp Worker Assassins: Rabid Reprocessing Dept.
description:
"Put up to 2 trashed cards on the top of a player's deck."

Available from the publisher as an event promo card.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor, Zombies
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Delayed Purchase, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Worker Placement

name: Blank Marry Kill: Geek Marry Kill
description:
Description from the publisher:

Geek Marry Kill is an expansion to Blank Marry Kill, and will add all kinds of comic book, video game, and pop culture references to your decisions. This is your chance to finally MARRY LINK, BE SLOWLY DIGESTED IN A SARLAC PIT WITH BRIENNE, and KILL IKEA MONKEY. Hey, these decisions aren't supposed to be easy.

name: Mixin' Sixes
description:
Description from the publisher:

A 6-round, 4-to-6-player hand-elimination card game where players race to create 6-point hands using both positive and negative cards.

Each player is dealt 10 cards at the beginning of each round. Cards can be a combination of positive cards (1, 2, 3, 4, 5, and 6), negative cards (-1, -2, and -3), and special Action Cards. Each player mixes and matches their cards each turn to create as many 6-point hands as possible with the ultimate goal of playing all of their cards (thus scoring zero points) and catching other players with points. The lowest score after 6 rounds wins.

Each player creates their own Laydown Pile of 6-point hands during each round. As a twist, when every player has started a Laydown Pile during a round, the board becomes Open for Business, and players can start making 6-point hands off the top of other players' Laydown Piles.

Several Action Cards allow players to both help create additional 6-point hands and also block (or at least delay) other players from making their own 6-point hands. Action Cards include both offensive and defensive cards, cards for stealing hands or forcing other players to steal each other's hands, cards that change positive cards negative or negative cards positive, and cards that force other players to draw varying numbers of cards.

name: Dragon Rush
description:
Mama dragon has four little babies, and she is spreading a rain of gems and coins to feed them with their magic energy. The little dragons must gather them to grow and become the king of the cavern. The dragon rush has begun!

Dragon Rush is an abstract board game for 1-4 player, with a duration of 30-60 min. Players must drop the gems/coins and form rows or diagonals of the same type in order to explode them and get points.

•••

Mamá dragón ha tenido cuatro lindos dragoncitos, y ha comenzado a esparcir una lluvia de gemas y monedas para alimentarlos con su energía mística. Los pequeños deben reunirlas para crecer y convertirse en el rey de la caverna. ¡La carrera de dragones ha comenzado!.

Dragon Rush es un juego abstracto para 1-4 jugadores, con una duración aproximada de 30-60 minutos. Los jugadores deben soltar las gemas y monedas con las que formar líneas y diagonales, explotando para obtener puntos.

name: Double Play: Genius or Drunk
description: Answer quickly to eliminate other players. a player keeps or wins back their sobriety by giving 3 answers to a question before their opponent does. The last player with a sobriety card is the genius and wins.

name: London Dread: 2017 Promo Pack
description:
3 card promo pack handed out during the 2017 Dice Tower Indiegogo campaign.

The Sky Is The Limit
Daredevil Pilot
Pilot Gear
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Murder/Mystery, Real-time
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Twin Stars: Adventure Series I – Scenario 06: Bounty Hunt
description:
Two cosmic adventurers are in a tricky scenario and must work together. By rolling and manipulating dice for special abilities and combos, you can be the one that guides them to victory.

The four planets of the Tetran System light up the display as your ship drops out of hyperspace.

"Remember, the mark came here for a reason. Every misstep we make is an opportunity for him to get ready for our arrival."

Now, should we split up, or stick together?"

The bounty has been tracked to the risky Tetran Sector. Use resources to capture the bounty to win. Lose if either character loses all health.

Bounty Hunt is a scenario in the Twin Stars solo system by Jason Tagmire and Mike Mullins. The game consists of just 3 cards and players will provide their own dice and coins/tokens. Each scenario comes with 2 all-new characters and can be interchanged with others for a very different gaming experience.

This scenario has only been released separately as Print & Play, but was then included in Twin Stars: Adventure Series I.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Blackwood: Viking
description:
A promo card of a viking visiting the village of Blackwood.

You can play the viking like a Potion card. If you give him 2 four-leaf clover, you will win 6 coins and the viking will return in the North Sea.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval

name: Findefuchs
description:
Felix Finderfox and his friends are playing hide and seek! But who is hiding behind which bush? The friends can be found by using strong memory skills and by having a little good luck. Players earn valuable shamrocks along the way; the goal is to be the first to win three shamrocks!

... a wild, push your luck memory game

—description from the publisher

How to play:


Roll the die.
Move Felix Finderfox toward the end bush by as many bushes as there are dots on the dice.
Felix Finderfox stops next to a bush.
Guess who is hiding behind the bush.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move

name: 112: Brandgefährlich
description:
Fire! Someone has dialed the emergency number, and together the players in 112: Brandgefährlich, which bears the English name "Fire Emergency", must search for the firefighting equipment needed to put out the fire. If you manage to assemble five pieces of equipment from your individual components before four fires break out of control, the fire will be vanquished and you will be celebrated as heroes!

112: Brandgefährlich includes two sets of rules: one for 1-4 players ages 6 and up and another for 1-8 players ages 9 and up. Both are fully cooperative games.

name: Rolling CUBES Pytagora
description:
Rolling CUBES Pytagora is a game to have fun with math and numbers.

The box contains 13 dice made of FSC® wood:
4 green dice with odd numbers
4 blue dice with even numbers
4 red dice with operations
1 orange die with ‘equals’ signs

You can play 3 different games plus a YAHTZEE variant.
The idea of all 4 games is to throw the 13 dice and make an equation with most of the numbers and operations.

Scoring is as follows:
- 1 point for each die used
- a multiplication sign scores 2 points, a division sign scores 3 points. However, this rule does not apply if you are multiplying or dividing by the number 1
- a double digit number (e.g., 78) scores 3 points (2 for the 7 + 1 for the 8), a three digit number (e.g., 678) scores 6 (3 for the 6 + 2 for the 7 + 1 for the 8) and so on
- 1 bonus point for using 12 dice
- 2 bonus points for using all 13 dice

GAME N.1 - ONE BY ONE
Each player throws all the dice in turns (clockwise).
There is a target score to win.

GAME N.2 - ALL TOGETHER
Each player needs a sheet of paper and a pen.
The 13 dice are all thrown and left on the table in clear view of all the players. The dice must not be moved.
Each player makes the longest possible equation with the numbers and operations, and writes it on his/her paper.
There is a target score to win.

GAME N.3 - THE LAST DIE
The first player throws all 13 dice and makes an equation with the numbers and operations, moving them around to try and use as many dice as possible. When he/she has finished, it is then the turn of the player on his/her left, who throws only the dice not used for the first player’s equation, and tries to make a new equation using at least one new die. The dice used in the initial equation cannot be changed, but can be rearranged to make the new equation.
The round continues with fewer dice at each throw, until the player throwing the dice is unable to add any new ones.
The last person to add a die to the equation wins the round and is awarded 1 point.
A new round starts with a new throw of all the dice.
There is a target score to win.

GAME N.4 - YAHTZEE
The 5 combinations to achieve are:
- Blue: the equation contains at least 3 blue dice (with 4 blue dice, you get 3 bonus points).
- Green: same as Blue, but with green dice
- Red: same as Blue, but with red dice
- Poker: the equation contains 4 dice of the same colour
- 101: there is a number greater than 100

name: Kodama: The Tree Spirits – Kodama and Decree Cards
description:
New promo card pack created primarily for the Kokoro: Avenue of the Kodama kickstarter project.

Includes three Kodama cards and three Decree cards for Kodama: The Tree Spirits and six decree cards for Kokoro: Avenue of the Kodama.

These cards were included in the base game of Kokoro: Avenue of the Kodama as an exclusive item for Kokoro: Avenue of the Kodama Kickstarter backers (and those signed up to get rewards at Essen), with remaining stock available through conventions and special promotions only.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game
publishers: Action Phase Games, Indie Boards & Cards

name: The Legendary War: Mahabharat Edition
description:
The Legendary War - Mahabharat Edition is a role playing, deck building game which can be played as duel (1v1) or as team game of (2v2 or 3v3 players). Ancient history is combined with deck building mechanism.The game is based on an ancient war which happened thousand of years ago and resulted in over one and a half billion casualties. The war only lasted for 18 days.

There are 14 characters divided into 2 teams (each team has 7 characters,--- blue and red team) in this game each having special ability, belonging to a particular faction (Archer, swordsmen, Spearmen, Macewielder). All of them have health points and defense value.

There are money cards (silver) and infantry cards to start the game , which are shuffled to form drawing deck. There are money cards (Gold), weapon cards (spear, mace, swords, bow & arrow), Potion cards which form trade row. Each weapon card has cost, value, and extra ability on them.

In this game the players draw initiative cards depending on number of players playing. The player drawing no 1 initiative card chooses either blue or red team and draws a random character. Each player gets initial money cards and attack cards and shuffle them to form their drawing deck. Out of which they draw 5 cards as starting hand and buy cards from trade row. The players have to raise their army by buying weapon cards from trade row. These cards help them to draw more cards, trash cards, add more money, add more attack points etc.

The players attack each other and resolving combat by either direct hit or by rolling dice if attack is equal to defense. The game ends when opponent/opponent team is eliminated.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Role Playing

name: Chakra
description:
CHAKRA. Sanskrit. n. "ring" or "wheel."

Chakra is a turn-based two-player strategy game descended from Go, a game of creating life through structure. Chakra is a game of territory, capture, and flow that exercises and improves your lateral thinking, spatial reasoning, serialization, and more. You will learn how to extend, trade-off, circumnavigate, and consolidate gains along subtle curves and beautiful shapes.

Each player has a set of game pieces (stones): black and white. Black plays first and traditionally played by the the less experienced player. Like Go, each stone is placed on an intersection of crossing lines. Unlike Go, the board is made up of twelve interlocking circles and an outer rim that functions as a thirteenth circle.

The player's goal in Chakra is to create as much "living territory" as possible by the game's end. Players create living stone groups by connecting chains of stones around two or more "eyes" (empty intersections). In each turn, a player will optionally pass or place a stone on an empty intersection, after which liberties are counted and any captures removed. The player may then choose to slide another stone on either of the two circles it resides on, with stones of either player blocking movement. Liberties and captures are then counted a second time.

name: Monopoly: Planet of The Apes
description:
The Planet of The Apes Monopoly features custom illustrated art by Dave Perillo with a vintage feel from the classic 1968 science fiction film.

—description from the publisher
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation, Novel-based
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: ゲット★スマートラブ (Get★Smart Love)
description:
User summary
ゲット★スマートラブ (Get★Smart Love) is a Japanese card game of match-making, but with somewhat adult themes and language.

In the game, players are dealt hand cards and draw and play more cards through the game. There are four male character cards dealt face up on the table, and the players are boy-chasers, competing to win the 'best' one. But which man is best is only determined at the finish.

During the game, players play hand cards against their chosen targets. These attribute cards have positive values for virtues, and negative values for bad behaviour. Some cards are played face-up, some face-down, so there is a strong element of bluffing in the game. Some attribute cards alter the rules as they are played.

The game is very social and encourages table talk about the good or bad attributes.

Players also put secret tokens on the male cards, to show their likes or dislikes. After the cards have been played, the players must 'Express Love' by simultaneously pointing at the man they chose. If only player chooses one man, they get him. If more than player points at one man, the player with the highest token wins him.

Then all the attribute cards are flipped and the value of the different men is calculated. The player who picked the best man, wins!

There are two Versions of the game, this second edition is themed on women trying to get the best boyfriend. There is another edition with the genders swapped, and the men are trying to get the best girlfriend - ゲット★スイートラブ (Get★Sweet Love). Whilst the games are very similar, there are differences in the special cards which affect the gameplay. With both editions, you can combine and play an 8 player game.

The game name has a couple of twists. The English name can be abbreviated to Ge★S Love, which for Japanese readers equates to 'guess love', trying to guess which girl to choose. But the name ゲスラブ in Japanese, has the word ゲス in it, which is used in many vulgar or even obscene words in Japanese. So the publisher is deliberately signalling to buyers that the game is for adults but still sociable, since the girl-chasers will be nice to some girls, and not so nice to others. This version has gone through five reprints in Japan and always draws a crowd at game shows, with its risque design (by Japanese standards).

Publisher's summary
グループ交際の中で相手の男性に様々な『属性』を付与し
最も点数の高い男性を恋人にした人が勝利。
通称ゲスラブ（Guess Love）

Get★Sweet Loveと混ぜて1名～8名で遊ぶ事も可能。
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Role Playing, Set Collection
publishers: しらたまゲームズ (Shiratama Games)

name: Alles an Bord?!: Das diebische Äffchen
description:
The promo card "Das diebische Äffchen" (The thieving monkey) is on the last page of the Abacus Spiele games catalogue 2018.

At the beginning of the game, players draw 4 equipment tiles and put them on the monkey. These tiles cannot be collected in this round.
At the end of a round, the tiles are put back with the rest and four new tiles will be drawn and put on the monkey card.

With the promo card, the difficulty is a little bit higher.

name: Sakenobori
description:
In Sakenobori / さけのぼり (which means "salmon run"), players want to move their salmon upstream as far as possible to lay eggs (ikura, or salmon roe).

Each of the three rounds plays out the same way. Players each have a hand of five river cards and one bear card. At the start of the round, players take turns laying down cards face down one at a time in a pyramid shape until each player has placed three cards. Then players take turns placing their salmon on a card in the first row.

Players then take turns in an action phase in which they optionally swim their salmon to a new location, jumping occupied spaces and revealing the card where they land, if it were hidden. Land on a bear and you're out for the round unless you can counter with a bear from your hand. After moving, you can either place a card from your hand face down to add to the river or pass. Once all players pass in turn, the round ends and players then collect ikura tokens equal to their rank in the pyramid.

In the third round, players score an ikura bonus depending on their final rank, then whoever has collected (a.k.a. spawned) the most ikura wins!

name: Belo Jardim
description:
A game that requires players to use cleverness and observation to move along a path consisting of all the elements of a cozy garden.

An invitation to arouse interest in being closer to nature and to interact with the sensations the tour offers.

(Translation/summary of publisher's description)

name: Battle for the Ball: the soccer football tactics boardgame
description:
Battle for the Ball is an original two-player sports board game simulating a soccer or international football match. Playing on an 11×16 hex map of a classic football pitch, two teams with 10 player pieces on each side compete to control the ball, pass to forward players, tackle to control the ball, and advance to a position to make a goal.

The game uses dice, player pieces, and cards to control the action. There are no springs or finger-flicking in this game; the rules, based on the 17 laws of soccer, the map, the cards and dice rolls determine success on the field and glory in the stands. Each player side has two key phases: the initiative phase in which the side with a high die roll spends momentum points to move, pass, tackle, and score; and a teamwork phase in which the whole team moves, enabling the game to reproduce the flow and movement of the Beautiful Game. Special cards may give special opportunities: a burst of speed or a cannonball kick; the hand of fate or owner interference... Ready your formation, lead your players to victory, and battle for the ball!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hexagon Grid, Roll / Spin and Move, Score-and-Reset Game, Simulation

name: Building Blocks
description:
Who doesn’t love building blocks? In this cooperative game 2-5 players try to build four perfect towers.

Each tower has a different color and is built by playing cards of that color in the right order. The players start the round by choosing the build order. Then, the players try to add cards from their hands to the towers. If they can't, they have to discard a card. Based on the discards of the last player, new cards are divided over the players.

Play continues until the first player runs out of cards. The final score is based on the height of the created towers. While only limited communication is allowed, the players cooperate to get the highest score.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: OrcQuest WarPath: Chapter Box – Sewer Fever
description:
Sewer Fever is a whole new expansion which will enrich the OrcQuest universe with new enemies. With the included Campaign Chapter, your heroes will be able to go under Castelray, the royal capital of Istarra and explore its repulsive sewers, infested with rats. They are humanoid rodents,that live in smelly tunnels and look to devour every intruder they can find.

By living underground, rats are also filled with diseases. They are almost immune to their own germs - even if they don´t live long enough to get old – but infect whoever gets too close, which usually gives them a certain advantage. Disease reduces the attack and physical ability of those wishing to confront them.

The sewers are also filled with traps that can quickly neutralize intruders (or food). Event cards will make the place more dangerous, by making swarms of little rats show up or by making your heroes fall in deadly traps. There's still a positive side to all of this, though. With all the waste that is thrown in the sewers, some good surprises may sometimes be found.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Tanks: M14/41
description:
The 14 tonne M14/41 tank of 1941 was an upgrade of the older 13/40, featuring a more powerful engine fitted with sand filters. Despite its armour and armament remaining somewhat inadequate, the crew manning these tanks did their duty and fought bravely against any odds.

This pack contains:
1x unassembled M14/41 tank
1x M14/41 tank card
1x Hero card
3x Crew cards
3x Upgrade cards
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Battlefront Miniatures Ltd, Gale Force Nine, LLC

name: La manufacture Lilienfeld (fan expansion for T.I.M.E Stories)
description:
1910. Germany. Bob is sending agents in a weapon factory. Illegal time travels have been detected. You must discover who, and why... But be careful, this mission will ask you to stay as stealth as possible if you don't want to ring the alarm !

This is my first Time Stories scenario. It has been tested by few groups of players.
Scenario is finished, you can download it and play.
Important : Just read the set up in the General forum

I hope you will appreciate to play it.

Allemagne, 1910, les agents sont envoyés dans une usine d'armement pour enquêter sur une série de voyages temporels illégaux.
Mais attention, un comportement suspect pourrait entraver le bon déroulement de cette mission...

C'est mon premier scénario réalisé pour TIME Stories.
Le scénario est terminé et plusieurs tests ont été réalisés.
Le scénario est disponible en téléchargement et prêt à jouer.
IMPORTANT : La mise en place du scénario est détaillée dans le forum général
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Science Fiction, World War I
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Storytelling, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Don't Touch My Jewels
description:
Become the Jewel master by not letting anyone touch or take your jewels! Can be played in teams or individually.

The game consists of 4 types of cards - sapphire blue, emerald green, clear crystal, and ruby red. They consist of 15 different cuts of gems! Correctly guess how many jewel tricks you and your teammate, or you individually, will win to score points. If you miss your bid, no penalty just no points for you. You also score points for each trick you win that contain certain numbered cards like the 15, 14, point values differ with team and individual.

There are 6 Power cards that can give the winner of the trick extra points or take points away, change the trump for 2 hands, add 1 extra trick to whoever takes that trick, etc. 7 rounds take place and each round a different amount of cards are dealt, 9, 7, 3, 1, 4, 6, 8.

For the 4th round only 1 card is dealt to each player and during this round the players do not look at their own card. Each person puts the card facing out on their forehead and then makes their bid based on what they see others have.
The player or team with the most points wins.
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Take That, Team-Based Game, Trick-taking

name: Helltoken: Remote Control Robot (ヘルトウクン)
description:
Publishers summary
ヘルトウクン (Herutoukun) HELLTOKEN: REMOTE CONTROL ROBOT is a Japanese game with two secret societies both operating the same giant robot by remote control. The giant robot has been built by Dr Mad, who sells it for 100m Bitcoin. The two buyers are evil organizations aiming for world conquest,
魔術結社メモレーヨ (Magical Association Memorireo) and マスドレダー科学財団 (Masudoreda Science Foundation). Since he only built one robot, Dr Mad lets the two groups fight for it, using the robot.

In Helltoken, all players control the same robot. You either try to crush the opponent's base, or deduce where your own hidden base is.

The game is easily to play by all, even those who have a hard time deducing! And the art is done by Takashi Kurihara, of 'Katamari Damacy' fame!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Memory, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Die kleine Hexe: Das turbulente Flug- und Suchspiel
description:
In Die kleine Hexe: Das turbulente Flug- und Suchspiel, the young players can accompany the little witch and help her to do good deeds.

At the start of the game, distribute tiles with good deeds around the room. During the game, the child with the flying little witch must find the different good deeds, collect them with the magnetic broom, and bring to the other children.

name: Monopoly: Winchester
description:
Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

From the rear of the box:
Located in the heart of Hampshire, the ancient cathedral city of Winchester is one of the oldest settlements in Britain and has a wealth of heritage and history. Dating back to the Iron Age, Winchester was one of Britain's first Roman settlements. This eye-catching city is packed full of culture and is host to the Hat Fair, one of the longest running festivals of outdoor arts and the Theatre Royal. The city has everything you need if you feel the urge for a shopping spree, there is a wide range of independent shops and well-known brands located along the High Street. If you want to grab some fresh air, you can't go wrong with a trip down the River Itchen, and to feel even closer to nature there is the amazing Marwell Zoo. So what are you waiting for? Get ready to roll the dice and play MONOPOLY: Winchester Edition!

PROPERTIES
BROWN
Trinity Winchester / King Alfred's Statue
LIGHT BLUE
City Museum / Westgate Museum / Militry Museums
PINK
The Buttercross / Hat Fair / Theatre Royal Winchester
ORANGE
Jewry Street / High Street / Parchment Jewellers
RED
Chesil Rectory Restaurant / Hampshire Chronicle / Wincester Distillery
YELLOW
Hospital of St Cross / Winchester Science Centre / Marwell
GREEN
Winchester Discovery Centre / 8 College Street / The University Of Winchester
DARK BLUE
The Great Hall / Winchester Cathedral
STATIONS
River Itchen / Winchester Train Station / Winchester Taxi / Stagecoach King's City
UTILITIES
Adam Knibbs Architects / Blue Apple Theatre
TAXES
Income Tax / Luxury Tax
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Eyedentify
description:
On their turn, players turn over a card and reveal a picture with an object to find (shape or color). Be the fastest player to find the corresponding object on the picture!

The first player to spot the object wins the card. Then another turn starts. The first player to get five cards wins!

Eyedentify is a fun accessible family game for four years and up that develops observation skills and knowledge of shapes and colors.

-description from publisher

name: Quick Pickle
description:
This fast-paced, family-friendly card game has you tossing toppings and collecting pickles.

Flip a card and be quick to react to keep your pickle stash intact. Take too long and you'll be passing pickles to your opponents. The player with the most pickles at the end of the game wins!

—description from the publisher

name: Blossoms: Night Iris Promo Card
description:
Night Iris is a single-card micro expansion for Blossoms.

After the game setup, shuffle the night iris into the deck.

When you draw the night iris during the Growth action, you must immediately put it into a chosen pot with a flower, even one with a special action token.

If you draw the card using the Pruner action, add it to your hand – you can use it any turn you want.

Once you play the night iris, discard all cards in the pot, including the night iris.

Playing the card ends your turn.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Farming

name: Wishes and Dreams
description: In Libertex Детский (Wishes and Dreams), each young player has a dream, and in order to fulfill it they need to collect money. Players earn money by means of their businesses, starting new courses and managing their assets in every possible way. The advanced version of the rules contains basic principles of working with shares. The first player to collect enough money to achieve their dream wins.

name: Conversation
description:
At last, you find yourself in company with the person you want to know everything about. Are you thinking about the right way to start the conversation? And, maybe, they're thinking the same? Put your doubts aside, grab this box, and prove that they are a great person.

Conversation contains 149 questions that you will definitely want to answer, whether playing with only one other person or up to five. Take one of these cards, ask a question, then decide who is worth your attention and who is not as interesting as they appeared at first sight. Whoever collects the most votes at the end of the game wins!

name: Raindrops
description:
A game of falling drops on fresh flowers.

Each player is given 6 random flower cards. The cards are placed, seed side up with no overlapping, in front of the player. Each round, players simultaneously drop their 8 raindrops onto their flower fields from a height of 12-18 inches. Seed cards that have a raindrop are flipped to the flower side. Flower cards are picked. The first to pick all their sprouted flowers wins the game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Print & Play

name: Darwinning!: Paradise Promo
description: Paradise is the perfect habitat for all species and provides food for all.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game

name: Peer Programming
description:
Two software developers on a single computer... If you want to be the first compiling and building your program, you will need big doses of caffeine, some undocumented shortcuts and maybe a few pokes. Obfuscate the code by hardcoding not-easy-to-remove constants and try to distract your peer with pizza... But, what if your program does not "exactly" fits the requirements? Well, let's see if we can sell this little bug as a brand new feature.

Peer Programming is an anti-cooperative game of software development for two players.
The players take the role of software developers who want to write a pretty simple code which just prints a sequence of 6 characters on console. The source code is shared by both players but the requirements are different for each. The players take actions to modify the shared code towards meeting their requirements. The first player to make the shared code print the character sequence in his requirements wins the game.

The shared code is built using a tile placement mechanic based on the logic of code statements such as FOR loops, IF and PRINT. A player can draw motivation cards each time the shared code gets closer to meet his requirements (in the "compile" phase). These cards give one-turn special powers breaking the risk of stalemate and adding a fun thematic variation (distracting your opponent with pizza, asking for help in Stack Overflow, obfuscating the code...).

—description from the designer

name: Cocobanana
description:
In Cocobanana, every player has a deck of cards, and the player who plays all of their cards first wins.

To set up, place the banana and coconut half in the middle of table. Distribute 48 cards face down among all the players. Each one places their pile of cards in front of them without looking through them. Then, each player turns the top card of their pile face up and places it in front of them on the table. The game can start!

On a turn, the active player chooses a player to fight, then flips a card from their pile onto the visible discard pile owned by that player. At this moment, each player concerned has to do very quickly the action of their card:

• If the card shows Banana, grab the banana and hit the opponent's head.
• If the card shows Coconuts, grab the coconuts and defend against the opponent's banana attack!
• If both cards show the same picture, every player should shout "Ukiki". The fastest player takes "starting player".

When one of the players plays their last card and wins the fight, they win the game! If they don't win this fight, all the other players give them one card each face down and they have to continue to play.

—description from the publisher

name: Cat Rescue: Clowder Time Expansion
description:
Every time a batch of cats are adopted, draw a card.
These cards are special events, some good, some bad for you...
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: Monopoly: Mechelen
description:
Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

Another version of the classic Monopoly. This time the cases represent different streets and monuments located at and around the city Mechelen, Belgium.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Et sans résultat! Tabletop Rules for Recreating the Napoleonic Wars
description:
Et sans résultat! is a grand tactical wargaming for the Napoleonic period.

The grand tactical focus means that a lot of low-level detail is abstracted away, a battalion being represented by a single stand. While this loss of detail may be mourned by some, it allows battles to be fought in a timely manner and players to concentrate on the tasks of generals rahter than of junior officers.

The rules aim to be compatible with figures from 2mm to 28mm size, and almost any basing scheme. There are also boxed sets of 10mm figures from The Wargaming Company purpose-made for the rules for those who don't already have an Napoleonics collection.

The title, French for "And without result!", is from Marshal Ney's comment on the indecisive yet bloody battle of Eylau.

name: My Forest
description:
Have you ever planted a forest? If not, it's time!

Here you can hear birds singing, Help me through the trees!

In this game, we invite you to plant the forest! Your profit will be to grow five trees. Each of them consists of four parts. You roll two dice, and in the factory you choose more elements. The person who is the first to grow five trees wins.

The box comes with a seed! They are tiny, but do not be fooled by appearances. Giant trees will grow out of them!

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Warhammer Armies (Fourth Edition): High Elves
description:
Warhammer Armies: High Elves is an expansion to the 4th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 96-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect High Elves faction and field it on the tabletop.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Inquisitor
description:
Fifteen centuries have passed since Jesus descended from his cross, bathed Jerusalem in blood, and conquered Rome. The world has been ruled by inquisitors ever since.

Flame and Cross are symbols of The Holy Office, the institution whose sole purpose is to spread and defend the one and only true faith. But these symbols also contradict each other, for one represents Persian mages of fire, the other righteous Christians who fight them. The struggle goes on.

In this petty world, fear paralyzes the hearts of those who shy away from ruthless eradication of any signs of evil or corruption. This world is not even full of secrets, but it is surrounded by them, wallows in them, and cannot get away from them. Whenever an answer to a question is found, ten more questions appear immediately.

Inquisitor is a detective board game based on the series of best-selling short stories by Jacek Piekara that take you to the grim, fictional world of inquisitors.

Important note: Not any content of the game, neither images, nor the plot or background, is intended to offend anyone's religious feelings as they are merely props of a popular category known as "Religious Fiction".
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Mysterious Island
description:
A Cooperative Game of Survival, Exploration, and Escape

Loosely based on Jules Verne's novel "The Mysterious Island"

In the early 1860s, a hot-air balloon carrying six friends, crash landed on an uncharted island in the South Pacific Ocean. Together, they must craft, explore, and move during the day and fight off threats at night. Survivors will move across the island finding clues that will reveal story moments and help them how to escape the island. However, as they move toward their ultimate goal, time is running out, as a catastrophic event will unfold at the end of 30 days!

Mysterious Island is a cooperative survival game that uses an action point system for players to make strategic choices. In conjunction with those choices is the variability of cards drawn during the Day and Night Phases. These cards often will determine how players make their choices.

The Day and Night decks double as a "timer" for the end of game. Once they run out, the game is over and the survivors lose in catastrophic fashion. Of course, staying alive while searching for a way off the island is another adventure of its own.

The Craft and Explore decks offer the player ways to improve their skills and chance of survival. The 35 Craft cards will ALWAYS provide items to help survivors along their way. The 35 Explore cards have both positive and negative effects on the players depending what is drawn.

Out of the 130 cards used in a game, only 6 are doubles, which makes each game session very unique. These variables offer high re-playability and make the gaming experience different each time.

If you or someone you know love adventure games with elements of survival and exploration, give Mysterious Island a try!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Parliament 2050
description:
Parliament is a politics themed strategy card game for 3-4 players. It involves the brinksmanship of poker, the contingency planning of chess, and the haggling of a used car purchase.
Each player represents a political party, and each party has different, but overlapping, voting preferences on various issue categories. The preferences are balanced so that no party has a greater likelihood of victory than any other.

Each player receives several points cards which indicate the points they will score for winning a given issue. Some are dealt face up and some are dealt face down, giving other players incomplete information about how much their rivals stand to gain on any given vote.
Each round, players take turns nominating issues and casting votes in a rotating order.

Players can only cast a limited number of votes each round, which they must ration carefully.

Throughout the game, players can form voting pacts with each other―however, the pacts are non-binding and so betrayal is always possible.

name: Falling Koalas
description:
Falling Koalas is a card game all about koalas. Drop Bears, as they are affectionately called, are known to eat eucalyptus leaves and sleep all day. Although seemingly cute and cuddly, they attack!

The game involves intense strategy and a bit of luck where players battle to see who will be the last koala hanging. It's easy to learn and takes 10-20 minutes to play.

The game is simple. Be the last koala alive and win the game
Play cards from your hand and end your turn by drawing a card. If you draw a falling koala card, you fall and are out of the game unless you can save yourself. Strategically play your cards to put yourself in the best position to win or force other players to fall.

Game play:

View your hand, keeping your cards hidden from all other players.
Play a card by placing it face up on the table.
End your turn by drawing a card from the draw pile.
If you draw a falling koala card, you're out unless you have a catch or sleep card.
If you have a catch or sleep card, you're safe. Place it on top of the falling koala card in the discard pile. This ends your turn.
Use your cards to attack your friends and put yourself in the best position to win.


—description from the designer

name: Exodus Chronicles
description:
In Exodus Chronicles you take on the role of one of six human factions, fighting for survival and dominance in an empire-building saga of epic proportions! Choose the primary path of your faction and elect the leader you believe is most capable of guiding your faction towards victory. Along the way, you must make clever decisions at every turn as you explore the sectors surrounding your home planet, expand the reach of your budding empire, exploit newly discovered worlds for their resources, and exterminate enemies that stand in your way.

Exodus Chronicles is a modern reimplementation and streamlined redesign of critically acclaimed Exodus: Proxima Centauri and its two expansions Edge of Extinction and Event Horizon. The game features six asymmetrical factions, each offering multiple choices of starting home worlds and faction leaders.

While the loved and praised game experience remains true to its predecessor, Exodus Chronicles is not merely a reprint of Exodus: Proxima Centauri. Each game mechanism has been thoroughly revisited and redesigned with the purpose of improving, enhancing, and streamlining game play.

—description from the publisher
categories: Civilization, Economic, Negotiation, Political, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Trading, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers, Voting, Worker Placement

name: LinkUs
description:
Linkus! is a fast and fun party game based on associations and their interpretations.

In Linkus! players try to connect one picture on the card from his hand with one of the pictures on the card in the center of the table by association link. Each card has 3 different pictures on it. Players must play as fast as they can because time is limited. They play cards in clockwise order turn by turn. Player can not use the same picture that was used by the previous player.

In the game there are two different modes: Competitive and Cooperative. Also you will have 360 unique illustrations to enrich your game experience.

—description from the designer

name: Weiß Schwarz: Batman Ninja
description:
Weiß Schwarz is a CCG produced in collaboration with some of the most popular animation/ video game works in Japan. Players separate the "Weiß" side which features mainly pretty characters from the "Schwarz" side featuring cool characters. Though the title consists of various kinds of card sets, a carefully planned system and rules make it possible for players to mix any of them on each side and enjoy the game.

Batman Ninja is a new series in the large Weiß Schwarz universe.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip

name: Stink Bug
description:
Everyone is playing in the pile of leaves including some funny little bugs! Choose a leaf on your turn and try to make a match. Turn over a Love Bug card and share the love by giving a card to another player. The Sneak Bug card lets you sneak a card away from an opponent. Butterflies are wild and add to your score. Lookout for the Stink Bug! If he shows his stinky self you'll lose all the unmatched cards in your collection. The player with the most pairs of matched leaves at the end of the game is the winner!

-description from publisher

name: Pluck Off!
description:
Pluck Off! is a card game parody of city life, where pigeons rule the roost and you help them find nestmates (because the rent is too plucking high!). Each pigeon is a unique character. Each has its own art and limerick that tells a short, plucky story. But players and pigeons must watch their tail feathers, because there are Urban Vermin like Panhandler Possums and Pizza Rats who are out to pluck up their big city dreams.

Easy to learn and play but difficult - if not impossible - to master, you need a combination of memory, strategic pluckery, poker face and pluck of the draw to dupe other players into giving up their hard-earned pigeon cards. And just when you think you've won it all, an Urban Vermin could pluck up your game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Set Collection, Take That

name: Xerxes: Annual Event Cards Expansion
description:
These additional events apply for the Building phase of the round. There are 6 events during which the buildings below cannot be constructed:

1) Wheat Silo. 2) Road. 3) Bridge. 4) Temple. 5) Palace. 6) Fortifications.

The additional events are considered different from the solo cards, so at any given round in a solo game, up to 2 different buildings may not be constructed. If a building is already built, the event does not apply.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Harry Potter Miniatures Adventure Game: Barty Crouch Sr. & Aurors Expansion
description:
Pack of high quality resin miniatures, ready to paint and assemble. Includes character cards and upgrade cards for the Harry Potter Miniatures Adventure Game.

The Barty Crouch Sr. & Aurors box contains the following:


4 High Quality Resin Miniatures ready to paint and assemble
Barty Crouch Sr.
3 Aurors

4 30mm Plastic Bases
4 Character Cards
4 Spell Cards
3 Artefact Cards
2 Potion Card



1 Wizarding Wars rulebook (tournament rules)
15 Duelling Cards


From the publisher: The Wizarding Wars are an exciting new way to play the Harry Potter Miniatures Adventure Game. These official events allow players to compete against each other in a fast, fun and furious day of gaming, proving themselves the ultimate champion of the Wizarding World...
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Expedition: Of Wyrms & Giants Booster
description:
Booster for Expedition: The Roleplaying Card Game (a lightweight RPG for 1-6 players ages 8+). Adds 10 new Dragon and Giant enemies to take your adventures to the next level.

Requires the base game (but no expansions) to play. Only works for GM Mode / telling your own stories, though if there's enough interest we'll comission a quest specifically for this booster.

Matches the size of the existing cards, though there may be a slight variation in color and / or weight.

name: Samsara: Revelation Expansion
description:
The Revelation expansion contains :

7 additional characters (7 player boards - 7 standees - 7 markers - 7 game aids) The new characters are more aggressive and offer more interaction than original characters: it is strongly recommended not to play less than three players.
16 special cards (8 Bhaga (luck) cards, 8 Durmangala (bad luck) cards
10 Ancestral Amulets (Ancestral Amulets have the particularity to present on their red face an aggressive power, and on their silver face, an abundance power)
1 rule leaflet FR / ENG


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Dust 1947: Cthulhu Mythos Cultist Fire Squad
description:
The Maidens of the Cult are a female-only branch of the Cult of the Great Cthulhu while serving Nyarlathotep and his Avatars. They are the most fanatical and devout worshipers of the Great Old One, second only to the High Priests of the Cult. The Maidens of the Cult’s main task is to guard the secret temples and hidden lairs devoted to the Great Old Ones. They show no mercy to trespassers or anyone who wishes to interfere with their masters' plans.

This squad comes with its own Dust 1947 unit card, for the Mythos Bloc. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Ancient Times (fan expansion for Dominion)
description:
This is an unofficial fan-made expansion, and is not affiliated with Donald X. Vaccarino or Rio Grande Games. Permission has been granted from Rio Grande Games and Donald X. Vaccarino to create a fan expansion, use any trademarks and copyrighted materials of Dominion and list "Ancient Time" on Board Game Geek.

This fan expansion focuses on deck stability, especially in turn 3 and 4, that is, early stage of a game. Also, it contains many trashers that help you build stable decks by throwing away cards you don't need. Moreover, it contains some flexible cards for combo decks, so you can enjoy combo decks more easily.

People in ancient times built great civilizations, though they had much lesser technology than today. They constructed pyramids, wrote documents and lived in a high mountain hundreds or thousands of years ago. At a glance, such great civilizations were flashy. However, in fact, they based on constant supply of food. How did they manage it?

The most important thing was stability. Astrologers predicted what would happen; shamans removed bad fortune when they were asked to; people wore accessories to gain more power; lapis lazuli was thought to prevent evil spirit. Ancient people made efforts to avoid disasters, such as famines, drought and floods.

Now that many ancient remains have been discovered by archaeologists, you can use the wisdom of ancient people. Stand on the shoulders of giants, and you will succeed!

-description from designer
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Artipia Games: The Promo Pack
description:
6 promos (9 cards in all) for 6 of Artipia's games that was Kickstarted as a result of having their cash stolen from them at Essen Spiel fair 2018.

These were all packaged together in a cellophane bag.

This expansion includes promo cards for:

Among the Stars (2 cards)
A Thief's Fortune: Prevent Robbery (1 card)
Fields of Green (3 cards)
Kitchen Rush (1 card)
The Pursuit of Happiness (1 card)
Whoosh: Bounty Hunters (1 card)

name: Going, Going, Gone!: A High-Stakes Board Game
description:
Thirty-six masterpieces are up for auction. Are they bargains to be snapped up or over-hyped drains on your finances? You’ll never know unless you bid! In this board game for up to six players, you travel the world as an art collector scouring the auction houses, visiting art fairs, and making private deals in search of elusive artworks to complete your collection.

Everyone starts with $1.5 billion dollars and three artworks. After rolling a dice a player can land upon auction, art fair, private sale, ask around, fortune, Venice Biennale, lawyer, detox, private island, or museum. Each space has different rules for trading art and gathering or losing wealth. When someone lands on "Auction" the player who landed on it becomes auctioneer and everyone is free to bid on an artwork pulled from the top of the cards. When bidding appears to be finished the auctioneer calls out "Going, Going, Gone!"

The game ends when all of the artworks have been auctioned off or when all of the players have run out of money. The winner is the player with the most valuable collection and the most cash in hand at the end of the game.

—description from the publisher

name: La Zuppaccia di Cornabicorna
description:
The goal of the game is to discard all our cards. The person who remains with the Cornabicorna witch in the hand is the loser.

To discard cards you have to match them in couple and reading the text on the cards (funny sentences as for example smells like boar poo).

When all people have discard the cards they have to turn a wheel. It can happens to give card to someone, to take a card from someone, to pass all the cards and other three options.

name: Epic Card Game: Forbidden Research Promo Card
description:
Epic Card Game Promo Card Forbidden Research

This is an Evil Event
Draw two cards.
Break a champion you control: Recall

This card comes in WWG1602E Tournament Kit
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That

name: Gogo CHALLENGE: Round 01
description:
GOGO Challenge is a Combination Puzzle Game that will help you to develop skills of: logical reasoning, concentration and perseverance (it has a lot of trial and error). People associate the game with a mix of Domino´s and Rubik´s cube.

The Goal of the game is to make a Gogo, that is, to complete the largest possible square by placing the pieces in such a way that any pair of pieces with common sides share exactly the same figure (pattern and color). The pieces have two faces (reversible) and you can use them as you want.

You have two kind of Gogo´s: “The Simple Gogo” ( Easy) and “The Supreme Gogo”( Difficult).

You can have fun alone or with friends.
—description from the designer

name: Cadomino
description:
A GAME OF OBSERVATION AND SPEED
OBJECT: be the first to find 4 gifts to win the hand!
At the beginning, all dominoes are spread out on the table with the animal faces visible. The cards are in a pile, face-down. A card is turned over: it shows an animal (starting point), a colour (ending point) and the gift to be found. To find the animal hiding the gift, players silently work it out on their own: each player follows the movement of the animals to arrive at the desired colour. Once the animal has been identified, the fastest player places their finger on that animal’s square and the domino is flipped over! If it’s the right animal, the gift is hidden behind it and the player wins the card.

+++ Hint: the gift is always behind the new animal on the third domino.

—description from the publisher

name: De Mol: De code-opdracht
description:
YOU AND YOUR TEAM HAVE BEEN SEND ON A MISSION TO CRACK 3 IMPORTANT CODES. ALL TEAM MEMBERS ARE IN POSSESSION OF DIFFERENT CODES AND KEYS. BY WORKING TOGETHER IT IS POSSIBLE TO SOLVE THE MYSTERY AROUND THE CODES, BUT WHAT IF THERE IS ONE PERSON THAT WANTS TO SABOTAGE EVERYTHING? WHO CAN YOU TRUST DURING YOUR MISSION AND WHO IS THE MOL?

De Mol De code-opdracht is a cooperative social deduction board game.
Players work together to try to solve 3 codes on the board by combining a set of dice. While doing so 1 player is de mol and tries to stop the other players from solving the code. But he must do this without being noticed. The game is playable with up to 6 players and takes about 45 minutes. The game has his own app with an AR-function to play an advanced version of the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Different Dice Movement, Hidden Roles

name: Roll It!
description:
The Animals's Carnival is here! Every year they team up and rock & roll their city! The most important thing is that you need to put your ball into the center hole as the best blessing team!
During the game, players needs to put their team's animals on different sides of the city, spin the city plate, and try to roll their ball more close to the center hole.
Let's rock and roll!
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Elysian Battlefields
description:
Who is the greatest warrior of all time?

Set in Elysium, the afterlife of heroes, each player controls the forces of a former hero of this life to try and conquer, rule, or reign over the Elysian Battlefields. Each hero offers unique attributes.

There are three different pathways to victory. Players can destroy enemy units(conquer), control territories(rule), or develop their kingdom(reign). Players must strategize what types of cards and units they will produce as well as how they will use those resources to accomplish their goals while reacting to their opponents.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board

name: Superfight: The Mythology Deck
description:
From Athena and Beowulf to Thunderbird and Hades, the greatest heroes from all of mythology are ready to fight in this 100-card Superfight expansion. So get ready for the most legendary debates you've ever had!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor, Mythology

name: 5 Second Rule: Spintensity
description:
It's like 5 second rule, only more intense!
Like in the original game, you gotta name 3 things, but you've got more Time now...Maybe! The new random timer is going, going, and you never know when it will stop!
Hurry to name three things, then spin to see what you have to do next: name more things, draw another card, or pass to the next player!
You can even combine this with the original game for even more fun!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Real-time, Trivia

name: Nice Darts -CardGame of Darts-
description:
'Nice Darts -CardGame of Darts- is a competitive card game themed on darts.

In the base game (Count-up), players use their hand cards to win three tricks, representing their three throws from the ockey.

One by one, each player plays a card from their hand, and each card has its rank. After all players play a card, the player who plays the card that has highest rank among them takes their played card back in front of themselves as a score card, and other played cards are discarded.

Once a player takes three score cards in front of themselves, that player finishes their play for this round, and waits for all players have finished.

When all players finished their play, they count up victory point according to their own score cards, and the player who has highest point wins!

There are three different mode for this game.
1. Count-up (カウントアップ)
Literally count up the scoring cards and the players compare their total points (as above).

2. Cricket (クリケット) (requires an expansion pack)
It plays as an area control game. Cricket for darts has variants but this card game supports 'All number Cricket'.
Team play is available for four players.

3. Zero-one (ゼロワン) (requires an expansion pack)
Count down from a number that ends '01', such as 301, 501, or 701. This game mode supports team play too.

ダーツをテーマにしたカードゲーム
ジャンルはトリックテイキングゲーム
ダーツが好きな人もトリックテイキングが好きな人も遊べる事を目指したゲームです。
基本ゲームでは、「CountUp」
拡張ボードを使用して「Cricket」と「x01」といったダーツを元にしたゲームも楽しめます。
publisher's summary
publishers: 758 Board Game Circle (758ボードゲーム会)

name: Tanks!
description:
Tanks!, fast introductive tactical level miniature wargame rules to simulate tank battles in World War 2, published in Vae Victis issue #30.
Published in French.

Allows to play in any scale from 1/300 to 1/72
Each player controls 5-10 tanks.

Turn order:

6 phases randomly activated depending on cards drawing (3 cards for the Allies, 3 for the Axis)
when a category is activated: move and fire depending on units abilities


Scale:
1 model = 1 tank
1cm = 20m
1 turn = ~10min
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Open Drafting, Simulation, Turn Order: Random

name: 走るメロスたち (Hashiru Melos-tachi)
description:
走るメロスたち (Hashiru Merosu Tachi) is a Japanese game based upon the short story "Hashire Meros" (Run,Melos!) by Osamu Dazai. It is a racing game, driven by trick-taking cards. The story is familiar to Japanese readers as it is a classic text on friendship, widely used in Japanese schools.

A road racing trick-taking card game that runs with the use of running Melos, furious Melos, naked Melos, sensitive Melos, sleeping Melos, and the king of wicked violence.

太宰治の短編「走れメロス」をゲーム化。

走るメロス、激怒メロス、全裸メロス、敏感メロス、寝るメロス、そして邪智暴虐の王を駆使して疾走するロードレース・トリックテイキング・カードゲーム。
publisher's summary
publishers: Bungaku Games (文学ゲーム全集), 米光と抜群のゲームデザイナーズ (Yonemitsu to batsugun no gēmudezaināzu)

name: Uhu! Hai!
description: Each card in the trick-taking game Uhu! Hai! features an owl on the top and a shark on the bottom. Whoever leads decides whether the owl or the shark is the valid half of the card for this particular trick, but exchange cards can flip a shark trick to an owl trick and vice versa, suddenly making your powerful card come up dry compared to others...

name: Chain Mail: A Problematic Pest – Adventure Kit
description:
It's not every day you get to escort such a creature, but the higher the risk the greater the reward, right?

Get the creature to where it needs to go and keep it away from pitfalls despite its heinous longing to throw itself head long into danger.

A Problematic Pest is an Adventure Kit for Chain Mail: Adventures of Earthshine.

Goal: Return the creature to its owner.

This expansion includes:

Quest: A Problematic Pest
Map: Heart of the Chasm
Monsters: Silver Robot / Temporal Spiders
Treasure: Cavern Map



Released in the September 2019 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: 狩猟の時代~大河の恵み~ (Shuryo no Jidai~Taiga no Megumi~)
description:
狩猟の時代~大河の恵み~ (Shuryo no Jidai~Taiga no Megumi~) is an expansion to 狩猟の時代 (Shuryou no Jidai). The title means 'Era of Hunting - The Blessings of Taiga'. Taiga is boreal forest, a mix of pine, spruce and larch trees, typically with lakes and rivers.

This expansion introduces new elements to the game, and gives rules for a two player game. There are also additional pieces and boards to include in the base game.

Rivers and Fish - River cards tuck under the hunting grounds. As players collect resources, they can also get fish when they are shown in the corresponding spaces in the river. Fish can be used as food, or sacrificed on Altars.

Altars - there are ten double-sided cards which give 20 Altars. Players can sacrifice fish here and receive bonuses, either immediate or permanent.
user summary
mechanics: Income, Physical Removal, Track Movement, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Divine Corruption
description:
In Divine Corruption: Rebirth, you play as a human who’s starting their second and final life in Aurae, the kingdom and paradise reserved for celestial beings. Selected by those heavenly rulers to serve as a lowly slave, it’s up to you to do everything you can to prove your value to your masters, so that you too can join the celestial caste. But remember that there are only two ways a slave’s life can end: in coronation among the celestials or in death.

In this semi-cooperative game, every outcome is possible. You can all be victorious and live happily among celestials or you can all finish on the scaffold. Only you can decide your path, will you cooperate with your peers or will you try to be the only one to live?

Every move, every action, every card you play have consequences. Help a fellow comrade accomplish a mission and he can help you achieve your goal but, take the renown of a more ambitious fellow player and see how fast revenge will come.

Each turn, the active player chooses the mission he wants to do. He can either do it alone if he has enough profession or ask another player and share credits. By doing a mission you gain renown but the more you are, the less you gain.

Then, any player can play cards from their hands. They can either be good with you and help you out or they can try to steal your points or your own cards.

People will do missions and amass points until one if them gets 75 points. At this point you have only a few turn before the game ends and all of those with 75 will have won, all the other will lose their heads and die for good this time.

—description from the publisher

name: klang²
description: Explore music, sound and language in a dynamic way. Your smartphone and our twenty klang squares enable you to play hundreds of different games. Develop your hearing and listening skills and deepen your general knowledge with klang². Play alone, or with friends and family!

name: Ponle Acento: Un juego Ortográfico
description:
Ponle Acento is a game about Spanish orthography. It consists of cards with spelling rules and cards with words. The words have gaps in them where the spelling is difficult.

Each player has three open word cards in front of them. One player draws a rule card and reads it out. Now everyone has to find word cards to which the rule is applicable and put it on top of the rule card. Only two cards can score per turn (from the same or different players), so players have to hurry. Players keep their correctly played cards and can exchange 3 for a victory point. First player to reach 3 victory points is the winner.

name: ⊿railways inc. After The RAIN
description:
In デルタ鉄道株式会社 (⊿railways inc. After The RAIN), it is time for the railroads to enter a small country town's urban development plan, as the Natural Public Corporation (NPC) has just opened a central station. The players take on running four railroad companies, Alpha Transport, Beta Transport, Gamma Orbital, and the eponymous Delta Railways.

The players will erect buildings, lay track, transport residents to work, and sometimes create a park, as they strive to build in accordance with the city plan formulated by the town. The players must also satisfy their company's difficult management policy, or convince their company to switch policies.

The game plays over a number of rounds, each with several phases, such as a Construction Phase and an Operation Phase. Players will spend money and construction material resources to erect buildings. Their trains will transport residents to work, and if a worksite is full, it will grow. If some residents are not able to go to work, they will not pay their rent, and the owner of the apartment building will make less income.

The player with the most points will win, and these points come from satisfying your company's management policy; building offices; establishing parks; meeting the requirements of the city's plan; leftover money; owning buildings next to parks; not owning factories adjacent to apartments; the tallest buildings; and the most different buildings.

(The name and capitalization is based on the game's inspiration from the Japaneses video game A列車で行こう).
user summary

In a nondescript countryside town, you'll be trying to contribute to the town's development plans and management schemes in a bid to get victory points, all while constructing buildings, laying rail track, and even transporting residents.
By the end of the game your empty country town will be transformed into a prospering city with skyscrapers on every block.

何もない田舎町に、建物の建設、鉄道の敷設などを行い、住民を移送しながら、町の都市計画や経営陣の経営計画に合わせた街づくりに貢献することで勝利点を獲得していきます。
何もなかった町が、ゲーム終了時には、高層ビルの建ち並ぶ都会に生まれ変わります。
publisher's summary
mechanics: Contracts, End Game Bonuses, Income, Network and Route Building

name: Kurza stopa!
description:
The hens were assaulted by the garden worms and they need you and your friends to help them catch all the worms.
How can you do this? Pay attention to which worm is fighting each chicken, follow the worms on the cards and catch the culprit. When you see the card with the chicken claw, shout out! The player that shouts first wins all the face-up cards.

name: Green HACK
description:
The sneaky "Estrella Corporation" is conspiring to get rich by taking advantage of our oceans. Pollution is rampant, but no one can find evidence to accuse them. Hackers of all the world, we have a mission for you: arm yourself with dice and pencil, and access the central server of the Estrella. Only in this way will we be able to download the incriminating files and stop the disaster once and for all!

—description from the designer

The game was published in ioGioco magazine.

name: Paper Pinball: Season 2 – Squishington Goes to Venus
description:
Paper Pinball is a dice game that tries to capture the feeling of playing pinball. All you will need is a pencil, three dice, and about five minutes.

Each round, roll two dice and fill in one of the scoring zones. Some zones need to be filled in a certain way, and most will cause some sort of effect, so the order you fill them in is important. If you ever can't fill a zone, you'll lose a ball. Lose three balls and the game is over. Try to fill as many scoring zones as possible while triggering multipliers, opening tunnels, and getting the coveted multiball.

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Print & Play, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Push Your Luck

name: Totalne zasmoczenie
description:
Almanak the wizard used the Total Soaked Amulet and took control of the inhabitants of Dragon Forest. Now, with his army, he is storming City after Wall to overthrow King Jacenty! Five heroes: dragon Gniewko, princess Izabela, knight Sergius, steed Lomot and Fochmistrzynia Rozczesalska face them!

A game of perceptiveness, cleverness and speed, the plot of which is set in the world of books from the series "Dragon Tales" by Marcin Mortka. Addictive, fast-paced gameplay will provide a lot of excitement to the youngest players and fans of the adventures of Izabela and Gniewek.

Purpose of the game:

Players release dragons from the power of the Amulet by sealing Dragon cards. A correctly sealed card goes to the player and brings him points in the form of crowns (symbols on the card). The player with the most crowns wins the game.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Czarodziej Almanak użył Amuletu Totalnego Zasmoczenia i przejął kontrolę nad mieszkańcami Smoczej Puszczy. Teraz naciera ze swoją armią na Miasto za Murem, aby obalić króla Jacentego! Piątka bohaterów: smok Gniewko, królewna Izabela, rycerz Sergiusz, rumak Łomot i Fochmistrzyni Rozczesalska stają im naprzeciw!

Gra na spostrzegawczość, spryt i szybkość, której fabuła osadzona jest w świecie książek z serii „Smocze opowieści” autorstwa Marcina Mortki. Wciągająca, szybka rozgrywka dostarczy wielu emocji najmłodszym graczom i fanom przygód Izabeli i Gniewka.

Cel gry:

Gracze wyzwalają smoki spod mocy Amuletu poprzez zaklepywanie kart Smoków. Poprawnie zaklepana karta trafia do gracza i przynosi mu punkty w postaci koron (symbole na karcie). Grę wygrywa gracz, który zdobędzie najwięcej koron.

—description from the publisher

name: The Elder Scrolls: Call to Arms – Quests
description:
Welcome to Tamriel – a realm of adventure and wonder. Where danger lies around every corner and where fame and fortune await the bold. It is a realm you can enter today, if you have the courage to answer the Call to Arms!

The Elder Scrolls: Call to Arms is a tabletop wargame set against the epic, sprawling backdrop of Tamriel. From the teeming cities of Cyrodiil to the towering mountains of Skyrim, across the ash-plains of Morrowind, and through the steaming swamps of Black Marsh, you must lead your Party of bold warriors on the path to glory. In this game, you must select a mighty champion to lead your Party, surrounding them with heroes and staunch followers. Players can take on quests, unearth magical artifacts, and fight roaming monsters as they do battle against their opponent, using a combination of strength, stealth and magic to win the day. Call to Arms is a simple game to learn, but a challenge to master; your Party can be assembled in an almost endless variety of ways, each unlocking new tactics and abilities with which to test your skill as a commander and challenge your enemies.

Whether exploring trap-filled dungeons, or battling in some windswept wilderness, Tamriel is yours to explore – or exploit – as you see fit, building your forces to take on all comers. This rich setting gives players the opportunity for a vast array of different game types and play styles, as well as collecting and modeling highly detailed, characterful miniatures from The Elder Scrolls universe.

This Quest Book is the gateway to starting your adventure in Tamriel!
It contains additional rules to those found in the Rulebook. Here you will learn about the different Game Modes, where you can battle with your friends or take on the wilds of Tamriel alone.
Most importantly, you will find numerous ready-to-play scenarios, providing tactical challenges and narrative adventure for your games!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Video Game Theme, Wargame
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Emporous: Roll & Sail
description:
A fast paced challenging Print and Play roll&write game about islands, riches, strategies and dangerous business. The game is about acquiring and spending your resources, to get as many points as fast as possible, by acquiring artisan works to fulfill contracts and acquire Masteries.

This game is a roll and write version of "Emporous: the boardgame" and implements most of it's set collection features adapted for a faster and more condensed experience, so as to fit the roll and write idea.

name: Monopoly: Assassin's Creed Syndicate
description:
The universe of Assassin's Creed puts the fan in the middle of an ancient struggle between two factions - The Assassins, who fight to protect mankind's right to freedom, and the Templars, who wish to impose a New World Order. Join the Brotherhood in Assassin's Creed Monopoly and revisit the most iconic locations of the series with breathtaking concept art. Past and present collide as you walk in the footsteps of the Assassins Altair, Ezio, Aveline, Connor, Edward, using the special Assassins playing pieces. Show off your Assassin's Creed Monopoly parkour skills and invest, negotiate, and trade your way to victory. What type of strategy will you choose? Should you try to collect as much as you can, or focus on specific targets?

—description from the publisher
