mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Ральф против интернета
description:
Ralph got out of the game machine and now walks on the Internet! Is there enough space on the Web for such a big guy? Check the strength of the World Wide Web servers along with the characters in the Disney animated film "Ralph Breaks the Internet". The one who overloads the most servers will be the winner.

In the deck of cards are four characters + a joker (replaces any character) with numbers from 1 to 16. At the beginning, 12 cards are dealt to each. In each round, you must select one card face up. Then all the cards are laid out in descending order on the table. If your card is the fourth in a row, column or pile - you take it. These are your victory points. After 12 rounds, the player with the most points is declared the winner.

—description from the publisher

name: Tlamatini
description: A trivia game about Mexico. The board consists of a map of Mexico, with a route leading from the Northwest to the Southeast. The active player rolls a d6 which determines a trivia category, then has to answer a question in that category. If successful, they move forward; if wrong, others get a chance to answer the question. Movement range is decided by whether additional clues were used. Some fields also have special functions. The first player to arrive at the end of the route is the winner.

name: Banned Books: Tom
description:
An additional character for Banned Books, from The Grapes of Wrath by John Steinbeck, delivered in the Board Game of the Month Club November 2018 package.

Tom:
(3) Parole: Restart your turn.
(3) Vitality: Place a stall token on your Stamina. At any point you can move it to a power.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Banned Books: Atticus
description:
An additional character for Banned Books, from To Kill a Mockingbird by Harper Lee, delivered in the Board Game of the Month Club September 2018 package.

Atticus:
(1) Represent: Take the action of a lane where a power is further than the progress.
(2) Equality: Move a progress token to the same space as a power token.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Roll For Omaha! 1944
description:
Roll For Omaha! 1944 is a WWII Roll + Write game intended for 1 player.

It is a low complexity abstract simulation of the D-Day invasion of Omaha Beach.

—description from the publisher
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Second Edition): Chaos Battletome – Hedonites of Slaanesh
description:
Of all the evil forces in the realms, the Hedonites of Slaanesh take the most pleasure in the carnage they wreak…

Slaanesh may be imprisoned – but, with this battletome, his powers are yours to master. This 96-page hardback battletome is your complete guide to the armies of the Dark Prince. You'll discover dark lore that sheds light on Slaanesh – the Chaos God of excess and pleasure – and his dreaded hosts. From the relentless seekers to usurping pretenders, this book brings some of the most sinister corners of the Mortal Realms to life in fantastic detail, with stunning art, new lore and tantalising hints of what the future holds for the Dark Prince. Meanwhile, a number of warscroll battalions, three sets of allegiance abilities, magical spells, command traits, artefacts and more allow you to build deadly Slaanesh armies made up of daemons and mortals alike. What’s more, the book contains painting tips and different colour schemes to inspire your collection, as well as bespoke missions and Path to Glory rules that are perfect for organising your first battles with Slaanesh’s hosts.

This book contains:


Allegiance abilities for Hedonites of Slaanesh, including a table of Battle Traits, a system for summoning Slaanesh Daemons, plus battle traits, command traits, and artefacts of power for the following Hosts: Invaders, Pretenders, and Godseekers
Three Spell Lores: Lore of Slaanesh, Forbidden Sorceries of Slaanesh, and the Lore of Pain and Pleasure
Path to Glory campaigns – rules for creating a Hedonites of Slaanesh warband for Path to Glory, including Champion Rewards Table, and Followers Rewards Tables
Four Warscroll Battalions that reward you for fielding thematic combinations of models
18 unit warscrolls, 3 endless spell warscrolls and a warscroll for the Fane of Slaanesh, printed here for your convenience
Pitched Battle Profiles for all units, endless spells, and the Fane of Slaanesh featured in this battletome, including minimum/maximum unit sizes, points values and battlefield roles


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Turn Order: Random, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Gesucht wird ...
description: Gesucht wird ... is an interesting and educational guessing game for quick thinkers and sniffers or those who want to become one. All players form a team and together guess the biblical person they are looking for. It can be very exciting because the hourglass continues to run. Whichever player ends up ahead, everyone will ultimately gain more Bible knowledge.

name: Juduku 3: Le Vice Ultime
description:
Like the rest of the Juduku games, Juduku 3 is a party game requiring players to answer dodgy, immoral and/or trashy questions in less than 8 seconds. Spontaneity is key!

The player with the lowest IQ is declared "Juduku Master". They will have to accept or decline the answers made by the rest of the group. If they like the answer or if it is fitting, the player who made it keep the question card and score a point ; otherwise nothing happens. The first player to score 7 points wins.
This second game in the series encourage you to explore your worst thoughts. This edition comes with:


400 new question cards
80 special "truth or dare" cards
1 rulebook presenting different game modes


—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Lakelands (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description: A new part of the landscape is added, the lake. The lakes are scored like cities, so whoever has the majority gets the points. Tiles with fish count two points, finished lakes count double.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval

name: Lost Worlds: Amara Wintersword – Female Barbarian with Axe
description:
Lost Worlds is the most popular entry in Alfred Leonardi's line of book games, which also includes Ace of Aces. Each player has a character card and a booklet (and sometimes special Tactics, Luck, or Spell cards) for one of about fifty (and growing) medieval-fantasy characters. Characters can range from barbarian warriors to animated skeletons to elven archers to unicorns — even two different dragons. Booklets are traded and, as each player selects a move, a reference grid in the books determine the results (wounds, off-balance maneuvers, and so on). Combat continues until one fighter or the other expires.

An interesting feature of the Lost Worlds system is that, under some versions of the rules, characters may improve their abilities as they gain experience. In theory, you are supposed to keep track of your progress with each character, and if one is utterly killed, it will have to start over without its improved skills.

Part of the Lost Worlds series of books.


From inside front page with User Summary:

This book represents "Amara Wintersword : Female Barbarian with Axe" in the LOST WORLDS combat book games and is playable, with all other LOST WORLDS books. Each book is unique and has its own special qualities.


User summary:

This Special Convention Edition is identical to the other, except for a cover that depicts Amara in front of the castle, having lost the top portion of her armor.
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Anisoptera
description:
Anisoptera is an abstract game where the objective is to organize a collection of dragonflies in the most optimal way in order to score you the most points.

Each turn you draw a card into your hand and then add a card to one end of the common display. After three turns, score the matched symbols based on the final card in your hand.

-description from designer

name: Kesse-Tu Fa Là?
description:
A game of mimes and wacky trials

You will need to act, make sounds, and use your creativity and imagination to make the players on your team guess the contents of the test cards.

Let go of your fool! Kesse-tu fa là offers a formula where all the tactics are good to make guess the words written on the playing cards.

First team to score enough points win !

Jeu de mimes et d’épreuves loufoques

Vous devrez mimer, émettre des sons et faire preuve de créativité et d’imagination pour faire deviner aux joueurs de votre équipe le contenu des cartes-épreuves.

Lâchez votre fou! Kesse-tu fa là propose une formule où toutes les tactiques sont bonnes pour faire deviner les mots inscrits sur les cartes de jeu.

name: Ryd bordet
description:
All the picture cards are spread on the table and one player reads a topic aloud. Eech player tries to collect all the picture cards that directly or indirectly relate to the subject. The opponents must approve the cards other players have collected, so they need to be able to vouch for their cards. The player who has finally collected the most picture cards has won.

Contains:

150 tasks,
150 picture cards
1 hourglass
rules

name: Градус
description:
Degree: competition for adults only!
Board Game Box Degree Want to diversify your party or any gathering in your home of up to ten people who are already 18 years old? Maybe you just need to liberate the participants of your corporate team building?

With the board game Gradus, you will not only diversify your fun but also get an unforgettable sensation and experience with a touch of the piquancy of adult competition. But what can I say: the roof will blow away completely from jokes, gags, eroticism, and alcohol. Everyone will play the board game Gradus because you simply won't be able to get out!

Hit the table with a Degree!
Before the start, all players receive tablets, presented by the designer in the form of beer mugs, and tokens with the volume of alcohol consumed to record their achievements in conventional alcoholic drinks. Do you want to be limited to conventional alcohol and liters? Prepare thoroughly: a few bottles of pleasure and a good snack will not be superfluous. Companies of teetotalers can simply eat well and drink tea.

The set includes 6 decks of cards with different themes:
Basic - it is also basic and participates in all mixes;
Alkotresh - the name speaks for itself, so the tasks are tied to the "alcohol" part;
Move your body - tasks from this deck will crush your bodies sitting at the table;
Tin - the special coolness of the tasks will blow anyone's mind;
Spicy - a little eroticism will not hurt;
Brain ON - don't want to move your body - move your brains. Components of the game Degree

It is recommended to use no more than three task decks in one game party, shuffling two more decks from the base one if desired. A menu with a standard section and a part of wishes is also available for players.

The goal of each player is to reach the liter or two-liter value on their tablet by drinking or drinking points. Points are awarded after completing a specific task.

So, you are in an entertainment establishment, and just burn with the desire to drink! Wait for your turn and, in the clockwise direction, make a move: take a card from the general deck and announce your task to all participants. If you successfully complete the task, you will receive a point by noting the amount taken internally on the tablet. Please note that if you refuse to fulfill the conditions, then you drink a free "penalty" for which points are not awarded.

During the game, you can use the menu once and drink your points to order any dish for another participant. The standard section is available at any time during the game, and the Wish Menu is available after completing the task. If the victim of your choice did not complete the task, then, like all losers, he drinks a "penalty", while receiving the right to use the Menu for free.

The board game Degree can be adapted to suit any company by using suitable decks, making some decks suitable for families as well.

name: Brain Games Kids
description:
Based on the Emmy-nominated National Geographic Channel TV series, Brain Games, Brain Games Kids takes players through a series of challenges that puts both their mind and body to the test! Teams go head-to-head to test their logic, language, vision and physical coordination. It’s a great party game and perfect for family game nights!

OBJECT OF THE GAME: Play as teams and work together to answer mind-bending challenges in this CEREBELLUM SHOWDOWN! The first team to reach the finish space wins!

name: Myth: Forged in Fire Promo Card
description:
Last of 4 promo Hero Cards for Myth released between 2014-2016. This card was released by Megacon at the GenCon 2016 Slaughterfield Event.

The card reads: "Stacked. Any Action may be played on top of this Card. That Action costs 0 AP."
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Sjavs
description:
Sjavs is a Danish and Faroese game in the Schafkopf family. Many variants exist but the predominant one in the Faroe Islands is a four player game and the predominant one in Denmark is a three player game. Variants exist for 1 and 2 players also. The game was brought back to Denmark from Germany by travelling journeymen (Navere) and evolved here mainly among craftsmen and very much became a pub game.

The Danish game is different in that it only has 20 cards and players start with 50 points each. The first to 0 loses. The most common variant is called Klørtjavs (Clubs Tjavs) where clubs is a fixed trump suit.

name: Páros Játszma
description:
Páros Játszma is a board game that raises serious and funny questions between couples living and in love together that they think they know about each other.
The board game reveals whether we know each other well.

Sure, it raises conflicts in several cases, but that makes it an interesting game.
Dormant desires, dreams, or even annoying little things can come up. Get to know yourself wisely!

Couple vs couple game mode:
This board game is actually a dating quiz where it can even turn out that friends know the couple better than they know each other.
Going through the fields of the board, you will encounter many good-natured, provocative, or surprising questions, if you know your partner’s answer in advance because you know him/her well, you can move quickly to victory!

name: Simon's Cat: Dinner Date
description:
In Simon's Cat: Dinner Date, the deck is composed of pictures with birds and special "Simon's Cat" cards. Players draw cards and lay them in a row. The first player to find the right bird and point to it gathers all the challenge cards and keeps them. Players guessing incorrectly return a card to the deck. When a special Simon's Cat card comes up, the first player to shout "Simon's Cat!" wins the card for extra points at the end of the game.

The game stops when all the cards in the deck have been used. The player with the most points wins.
mechanics: Move Through Deck, Pattern Recognition, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Sneaker War
description:
The most desired (limited edition) sneakers are launching soon! Gather your friends to queue up and buy the sneakers! Suit up, warriors. This is War and get as many shoe boxes as possible!

Players are scalpers and play with cards. Players who collect shoeboxes with 20 points will win the game.

There are sneakers cards, queuer cards and action cards. Sneaker card shows the condition to get scores, i.e. the queuer card limit and also the points which can be taken. Queuer cards and action cards are for your hand management.

Random players begin to play clockwise and each player will choose one colour of queuer cards and action cards. They will be divided into 2 card decks. Each player draw 2 queuer cards and 2 action cards.

During your turn, player can play the queuer card concealed and below the sneaker card. If there are already queuer cards present, put below the last queuer card and queue up. Player may also choose to use action cards to fight against others, to increase own queuer numbers or create chaos. Once the queue vacancy of particular sneaker is full, reveal all queuer cards in this row and check the total queuers of each colour. Player can get points in form of shoeboxes and stack them up (There are 72 mini shoeboxes figure). Any player who collects shoeboxes with 20 points will be the winner.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Queue, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: The Game of Life: Disney Pixar Inside Out
description:
Experience The Game of LIFE from the Inside Out!
Based on the popular Disney Pixar film Inside Out, this special edition of The Game of LIFE takes fans on a journey through the mind of an 11-year-old girl named Riley. Guided by her five emotions; Joy, Sadness, Disgust, Anger, and Fear, players must travel through the subconscious mind to regain core memories and bring them back to Headquarters. The player with the most memory points wins! Great collectible item for Pixar fans and fun for family game nights.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Simon's Cat: Total Mess
description:
In Simon's Cat: Total Mess, the deck is composed of pictures with connected drawings and special "Simon's Cat" cards. Players draw cards and lay them in a row until a card with no number in the corner is drawn. The first player to connect objects from the first to the last card and correctly name the last objects gathers all the challenge cards and keeps them. Players guessing incorrectly return a card to the deck. When a special Simon's Cat card comes up, the first player to shout "Simon's Cat!" wins the card for extra points at the end of the game.

The game stops when all the cards in the deck have been used. The player with the most points wins.
mechanics: Move Through Deck, Pattern Recognition, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: 15 Days: Feathers & Lag Season
description: Mini expansion, introduces 5 new feather tokens that can be used to get one of the animal abilities during that action and 6 Lag cards that will add choices to boost your score during each season.

name: Murder, Mayhem & Lollipops
description:
Murder, Mayhem & Lollipops is a darkly comedic competitive card game in which players collect weapons that they will later use to assassinate targets. The player with the highest total value in assassinated targets and unused weapons and other items wins the game.

On a turn, a player must perform 3 actions. This could either be revealing a target, killing a target by spending weapon(s), aqcuire items through flipping a card over or taking them from a deck or another player, or discarding candy to get more actions.
mechanics: Events, Hidden Victory Points, Push Your Luck

name: Lucky Numbers
description:
Players attempt to win chip pots based on lottery numbers turned over on the game board. Six green number cards are placed on the board, with the first three turned over. Players are then dealt cards from a red deck and ante chips under each of the cards on the board.

On their turn, a player may either play a card towards the board or draw one if they don’t have any numbers that match. Players must then discard one card at the end of their turn, regardless of whether they play a card or not. When a player can match the three number combination, they claim the pot under the third card, then turn over the fourth card. Play continues the same as before, with the fifth and sixth cards revealed once the previous pots are claimed. The player with the most chips at the end wins.

name: DINGO
description:
DINGO is a card game for the whole family, where you have to be the fastest creating words with the syllables that appear on the cards. But there are cheat cards you'll have to avoid!!.

The winner will be the player who previously runs out of cards in hand.

—description from the publisher (translated)

DINGO es un juego de cartas para toda la familia, donde tendrás que ser el más rápido creando palabras con las sílabas que aparecen en las cartas. Pero hay cartas trampas que tendrás que evitar!!.

El ganador será aquel jugador que antes se quede sin cartas en mano.

—description from the publisher

name: Limbo
description:
Arithmetic game with a traditional card deck, from David Parlett, creator of Ninety-Nine. From a hand of 5, players play a card at a time, either deducting from or dividing into the current sum. Totals start at 101 each hand and go down to as close to 0 as possible. The catch is: If card played divides into the sum without remainder then it may not be deducted but must divide. (For instance a 5 played to 20 must divide for 4 rather than deduct for 15, whereas a 3 must deduct since it can't divide into 20 evenly.)

An Ace counts either 1 or 11. A Jack played repeats the same value as the previous card. A Queen reverses the digits of the current count. However, you may only play a Queen if reversing the digits reduces the count. A King divides by any desired number higher than 1 and lower than the current, provided that it leaves no remainder.

The hand ends when one player plays their last card or is unable to play without going below zero.

name: ¡Caiaaate!
description:
Caiaaate is a quick card game in which players try to be the first to get rid of their face-down stack of cards.
Players take turn playing a card from their stack openly on a pile, making the sound that the card tells them. However, if the sound would be the same as the sound just made by the previous player, they have to invent a different sound. When a player plays a "shh" card, everybody must immediately be silent and put one hand down on the table. Anyone who makes a mistake or is last to put their hand down takes the entire pile of cards on the table. Some special cards spice up the game.

name: Knockabout / Warp 6
description: Includes Knockabout and Warp 6 in one plastic clamshell box.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Intel
description:
Intel is a simple yet highly strategic card game about tracking the Agent card and leading others off its trail. Take turns playing cards to uproot information on others or sabotage them by stealing and swapping cards. Score points by correctly voting for who has the Agent at the end of the round. Whoever has the Agent itself scores even more points, but only if they successfully lead others off their trail!

As the end of round approaches, the stakes get higher and higher—every action taken affects who ends up with the Agent card, as well as who might know its location! Deceive your friends with mind games, reverse psychology, and other strategic plays to maximize your points.

That’s just the tip of the iceberg—keep an eye out for stray point cards, the valuable Asset card, the elusive Double Agent, and much more...
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deduction, Hand Management, Memory

name: The Mermaid's Jewels: String Together A Treasure From The Sea
description:
Mermaids have been swimming through the magical sea, collecting colorful jewels along the way. They have an overflowing treasure chest full of “pearls” and want you to join in on the fun. Can you string together enough of these treasures from
the sea to make your very own necklace?

Roll the die and collect pearls from the special, pearl-sorting treasure chest. Once you remove a pearl, all the other pearls will cascade down the lane. Look closely! Did any of the pearls form a chain reaction with two or more of the same colored pearls touching?

The first player to complete their necklace wins!

For a more challenging game, you can add the dangerous, dark green, seaweed colored pearls to the treasure chest. You’ll need to avoid getting “caught in the seaweed” and complete your necklace to win.

—description from the designer

name: Dead Road
description:
Awards:

-1 Place best solo game in: 8th roll and write design contest.
-1 Place best foreign language game in: 8th roll and write design contest.
-2 Placed best game in: 8th roll and write design contest.

Wargamevault:https://www.wargamevault.com/product/366275/DEAD-ROAD

Dead Road is a survival game in a post-apocalyptic world in which you must survive together with your community, reaching the proposed goals to prosper. In this world you must go to places and find the necessary resources to achieve these goals, but you will meet Zombies on the path that you must eliminate to continue on your way.

Dead Road is a single player roll and write survival game.
With a maximum of 40 minutes of play and for people over 10 years old.

Objective

Reach each goal from levels 1 to 5 by getting the resources necessary for each level. Future expansions will have additional goals that the player must reach to win.

What do you need to play?


One printed sheet of paper (we recommend putting the sheet in a polypropylene protector).
One red Dice D-Six to simulate the Horde’s moves, both walking and attacking.
A few Dice D-Six to simulate the survivors.
Two whiteboard markers. We recommend using a red marker for the March of the Horde and for Morale, and a blue one for the inventory.
A few tokens or Meeples to simulate the survivors.


—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Mein Königreich für ein Pferd: Promokarten
description:
Three German promo cards for Mein Königreich für ein Pferd:

- Life finds a way: Give away 1 pig. Everyone must remove 1 fence from their pasture. You may not move/swap your animals to other areas beforehand. Unfenced animals run away immediately.
- Be a pig!: You may re-roll 1 die one additional time in the dice phase of your turn, after you have already executed it. However, you cannot execute it again.
- Swine mess/Swinishness: You may re-roll as many dice as you like in the dice phase of your turn after you have already executed them. However, you cannot execute them again



The original cards in German
- Das Leben findet einen Weg: Gib 1 Schwein ab. Alle müssen 1 Zaun von ihrer Weide entfernen. Ihr dürft eure Tiere vorher nicht in andere Bereiche versetzen/tauschen. Nicht eingezäunte Tiere laufen sofort weg.
- Sei ein Schwein!: Du darfst in der Würfelphase deines Zugs 1 Würfel 1x zusätzlich nachwürfeln, nachdem du ihn bereits ausgeführt hast. Du kannst ihn jedoch nicht erneut ausführen.
- Schweinerei: Du darfst in der Würfelphase deines Zugs beliebig viele Würfel nachwürfeln, nachdem du sie bereits ausgeführt hast. Du kannst sie jedoch nicht erneut ausführen
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Hand Management, Re-rolling and Locking

name: 迷宮推理 (Labyrinthine Mystery)
description:
迷宮推理 (Labyrinthine Mystery) is an asynchronous cooperative game for 3 to 5 players. Players are guests who have been invited by the owner of a grand manor on a snowy winter night. While the guests have never met each other before this night, they share one thing in common: they all have their own reasons for hating the owner of the manor and have designs on his death. When the owner turns up dead, everyone realizes that a formal police investigation might end of leading back to their own person…so they decide to resolve it among themselves by collecting evidence to find the murderer concealed amidst their numbers.

If the players can expose the true identity of the murderer and reveal the tricks and weapon he or she used within the time constraints, they win. Oppositely, if the guilty party is able to deceive everyone and go undetected, that person wins the game.

On each turn, a player can chose to either investigate, accuse, or make a final accusation. Every action costs minutes of the player's limited time.

The game ends when all the time is consumed or if the murderer is discovered.

According to the publisher blurb, this version improves on the original Mystery Homes (2018) by adding new murder weapons, tricks, and changes to the scenario. Aspects of the components/box have also been improved based on feedback from the previous game.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Real-Time, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers

name: Jurassico
description:
Welcome to Jurassico new hires! I was told you were all top notch scientists in the field of genetics. It will be your job to finish genetic codes for our dinosaurs so we can sell them for profit. We can get a little competitive here, the boss has promised extra money to the scientist that finishes each dinosaur first. Oh and try to ignore those people across the way at Embryonic Inc, they are always bribing our employees trying to get our secrets, you aren't that type of person are you?

Jurassico is a roll-and-write game heavily inspired by the process of reconstructing dinosaur DNA as seen in Jurassic Park. To do this, the players share a common pool of dice and take turns selecting pairs of dice to utilize, crossing off their sum from their scoring sheet (representing different dinosaur genomes, with six sets of genes needed to complete each), then re-roll the used pair for the next player.

Much as in Jurassic Park, it is possible to take shortcuts by splicing your DNA with that of modern reptiles and amphibians, modifying dice values and/or colors, but the uses of this ability are limited only do this a limited number of times for each die. It is also (again inspired by the events of the book and the movie) possible to sell samples to a competitor (Embryonic, Inc) to earn additional points.

The game continues until a player reaches five points based on the genomes they have completed and/or sold to the competition. There is also a solo mode where the player tries to reach a set points goal before Embryonic does.

name: Respuestas Abiertas: Imágenes
description:
Respuestas Abiertas: Imágenes makes you travel to a world of infinite possibilities where limits are given by imagination and the ability to invent original stories or phrases.

One player is the storyteller for the turn and looks at the images on the 5 cards in their hand. From one of these, they make up a sentence and say it out loud (without showing the card to the other players).

Each other player selects the card in their hands which best matches the sentence and gives the selected card to the storyteller, without showing it to the others.

The storyteller shuffles their card with all the received cards. All pictures are shown face up and every player has to bet upon which picture was the storyteller's.

If nobody or everybody finds the correct card, the storyteller scores 0, and each of the other players scores 2. Otherwise the storyteller and whoever found the correct answer score 3. Players score 1 point for every vote for their own card.

The game ends when the deck is empty. The player with the most points wins.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Move Through Deck, Simultaneous Action Selection, Storytelling, Targeted Clues, Voting

name: Crimetime: Fall 002 – Vater vergib mir, ich habe gesündigt
description: A brutal murder of a clergyman. Is the main suspect really guilty? You slip into the role of the investigator and, in this case, travel to San Giotto in Italy. Can you clear up this authentic sacred crime thriller?

name: Smash Up: Tournoi TITANS Saison 1
description:
Included Faction Titans:

Innsmouth (Obligatory Cthulhu)
Time Traveler (Science Fiction Double Feature)
Ghosts (Awesome Level 9000)
Minion of Cthulhu (Obligatory Cthulhu)
Pirates (Original)
Bear Cavalry (Awesome Level 9000)
Tricksters (Original)
Super Spies (Science Fiction Double Feature)
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Tawantinsuyu: Book of Challenges
description:
The Book of Challenges contains 3 variants for experienced players. Two variants were featured during the Tawantinsuyu Digital World Championship 2021 and are therefore uniquely balanced for 4 players. The third variant is not for the faint of heart, likewise representing an expertly crafted challenge.

Balanced Symmetrical
This is a very balanced game setup for 4 players. It was used during the Tawantinsuyu Digital World Championship 2021 as the setup for the Grand Final. In that particular game, "Bijmeister" secured the win (as player 2) with a final score of 179 points. The player "ooba" clinched second place (as player 4) with 163 points, followed by "Vrarimor" (as player 1) with 144 points, and "Wppxis" (as player 3) with 130 points.

Balanced Asymmetrical
This is a very balanced game setup for 4 players. It was used during the Tawantinsuyu Digital World Championship 2021 as the setup for the Semifinals. Across the four semifinal games, each player position managed to win their table once, thereby securing a spot in the Grand Final that followed a few days later.

Extreme Asymmetry
This is an extremely asymmetrical setup for 3–4 players. While it provides each player with an "all stars aligned" start to the game, the players must play expertly to emerge victorious as letting down one's guard can result in another player gaining the advantage.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Rondel, Set Collection, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Ninjajakten
description:
Sneak out of the castle - without getting caught!
Now you have been at the Ninja school for a long time… You have trained a lot and your Sensei says that you are ready for the final exam: You will sneak around in the Ninja castle together, collect all the equipment a Ninja needs - and sneak out through the gate without Sensei catching your.

If you manage to do that, you will be approved Ninjas. But time is limited!

Exciting adventure games that require cooperation. You win or lose together!

You are a group of Ninja students at the Ninja School and have trained hard together to pass the final test to
become approved Ninjas. You should sneak around together
in school and find the various Ninja gear like your Sensei, hidden in the classrooms on school at the castle.
But you have limited time! You all have to have time to take you to the Ceremony Room and out of the castle before Sensei gets there, and besides, you must all have gathered at least
one Ninja gear each.
Be careful! If Sensei sees you (ends up in the same
room like you) then he punishes you by sending
back to the start box! Sensei has also placed
out cages you can get stuck in.
If you succeed, you have passed the test and will be approved
Ninjas. But if Sensei comes before you to the Ceremony Room. Then you have all failed…
But you can do the test again!

name: Kingdom Dice
description:
The old king lies dead in a gambling hall, just two gems left in the coffers. Bandits wait on the borders, ready to strike. The farms and mines have fallen silent. You must rebuild the kingdom before the borders fall! All you have left to lose is a pair of dice. Save the failing kingdom you've inherited in this print-and-play roll and write game. You must rebuild the kingdom by constructing new farms and mines, investing in technologies and funding adventures, all before the kingdom inevitably falls again.

Made during the 2020 worldwide Covid-19 quarantine. Print out a few copies and play with the people you're isolating with, or hop on a chat and play a remote game with friends.

—description from the publisher

In this game, you will roll two dice and use their results to mark attacks, production, buildings (farms and mines), technologies, and adventurers in the game sheet.

The game ends when any player marks all the attacks on a single border of the realm or all his/her mines as built. Finish the current round, then tally scores. The player with most victory points wins.

name: The Final Light-Year: The Iris Sector
description:
October 2021 episode for The Final Light-Year.

This kit adds the new sector map, the overlord, minion ships and new crew.


Released in the October 2021 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: マッドネスアワー (Madness Hour)
description:
North America, the 1920s. There is an old mansion surrounded by disturbing rumours: “The owner, a wealthy man, was devoted to ancient and blasphemous cult.”, “A decade ago, the inhabitants suddenly vanished.”, “All who entered the mansion disappeared, and the few who returned took their own lives soon after.”… The many strange phenomena that occur here hold a dark fascination attracting experts in mysticism and magic. Then, one day, the mansion is visited by a new group of people: A team of investigators from Miskatonic University. How they will end up only depends on the mysterious girl who will hold their fate in her hands…

Madness Hour is an asymmetrical cooperative game of exploration, based on the Cthulhu Mythos by the works of H. P. Lovecraft. One of the players takes the role of the mysterious girl, while the others play investigators, searching for ancient artefacts and trying to escape from a dangerous mansion. You won’t know whether the girl you will encounter in the mansion is human or something more terrifying. The girl’s intentions will depend on her identity, and she will manipulate and change the course of the investigators and the objects they hold. As they investigate, they will have to try and figure out what she is and what she is not.

The mysterious relics that the investigators find in the mansion will drive them into madness and turn them into something else. The investigation within the dark mansion is a mixture of madness and suspicion, leading to unexpected consequences. Will you be able to unravel the true identity of the mysterious girl who controls your destiny and escape from the mansion – while still being human…?
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Map Addition, Modular Board, Role Playing, Semi-Cooperative Game, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Unigames (ウニゲームス) (II), Yanoman Corporation

name: Animanize
description:
Circus-themed trick-taking game.
Collect animals with special skills.
However, if you collect too much, the animals will fight each other.

name: Let Sleeping Dons Lie
description:
In Let Sleeping Dons Lie your goal is to get out of your criminal life with enough loot for a fresh start before the Don wakes up.

As a member of the Don’s crime family, you begin with a hand of 7 cards and some loot. The Don is laid out sleeping in the middle of the play area. Based on how big your crime family is, will determine how much plunder there is to go around.

Each turn you draw a card from either the draw or discard piles.
Then Play a card onto the discard pile, following any actions that may be on the card. When you manage to pick up a total of 7 of one type of plunder, the round ends and the plunder is stashed into Loot bags. Then another round starts. You escape when you are the first to reach enough loot bags for a fresh start.

If the Don wakes up then the game is over and you have to get out with what you loot you can carry.
mechanics: Race, Score-and-Reset Game, Set Collection, Variable Set-up

name: Rabauken
description:
In Rabauken ("Bullies"), you need to keep things moving because if your ball stops, everyone else gets rewarded.

To set up, place the round wooden board on the table. Each player receives a flat block of wood, a wooden tower with a bowl carved in the top of it, and a glass ball. Each player in turn places their block on the board, with their tower fitting into a hole in this block and their ball placed on top of their tower.

Once everyone is ready, play begins, with each player in turn using a finger to push their block toward the blocks of other players. If you knock someone else's block off the board or dislodge their ball without yours falling out, then you receive a boar token as a reward. If you dislodge your own ball or you take too long and your ball comes to rest inside your tower, each other player receives a pig token as a punishment to you.

When someone scores, reset the board, then start a new round with the player to the left of the previous starting player.

Whoever collects ten tokens first wins!

name: The 50 States Game
description:
How well do you really know the USA? This game will vastly improve your knowledge while introducing the thrill of competition and a great deal of fun between friends and family.

Each player gets two state sheets - five states per sheet. The first player that fills ONE sheet wins the game. Player gets cards by either competing with facts (Area, Population, Highest point, Avg. temperatre) or either wining challenges. Challenge can be called by player that's on turn and holding a weak card - lower fact values and is decided by dice roll.

name: Solitaire Legends: Guinevere
description: Morgan le fay hast placed a curse over Camelot! There art four Arthurs seated at the round table. Three art changelings who've stolen the king's true form. Guinevere must find Merlin's crystals and send the imposters back to the faerie realm. But maketh haste, for the fabled knights art under the witch's spell and seek to destroyeth thee!

name: CookPot!
description:
The best chefs are in the town.
But the best cannot be many!
Cooking competition was held to determine the superiority!
In addition to cooking skills, you need "a little bit" of luck to win.

Gather ingredients!
Use cooking tools!
Treat guests!
Be the best chef!

There're 5 cooking ingredients. Meat, Fish, Vegetable, Wheat, Rice. You can get these ingredients with cards or dice. Draw an 1 card or roll 2 dice. The cards belong to the individual, and the dice belong to everyone. Therefore, only roll the dice when you are sure!

If someone makes 5 dishes, game ends. The player with the most points wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Horns Up!: Black Deck
description:
An 18+ expansion, whose cards not only include new rules and Paths, but also new Audience cards regarding the less "family-friendly" (and most intriguing and fun) aspects of a concert.This expansion was developed hand in hand with the Lacuna Coil band, asking them about the most awkward and exciting situations happened during their concerts around the world. The result of their tales has become a deck of cards that are extremely... heavy. For this reason, it was decided to pair these episodes with the most “friendship-threatening” game mechanics.

Playing with this deck, you will have the chance to unleash your wrath against a single opponent -loading them with endless debuffs- or spread your evil ways on every opponent. This may call for revenge from your opponents, but keep headbanging and keep your Horns Up!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult

name: Σινεμαχίες (Movie Battles)
description:
A classic board game playing pantomime or answering trivia questions on Greek and International Cinema. In a round metal box (cinematic bobbin), 2 packages of 100 photos, original dashboard, wooden pawns and dice.

The board has a similar use as with trivia games, there is no start and end, but it's purpose is to stop over different frames (places) to be asked different questions about the movie between: "title" by doing pantomime or verbally by looking at the picture, "director", and "actors/actresses". For that, a pawn and a dice are used giving you the option to select the type of questions that you are most familiar with. One side of the card is showing a scene from the movie, while the other has the title, director and actors/actresses involved.

When a movie card is played, the player/team has to answer the question to win it. If he/she/they can't reply then the next player has the opportunity to do so, etc. A movie card never returns to the pile.

The goal is to collect as many movie cards as possible throughout the game. The game ends if all the cards from the deck are finished of when the predefined time has passed. The player with the most cards on hand is the winner.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Ego Pictures
description:
Ego Pictures is the next instalment of the social game EGO. Thanks to the pictures you will get to know each other better! There is no wrong answer here! The main attraction of the game are the pictures. Choose for yourself, which picture you like best and which you like least. Which picture best represents the drawn text? The task of the other participants is to guess your choice.

Do you think that the other participants know you well?

You will soon find out!

name: Abstract Academy: Humpy Promo
description:
Exclusive Professor card available from Crafty Games webstore.

Humpy Rules: 5 points for the most chaotic composition*

As Balanced Composition, but highest result
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Grid Coverage, Pattern Building, Score-and-Reset Game, Set Collection

name: Wortblitz Junior Kartenspiel
description:
A game with 50 round cards in a tin box. Each card has a letter and a category.

The players have to find a word which starts with the letter of the first card and belongs to the category of the second card. The player who finds a valid word first, collects the card, uncovers and reads the next pair of letter and category.

The player with the most gathered cards wins the game.

This is the children's version of the game Wort Blitz Kartenspiel.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Word Game

name: On Base Baseball
description:
On Base Baseball is a Sabermetric-driven tabletop baseball game using cards, charts, and dice. Using real MLB players gamers can recreate many modern and classic games and seasons. At its heart, On Base is a game engine that you can change and add to as you like. It is basic enough to be played quickly (similar to basic APBA or Strat-o-matic) but, through gamer mods, it can become more nuanced.

There are carded seasons for the game and there are whole decades of roster sheets available. The older cards have at bat outcomes right on the cards while newer card sets and roster sheets give you the values to use while playing the game but the outcomes are found on the game engine chart--the heart of the game.

Game play is based off of some of the original dice baseball games from the early 20th century--roll two d6 dice and a d9 (or d10). From that roll result the gamer cross references the player's game play values against the roll number to find the outcome of the at bat.

One of the unique features of the game is the pitcher/hitter interaction. Every at bat starts with the pitcher. If there is an outcome for the pitcher then the at bat is complete. If the outcome for the pitcher is blank then the outcome comes from the batter. The game is based on the DIPS Sabermetric theory so pitchers will affect strikeouts, walks, and home runs based on their ability to control those outcomes in real life.

name: Menzacsata
description:
Menzacsata sends you back to a typical Hungarian school canteen. You like it or not you cannot leave anything on your plate to go to waste, you have to eat it. The overly nice kitchen ladies keep the extra portions coming and your evil school mates try to get rid of their collection by tossing it on your food pile.

This is an easy to understand quick and fun card game. Each card has a color and a food on it. You start with three in your hand, no cards in your food pile, and one card in the common discard pile. The goal is to have less cards in your foodpile than the others when the deck runs out. In your turn you can play cards from your hand or your foodpile if the color or the food mathes the top card on the discard pile. You can continue playing cards until you don't have any that matches or you decide to stop. Kitchen staff, classmate and school pet action cards help you to get rid of your food pile, often by giving cards to other players.

name: Spelet om Allsvenskan
description:
Spelet om Allsvenskan ("The Allsvenskan Game") is a casual strategy game themed for the professional league for men's association football, Allsvenskan (Eng: ”the All-Swedish”).

In Spelet om Allsvenskan, four players (called Rivals) compete in either a complete or short season (double or single fixtures). The game requires four Rivals: in case you are only 2 or 3 players, the game itself will manage the other Rivals according to special ”AI rules”. In this way, players may leave and join during the game: the ”AI” will manage a team while they are gone.

The base rules of the game are simple, but choices can be tricky. A round consists of all Rivals playing their matches simultaneously. Each Rival has to play two cards (a blue and an orange card) on a team in any other match than their own: but each team can only hold one card. A blue card gives scoring chances to both your team and the team you play it on, and an orange card gives scoring chances to both your opponent and the opponent you play it on. As the game progresses, more rules are added that have the Rivals affect their cards with ”success points” that are assembled by winning games.

The game has all the licenses required, so the teams, logos, and arenas are picked from the real world (teams like Malmö FF, IFK Göteborg etc). No knowledge of football is required, but the game is highly competitive as it requires you to win as many matches as you can – and subsequently have other Rivals preferrably lose their games.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Catch the Leader, Chaining, Communication Limits, Negotiation, Prisoner's Dilemma, Simulation, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Lord of the Chords: Who Let The Chords Out? – 4th Booster Pack: Essentials
description: The Essentials pack introduces an additional card type; the Equip! Aimed to serve every musician's favorite pastime; buying new music equipment! Equip them onto your instrument to augment your playstyle and diminish our foes!

name: Kernel
description:
Kernel is a press-your-luck dice game for small and large groups. Players collect as many kernels as possible all while racing to 100 points. Learn in under 5 minutes. Be smart, quick, and lucky to take home the win. The player that collects the most Kernels wins!

About the game:

Lose or gain kernels depending on your roll.
Be the first to grab the corn cob squeeze when doubles are rolled to earn bonus kernels!
Play it safe or risk it all to earn extra kernels.
Everything you need to play in a convenient canvas storage bag.
Great game for kids to practice addition and risk management skills.
Fun for the whole family and large groups!


—description from the publisher

name: Super Plushies
description:
During a quiet afternoon, children discover 2 magical dice in their room, hidden in a small box.
As they roll the dice, all their plushies come to life and express their greatest wish: becoming Superheroes... or better yet... Super Plushies !!

In this game, the players have to create the best Super Plushies team.
To do so, they have to recruit 4 heroes by giving them the necessary equipment, such as gloves, boots, capes and masks they need for their outfit.
The player who ends up with the most stars in their team at the end wins the game.

Super Plushies is kind of "my first Resources Management Game". It's a perfect family game as children can easily play on their own (from 6 years old), but parents will be glad to share these funny and poetic boardgames moments with their kids :)

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Dice

name: Potion Pot Trail
description:
Potion Pot Trail is a puzzle and resource management roll and write game in which players assume the roles of alchemists preparing to open their new potion shops.
With only ten days to brew potions to sell, they ride off into the forest in their enchanted potion pots to gather ingredients.
However, these handy potion pots leave a trail of ruined ingredients in their wake, preventing players from harvesting in locations they’ve already passed through.
Players will need to plan ahead, choosing the direction and distance of their moves carefully, in order to visit the hexes containing the ingredients they seek. Along the way, they can brew up potions to earn extra ingredients, additional actions, and helpful enchantments.
With a clever strategy and some skillful maneuvering, they should be able to line their shelves with potions in time for opening day.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Drinks with Frenemies: Explicit Edition
description:
The game of creating friends out of enemies & enemies out of friends. If you like games, drinking and sabotaging your friends, this game is for you! Drinks with Frenemies is a card game that brings the worst out of you and rewards you for it!

It's an entertaining party game that will keep you on your toes as you adjust to the ever-changing rules. It's a drinking game that's not family friendly. Meaning you can play with any type of beverage you prefer. In fact, we've made gameplay rules for those who wish not to drink at all. From water to moonshine, we think there's no perfect way to ruin... uh... enhance your relationships!

It's a great icebreaker game that gets you moving, thinking and laughing. We've designed it to be instantly playable and incredibly enjoyable with rules that are simple to follow and cards that are easy to understand. It's just as much fun to watch others play as it is to play the game yourself. It's a great addition to any game night, pre-game or party and makes for a great gift for birthdays, graduations and holidays!
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Magic: The Gathering – Commander 2020: Ikoria: Lair of Behemoths Commander – Arcane Maelstrom
description:
Turn the tide of any battle with the Arcane Maelstrom deck—copy spells with Kalamax the Stormsire draw cards when you do damage with Xyris the Writhing Storm or exile your opponents’ resources and cast them yourself with Haldan Avid Arcanist and Pako Arcane Retriever.

Arcane Maelstrom is one of five Commander Decks from Ikoria Lair of Behemoths (IKO). Each includes exclusive cards tailored to that deck—pick your favorite mechanics and dive in to battle!

Battle your way through the plane of Ikoria with monster-themed mechanics that grow your creatures build your bond and crush your opponents.

Contents: one (1) foil oversized Commander card one hundred (100) card deck ten (10) double-sided tokens one (1) deck box one (1) Life Wheel one (1) punchout keyword counter card.
mechanics: Hand Management, Interrupts, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Star Realms: Finder Promo Card
description:
Name: Finder
Type: Consortium Ship
Cost: 2
2 tokens OR you may acquire a card of cost 2 or less for free and put it on top of your deck.

Consortium Ally bonus: 1 token.

When you acquire this card, you may draw a card and discard a card.

Promotional card from Gen Con 2022.

name: Cas & Cato: Het grote zoek & vind familiespel
description:
Will you be the first to find Zack and Zoe (Cas & Cato)?

Imagine yourself in the world of Zack and Zoe, where there is an incredible amount to see and experience! Challenge a fellow player to be the first to find the search items on the playing card. Can you rely on your memory and find the items on the gameboard within thirty seconds? The game consists of five categories. When you win a category, you earn a token. Make sure that you have collected all the tokens and be the first to complete your player board; then you’ll be the winner of this super fun search and find family game!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Memory, Pieces as Map, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: A game about quickly grabbing cards and judging them against three descriptions.
description:
Cards have descriptions on one side, objects on the other. Leave 2 more objects than the number of players in the middle of the table.

One player is the judge. They turn their back, then read out three descriptions. Everyone quickly grabs a card, and puts them into a pile near the judge.

The judge now turns around, and makes a decision as to which object best first the 3 descriptions.

You can also play without the judge turning around, and take turns presenting arguments to the judge after the grabbing.

Either way, one person gets a point and the judge rotates.

Play until everyone has been the judge once.

-description from designer

name: WatchMojo: A Super Fan Top 10 Party Game
description: In WatchMojo: A Super Fan Top 10 Party Game, you submit entries to Top 10 Lists about pop culture subjects to be judged and ranked by the game round's ranker.

name: Obake Meeting
description:
Players hold 3 cards with different types of ghosts in their hands, numbered 1-5 (independent from the type). In each round, players think about which of their ghosts to play, then a 20 second timer is started and everyone looks down. While the timer runs, they can only communicate with each other by knocking under the table. After time is up, everyone plays a ghost card simultaneously. Depending on which ghosts meet in which place and in which combo, points are scored. First player(s) to 8 points win(s) the game.

(The game mentions no year of publication, but it was available at SPIEL 2022.)
publishers: Adventure Planning Service (冒険企画局 / Bouken)

name: Naruto: Au secours de Konoha!
description:
Put together the best team of ninjas to succeed in your missions! The village of Konoha is counting on you!


Pass a Ninja card to your neighbor!
Evaluate the strength of your team and communicate... without saying too much!
If you think you're strong enough, go on a mission!



A thrilling team game that will delight all NARUTO fans!
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Cooperative Game, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Woodland Craft
description:
Woodland Craft is a competitive roll and write game of gathering and crafting. You will guide two animal friends around the Forest to gather Forest items in order to make crafts and score the most points before fall is over.

Woodland Craft is played in rounds with three phases per round.

Roll Dice: At the beginning of each round, each pair of dice is rolled. If doubles are rolled for any of the pairs, all players fill in the next open space on their Fall Track.
Move & Gather: Simultaneously, players will use any one of these pairs of dice to move one or both of their animal friends around the Forest to gather Forest items.
Crafts & Shed: Player may use gathered Forest items to make crafts and/or place items in their Shed.


When one or more of the following conditions is met, finish the round and proceed to Final Scoring.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: Chameleon
description: Hungry daring chameleons battle each other to see who is the best hunter. They select five hunting grounds in the tropical forest where they will try to catch as many insects as possible. Each of the five hunting grounds makes them change colour because of the tropical fauna that grows there. At the end of the day, the chameleon who has caught and eaten the most insects wins the battle. But watch out! Flying eagles in the forest are a threat to the hunting chameleons, unless they can hide underneath a tropical leaf. Transform into a colour changing chameleon yourself in this amusing dice game and become the best hunter of the forest!

name: Target:  Rats
description:
In every alley in the city of Chicago, you can find a bright yellow poster with a mean-looking rat under a red cross hair, warning you of how dangerous rats are and to alert you that exterminators have planted rat poison in the area. Printed in bold red letters on the poster is the slogan, "IF RATS CAN'T FEED, RATS CAN'T BREED." 

In this game, you will be playing as the head of a family of rats trying your best to survive in this hostile environment. You must lead your family to victory by scavenging for food to feed your rats, then breeding to produce more rats, and establishing new nests to grow your territory. Finally, you must become Da Big Cheese to control Rat City at the heart of the underground. But beware! In the big city, a rat can meet danger around every corner!

—description from the publisher

name: Pirate Island
description:
ROLL-AND-MOVE AND COLLECTING GAME

Prepare to board! Which pirate will collect the most loot or find Edward the Terrible’s treasure hidden on Crocodile Island?
You’ll need a real buccaneer’s luck and courage to win! Luck, strategy and courage are the theme of this pirate game, where only making the right decisions will win the race to the treasure. Simple rules for games full of surprises.

“Pirate Island” is a roll-and-move and collecting game. As you move across the board there are tokens to collect, including gold coins, precious jewels, a ship, and a compass or map to help you reach Crocodile Island. Once you get there, you’ll need to hunt for a key and your treasure chest. Watch out for the other pirates though – they might try to pillage your plunder!

The game is over when a player has collected:
• their treasure chest in the correct colour + a key
or
• 7 gold coins
or
• 5 precious jewels

That player is declared the winner, and top pirate.

-description from publisher

name: Oh What Fun!
description:
This festive collection of brainteasers and challenges will entertain the whole family! Great for groups and easy to play. Just spin the dial to choose a category and draw a card.

—description from the publisher

name: Rolling Maze: The Dungeon Tower
description:
You are a warrior exploring a forgotten tower that contains many secret passageways, stairs, treasures and creatures. Few dare to enter and fewer have left.

Solitaire game mode and two players mode.

The board is made of two printed sheets, you will have to cut some holes in one of the sheets and assemble it with tape and a clip, lower sheet will rotate and the maze will change with each floor. You will have 8 levels of adventure to solve.

You must collect all red and green chests, when you open a chest you will get its treasure, it can be health points or weapons to improve your attack or a helmet for better shield... Mark on the table the collected chests on each floor. When collected all the chests you will win the game.

Select a character, warrior or archer. The turn consist of two actions: move and attack, or attack and move. You can choose to not move and wait.

The heart icon represent your 12 HEALTH POINTS. If you loose all your health points the game ends with no winner.

Place a creature meeple in the places that contain a skull, for each one open a card from the creatures deck. Place a dice with the corresponding HEALTH POINTS.

Creatures on their turn will try to move closer to you to attack.

Characters and creatures have values on each card: health points, armour, weapon damage, attack range, and speed move. Use your character wisly to fight the creatures, if you loose all your health points game will end with no winner.

What else you need to play this game?

You will need 8 dice.
I recommend to use the meeple base stand 2cm maximun size.
Optional: corner rounder trimmer punch for cards, maximun size 4mm radius.
Optional: card sleeves 61mm x 90mm

Main game language: English
Rules: English, Spanish

Rules English
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1EE2EIywqLqBl8v0jKq7LJPfEiJm...

Rules Spanish
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1g08IYjA2xKsn19JWcL4yr_9SEds...

https://linktr.ee/madchest

-description from designer

name: El Melómano: Expansión Vol.1 – Grandes Éxitos: Español
description:
Stand-alone expansion with new songs in Spanish for El Melómano.

Contains 128 cards to sing and answer, with greatest hits.

It can be played with the original game, or individually.

name: Everything is in butter, boss!
description:
Everything is in butter, boss! is a card game about common phrases. If you translate German idioms into the English language you don't get the correct English equivalent, but rather a funny English sentence. Then it's not English, it's Denglish ("D" for Deutsch = German). So one by one the players draw a card and have to translate the Denglish sentences into German and then also have to find the correct English phrase. Only if a player can translate the Denglish phrase into German and then correctly into English they can keep the card. The more cards the players collect the more points they earn. Whoever earns most points wins.

This version includes idioms about daily routines in the office and business-related topics.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Humor, Word Game

name: Not It!: The Camping Chaos Edition
description:
When the three dice tumble from the dice tower, you must find a card in your hand that does not match any of the 3 attributes on each dice! Watch out for the wild raccoon card as 2 played will result in both captured!

Be the fastest to correctly get rid of your cards to win!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Dice, Real-time
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Recognition, Real-Time, Speed Matching

name: Párty trefa
description:
In this party game you tests your ability to connect the unconnected as much as it does the knowledge of your friends. Can you figure out what the words crime, yacht and battle have in common?
A creative, communicative party game for 4-12 players matching the right words!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Targeted Clues, Team-Based Game

name: 8 Planet
description:
In 8 Planet, players have a hand of 8 cards and hope to get them in order. The deck of cards consists of some cards showing planets and some special moon cards.

Players are not permitted to rearrange their hands; rather, to get their cards in order, on their turn, they will play any card from their hand, move their pawn that many spaces around a central sun and swap the card they played with the card in that location on the board. The acquired card can be added to their hand in any position.

At the end of a round, players will earn 2 points if their hand is in order (it can wrap around from one end to the other), but lose points for gaps in the numerical sequence, for each moon, and if two moons are adjacent.

The players start with 8 points and the game ends at the end of a round in which one player has 0 or fewer points. The person with the most points wins.

name: Bing Boing
description: Your goal in Bing Boing is to mark off all the numbers on your sheet first. On a turn, someone rolls the dice, then all players use them to mark off the combination they want, with die results of 1 and 5 allowing you to mark 15, 51, or even 6. Along the way, you want as many "boing" bonuses as possible so that you can mark off extra number fields.

name: Survival Stories: The Cottage
description:
Welcome to Connieville, a small fishing village that has acquired the reputation of a cursed town. Both the village and its inhabitants hide dark secrets.

Will you be able to solve the mystery that terrifies them and get all your characters to survive?

In The Cottage you will live an incredible story of Mystery / Terror in which your goal will be to get all your characters to survive their terrible fate.

Your decisions affect the story!

The game is designed to be played alone, although it is perfectly possible to play in a group by making decisions together and solving the puzzles as a group.

You will move through different game boards where you will decide which squares to investigate. Then you will read the corresponding paragraphs in the history book and make decisions.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Klon
description:
In a world where technology that saved humanity from extinction is humanity's greatest enemy, the greatest war of all time is waged between two species. And people are about to lose this war. The last hope is a group of people leaving everything behind. If this mission fails, the world will be a very different place.

Klon, the new entertainment of crowded groups with its different characters, offers its players a different scenario in each game. Finding the clones hiding among humans is the only way to successfully finish your mission. Clones, on the other hand, must hide their identities and prevent humans from winning the war. Be careful who you trust. When you reach the final stage, your best friend may turn out to be a clone.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Negotiation, Party Game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hidden Roles, Memory, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game, Voting
publishers: Koz Oyuncak Sanayi ve Ticaret Limited Sirketi

name: Da kommt der Wurm raus
description:
Da kommt der Wurm raus is a joyful colour game that has a lot crawling for it.
The worms are loose in the garden. On Stripy Toni’s birthday, everyone wants to give him the biggest and most beautiful bouquet of flowers. But each flower can only be picked by one if the six worms. Only those who know which worm comes out where can enlarge their bouquet. But after each turn, a worm changes the hole, which causes colorful confusion.

—description from the publisher

name: Impression: Spiel 2022 Promo Card
description:
An extra card to add to Impression.

The Essen promo card is visibly placed on the table at the start of the game with the I side up.

The players may use the card actions on their turn. When the order cards from age I run out on the table, the card is flipped to the II-IV side for the rest of the game.

Card actions:
The player taking a turn may choose to keep all tradesmen on the board in the same location, and instead of moving them, lie one of them down and perform the promo card action instead.

I side
The player taking a turn lays down one of their tradesmen and takes 2 different resources from the supply. This is their action for the turn, after this, the next player takes a turn. The other non-active players can now choose to pay 1 mark to the active player and take 2 identical resources from the supply. The non-active players may only do this once each, and they pay the mark from their own supply. If they don't have money, they cannot make use of this action.

II-IV side
The player taking a turn lays down one of their tradesmen and chooses one of the following 3 options:
• Perform a free production. They don’t spend capacity or resources for this. One of the order tiles moves one slot to the right, if it can move. If the order is now completed, the player receives the points as a reward, if it contained a signboard, the benefits may now be gained. If the player had the correct factories on the technology board, they may also gain their benefits.
• Make a free movement step on the map, or move to the front on the order track. If the map move is chosen, the move is free, and if he should arrive in a city with this step, one city marker is placed there, and may also gain the city disc, should it be available. No factory may be built and no trade action can be done. If the order track is chosen, and if another player is further ahead, this player can be overtaken, irrespective of what space they are on.
• Carry out a typesetting action. They may take a lead letter from next to their board and move it to their composing stick board. If the letters match, the bonus is gained as usual, the contract slot can be unlocked, if the formation is right.

name: Takaro!: Feelings + Emotions
description:
This is a standalone expansion for Takaro! that can be played with the original game or on it's own.

Each card features a number of symbols. Each of these symbols will have a direct Māori translation, which players will need to memorise and learn.

Players will flip over two cards competing to find the matching symbols; the first player to call out the correct translation wins the round.

Tākaro can be played by ages 4+ with each round lasting 10-15 minutes. It will rely on the recognition of 31 various symbols, and the correct pronunciation of their Māori names.

—description from the publisher

name: Line Dice
description:
In Line Dice (ラインダイス), your goal is to reach your finish line first with your six dice.

Each player has their own movement track with six lanes for their six racing dice. The racing dice all start off the board on their 1 symbol, which is also wild. On your first turn or two, you'll roll two six-sided dice, choose a die, flip a racing die to the matching number, then place it in the "start" space at the beginning of the lane; you'll then repeat this process with the other die.

Once you have at least one die in a starting space, on a turn you roll the two six-sided dice, then use each die to either change the face of one of your racing dice or advance a racing die of the matching number. If you create a line of racing dice of the same number, say, two 4s that are adjacent to one another, then you can use a rolled 4 to move both of the racing dice four spaces at the same time. (A 1 counts as all numbers, so it automatically creates a line when adjacent to another racing die.)

If you land one of your dice on a change space in a lane, you can change an opponent's die to the value of your choice.

You must land a racing die in the goal space at the end of the lane by exact count. If you would have extra movement, then you move the racing die backwards in the lane until the full value of the die is used. However, if you land a racing die in the penultimate space in a lane, then when you roll that number again, you can push that racing die forward one space onto the goal.

Get all six of your racing dice onto the goals first, and you win. Alternatively, you can play multiple games, with each player scoring points for the face value of the racing dice in the goals and losing points for dice that didn't make it, with jokers now counting for -10 points.

name: Ichabod Jones: Monster Hunter – The Card Game
description:
A psychopath escapes from a mental asylum and becomes a monster hunter during the apocalypse - with the unwelcome help of the voice in his head. A story about perception, turned into a game inspired by the prisoners dilemma. Fast-paced and easy to learn with multiple layers of strategic finesse.

In this exciting monster fighting game based on the hit comic book series "Ichabod Jones: Monster Hunter" by Russell Nohelty, you’re never sure who you’re really fighting against. Work together to build up epic attacks or take a risk and turn against your allies! Are you killing monsters - or is it all in your head? Do you hear that voice? Ichabod Jones: Monster Hunter Card Game might seem like a cooperative game, but it really isn’t.

Battle monsters cooperatively by playing the right cards. But in the end you're all by yourself, scoring points depending on your remaining hand cards!

Combine two copies of the game to play with up to 8 players.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Matching, Prisoner's Dilemma, Traitor Game

name: Heroes Keep
description:
A card game for the whole crew. Whether it's games night at yours, or maybe just that deck of cards you take with you on holiday, this will be the game to play and your soon to be favourite.

You start off with a Castle Keep and a hero to defend the Keep. You have a hand of five cards. On your turn you either play up to 2 cards or discard up to 5 cards and redraw. When you play a card, you can either attack your opponent by playing attack cards to reduce the strength of the hero and/or keep, or you play a card with a special ability. When you are being attacked you can either play a shield to defend the attack or play a counter attack card to inflict damage on the attacker. At the end of your turn redraw up to 5 cards. When a player has lost their Keep, they are out of the game. The last player standing wins.

name: Cuckoo
description:
Someone has introduced Cuckoo's into the bird sanctuary!

It's up to you (the players) to rescue as many eggs (cards) as possible before the game ends. The first player to achieve 2 victories (complete sets of egg cards) is the winner. This is a push-your-luck card game.

At the beginning of each game, you will randomly remove several cards from the nest (draw deck). This makes it difficult to count cards (and thus make the game too predictable), but also enhances the push-your-luck aspect of each game turn.

By drawing a 'Multi-Cuckoo' card, you are able to steal up to 2 eggs (cards) from any opponent, but beware that if you draw an opponent's Cuckoo card, they are then able to steal up to 2 of your collected (set) cards! When a player passes for their turn, the other players have the option to force you to draw an extra card. Don't forget the Angry (Bird) Parent card, which makes you drop all the cards that you have hitherto collected (if they are short of a complete set)!

So do you play your turn safe, or do you Push Your Luck?! Whatever you decide, it will drive you Cuckoo!

The cards have been designed with colour-blindness taken into account, showing shape and colour on each set of cards.

Components

Each game comes in a tuck box. In this up to 6 player game, each player picks one of the 6 shaped/coloured decks, which contain:

5 x 1-point cards
3 x 2-point cards
1 x 3-point card
1 x Multi Cuckoo
1 x Angry Parent card
1 x Play + 1 card
4 x Cuckoo’s of your shape / colour
1 x Win(g)dicator

Enhancing the experience, but danger is around the corner

Removal of several cards from the nest at the start means not only is it more difficult to card count, but also enhances the push your luck aspect.

By drawing a Multi Cuckoo card, you are able to steal up to 2 cards from any opponent; but beware if you draw an opponents’ Cuckoo card, they are able to steal up to 2 of your collected cards. When a player passes, other players have the option to make them draw an extra card. Don’t forget the Angry Parent card, that makes you drop all cards you collected that go.
Do you play it safe, or do you push your luck?
Whatever you decide, it will send you Cuckoo!!

name: Yummy Kitty
description:
Let me tell you a story! "There was a small town on the coast whose inhabitants were fishermen. One day they found a litter of newborn kittens on an abandoned ship and decided to adopt them. To feed them, they gave them the fish left over from their catch. In time, the cats became expert mice hunters, helping to keep the city's warehouses free of pests. The fishermen lovingly cared for them, entertaining them with balls made from the strings of their nets. The relationship became so close that it became a tradition to "adopt" each new litter of kittens.

Can you attract the most cats to your feeder?
