The five cheese tokens will be placed randomly in four different rooms. Now all players choose hidden from the other players in which room they want to sneak and try to pickup a cheese token.
You can modify the power of your rat with actioncards such as weapons.
The player who conquers five cheese first, wins the game.

name: Statecraft: The Political Card Game – Extreme Supporters Pack
description: Extreme Supporters come with insanely hard to claim preferences, as well as additional special requirements to claim them, making them particularly difficult to manage. Extreme Supporters are shuffled and replace one supporter in the floating supporters area at the start of the game.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Political
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition
publishers: Inside the Box Board Games LLP (ITB)

name: Tiny Swords SMAAASH!
description:
A spin-off of the cute and casual card game Tiny Swords, Tactics is a completely new game. Flip, slide, and toss other player's tiles away to be the last one standing.

Keep your tiles close to the Heart of the Battle, and toss your foes away. If a tile is disconnected from all other tiles, that player has until the end of their turn to get it back to the battle or risk losing it forever! Tiles that are face-up can be pushed and tossed, while face-down tiles can act as walls to contain the ever-increasing chaos. Every time you toss a tile, they accumulate more Toss Tokens and get flung further each time, pushing any face-up tiles in their path!

On top of that, each team has their own Captain with unique powers. Utilize each Captain's ability to turn the tide of battle and knock the other players off of your actual table. The whole table is your stage!

name: Fairy God Plumber
description:
Fairy God Plumber is a cheeky card game about matching the mythical monster poop to win. Find more matches than your opponent, and avoid (or take advantage of) special hazard cards.

For 2-4 players, 6 and up, 15-20 minutes playtime, sure to be a fun hit with anyone's collection.

—description from the publisher

name: Bruhaha
description:
Eliminate your friends and fight your way to the top in this highly-strategic, fast-paced card game! Hit your rivals with hammers, and dance away from incoming Hits. Unlock power cards by collecting 3 of a kind to heal yourself and to go on rampages. Play individually or in teams (Beware of friendly fire!), but don't forget to laugh in the face of the losers with a loud "Bruhaha."

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Take That

name: Aether Captains: Dread Supremacy
description:
Air Pirates have gathered at the mysterious Black Canyon to decide who shall lead them next. It is trial by combat! Build the strongest ship, stock it with ammunition, a fearless crew, and a fast engine. Then engage in a do or die dogfight to see who will have supremacy over the Federation of Air Pirates.

An Aether Captains Pirate Skirmish Game
for 2 to 4 players

What's Needed to Play
the set of components in the downloadable PDF (ship tiles, 3 ship building dice)
10d6 per player
1 damage marker per player
1d12 (optional)

There are 2 phases: Build and Battle

1. Build Phase

Players take turns throwing the 3 ship building dice trying to make combinations of 2 and 3 colors. You are allowed up to 2 rolls for each throw and may re-roll 0, 1, 2, or 3 dice, as you choose, on your second roll. Each player will make 10 throws to build and stock their ships. Make your throw and pass the dice to the next player until everyone has had their 10 throws.

Different color dice combinations will allow you to activate a section of your ship (you only activate a ship section once) and then stock it with resources for the battle phase. Each activated ship section is also worth one damage rating point towards your total ship so it is advised that during the build phase to try and activate as many sections of your ship as possible. The black die icon counts as a wildcard and can be applied to any ship section or resource.

Rules include a players aid chart for resource combination.

2. Battle Phase

Once everyone has built their ships it is time to battle in a set of skirmishes between players. Each player should roll the 1d12 once at the start of the battle. Reroll any ties. Whoever rolls highest has initiative to begin the battle skirmishes and goes first.

This person is the Attacker. They must pick one person to attack who will be the Defender. Both then roll their 3d6 battle dice simultaneously, hiding one and revealing the other two.

Players may use as many resources (from the resource dice on your ship sections) as they like to get the highest possible total for the two dice showing (be strategic however, there are many battles to come and you may not want to use all of your resources at one time). If you use a resource, rotate the resource die face down one number (i.e. 3 to 2) on that ship section. If you use the last resource, remove the die from the ship section.

Then the hidden dice of both players are revealed. Whoever has the highest total is the winner of that skirmish. The loser should move their damage rating marker down one skull icon to the left on their ship. The loser then becomes the next Attacker. In the event of a tie, neither player loses any damage rating points and the Defender becomes the next Attacker.

If your damage rating marker ever is moved to the Tail Section, your ship has been disabled and you are out of the battle.

Play until one person is victorious.
categories: Bluffing, Dice, Fighting, Pirates, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The South: Terminus
description:
The South: Terminus, which combines set collection and hand management with multiple scoring avenues, is the fourth, and final, card game set in the world of The North: Provenance. Two players take turns acquiring unique Ancients that are then discarded from their hands for a variety of different in-game effects.

Players take turns acquiring Ancient cards from the top of three face up decks and playing the cards they've acquired several ways. Game play is driven by the Turn Sequence Card, which is passed back and forth throughout the game. As the game is played, players lose points, acquire new cards for their hand or Zone (play area), and score points at the end of the game for the cards beneath their Vault.
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: Paper Pinball: Wolf Hackers
description:
Paper Pinball is a dice game that tries to capture the feeling of playing pinball. All you will need is a pencil, three dice, and about five minutes.

Each round, roll two dice and fill in one of the scoring zones. Some zones need to be filled in a certain way, and most will cause some sort of effect, so the order you fill them in is important. If you ever can't fill a zone, you'll lose a ball. Lose three balls and the game is over. Try to fill as many scoring zones as possible while triggering multipliers, opening tunnels, and getting the coveted multiball.

Wolf Hackers is one of three Paper Pinball titles available, together with Laser Sisters and Sherwood 2146.

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Print & Play, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Push Your Luck

name: Chimères
description:
A magazine game from Jeux et Stratégie #12.

In 1881, players' teams explore the lab of the mad doctor Azhram Mac Krazy to gather the maximum number of documents while avoiding monsters, traps, etc...

name: Hitler's Last Gamble: The Battle of the Bulge
description:
Hitler's Last Gamble: The Battle of the Bulge is the Rand Game Associates Operational level entry for Battle of the Bulge, unique for the use of German identification symbols on the German counters. This title was one of the two release in their second year of subscription games (along with Brandy Station) before they went out of business. Collectively titled Command Series, Vol 1. included nine games in a single red storage box, and Command Series, Vol 2. was projected to have 6 titles).

The game is the traditional hex based CRT combat system wargame with a smallish map of the Ardennes. The scale is regimental/brigade level with 2 turns per day of battle.

name: Fictionary
description: A trivia type game where players must move inward along the different color tracks until one player reaches the mortarboard space while trying to figure out definitions to words. The first player who picks the correct definition of the word while on the mortarboard space wins the game.

name: Rechen-Kapitän
description:
Ship ahoy with numbers from 1-20.

Where does the banana box go? Is this the place? At the harbor, the sailors load valuable freight in their ships. Each ship is distinctively large and must be loaded in the best way possible. Which ships fill up first and can begin the adventure on the high seas? The counting captain offers numerous exercises for the playful training of addition and subtraction in the number range from 1-20. The captain supports number understanding and promotes logical thinking. The option of playing alone lets children play and learn independently.

—description from the publisher (Translated by W. Eric Martin)

name: Close and Destroy
description:
Wargame that was included in TSR Games Magazine "Little Wars" in the early 1980's. This is an armor and tank game using TSR's standard wargame rules.

Expanded by:

Close and Destroy II

name: Kosowe Pole 1389
description: Kosowe Pole 1389 (Kosovo fields 1389) is a game on the battle of Kosovo (June 28, 1389) when ruling knez (prince) of Serbia, Lazar Hrebeljanović, marshalled a coalition of Christian soldiers, made up of Serbs, but also of Bosnian Serbs, Magyars and a troop of Saxon mercenaries. Sultan Murad I also gathered a coalition of soldiers and volunteers from neighboring countries. This game use the Sredniowiecze system

name: Octoverso
description:
French word game akin to Scrabble. 8 double-sided letters are placed on a rotative rail. Each player must form a word using the letters in front of him. The word has to begin with at least the last 2 letters or end with at least the first 2 letters of the "word" currently on the rail. Since the rail rotates, that effectively gives 4 possibilities.

The first player to get rid of all his letters win.

name: Solo Dungeon Crawl
description:
In this game, you have captured by the village and thrust into a pit, which is the home of a dragon. You must fight the dragon to be able to get out. You are fortunate to have been left with some items, but this dungeon crawl will be hard.

To start the game, you make your character, and then the dungeon.
On your turn, you move, you fight, you see.
Will you find vast treasure, and weapons of great strength? Or will you find monsters of hideous nature? Can you survive?

If you are playing 2 player:

You have been captured by the barbaric goblins, and thrust into a pit, known as the arena. In order to get out, you must kill the other player. No rules, no limits, just a brutal blood bath. Oh, and did I mention there are still other monsters in here? Have fun...

All mechanics are the same, except you must fight the other player. And if you leave an area, it gets reset next time you enter it, so there is all ways something new.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Vorsicht, Fuchs!
description:
A fox-and-rabbit themed press-your-luck game for children.

Theme
Roger Rabbit and his friends are having a picnic at the park, but in order to participate, everyone has to bring a carrot. But Frido the fox knows about the picnic too and he's lying in wait! As soon as the alarm call sounds, all the rabbits run off. Will you be the one who is best at calculating the fox risk and manages to collect four rabbits and four carrots on your picnic blanket first?

Goal
Collect four rabbit and four carrot tiles to earn a candy token. Earn two candy tokens to win the game.

Game play
The tiles (16 rabbits, 19 carrots, 7 foxes) are put in the tile bag. 3 tiles are removed from the game, without anyone knowing what they are (there is a variant with no tiles being removed). Each player gets a board showing a picnic blanket with designated spaces for four rabbits and four carrots. Players take turns. On your turn, you draw a tile from the bag.
If it is a carrot or rabbit, place it next to your board. Then you may keep drawing tiles as long as they show either a carrot or rabbit. You can stop drawing tiles at any point. When you decided to stop, you first place the carrots on your board. For each carrot, you may also place a rabbit. Tiles for which you don't have enough space on your board, or rabbits for which there are no carrots, go back to the bag.
If you draw a fox, the rabbits flee and you have to put all the rabbits and carrots drawn during this turn back into the bag. The fox tile is put into the fox den (i.e. it doesn't go back to the bag). Then the next player's turn starts.

The round ends when a player has collected four carrots and four rabbits on his/her board. The player gets a candy token. All carrots, rabbits and foxes are returned to the bag and a new round starts.
The game ends when a player has collected two candy tokens. He/she wins the game.

name: Two Rooms and a Bang!
description:
This game is a combination of two other party game which are "Two Rooms and a Boom" and "Bang!".

At the beginning of the game each player has a role assigned to him/her. There is one role of sheriff and other players are split evenly to gangsters and deputies. After role assigning players are split in two different rooms. In each room players have some time (until they're ready) to vote for a room leader. The room leader chooses two (depending on the number of players) hostages which he will change for other two hostages from another room.

Additionally each player has a gun with 4 bullets. A player may anytime shoot to anyone. If a player gets shot 7 times he/she's dead and eliminated from the game. The sheriff may not be eliminated, he's got a bulletproof vest. When he gets shot 7 times he shows his card and now everyone in that room knows who the sheriff is.

A player may anytime freely negotiate with others and also show his role card to anyone. But the players may not show their cards at the same time. They may consult to do it one after the other but no agreement is valid at anytime.

The goal of the sheriff is to have in his room at the end of the game more deputies than gangsters. In that case he wins and every other alive deputy also wins. If the sheriff does not meet his goal, every gangster who's alive wins.
categories: American West, Bluffing, Deduction, Fighting, Party Game
mechanics: Player Elimination, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Once There Was... 3+
description:
Once There Was... 3+ is a pre-school learning game for home and kindergarten, a game that develops the imagination and creativity, enlarges the vocabulary, and improves the memory and the powers of observation.

In the game, Moritz the cat has finished playing on the lawn and he's going home. The players help him by rolling the dice and drawing cards with cheerful colored pictures on the basis of which they have to make up a story. The players form sentences using the themes from at least two cards. The purpose of the game is to form coherent sentences and to collect as many cards as possible.

name: Escape: Zombie City – Queenie 1
description:
10 alternate zombies and 2 new street tiles that can be used with Escape: Zombie City.

The new zombies are: 1 x Queen, 1 x Robust, 2 x Runner, 3 x Gully, 2 x Leech and 1 x Burner, all of which have advanced properties. The new street tiles are "the scrapyard" which can have equipment from any of the three equipment piles and "the radio tower" which allows you to move some of the zombies away from the church.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Real-time, Zombies

name: Battle For Souls: Presidential Souls Promo Pack
description: Includes 7 new soul cards to battle over the souls of the first 7 US Presidents
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Religious
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Team-Based Game

name: Highway to Hell
description:
Welcome to 2054. Climatic and economic crises have destabilized our societies.
States are no more than the shadow of themselves and the world is slowly turning to chaos. Violence has increased to epidemic proportions in every city, while in the wastelands between them, militias have been formed to stem the tide gang warfare that has brings terror to the roads.
Following the collapse of government, catastrophic shortages in fuel and food have seen these consumables become commodities to fight and die for. In this post apocalyptic nightmare, the Patrollers
have become taken up the role of the sheriffs of the Old West, as they struggle to maintain order amid the all-encompassing chaos.
You are one of the Patrollers tasked with preserving law and order in District 31 of Corkland. Today your 24 hour patrol will take you through Conway, Green Lea and Altamont counties. This region to the south of Corkland has been claimed by the Jezebel Queens, a dangerous and violent gang who have been plundering the area for weeks now.
It’s time to restore some order!

Each player takes on the role of a Patroller, a highway sheriff who pits themselves against the many threats that infest District 31 while helping and protecting its surviving residents.
During their patrol, a Patroller will journey through three Sector.
As they pass through these Sectors, they will be able to replenish their hand of Action cards, customize their Vehicle and pick up Passengers who may suggest additional missions.
During their travels, a Patroller must resolve various Pursuits, Shootouts or Enforcements.
A Patroller must finish their patrol in the least amount of time and with the most Pacification Points.
If a Patroller’s patrol takes longer to complete than the number of Hours allocated to it, they will be subject to penalties at the end of the game.
At the end of the game, the Patroller with the most Pacification Points wins the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Dice, Racing, Science Fiction

name: Expanders
description:
How well can you expand numbers and connect areas to be the first to place all your tokens? Planning and applying addition skills will help you win this game.

Expanders is a game for children who like to add small numbers and enjoy strategy. There are easier and slightly more difficult versions of the game, and the board is different each time it is played, so players can't memorize an approach. Players also have choices about their plays, including making simple pairs or adding a sequence in horizontal, vertical or diagonal directions to make a sum and use up their tokens to win the game. Strategy is also important for blocking opponents. Children who have good spatial reasoning skills will also like this game.

-description from publisher's website

name: Warhammer Quest: Cursed City – Morrvahl Olbrecht
description:
A character card for the ruthless wizard Morrvahl Olbrecht that was included with hardback and Limited Edition copies of the Cursed City tie-in novel from the Black Library. The card gives players the option to add Morrvahl Olbrecht to the pool of heroes available to undertake quests in Ulfenkarn.

Morrvahl plays quite differently from other characters in the game, possessing an attack that can damage friend and foe alike.

Players will need to provide their own miniature to represent Morrvahl on the board and he is specifically patterned after a model that can be built from the Cities of Sigmar Collegiate Arcane Mystic Battle Wizards box.
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Square Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Jurassic World: The Legacy of Isla Nublar – Kickstarter Exclusives
description:
A separate box that backers of the Jurassic World: The Legacy of Isla Nubla Kickstarter campaign received.

Includes:
1 new playable character (Blue)
1 character mover
4 dinosaur figures
40 upgraded tokens

name: Kamakai
description:
"Meet the animals that inhabit the seas. Be the first to collect 1 fish, 1 turtle, 1 crab and 1 seahorse in front of you.

But watch out!

The terrible Kamakaï, the largest of the tiger sharks, is also prowling these waters, frightening the other sea creatures."

Kamakai is a game in which player collects cards of various sea animals, trying to get all four species in their card line by drawing on top of the deck or of the discard pile. Players can rearrange their line whenever they want, with one of the cards being next to a shark token.

After each turn, the player must roll a die, and depending of the colour rolled, they must discard a card of the corresponding colour, should they have one.

They can also roll a shark, in which case they must discard the card that is next to their shark token. Lastly, they can roll a seaweed in which case the turn is over without having to discard any card.

Some cards have half a seaweed icon on their side, and if the player can complete a seaweed icon with the card they just drew, they can skip the dice roll entirely.

The first to have all four animal icons in their card line wins.

name: Shacru
description:
The object of Shacru is to acquire as many squares of your color on the board as possible before the game is over. The board is a 9 by 9 grid divided into 9 borderlands of 3 by 3 squares (could now be mistaken for Sudoku!), and at the start of the game all of the squares are neutral (not colored).

With 2 players there are four pieces (aka chevrons) each, with 3 or 4 players three pieces each.

Each time you move a piece the square you move onto becomes your color. You can move onto neutral squares, or squares of your own color, but not onto squares of a different color. So the game focuses on blocking the pieces of other players, and avoiding your pieces becoming blocked.

Pieces move only forwards (forwards directly or forwards to left or right). When a piece crosses a border the player can twist the piece 45 degrees to the left or right.

The game ends when no player can gain any more squares of their color (either because none of their pieces can move, or because they can only move around onto squares that are already their colour).

Shacru was first published as part of the Pacru 101 game, and again with the Pacru 302 game. It can also be played with crayons and paper with the addition of some colored chevron/arrow shaped pieces to move around the paper. Free software exists at http://www.pacru.com/shacru.html.

The game is suitable for anyone aged five years or over.

Separate entries exist for Pacru, Shacru & Azacru as opinions vary widely on the 3 games.

name: Más mascotas
description:
Mas macscotas is an expansion for the hilarious game Mascotas. In this expansion (requires the original game to play) you will find two more pets to take care of, your babies, as well as new characters and a new way of playing.

You will also find a large card that will allow you to customize the game with your own pet !!!
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Staka
description:
The general idea of the wooden game Staka is to stack and win, and the game comes with five modes of play:


In Duel mode, two players compete to stack figures before their opponent. The first with five figures completed wins the game.
In Flash mode, the players try to complete the figure against the clock, which is represented by a die that opponents roll and add up.
In Crash mode, it's the first to crash the construction that loses.
In Zen mode, take your time, put on your noise-cancelling headsets, and try to complete the twenty challenges in the game.
In Art mode, unleash your creativity and build new figures.


—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Dice, Educational

name: Gopher Broke
description:
Gopher Broke is a fast-paced game fun for the whole family!

Each turn, roll all 7 dice. If you roll more gophers than foxes, you can move 1 space for each money bag rolled OR "Gopher Broke!" and leave your money bags and foxes on the table, and re-roll all gophers to try to get more money!

If you roll more foxes than gophers, your turn ends and you pass dice to the next player.

If your movement ENDS on a space occupied by another player, you bump that player back to the gopher hole (0).

Be the first to make it around the board 3 times to reach Millionaire’s Mansion to win!

-description from publisher
mechanics: Deduction, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking, Set Collection

name: Okavango
description: Your goal is to lead animal kids to their mummy who is waiting on the island on the other side of backwater. Animals can move on the islands as well as on the wooden logs that swim in the water. The logs are changing their possitions all the time and the crocodile can appear.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: The Smurf Card Game
description:
The Smurf Card Game is similar to the classic "War" game but with a few changes.

Instead of suits, the cards have specific characters that "win" over other characters. Smurf takes Smurfette, Smurfette takes Papa, Papa takes Smurf and Gargamel takes anything.

During the game, all cards are dealt out for 2 to 4 players. During each turn, players turn over the top card of hid/her face down pile. The person with the winning card collects all of the cards and places them on the bottom of their pile. If there is a tie, cards are turned over until one player turns over a card that matches the original.

In a 3 or 4 player game, players play the player adjacent to them, taking turns, in a clockwise direction.

The game is won by the player who collects all of the cards.
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Travel

name: Panty Raider
description: Panty Raider is a fast-paced, light-hearted non-collectible card game for two to six players. The objective is simple: infiltrate the girls' dorm and use the powers of stealth and sweet talk to snag yourself some underwear! The first to make off with five pairs wins the game, but the road to victory is never simple - to help pave the way, players have an assortment of Mischief cards with which to raid, barter, or simply drive their opponents up their wall. Build alliances or go it alone, deploy an assortment of random dorm junk, and prepare to go toe-to-toe with some of the most colorful coeds ever put to cardboard.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Rauf und Runter
description:
Rauf und Runter is a roll-and-move board game with a meerkat theme on two layers with a few twists.

The player's meerkat pawns are magnetic and move therefore simultaneously on the top and bottom side of the gaming board.
Players start in the corners and must move their meerkat to a specific location, randomly revealed, and back to a corner. Roll the die and move accordingly one to three spaces to your destination. Borders (hedges, walls) may not be crossed. Then it's the move of the next player.

Once reaching a corner, however, the board is immediately turned upside down and play commences on this side. Players that did not reached their target space get a random one-shot-bonus of either moving two extra spaces, crossing a border, or taking a second move. The first player to visit all locations, then reach a corner wins.

Be sure not to lift your meerkat from the board while moving as this will cause the corresponding figure to fall off.

name: The Hollow Woods: Storytelling Card Game
description:
Fire your imagination with these fun storytelling cards. Reviving the Victorian craze for ‘myrioramas’, the 20 picture cards can be placed in any order to create seamless scenes. Almost infinite combinations of cards provide endless storyscaping possibilities. Traverse an enchanted landscape as you build a perpetual panorama inhabited by fire-breathing dragons, magical unicorns and sinister shadow figures. With many games to play and millions of stories to tell, each turn of the card is a new adventure. Where will the story take you? There are over two quintillion storyscaping possibilities, and you can build a seamless panorama stretching up to 170cm!

Description from the publisher's website
publishers: Albi, Albi Polska, Laurence King Publishing Ltd

name: Ravehard: Magiczna Gra Karciana
description:
Something's rotten in the realm of Labamba...

The annual rave party is an event where every self-respecting wizard and sorceress has to make an appearance; however, this year's party was so epic, that in the morning the guests – all tired and hungover – discovered that someone has murdered the Archmage!
No one knows how, no one knows when. It's quite possible that even the murderer him or herself is not aware of what happened last night, since barely anyone remembers anything. Unfortunately, according to the ancient laws of Labamba, the one that kills the Archmage may become a powerful Darchmage, bringing Darkness onto the land. And if there is one thing that Darkness hates, it's fun, techno, lasers and glitter – which is all that is dear to the magical folk.
Thus, it's time to pull yourselves together, put your holo detective hats on your aching heads and catch the killer, before he grows too powerful!

RAVEHARD: Magiczna Gra Karciana is a party game that mixes elements of classic card battle games, games of deduction and deception, as well as more cooperative titles. It's meant to be played by 2-5 players aged 12 and more.

Over the course of the game, which lasts three rounds, the players will have to work together in order to discover who killed the Archmage during the magical rave party yesternight. To achieve this goal, they'll have to overcome dangerous obstacles, including boss fights (each boss capable of summoning powerful minions) and unpredictable events. After each round the players gain a new clue which sheds some light on the last night's incident and points towards a possible murder weapon.
If the players manage to survive all three rounds, they reach the Archmage's Chamber. There they may incapacitate one of them, should they be certain that he's the killer. If they are correct – they win the game; if they are wrong – the murderer steps out of the shadows and attacks the rest of the players. The side that emerges victorious from this final confrontation wins the game.

Do not trust anyone – not even yourself! Each player starts the game with two different objects which may turn out to be the murder weapons – or they may prove your innocence. During your turn you may switch the objects with those belonging to other players in order to frame them and clear your name. However, not until the very end will it be possible to tell which object is really the murder weapon. Thus, during the game you'll have to bluff, form alliances, deceive and distract, both openly – and secretly, using the Flirt Cards that let you pass private messages, scheme and conspire (and flirt).

This game is for you if you enjoy playing such titles as Magic: The Gathering, Munchkin, Hero Realms, Epic Spell Wars of the Battle Wizards, Love Letter, Mascarade, Coup, Not Alone, PENNY DREADFUN: Duchy, Demony, Dickensy.

—description from the publisher

Źle się dzieje w magicznym świecie Labamba…

Doroczna techno-impreza, na której musi pojawić się każdy
szanujący się mag i czarodziejka, była tak epicka, że o poranku
skacowani i zmęczeni goście odkryli, że ktoś zamordował
Arcymaga!
Nie wiadomo jak, nie wiadomo kiedy. Prawdopodobnie nawet sam
morderca nie wie, co zrobił, bo mało kto pamięta wydarzenia
wspomnianej nocy. Niestety, według odwiecznych praw Labamby,
zabójca Arcymaga może stać się potężnym Darkcymagiem,
sprowadzając tym samym Ciemność na całą krainę! A jeśli jest coś, czego Ciemność nienawidzi, to dobra zabawa, techno, lasery i brokat – wszystko to, co jest bliskie czarodziejskiemu światu.
Pora zatem wziąć się w garść, przywdziać na obolałe głowy odblaskowe czapeczki detektywów, rozwiązać zagadkę śmierci Arcymaga i złapać mordercę, nim ten urośnie w siłę.

Ravehard: Magiczna Gra Karciana to gra dla 3-5 graczy w wieku 12+ łącząca elementy klasycznej gry karcianej, gry blefu i dedukcji oraz gry kooperacyjnej.

W czasie rozgrywki, trwającej trzy rundy, gracze będą współpracować, aby pokonać wiele niebezpieczeństw: bossów i ich popleczników oraz przetrwać nieprzewidziane zdarzenia. Po każdej rundzie gracze zdobywają dowody, które pozwolą im ustalić jakie było narzędzie zbrodni oraz co naprawdę się wydarzyło.
Jeżeli uda im się przetrwać trzy rundy, gracze dotrą do komnaty Arcymaga. Jeżeli są pewni, kto spośród nich jest mordercą, mogą go wytypować i obezwładnić – wtedy gracze wygrywają. Jeżeli nie – morderca ujawni się i zapoluje na graczy: drużyna, która wygra ostateczne starcie, wygrywa grę.

Nie ufaj nikomu, nawet sobie! Każdy z graczy rozpoczyna grę z pewnymi przedmiotami, które świadczyć mogą o ich winie lub stanowić alibi. W czasie swojej tury gracze mogą podrzucać innym te przedmioty, próbując zwalić winę na nich i oczyścić się z zarzutów. Jednak do samego końca nie będzie wiadomo, który przedmiot naprawdę okaże się narzędziem zbrodni. Przez całą rozgrywkę gracze będą blefować, zwierać sojusze, oszukiwać
się nawzajem i mącić – jawnie oraz niejawnie – przy wykorzystaniu specjalnych kart Flirtu, służących do przekazywania sobie informacji i knucia.

—description from the publisher (Polish)
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Humor, Murder/Mystery, Party Game, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Take That, Traitor Game, Voting

name: Kalabalik
description:
Kalabalik is a Bridget Jones-tier hot mess of a game that straddles the boundaries between card game, board game and party game, then does something funny in each of them. At its core, it's a short and extremely sweet trip round a playing area made up of cards, where you get ahead through your ability – and your willingness – to complete the challenge that your token lands on. Sounds straightforward, right? Haha.

If you've ever been frustrated by your inability to remember the Presidents of the United States, but really like the idea of creating a recognizable melody by blowing raspberries on a willing collaborator's tummy, it's perfect for you. If you can fold a paper airplane that will go further than everyone else's, and stand up and chuck it with your shoelaces tied together, that's fine. If your knowledge of sitcom characters is better than your knowledge of what you do for a living, you need this game. By the end of it, someone else might be wearing your bra. That's just the way it is.

Kalabalik is a Swedish word meaning "uproar" or "hoo-ha" and this game stemmed from an idea to create a board game where the rules are: there are no rules. Except rules help control the fun, don't they? So the few rules you'll have to follow are awkward ones. They're joined by a lot of different challenges, refreshed constantly as the game progresses, that are the either the kinds of things you don't really want to do in polite company, or the kinds of things you've been waiting for an excuse to do in polite company. Throw in a bunch of questions that make you think "how the f... oh actually I do know that lol," and a few confessions for good measure. (You don't actually have to do any of them, of course. This is the 21st century. But if you don't, you're probably going to lose.)

What emerges is the lovingly-designed equivalent of that one party you went to in your youth that everyone still talks about, for all the right reasons, twenty years later. What's more, the amount of time it takes to set up, learn and play is far shorter than the intense period of soul-searching you'll get when you sit bolt upright in bed in 3am, drenched in cold sweat, having remembered that you won by texting the word "MILF" to your boss.

—description from the designer

name: Combo Color: Print & Play Demo
description:
The game of conquest by colors! —description from the publisher.

Combo Color is a strategic family game. Explore and expand your territory by coloring the boxes on the board in turn, while also collecting and combining items to win the most points. When the whole board is colored in, it’s time to count your points! —description from the publisher.

This print & play version contains two 1-sided boards.

Published during the COVID-19 2019-2020 Pandemic. The publisher posted:
"In these difficult times, we see families needing joy and entertainment more than ever; turning towards board games and party games to bring their loved ones together. We at Asmodee have created free print & play versions of some of our most popular family games, for anyone to print, use, and enjoy from home."

name: Misión Antártida
description:
The frozen continent still has many stories to tell. They will be part of a group of documentalists who will travel to Antarctica to record the best images found throughout their territory.

Roll the dice, place them on the image cards and locate the results on the map for 12 turns, divided into two phases, Day and Night.

Adventure and fun will not make you cold. Be the one who gets the best movie: Misión Antártida (Mission Antarctica).

name: Party & Co: Shock You!
description:
Funny, stressful, surprising, dynamic... The new game in the “Party & Co” series has three different categories and a random time limit. Who will complete the tasks before the timer runs out and a pulse is triggered? Three different levels can be set: no pulse, small pulse, medium strength pulse. Note: The electricity emitted by the product is not harmful to the human body.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Witzig, stressig, überraschend, dynamisch … Beim neuen Spiel der „Party & Co“-Reihe gibt es drei verschiedene Kategorien und eine zufällige Zeitbegrenzung. Wer besteht die Aufgaben, bevor der Timer abläuft und ein Impuls ausgelöst wird? Es können drei verschiedene Stufen eingestellt werden: kein Impuls, kleiner Impuls, Impuls mittlerer Stärke. Hinweis: Der von dem Produkt abgegebene Strom ist für den menschlichen Körper nicht schädlich.

—description from the publisher

name: Farmer
description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

"Welcome to your new farm! The land has been previously farmed pretty hard and it is your turn to make it profitable again."

Players take turns placing their markers, either on the mapsheet or on a strategy sheet (the latter invokes certain special results, such as increasing victory points for occupied hexes, or requiring markers to be removed from the board, etc.) Once both players have placed all twelve of their markers, the positions are scored to determine the winning farmer.

name: The Tour
description: A simulation about the 1991 edition of the Tour de France.

name: Diddly: The Game of Squat!
description:
From Publisher Information

Diddly

The Game of squat!

In this card game less is better, but Diddly is best. On a turn, draw a card to replace a card. Match cards to make them worth Diddly. There’s Nothing to it! But wait, there’s more! (Or is it less?) Special cards let you peek at your face-down cards, dig through the discard pile, swap your cards, or halve the value of a card. Look Ma, no hands!! Cards are played in front of a player not held in a hand.

Diddly is an easy and addictive game for children and adults. To win Diddly, stop at nothing… or as close as you can!

Ages: 6 and Up
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Food Chain
description:
Despite the Food Chain name, in this game animals don't eat one another, but they do take actions depending on their place in the predator/prey menu chain.

The 36-card deck in Food Chain consists of six animals in six colors with each color having 1-6 animal icons on it. At the start of a round, each player receives a hand of six cards. In the first round, each player simultaneously reveals a card and places it in the center of play. For rounds #2-4, players then do the following: Simultaneously reveal one card from their hand, take turns claiming one card from the center of play in food chain order (tigers, wolves, raccoons, snakes, frogs, butterflies, with more animals of the same type beating fewer), then they all place their cards in the center of the table.

After each has claimed three cards, they use their final two cards in hand to try to make poker combinations using either animal type, number of animals, or card color. Players score 1 point for a single pair up to 15 points for a five-of-a-kind. The best combination earns 3 bonus points, and each butterfly card is worth 1 extra point. If someone has reached fifty points, the game ends and this player wins; otherwise shuffle the deck for a new round.

name: Stieren Versieren
description:
It's Saturday evening. The steers go downtown. But where do they find the one cow of their dreams? At the fitness center, the cafe, or the theater? Who dares to take the first step, when they find an attractive cow? Who is the best fit for her? Only a good conversation will tell.

Things get exciting if she has the same preferences as one of the steers... Madly in love, Romeo makes his move! But there are competitors, and he has to be quicker of smarter then them. A bull fight could be very risky! If he's successful, the can take her to the Love Shack.

—description from the back of the box (translated)

This is a set collection game, in which players try create pairs of steers and cows with the same preferences. Points are counted after seven rounds; the player with the most points wins the game.

—user summary

Includes two bonus cards: De Spuger (spitter) and De Allesdrinker (all-drinker)

Released on February 9, 2019.

name: Lista, lista przebojów
description:
Lista, Lista Przebojów is party game full of all-time hits!
Make your teams, choose your captain and guess hits of more than 170 artists!

Draw 9 category cards, take 3 of them, give the rest to second's team captain, who chooses also 3. Discard the rest.
Then place a card on 1 of 3 tasks: describe an artist by one word, quote a lyric, play on kazoo (or sing mormorando) a hit - your team has to guess an artist. And you have only 30 seconds for all of this! Who'll guess 8 of 9 categories - wins.

Nine categories, e.g.: '60, '70, '80, '90, 21st century, current hits.

Retro style graphics, lot of fun, a lot of memorable emotions! Play, sing, guess, have fun!

name: Spot it! Preschool
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Little ones get a head start with the family-favorite matching game. This value pack includes 2 games that teach the basics, each with 3 ways to play and varying challenge levels. Players race to spot matches between cards, learning letters, numbers, colors, and shapes along the way. Kids love flicking the spinner to find out which mini-game to play next!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Party Game, Real-time

description:
"1944 is an historical simulation game of the World War II D-Day landings and the events which followed it. It place you in command of the armies and offers you the chance to duplicate or even change history. Actually, 1944 is three different game in one: the Historical Game (the actual 1944 invasion), the Bolero "Mini-Game" (a hypothetical 1942 landing in France) and the "Overlord '43 Mini-Game" (a proposed invasion for 1943)."

Full-size hex-map of France, white with blue, green, black and gray coloring. 92 avocado-green Allied counters, and 90 'Luftwaffe-blue' German counters. Rules seem to be on the low complexity side about like the early AH and SPI-Quad games.

name: Světový film
description:
How well do you know the world movies? Dive into the world of successful movies, many of which were crowned with Oscars. This game builds on the great success of knowledge game Český film (Czech movies). There are newly included photos from the movies, so you can remind the famous movie scenes and recall the names of your favorite actors.

In this game you will find 1800 questions from world cinema. Questions are divided into six groups: American films, European and other films, filmmakers, actors, series and photos.

Double-sided game board allows you to play even a party version of this game, where you will also answer questions and perform fun tasks by speaking, mime or drawing.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Lots
description:
Lots is an abstract shareholding game with an unusual method of valuation.

Players will build 5 “Lots” of objects collectively, taking shares in lots of their choice as the game progresses. Each lot’s ability to score is dependent on the objects in lots to the right of it, so players will have to be clever to maximize the value of their own lots, sometimes sharing the spoils with other players to win.

Lots is a game for 2-4 players and takes around 10-15 minutes to play, making it a perfect after-dinner or lunchtime game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Hand Management, Investment, Semi-Cooperative Game, Stock Holding

name: Chaos & Alchemy: Apprentices
description: Adds twelve uniquely talented Apprentices into the Chaos & Alchemy mix.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval, Renaissance
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Superfight: The Hero Machine Deck
description:
Superfight: The Hero Machine Deck — an expansion for the Superfight party game in which players pit unusual characters with superpowers and superweaknesses against one another — adds one hundred new cards to your Superfight game that take your available characters in a whole new direction. The cards are split into three decks. Each deck contains words that combine to create a character. When a player plays a "TO THE HERO MACHINE" card, he or she chooses one card from each Hero Machine deck.


Deck 1 contains words like: Super, Giant, Flying, Retired, Flaming, Mutant
Deck 2 contains words like: Monkey, Zombie, Girlfriend, Dino, Bat, Hero, Sumo
Deck 3 contains words like: Assassin, Swarm, Babies, Cyborg, Army, Duo, Love Triangle


Players choose one card from each deck, and place them in order to generate combinations such as "Flying Girlfriend Army", "Giant Zombie Babies", and "Retired Dino Love Triangle". This is a powerful and very funny deck, and will add thousands of possible characters to your game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor

name: YangTzee
description:
Publisher's Description:

Collect your tiles from the Sphere. Rain to the Stream. Stream to the Sea.

YangTzee is the "ancient" game of tile matching that's as swift as a stream. Each tile has two symbols and one blossom. Match blossoms in order to score. Simple rules, top-notch wooden components, surprising depth of play.

Contains:
45 Wooden Tiles
1 Scoring Track
4 Scoring Markers
2 Tile Trays

name: Sheng Guan Tu
description:
Sheng Guan Tu means "Promotion Official Chart" in English. It is a classic Chinese game similar to Chutes and Ladders or Kang Le Qi. The game is allegedly from the Ming dynasty and was created by the calligrapher Ni Yuan-Lu. The game plays with a top that is similar to a Teetotum or Jewish Dreidel. The person who reaches the last promotion wins.

Promotion games such as this one and Hor Lor Boon were very popular in ancient China. Parents often encourage their children to play promotion games, hoping that the games would stimulate the children to work hard on the track to officialdom.

During the Cultural Revolution, the game was banned and has since been out of print.

name: Wax
description:
Wax is a Pure Card game from Small Box Games.

Wax is the retheming and reworking of one of Small Box Games' earlier games, Rank.

In Wax, players are granted powers based on the phase of the moon. Players use these powers to conquer new lands and build them up from keep to castle.

name: DKT dynamic
description:
DKT, das kaufmännische Talent, is an Austrian equivalent for the well-known "Monopoly".

Your object is not to be the last still in play, but to be the first to pay back your debts and thus win the game. Players start with 2000 units of money and choose 1 to 3 start actions, depending on the number of players, either buying a plot of land or taking out a loan. Player rolls the die - first he moves a tourist marker and implements the spot reached for him. Then he moves his own marker and implements the game reached - special spots or buying, building, paying rent or either paying back a loan or taking out an additional loan.

In this dynamic version there are a few major changes, which make for interesting decisions and the game quicker:
You move two tourists with a third die.
To win the game, you have to pay back your starting money.
The Hotel is not just a fifth house, but is worth 100 for each house in the area/city.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Eigen Kweek
description:
The potato harvest has failed, so you are forced to grow weed to survive. You bluff your way through this new world to make money as quickly as possible so that you can exchange your weed field again for real potato fields!

In Eigen Kweek, based on the TV series of the same name on Eén, you must invest, sow, and harvest at the right time because you are never sure when the rabbit will pass through and eat all of your crops — or when Chantal will confiscate your weed. The first player to once again have only potato in their fields wins!
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Pferdeäppel
description: Pferdeäppel is a tactical 2-player game. It is fast and easy to learn. Each player controls a horse and tries to either capture their opponent or make their opponent's piece unmovable. The horses move just like in chess. The twist is that each time a piece is moved the prior spot it occupied is marked. Marked spots can no longer be moved into, so eventually somebody gets stuck (or captured).
publishers: Bütehorn Spiele (Buchholz Verlag), Istituto Del Gioco (IDG)

name: Celtos
description:
From Publisher:

Celtos is a fast paced miniature tabletop battle system for two or more players. The game is set in the ancient land of Goria, which is fought over by powerful heroes and potent mages, wizards and shamans, and their warbands of warriors. Five races battle for dominion over Goria: the Fir Bolg-the accursed living dead hosts of Anwyn, the Sidhe-the immortal elven rulers of the elements, the Fomorians-demonic orc and goblin spawn of Chaos and Old Night, the Gaels-warrior men and women, the favored children of the All Mother and the Vanir-dwarven raiders of the frozen wasteland.

Celtos contains all the information you need to play games with your Celtos miniatures, including army lists to get you started. There are army book supplements available for each race that introduce new rules and contain many more troop types for your armies, allowing you to play more advanced games
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Asteroids
description:
Solo Table top game based on the Arcade Classic.
You control a space turret to destroy incoming Asteroids.
However as you destroy the larger asteroids they break up into smaller ones, increasing the number of targets on the board.
Although a one player game, it can be adapted for two players.

All items needed to play are available for download:
- Complete Rules Set
- Game Markers and Dice
- Asteroids
- Turret Model
categories: Dice, Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme

name: Cum Laude
description: "El juego para apasionados del lenguaje" (The game for those passionate about language". Cum Laude is a trivia game focused on Spanish language, with questions on topics like Latin, Orthography and Etymology.

name: Falaise 1944
description:
This game depicts allied Operation Totalize, launched during the later stages of the Battle of Normandy, from August 8 to August 13, 1944. The players control Canadian, British, Polish, German, US and French units.

There are 3 scenarios provided:
"Przełamanie" ("Breakthrough") - early stages of the attack of the Canadian 1st Army,
"Husarskie skrzydła" ("Hussar's Wings") - focuses on the flanking attack of the Polish 1st Armoured Division,
"Maczuga" ("The Club") - Polish Division closing the Falaise pocket at the escape route of the German divisions.

The game box includes over 500 counters (which need to be cut and glued) and the map of over 60x80 cm (two sheets which need to be joined together).

The game uses the B35 gaming system from Bitwy II wojny światowej. The units are companies and battalions.

Additional scenarios are available in the Polish "Taktyka i strategia" magazine.

The rules are in Polish.

name: COD WARS: Iceland vs. Great Britain in the 1970s
description:
Disputes over fishing in the waters around Iceland have been going on for decades. The most famous of these confrontations were the incidents known as the Cod Wars of the 1970s.

This game matches the coastal patrol force of Iceland against the fishing vessels of Great Britain and their Royal Navy escorts. It features a diceless conflict resolution system with a scoring method based on fish tokens and diplomatic tension.

name: Monopoly: G.I. Joe Collector's Edition
description:
G.I. JOE vs. COBRA: The Battle Rages On!

America’s daring, highly trained, special mission force teams up with the world’s most popular board game to bring you the MONOPOLY: G.I. JOE Collector’s Edition. Your mission: buy, sell and trade iconic locations from the world of G.I. JOE. Travel the globe over land, sea and air from G.I. JOE Headquarters and COBRA Island to the Aztec Palace of Doom and the Roof of the World, in a quest to own it all!

YO JOE!

Game comes complete with six collectible pewter tokens: COBRA COMMANDER’s Battle Mask, Timber, U.S.S. Flagg, Thunder Machine, DUKE’s Dog Tags and Cobra Snake.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Cubiko Word
description: A member of the Cubiko family. This game takes the two genres of word games and dexterity games and mixes them. Bounce your bouncy ball into a grid and place one of your letters where it lands. Be the first to make a word and you score the points indicated on the die. Careful though, if the ball knocks letters around the board the situation can change in an instant. There are several variants included in the rules.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Word Game

name: Bop It Extreme 2
description:
Like the original, Bop It!, this game is a noisy speed reaction race. The active player responds as quickly as possible to recorded commands to manipulate the game device.

The layout of Hasbro's Bop It Extreme 2 was shown to be altered from that of Bop It Extreme. The shapes of several inputs were also altered. Volume controls were added, and the method of score reporting was changed to using plain English. In addition to the four modes featured in Bop It Extreme, a "One on One" mode was added.

name: Tell Me a Story: Fairytale Mix-ups
description:
Lizzy Rockwell’s charming fairy tale characters, locations, and iconic objects can be arranged and rearranged to create logical and/or hilarious tales. Kids will build critical thinking skills when they devise a way to incorporate a fire-breathing dragon and a flask of magic potion into their tale of a clever boot-wearing cat.

The deck of cards consist of cards of 3 categories: characters, settings, and objects. Instructions with the game offer a variety of gameplay options. One of these is that the players start with exactly 4 cards in their hand. In turn, they choose from the face-down stack. Keep one and discard one they do not want... play continues until someone has 2 characters, a setting and an object. This player is "winner" and for reward gets to tell a story using the cards in hand.

Object: Be the first with the correct combination of cards in hand.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Fantasy

name: The King's Will: Magyar Expansion
description: 18 of the 25 expansions contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2017
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Farming, Industry / Manufacturing, Medieval, Territory Building
publishers: ADC Blackfire Entertainment GmbH, Frosted Games

name: Roll for Adventure: Abtrünniger Promoheld
description:
A promo hero for the game Roll for Adventure.

Jedes Mal nachdem der Gebietswürfel geworfen wurde, darfst du einmal das Ergebnis ablehnen und den Würfel erneut werfen. Es gilt dann das neue Ergebnis.

("Each time the territory die is rolled, you may ignore the first result and reroll the die. The new result stands.")

name: iKNOW: All in
description:
Are you a real quiz champion? Everyone plays at the same time, everyone bets on each other, but ... there is only one winner! Compared to other quiz games, iKNOW offers that little bit extra. You score points by answering questions correctly, but also by predicting the success of other players! How well do you know your opponents? Bet on the right player and score even if that player gives a wrong answer! This interactive trivia will get all players involved from start to finish!

—description from the publisher

name: Egri Csillagok 1552
description: Egri Csillagok is a cooperative board game for 4-6 people, which evokes the spirit of the heroes of Eger and Géza Gárdonyi. The players play the roles of the defenders of the castle, i.e. the protagonists of the famous novel, such as Dobó, Mekcsey, Bornemissza, and their goal is to keep the Turkish attackers outside the walls. To do this, they not only have to repel the continuous Turkish attacks against the walls, but they also have to neutralize the minework of the traitor(s) inside. In each round, four events occur at the four wall sections of the castle, for the solution of which cards must be submitted secretly, and the success of the defense depends on their results. If you succeed in handing in the cards corresponding to the prescribed task together, the defenders will receive a reward, otherwise the Turkish armies will approach the inner castle, the will to fight will deteriorate, or the players will suffer dangerous injuries.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hidden Roles, Traitor Game

name: Monopoly Travel World Tour
description: The Monopoly Travel World Tour board game is a twist on classic Monopoly board gameplay! Now, players can discover and visit exciting travel destinations. Players buy destinations, complete travel goals and stamp the dry wipe gameboard with their playing piece stamper to win.

name: Mosaic
description:
Players take turns placing variously colored hex tiles on to a common play area. As tiles are placed, areas of tiles may be formed. The goal of the game is for have the highest 'Secondary Score'. A Secondary Score is the *second* largest group of connected tiles.

Mechanisms that differentiate this game include: Using both personal and shared tiles, and the methods by which tiles are connected, smothered, blackmailed, or blocked. Primary colors, as well as black and white, may blend for example, and the resulting color provides extra options.

—user summary
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hexagon Grid, Tile Placement

name: Otters
description:
Otters is a quick, kid-friendly card game for 2-4 players ages 6 and up. Players take turns sending otters from their hand to the lake playgrounds on the board, playing 2 cards per turn. If you add enough otters to a playground to fill it up, you win that playground! Whoever has the most valuable collection of playgrounds at the end of the game is the winner.

Most of the game is made up of simple otters numbered 1, 2 or 3. Players must decide which 2 of their cards in hand to play, and which playgrounds to play them to.

There are also special otters in the deck, which players can use to try to win playgrounds quickly, plus alligator cards to keep opponents away from playgrounds.

The playgrounds themselves range in value from 2 to 10, making some easy to win with a card or two, but less valuable to your final score. Others are hard to win but worth lots of points! And if you collect all three playgrounds of the same color, you get bonus points at the end of the game.

Otters is simple enough for kids to play, helping them to learn basic addition. But it's also designed to be interesting for adults, requiring strategic decision making.

Ultimately, Otters is a game about playing with adorable otters with your friends and family.

name: Flags around the World
description:
In Flags Around The World you need your geography skills! Recognise flags, answer questions about countries and score points. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins! You can choose to use multiple choice answers if you want to make the game a bit easier, which makes it ideal for parents and children playing together. Start playing and expand your knowledge on a trivia trip around the world!

—description from the publisher

Contents: Game board, 200 cards, 36 alias pawns, and rules

name: Quorsum
description:
Quorsum is an abstract, strategic racing game for two players. The goal is simple enough: move your tokens to the opposite corner of the 4x4 board. Quorsum is unique, however, in that the board is never the same from game to game; rather, the 16 board tiles are picked at random before the game, so that players must constantly react to an unexpected setup. Not only that, but the board continues to change throughout the game, as players try to flip key tiles from light to dark or vice versa.

Luck is minimal: even the dice require skill, since players may decide how many of their dice to use for each important move. The result is a fast-paced game in which players must constantly calculate the best path to take and the best way to hinder the opponent's tokens. Although the experienced player will usually win, still there is often a chance for both players right up until the last move.

Quorsum avoids both the predictable setup of most strategy games, and the swings of luck in most dice games. The players' fate, therefore, is always in their own hands.
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Enki-Des:  The Soul Gates
description:
The game is about the afterlife of a fantasy warrior-nation called the Ukri. When an Ukri dies, he or she must battle his or her way through a series of seven Soul Gates, also known as the Enki-Des. Each Enki-Des has a unique guardian that must be defeated. The guardian of the seventh Enki-Des, Enko-Rochimga, cannot be defeated in physical combat. Instead, the Ukri must present his or her Enko-ori, or essence pearl, to prove him- or herself worthy of entering Furrma, or paradise.

In Enki-Des, you play a young Ukri warrior who dies on the battlefield. You find yourself at the first Soul Gate and must fight the first six different guardians while searching for your Enko-ori in order to reach Enko-Rochimga and win the game.

The game utilizes a 6x6 "action chart" and a dice-rolling mechanic to determine your action each turn. You roll three dice, then select two of them and use them to select an action from the action chart. Alternatively, you can select just one die and lock it into place for use next turn. Choose your action carefully, though; the guardian will not let up attacking until you are dead. And don't forget to search for your Enko-ori! You'll need it to win the game!
categories: Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Mythology, Print & Play

name: Margot: La fée
description:
Margot is a strategic card game for 1 to 4 players. Infiltrate the enemy castle and fully extricate only your own party.

In the Lamballe of yore, there once lived fairies called `Margots'. They comported themselves spreading good fortune amongst the people as incumbents of their faith. An evil witch, however, did not look upon this state of affairs favourably. One day the witch roused the king of man to collaboratively extirpate the Margots from this world.

Players each take the role of one such Margot, who has narrowly managed to evade the witch's plot. They are tasked with rescuing their kin and recovering various items related to fairies. Can the fantastical triumph over the corporeal?

Starting with the players, the Margots all hold special powers. Extricated allies will subsequently become most heartening assets when infiltrating. As the game draws to a close, each player will reach a different end.

—description from the publisher (translated)
publishers: Domina Games, Japanime Games, Just Play Games

name: Freestyle
description: FreeStyle is a game of competition in a swimming pool. Players (from 2 to 8) move their athletes on the board representing a pool: athletes must dive, swim to the other side and back, just as in a real competition. In order to play FreeStyle, you need, beside the board supplied with the file, six dice and a token for each player. FreeStyle has some basic rules, intended for children, and some advanced ones, for adults and children smarter than adults.

name: Augen auf!
description:
Augen auf!, turns the entire room into the game board. 50 task cards show what is to be searched for in the room. Ten game stones with the numbers from zero to eight and "+"-sign are placed in a circle on the table. The top card is revealed by the starting player and all players are looking at the pictured object and counting how many of them are in the room. If a player believes he or she knows the number, he or she grabs the stone with the correct number and calls stop. If there are as many objects in room as number in the stone player gets the task card. The player who gets most cards wins.

Ages 5 and up.

name: World Wise American Edition
description:
(Back of box):PUT THE WORLD IN YOUR HANDS with this great new educational family card game! No matter what your age or education level, no matter how little or how much you know about geography, you can be equally competitive. Parents and children can play and learn together. Prepare for an upcoming vacation or sharpen your knowledge for a business trip. Or just relax and have fun.

There is a card for each country in the Americas and each body of water bounding the Americas, as well as wild cards and super wild cards. Each player must play a card whose geographic location shares a boundary with the card that was last played. Bluffing and using wild cards add strategy to the play.

Exciting and educational for 2-8 players, ages 9 years to senior citizens.

name: The Perfect Pyramid: Four Card Games in One
description:
Using a deck of 60 card depicting pieces of pyramids, and 7 star cards, The Perfect Pyramid offers four different games:

Solitary Pyramid - A solitaire game in which you try to build ten pyramids without having your plans trashed too badly by the star cards. (1 player)
Pyramid Rummy - Manage your hand of twelve cards in order to build two pyramids before your opponent(s). (2-3 players)
Pyramid Poker - Three different variations of poker, but the valid hands are based on pyramids, rather than the traditional hands. (2-5 players)
Path to Perfection - This utilizes six dice (three depicting pyramid pieces; three depicting colors or stars) in order to enable the players to fudge their cards to create more proper pyramids. Players maximize their scores by use of pyramid cards, star cards, and the dice, trying to be the first to 200 points.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Wild Pursuit!
description:
Wild Pursuit is a race around the world to capture some of the wildest animals on the planet. Players compete to capture and tag different kinds of animals so that scientists can track their movements and protect their natural habitats. But it won’t be easy. You must have the right tools to capture them as well as the right gear to navigate the treacherous terrain. But be careful — these animals are wild and may fight back! As you play you’ll learn interesting facts about the animals and tools used to safely capture them. It’s a fun and sometimes dangerous strategy game for the whole family!

(No animals were harmed in the development of this game.)

This game features a unique board design that allows a different set-up each time you play. Together with the different card abilities and a random draw deck, you’ll have a different experience each time you play! - from the publisher of Wild Pursuit, Nightstalker Games.
categories: Adventure, Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction, Educational, Environmental, Memory, Travel
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Memory, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Chaos & Alchemy: Substances
description:
An expansion to Michael Iachini's 2013 game of rivalry and potions, Chaos & Alchemy. Players now add new elements to their laboratory in a bid to become the greatest of all alchemists and achieve fame and glory throughout the land.

New Substance cards will allow you to skew the rules in your favour, rerolling dice, stealing element cards from other players and seizing control of their creations. The base game is required to use the Substances expansion.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval

name: microMob
description:
The world's most powerful criminal organisations have come together in a struggle for control of a rich and corrupt city. Hire Goons, make alliances, and hit the right Bosses to install a new Kingpin and win this game of strategy.
Hiring Goons gives you more cards to use.
Making alliances with Bosses lets you use their Ally Powers (many powerful combinations are possible!).(this is an engine building game)
Putting out a hit on a Boss gives you points (unless it is from the same family as the Kingpin.)
At the end of the game, each player gets 1 point for each Goon they control, 2 points for each Ally they have made, and Bosses they have hit are worth points equal to their hit number (unless they are from the kingpin's family). Most points wins.

microMob is a modular game. The base game includes 4 modules;
(Japanese Yakuza, Italian Mafia, Jewish Mob,and Mexican Mob)
Include more modules for more players or to increase game length. Use fewer modules for a quicker game or fewer players.
1 module : 2 players 10 minutes
2 modules : 2-3 players 20 minutes
3 modules : 2-4 players 30 minutes
4 modules : 2-5 players 40 minutes
5 modules : 3-6 players 50 minutes
6 modules : 3-6 players 60 minutes
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Lazer Ryderz: Captain Cosmic and The Visionary
description:
Offered as rewards for backers of the Kickstarter, Lazer Ryderz: Captain Cosmic and Visionary offer different powers for two of the four player characters:


Captain Cosmic blasts through space as a Lazer Ryder, seeking to unlock the power of the ancient Prizms. Other Ryderz beware as Captain Cosmic's powers allow him to create golden constructs in space that can block travel or even cause a crash!



Vanessa Long has traveled through time and space as The Visionary! Now, she takes to the cosmos in search of prizms of power to aid her and her allies on earth. Her mental powers allow her to neutralize prizms, making her a psychic force to be reckoned with. Through a combination of psychic befuddlement and raw telekinetic force, The Visionary can move a power prizm she controls out of the grasp of her enemies.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Maze, Racing, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Network and Route Building, Push Your Luck, Tile Placement, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Assassination in Sarajevo
description:
A game based on the event that sparked the First World War, the assassination of the heir to the Austro-Hungarian throne, Franz Ferdinand, and his wife, Sofie. Utilizing die-roll and random-chit mechanics, it is designed for solitaire play but has rules for 2 players.

The game consists of two parts. In Part 1, "Assassination," the player tries to prevent the assassination or wounding of the royal couple by members of the Black Hand Serbian separatist group. In the 2-player version, one player takes the role of the Black Hand.

In Part 2, "July Crisis," the solitaire player tries to prevent the incident from starting a war; in the 2-player, one player is the peace faction, the other the war faction. The odds for peace are improved if the royal couple survived in Part 1, but that does not guarantee the "powder keg of Europe" won't explode.

This game originally appeared in World War One Illustrated magazine No. 2 and does not include the 13 six-sided dice necessary for play. Two-player rules that were not in the magazine are included in the stand-alone game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Disney Hocus Pocus: Tricks & Wits Card Game
description:
Split into two teams—Kids versus Witches—and work together to outsmart your opponents with clever card play. Get the ghastly spellbook before the black flame candle burns out to win!

In each round, players will play action cards and resolve them from the lowest to the highest number on the card. At the end of the round, the black flame candle gets smaller, counting down to the game's end.

At the end of the last round (round 6), whichever team has the Book card wins unless one player on the other team has both Special cards in which case their team wins instead.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: 1877: Venezuela
description:
1877: Venezuela is all the best parts of 1817 packed into a very small game that plays fast and comes out of the starting gate at full speed.

Short (2h) 1817-style game with a focus on short sales and financial arbitrage and sabotage

Rules changes from 1817:

Currency “$” and “Bs.” both represent the Venezuelan bolívar
There are no private companies.
Corporations can only IPO as 5-share. There are no 2-share companies in the game.
10-share companies have 10 short shares available.
When a player wins an auction to start a company, they immediately get a “housekeeping turn” where they can only do actions with the corporation they just won, (buy tokens/take loans/buy trains/redeem shares). Then the turn order resumes with the player after the player that started the auction.
The auction bid is paid to the bank. When a new corporation IPOs, the stock value is half the bid amount, rounded down. The corporation receives 2.5x the stock value and three shares are placed in the open market.
There is no restriction on when a corporation can be shorted after it has IPOed.
Corporations that formed during the current stock round can buy trains as a part of the stock round as a corporate action.
Corporations may only buy new trains from the bank, not from other corporations or the open market.
Game end trigger is the 4-train and ends after a full set of 2 ORs. There is no short sale restriction during the last stock round of the game.
When a mine tile is upgraded (yellow to green or green to brown), the company that performed the upgrade receives Bs.20 after the upgrade.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Investment, Network and Route Building, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: Tschuk
description:
The game consists of 21 coins in a bag (7 additional coins are used as positional markers).

Each coin bears two numbers ranging from 1 to 7 - one number per side. The two numbers are always different.

The coins are thrown on the table and then sorted by the visible numbers.

In his turn a player selects a coin, put it on his side of the table and flips it over.

The first player to reveal all seven numbers on his side of the table wins the game.

Since each coin bears exactly one of the (21) possible combinations of two different numbers from 1 to 7 the players gain more and more information about the numbers still hidden and thus are able to make - quite educated - guesses to select the correct coins.

Online Play


Edition Erlkönig Online Games (solitaire and versus computer opponent)

name: Card City XL: The Crime Expansion
description:
This is the first expansion for Card City XL and it deals with crime.

This small expansion contains 12 cards:

8 Crime Cards
4 Police Station Cards


It is compatible with the 240 ways to play CCXL

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, City Building, Expansion for Base-game

name: The Colony
description:
From the box: A themed mancala variant.

Overview (from the game rules): Players take the role of rival ant colonies that discover a recently cut wood pile. Live eggs still linger in the cut logs. To restore and control the colony, players collect and protect the eggs. Collected eggs are moved to a safe location in front of the player. Players can place ants on the board which will protect the wood pile. The colony that collects and protects the most eggs at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Mutabor: Im Irrgarten des Kalifen
description:
The 52 picture cards are mixed covered, stacked and laid out in the pictured sequence with the picture side facing up, the middle four cards remain covered.
Each player selects a color and receives the corresponding large card with the move rules of the labyrinth garden. He places the four figures of his color on the four edge fields located nearest to him.
How a piece moves further, depends on the picture on which it stands.
Morning star: moves horizontally, vertically or diagonally one or several fields
Tree: move like the king in chess
Big Gate:only moves horizontally or vertically one or several fields.
Elephant: moves only diagonally
Lobster: Moves one field horizontally or vertically and finally moves further one field diagonally.
Stork: like the Trees.
Aim: move the opposite site first.

name: Warehouse 51: Promo Cards
description:
The Warehouse 51: Promo Cards were first offered to promote the release of Warehouse 51 at Gen Con 2015. The pack (of 8 cards in total) includes the following items and their corresponding counterfeits:

Ra's Solar Barge
Ring of Nibelungen
Aphrodite's Magic Girdle
Buddha's Begging Bowl

name: U-Boat
description:
The longer the war lasted, the clearer it became that the Atlantic was the deciding factor, and that if the German U-Boat force could achieve real success in the war against Merchant Shipping, the tables would be turned in Germany's favor. In 1942 the Battle for the Atlantic was moving toward its climax and whole U-Boat packs were fighting bitterly with Allied escort forces. This is a situation in which our convoy, bound from Halifax in Canada to Liverpool, steams into the middle of a U-Boat formation.

One of several titles released by Tabletop Games which were intended to be played directly on the game table (without a map) using rules concepts from traditional miniatures wargaming.
