The games offered an affordable alternative to the miniatures hobby in that they used un-cut cardstock counters. Other games in the series include Ballistic Missile, MTB, and Galactic War.
There apparently two versions of this game published copyright 1977. Other version had different cover art, identical contents, and was print jointly by Tabletop Games and Heritage Models, Inc. In the back of this edition's rulebook, it lists other games available as Ballistic Missle, Galactic Warfare, Micro-Napoleonics, Micro-Ancients and Colonial Warfare.
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Movement Template, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Three Dimensional Movement, Variable Set-up

name: Wallace & Gromit Going Crackers
description:
Join the world of Wallace and Gromit and their friends in a fun-filled game that'll have you doing rather odd things.
If you're Wallace, you have to pull your mouth into a grin every time you sing, say or name something. Gromit, on the other hand, can only draw.
Do the task before the time runs out... and you collect points. The player with the most points wins. Special gameboard spaces keep the surprises coming. You may get to switch characters, collect extra points or lose a turn as you take a "tea break". Each game is different and varied and the tables can turn at any time in this game of ups and downs and batty stunts.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move, Singing

name: Barsoomian Battle Manual
description:
"Few fictional worlds have created the interest that has grown from the Mars of Edgar Rice Burroughs. As a world of constant warfare and adventure, it is naturally of special interest to the wargamer. In this area we are quite fortunate in the amount of information on military organization provided by Burroughs . . . The basic scale is decimal in nature. This means that each figure can represent ten men, one hundred men, or even one thousand men. This enables the same system of rules to deal with military operations that vary in size from small actions to the huge wars of survival often waged between major cities of Barsoom in which hundreds of thousands of fighting men are under arms on each side."

A separate set of rules is included for air-to-air actions between the "navies" of Barsoom which can be fought out on a hex grid.

The companion book John Carter: Warlord of Mars – Adventure Gaming Handbook was also released by Heritage. That booklet included a figure painting guide, descriptions of the various ethnic groups of Mars, and the Man-to-man Action Rules which provided for roleplaying and single combat.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Measurement Movement, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Veld Spoorweg
description:
British, Dutch and German investors capitalize on the opening of the Orange Free State and Transvaal Republic of Southern Africa from 1885 to 1915.

In this game, players invest in companies and try to increase the value of their holdings through cagey track construction choices. Track construction in this game is accomplished via "Consortium bidding" a unique system that forces players to cooperate to grow their companies.

Veld Spoorwegis part of the Prairie Railroads Series.

name: Totally Tut
description:
Reach the top of the pyramid on this colorful Egyptian-theme game board by combining basic math operations skills (addition, subtraction, multiplication and division) with order of operations practice. Players trek their way across the rows of the pyramid by using numeral and operation triangles to create and solve math problems! But beware, your opponents can steal or swap your number triangles completing their pyramids first! Game board has four pyramids and a built-in spinner.

Ages 6 - 9

name: Doubles Chess
description: Chess for 2, 3, or 4 players. Interesting stretched diamonds for "squares" that allow all of the traditional moves to be made. It has rules that incorporate partnering....
publishers: (Self-Published), DCP, Limited, Make Your Move, Inc.

name: Henry
description: Henry is a memory game that uses sounds instead of the usual pictures.

name: Crazy Office
description: Will you be able to survive in the craziest office in the world with clumsy colleagues and awkward situations. To be able to "survive" you will have to use all your diplomatic skills: the ability to come out from difficult situations, to appear good to you bosses, to make your colleagues guilty ... like in a real office. Crazy Office will test your diplomatic and dialectic skills

name: La Rana
description:
La Rana is a traditional game of Spain. Most commonly played in Spanish taverns in a similar way to the British darts. A special table where you drop from the distance heavy Iron coins into a frog's mouth.

In the late '70 all of them exited as all the bars changed them for video games and vending machines.

name: BattleTech: Twilight Of The Clans
description:
From the back of the book:

THE STAR LEAGUE STRIKES BACK!

The brave warriors of Task Force Serpent secretly made the thousand-light-year journey to the Smoke Jaguar home world of Huntress to eliminate the last of the Clan's holdings. What they find there will test the limits of their skills, their endurance and their loyalty.

Twilight of the Clans is a BattleTech scenario pack that picks up where the Dragon Roars left off, as the campign to end the Clan invasion reaches its stunning climax! Players can take the part of the Star League or the defending Clans in a series of ten BattleTech scenarios, and even accept the challenge of commanding the entire assault on Huntress in a detailed BattleForce 2 campaign.

User comment:

This BattleTech scenario pack forms the second volume in the series charting the end of the war between the Clans and the Inner Sphere, and follows on from the earlier BattleTech scenario "The Dragon Roars." While this scenario pack doesn't add any new rules or equipment, it does incorporate a wide range of units including ProtoMechs and OmniFighters, and includes detail on BattleForce 2 campaigns, a relative rarity in BattleTech scenarios.

Although this scenario pack is now out of print, it's available as an electronic download from the current license holder.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Quick Picks Password  Travel Game
description:
From the publisher:

Play Password, and American original. For more than 35 years, Password has been challenging players' communication skills. Teams of two square off to see who can guess the secret Password first. But you've got to be clever when you communicate because players can give only one-word clues, and the fewer clues given the higher the score! Contents: 50 Password Cards, Scoring Indicator Dial, 2 Vinyl Card Holders, Instructions, Score Pad

name: Karuta
description:
Traditional Japanese game where a card is revealed from the top of draw pile and players try to find its pair from the cards laid on the table.
Uta-garuta has first three lines of a tanka poem written on the cards in the draw pile and the last two lines on the cards laid on the table, these two cards form a pair. Another version, iroha/garuta, which is mostly played by children for education, has kana written on the other card and a poem or proverb starting with the same kana written on the other card.

name: Indiana Jones: Fortune and Glory
description:
“If Adventure has a Name, it must be Indiana Jones.”

It is the 1930s. The world is in the grip of the Great Depression. Across the globe war clouds gather. The Japanese have invaded China. The Italians are in Ethiopia. Adolf Hitler is planning to build an empire while Stalin butchers millions of his own people. Spain is engulfed in civil war. Britain, France, and America are too weak to stop the gathering tide of blood. In these chaotic times Dr. Henry Jones Jr., known by his nickname “Indiana,” quests after lost artifacts. In doing so he must battle gangsters, cultists, thugs, and worst of all Nazis, who are fanning out across the globe looking for items that will allow them to found a 1,000 year Reich.

“The return of the great adventure.”

In Indiana Jones: Fortune and Glory you play either as Indiana Jones or his adversaries, battling across Africa, Asia, and Europe as you try to recover some of the greatest artifacts of human history. As Indy you rely upon your wits, your weapons, and a small cadre of allies, including Marion, Sallah, Short Round, and Henry Jones Sr. The Villains rely more upon brute force, utilizing a host of henchmen. More importantly, they must use an asortment of talented and morally dubious individuals, including Belloq, Toht, Lao Che, Mola Ram, Elsa, and Vogel.

“You call this archaeology?”

Each player deploys some cards to locations, battling for either artifacts or an advantage. Some locations have a puzzle rating, which must also be overcome in order to gain artifacts, with each item being worth victory points. Special cards handle the events. While some cards are free, most are deployed by discarding cards from your hand. Each deck is asymmetrical. The Villains rely upon brute force, while Indy must often use event cards to get out of a jam. The game is meant to be played quickly. And of course, some of the greatest lines in the series will have cards…

“Indiana Jones. I always knew some day you'd come walking back through my door.” – Marion Ravenwood

“Fräulein Ravenwood, let me show you what I am used to...” – Toht

“Snakes. Why'd it have to be snakes?” – Indiana Jones

“Indiana, we are simply passing through history. This...this is history.” – Rene Belloq

“Fortune and glory, kid. Fortune and glory.” – Indiana Jones

“Drop them, Dr. Jones! They will be found! You won't!” – Mola Ram

“Prepare to meet Kali... in Hell!” – Indiana Jones

“I'm going home to Missouri where they never feed you snakes before ripping your heart out and lowering you into hot pits!” – Willie Scott

“You lost today, kid. But that doesn't mean you have to like it.” – Fedora

“And this is how we say goodbye in Germany, Dr. Jones.” – Colonel Vogel

“I suddenly remembered my Charlemagne. Let my armies be the rocks and the trees and the birds in the sky...” – Henry Jones Sr.

“He chose poorly.” – Grail Knight
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play

name: Monopoly Peru
description: Special Monopoly edition for Peru.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Adventure Time Card Wars: Sundae School
description:
Adventure Time Card Wars: Sundae School is a single card that can be added to any of the Adventure Time Card Wars games. Sundae School is a "Rainbow Building", the text of which reads "While you have an even amount of Hit Points, your Creature on this Landscape has +2 ATK."

This card was released in the July 2015 comic Adventure Time with Fionna & Cake: Card Wars #01.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Bandes Dessinées: le jeu des collectionneurs
description:
Collect comics. Choose her favorite series and complete collections in bookshops or from other collectors.

To earn money, work at the Delcourt-Soleil editor to publish new comics.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip

name: Paul and Storm's Sausage Party
description:
Sausage Party is a party game inspired by the Paul and Storm song from Learningtown.

In the game, each player has a deck of cards that feature different types of sausages, buns, and (on the bottom of the deck) a "last bun" card. Each player has three places in front of themselves where they'll cook sausages on the grill.

With everyone playing at the same time, you continually draw the top card from your deck and play it either on your grill or on someone else's. Once a type of sausage is in a grill slot, only more of that type of sausage — or mustard, which is wild _ can be played there. Once you (or someone else) places a bun on a sausage on your grill, you move it to your plate, making room for a new type of sausage on the grill. If your hand is empty, you can choose to trash all of the cards in one of your grill slots. Once someone plays their "last bun" card, the game ends.

Each type of sausage has a number on it, and if your bunned sausage has exactly that many cards (not counting the bun), then you score points equal to twice that number. If you have fewer cards, you score as many points as non-bun cards; if you have more cards, you score zero points for that sausage. Whoever has the most points wins!

name: Daydream Dungeon
description:
Description from the publisher:

Daydream Dungeon is a single-player dungeon crawl played entirely with a single piece of paper, a 6-sided die, and a pencil. A key feature is that the game requires no erasing, so once an adventure is completed, the player can see every action they took on the page.

Players begin by designing a character using the games five skills, Dexterity, Ranged, Endurance, Accumen and Melee. Purchase equipment, and then set off to fight or outwit a dungeon full of monsters, finally clashing with the boss.

Players track their movement through the dungeon on a 5x6 grid. Upon entering a room, roll a die, add your depth, and look up the resulting number in the Bestiary. This can reveal anything from a chest full of loot, to a deadly trap, to a terrifying monster. Once they know what they're dealing with, players can choose how they want to deal with the situation. A roguish character may want to sneak past, or even risk pickpocketing a monster. A stronger character might simply choose a direct attack. A magically attuned character might try casting a charm spell. Each of these actions are performed using a single die roll, and players get a bonus based on thier character's statistics.

Sometimes a player might not be able to play to their strengths, such as an archer running out of arrows, or a swordsman fighting a flying enemy. Fortunately they can use a variety of magical potions to help even the odds, though it's probably best to try them before you need them, since the first time you try a potion of a given colour, you don't know what it will do.
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: New Salem: Tom Commands Promo Card
description:
A new event card. Originally available as a reward in the 2016 Dice Tower Season 12 Kickstarter.

Text says:
Choose an event card that has been given to any player and give that event card to a different player
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, City Building, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection, Team-Based Game

name: 1831 For our freedom and yours: Battle of Grochow
description:
Board wargame 1831 For our freedom and yours: Battle of Grochow represents one of the most famous battles in the history of the Polish army. Players have historical forces and must act, given the historical advantages and limitations of their armies. Also important are factors such as terrain and weather conditions. Of course you can not skip the random factor.

All these aspects are described in rules which are not complicated.

Among the four scenarios it is introductory scenario - attack of Rosen’s IV corps on alder grove. This is the perfect introduction to a large battle. Players have limited forces and learn basic
rules and characteristics of the terrain. Thanks to this, the experience gained can be used in the course of the scenario for the entire battle.

Game mechanics based on random activations. However, the proper marker set reflects a better command structure of the army of Field Marshal Dybicz. Moreover, this solution provides an exciting game in which each side can take the initiative to surprise the enemy.

Three types of weapons: infantry, cavalry and artillery act according to the common rules, but each of them has its own characteristics. Success on the battlefield provides the appropriate use of the advantages of all kinds of weapons at the right moment. This is obviously the goal pursued by both players. Coordination of their own troops, and respond to your opponent moves makes Battle of Grochow a challenging game, even for experienced players.

name: Showdown! The Samurai Card Game
description: Showdown! is a standalone expansion of Shootout! the High Noon Card Game. 2-6 players try and build the best hand possible before getting into 1 on 1 one-stroke duels. The last player standing becomes the Shogun, winning the game. This game can be combined with Shootout! The High Noon Card Game or played on its own for the same intense dueling action you've come to expect from this series!
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Pattern Recognition, Player Elimination

name: Creeps of Keister Island
description:
Spy, swap, and peek your way to the lowest score in this addictive card game of deception and fun. ​An addictive game of deception and fun. ​Your objective is to have the lowest score when any player goes over 100 points. How? Figure out which cards you have and accumulate fewer points than anyone else by replacing your high cards for low ones, swapping high cards for your opponents' low cards, and trading matching cards for a single card. Call "Keister" when you think you have the lowest score and hope to catch your opponents with a keister-full of high cards!

Creeps of Keister Island describes itself as a "cabo-golf" game and is mechanically identical to Cabo, reskinned with monster artwork.
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Superfight: The Blue Deck 2
description:
Blue Deck 2 adds 100 more location cards to Superfight. Use these cards to take your fights to all kinds of crazy new places, like a hot air balloon, the Batcave, or a shark-infested swimming pool.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor, Party Game, Science Fiction

name: Time Trunk Man
description:
User summary
タイムトランクマン (Time Trunk Man) is a Japanese game of time travel (English rules online - see weblink).

In 22XX, a while passed since operation of time machines began, agents of a private time travel company named "Time Trunk Man" undertook a mission of retrieving lost treasures scattered through ages.

In the game of TIME TRUNK MAN, players travel around past Tokyo (Edo), present Tokyo, and future Tokyo (Neo Tokyo) to retrieve lost treasures.

At the beginning of the game, players place their pawns at a location of their choice in present Tokyo.

During your turn, you play two action cards.
1) Move: Move your pawn up to written number of spaces without changing ages. You may gain resources on the way.
2) Search: Draw a search card and place the written resources at any unoccupied locations in the wriiten age of Tokyo.
3) Time Travel: Spend resources to travel to different age of Tokyo without changing locations.
4) Purchase: Spend resources to purchase a lost treasure at the age you exist.

You draw an action card each time you play an action card.

When any player accumulates 15 points worth of lost treasures or more, the game end after the last player's turn. The player with the most points wins the game.

Publisher's summary
It's the year 22XX, and time machines have been operating for a while at this point.

In Time Trunk Man (タイムトランクマン), players are given a mission to recover valuable relics that have been lost in one of three periods of time: Edo, Tokyo, and Neo-Tokyo. Where? When? That's for you to figure out as an agent of a time-moving company. Be the first player to recover 15 points worth of lost treasures to become the #1 agent!

■ストーリー
タイムマシンの運用が始まってしばらく経った22XX年。
プレイヤーは、民間時間移動企業「タイム・トランクマン」のエージェントとして時間移動をしながら、現代では失われてしまった貴重なロスト・トレジャーを回収するミッションに挑みます。

■ゲーム概要
価値点15点以上のロスト・トレジャーを先に集めたプレイヤーの勝利です。ロスト・トレジャーの購入やタイムトラベルに必要な「動力通貨」、マップ構成の異なる3つの「時代ボード」、プレイヤーの行動を左右する「アクションカード」など、ゲームの戦略をより奥深くするコンポーネントが特徴です。
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection

name: Bad People: NSFW Brutal Pack
description: The NSFW Brutal Pack comes with 80 NEW Question Cards and MUST be played with the Bad People Base Game. Great for groups and an epic BONUS optional adult drinking games variant is included in the base game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: The Heist: The Museum of Fine Art
description:
The thief moves invisibly through the museum stealing art, disabling security cameras, avoiding the museum staff and attempting to escape before being cornered. The thief player has a privacy screen, a pad of mini maps to plot their course, locations of art and security cameras on, a thief token that gets placed on the game board if spotted by a museum staff player and two custom dice which are used to determine if an exit has been successfully unlocked. There are 4 thieves to choose from each with a unique skill.

The museum staff coordinate in order to detect and detain the thief before the thief can unlock an exit and escape the museum. The museum staff players roll a standard D6 to move their tokens around the game board, checking rooms "visually" or by checking on 1 of 12 security cameras to track, locate and corner the thief. They can also access the IT room to check and or repair all the cameras.

The game ends when either the thief has been caught or the thief has managed to escape the museum with at least 1 piece of art.

The box contains a quad fold game board, the instructions, a privacy screen, a 100 sheet pad of mini maps, 16 pieces of fine art, 15 art stands, 6 museum staff tokens, 6 museum staff cards, 1 thief token, 12 security cameras, 1 D6, 1 thief exit die, and 1 Lucky Leo thief exit die. The characters represent a variety of ages, genders and ethnic groups.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Hidden Movement, Line of Sight, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Les Contes Émerveillés
description:
The fairytales are all topsy turvy! A magical tornado has shaken everything up.
Create new stories to help the fairytales and gather enough stars to give them back their sparkle.

Each day, tell a story and bring the characters to life using the 7 variations available. You will create tales which are more and more goofy, moving and hectic.

Each story-teller gets an amount of Tale token with a unique symbol on it then the game is divided in two chapters.
Chapter 1, the storytellers pick a Character tile and place it face up on the board with a Tale token of their choice. This token is then put face down once the whole team knows which token it is. The game goes on until all Tale tokens have been played.
Chapter 2, the storytellers, in turn, pick one of the characters of the story and tell what happened implying the token he or she thinks is associated with the character. The game ends once all Tale tokens have been revealed.
In case of failure, the sky darkens because of stormy clouds and in case of success, the sky twinkles with stars.
Cooperate, help each other to amaze the fairytales.

name: Outlines
description:
Outlines is an extraordinary drawing game. Everything is about the countours. Using the drawing stick you try to form the shape with a necklace. Who reognizes the outline of the pinapple first? Who will get the most points?

—description from the publisher

name: Amytis: Visuté zahrady
description:
Become a garden architect and build hanging gardens for Queen Amytis. Arrange the stepped garden cards in three floor levels so that at the end of the game you have connected the most of the
same symbols. Thanks to spatial imagination, concentration and planning will the winner manage to create a true seventh wonder of antiquity, which is breathtaking.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Collectible Components, Environmental, Puzzle
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Pieces as Map, Three Dimensional Movement

name: Stadt Land Vollpfosten: Das Kartenspiel – Junior Edition
description:
High quality hinged lid box in cool design made by DENKRIESEN.

The principle is as simple as it is ingenious. Whoever thinks that Stadt-Land-Vollpfosten can't work well as a card game will soon be proven wrong.

The game is explained in no time and the fun can begin. There are no open questions and the game rounds are entertaining and exciting. Due to the 200 different categories, there is always enough variety.

The child-friendly card game from STADT LAND VOLLPFOSTEN with 120 playing cards for an unforgettable gaming experience among friends.

200 creative and funny categories make every hobby thinker sweat. Fun guaranteed!

Due to the 3 different editions, a huge variety is offered. In addition to the family-friendly Classic Edition, the child-friendly Junior and the naughty Red Light Edition bring a certain variety to the game night!

How to play: Each player is randomly dealt 8 letter cards. Now each player must place a word matching one of his letter cards as quickly as possible. Important: The first letter of the word counts and you do NOT have to form a term from the letter cards, as is sometimes the case in other games, e.g. Scrabble.

So it gets exciting: The 60 category cards contain a total of 200 different and funny categories:

Who can put down a "profession" first? Or a "reason for separation"? What about a "city abroad"? Can you quickly think of a "Famous Dead Person" or a "Famous Actor" for your letter cards?

Important now: The FASTEST player wins each round and at the end the player who first got rid of all letter cards wins the game. The 10 additional action cards make the game especially exciting.

Of course, there are also FULL FIX cards in the game that either act as jokers or are used as tricky counters.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Hochwertige Klappdeckel-Schachtel in coolem Design made by DENKRIESEN.

Das Prinzip ist so einfach wie genial. Wer glaubt, dass Stadt-Land-Vollpfosten als Kartenspiel doch nicht gut funktionieren kann wird schnell eines besseren belehrt werden.

Das Spiel ist im nu erklärt und der Spielspaß kann beginnen. Es bleiben keine offenen Fragen und die Spielrunden sind kurzweilig und spannend. Durch die 200 verschiedenen Kategorien ist immer für genug Abwechslung gesorgt.

Das kinderfreundliche Kartenspiel von STADT LAND VOLLPFOSTEN mit 120 Spielkarten für ein unvergessliches Spielerlebnis unter Freunden.

200 kreative und lustige Kategorien bringen jeden Hobbydenker ins Schwitzen. Spaß Garantiert!

Durch die 3 verschiedenen Editionen, ist eine riesige Vielfalt geboten. Neben der familienfreundlichen Classic Edition bringen die kinderfreundliche Junior und die unanständige Rotlicht Edition die gewisse Abwechslung in den Spieleabend!

Spielablauf:
So wird gespielt: Jeder Spieler bekommt per Zufallsprinzip 8 Buchstaben-Karten ausgehändigt. Nun muss jeder Spieler möglichst schnell einen Begriff passend zu einer seiner Buchstaben-Karten ablegen. Wichtig: Es zählt jeweils der Anfangsbuchstabe des Wortes und man muss NICHT aus den Buchstaben-Karten einen Begriff bilden, wie es in anderen Spielen z.B: Scrabble manchmal der Fall ist.
Es wird also spannend: Die 60 Kategorie-Karten enthalten insgesamt 200 verschiedene und lustige Kategorien:
Wer kann zuerst einen “Beruf” ablegen? Oder einen “Trennungsgrund”? Was ist mit einer “Stadt im Ausland”? Fällt dir zu deinen Buchstaben-Karten schnell ein “Berühmter Toter” ein bzw. kommt Dir sofort ein “bekannter Schauspieler” in den Sinn?
Wichtig nun: Der SCHNELLSTE Spieler gewinnt jeweils die Runde und am Ende gewinnt der Spieler das Spiel, der zuerst alle Buchstaben-Karten losgeworden ist. Durch die 10 zusätzlichen Aktionskarten wird das Spiel besonders spannend.
Natürlich gibt es auch VOLLPFOSTEN-Karten im Spiel die entweder als Joker wirken oder als kniffliger Konter genutzt werden.

—description from the publisher

name: Scene It? Disney Super Game Pack
description: The Disney Scene It DVD Game is the perfect game for any Disney fan! The Scene It Disney Super Game Pack is loaded with all new movie clips, trivia questions and puzzlers from The Incredibles, Chicken Little and all your favorite Disney movies. This game pack lets you relive all the fun and excitement of unforgettable Disney movie moments, from swimming with sea turtles in the East Australian Current to battling the evil Syndrome on his secret island base. Whether you play it by itself or add it to your existing Scene It? games, Scene It? Disney Super Game Pack is destined to be a family game night favorite. This Disney Scene It? Game features clips from Toy Story 2, Finding Nemo, The Incredibles, and more of your favorite Disney movies! You can add new Disney magic to any Scene It? game with more clips, trivia cards and tokens!
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Subdivision
description:
You are a real estate developer competing with others to develop a new subdivision. Where you build is somewhat restricted and what gets built next to you affects your value. Bring down your competitor's value while maximizing your own.

Subdivision is luck free abstract game that uses Icehouse pieces and a chessboard to simulate a developing city.

Rules can be found at the Icehouse Games Wiki: https://looneypyramids.wiki/wiki/Subdivision

Online Play


Super Duper Games

name: E-Z Run
description:
The object is to score the lowest number of points while trying to get rid of all your cards.

There are four different colored suits numbered 1 to 11, four E-Z Run cards, and four different symbol cards. The board has four E-Z Run columns, four different symbol card spaces and a stockpile card space.

Symbol cards are 25 points each, E-Z Run cards are 15 points each, and cards 1 through 11 are 10 points each. The cards rank from high to low as E-Z Run, 11 - 1, symbol card.

Each person is given five cards and then one card is put on each E-Z Run space. Players may play a descending card of a different color on the E-Z Run columns. Symbol card columns are built same color in ascending order. Entire E-Z run columns may be moved to another to free up the column and allow an E-Z Run card play. When a player does not have a play, they draw a card, and do so every time they run out of plays until three cards have been drawn. Then the turn passes. When someone goes out, the scores are tallied. 100 is the end of game with the lowest score the winner.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Pattern Building

name: CromoGnomo
description:
Taken from the publisher's website:

CromoGnomo is a game for four players, playing in two teams of two players each, that deals with four painter gnomes. Each gnome/player begins the game with the same hand of twelve "colour" cards. During his turn, each player either plays in the bucket one of his card, or passes. The colours in the bucket blend to form other colours: at the end of each round, one of the team may score points if the resulting colour is one of his favourites.

An elegant and fun card game created during the event "Create a Game from Scratch" (Gradara Ludens 2003) by: Andrea Angiolino, Roberto Cestaro, Claudio Del Pizzo, Emiliano Liverani, Giovanni Galanti, Silvano Sorrentino.

This game was available in the free web magazine GiocAreA OnLine (former partner of daVinci Editrice) as a promotional tool.

name: The Arcane Warfare Project
description:
The Arcane Warfare Project encompasses a series of miniature games for the Ancient and Medieval periods.

Arcane Warfare (AWr) versions 1 to 3, from 2004, used conventional opposing dice rolls with d6. The engine was similar to other games, yet it featured a significantly different historical interpretation of the units' behaviour, therefore completely different outcomes. Out of print.
Renamed
AWR the 4 and 5th editions, also using mainly dice, on a 120 com x 90 cm table. Out of print.

ABC Arcane Battle Composer, is a very fast game using dice and a resolution grid, on a small 90 cm x 60 cm table. No longer supported.

AWE Arcane Warfare Excel, versions 1 and 1.1 are the project's top evolution.
AWE is an original gaming system dialog based, using hidden tiles under the miniature's bases. No dice, cards or markers are necessary to play.
A pure diceless miniature wargame. The play area is a 120 cm x 90 cm table.
First published in 2016, it is currently (2023) the only available title, in it's 1.1 implementation:
https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/209756/arcane-warfare-ex...
It can be obtained from Wargame Vault.

Current Work:
On the bench is AWE mini, a game played on a 10 cm square grid using the revolutionary Combat Tiles. All AWE games will require bases preparation with magnetic sheets and steel paper. It is driven by a unike engine, directed for the few wargaming people that seek to play miniatures games not centered in dice rolling /card drawing.
The mini game will require just 90 cm x 90 cm and the big novelty is that it will include built in mechanisms for solo playing. This will require some randomization, but the two players version will still be diceless.
mechanics: Simulation, Turn Order: Claim Action, Variable Player Powers

name: Professor Noggin's Outer Space
description:
Professor Noggin delves deep into Outer Space, exploring plants, starts, and solar systems. Explore the cosmos in this challenging trivia game that will have you guessing about everything under the sun, and some things over it.

Card.topics.include:
Asteroids
Astronaut
Comets
Crater
Earth
Earth’s Moon
Eclipse
Galaxy
Galileo
General_Topic_Card
Hubble
Jupiter
Mars
Mercury
Meteor Shower
Neptune
Observatory
Pluto
Satellites
Saturn
Saturn V Rocket
Solar System
Space Shuttle
Space Stations
Stars
(Part 1)
Stars
(Part 2)
Sun
Telescopes
Uranus
Venus
categories: Card Game, Educational, Space Exploration, Trivia
publishers: Éditions Gladius International, Inc., Outset Media

name: Gnome Crystals
description:
The game uses a 6x6 grid as the main playing area. Each player receives a bunch of little plastic pieces and 2 large ones (gnome crystals) with an irregular shape.

The object is to score the most points by the time the game ends, which happens immediately when someone runs out of pieces to play. A point is scored by having a straight or diagonal arrangement of three crystals of the same color, and a large crystal as part of such an arrangement scores 2 points instead of 1. A line of 4 crystals scores twice, once for each "end" of the row.

The game is played by rolling two dice, one for each side of the grid (rows and columns). After rolling the dice, the player places them on the appropriate row and column that matches the die face. Then the player can place a crystal in any empty location on either the row or column indicated. They can also choose to "combat" another player's crystal on the specific intersection of the rolled dice. Combat involves a simple die-off, defender wins ties, with a large crystal providing a +1 bonus to the roll.

Finally, if a player rolls doubles and is able to place a crystal on the intersection (say row 3 and column 3), then they get to roll again.

name: Brown Water Subs
description:
From publishers site.

Take command of one of the five actual subs during the ACW. Each has its own special way of sinking the target. This solo game is quick, fun and habit forming. The example is the record board for your sub. Warning do not order if you hate losing. The chance to win is the same as it was in real life: 25%.
Great game to introduce older kids to gaming.
categories: American Civil War, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Face the Clown
description: Variant of "Old Maid" - the players draw a card from their neighbor, and when a pair is found, this is discarded. The last player to hold a card loses. Losing means that the other players use the included facial pens to start painting the losers face (cheeks, forehead, chin, nose). The first person to lose four rounds therefore looks like a clown and loses the entire game (but looks fun).

name: Dead Meat: Quarantine Zone America
description:
Dead Meat: Quarantine Zone America Dead Meat is an action-packed tabletop skirmish game, where human factions compete in the ruined wasteland of the zombie apocalypse.

Dead Meat is a 28mm, tabletop skirmish game set 4 years after a massive pandemic has toppled society and set man against man. While zombies are an ever-present threat, other groups of survivors pose a much greater danger – you’ll soon learn that the dead are the least of your problems.

This focus on battles between groups of survivors is one of the things that sets Dead Meat apart from many of the current offerings in the zombie game genre. While zombie-bashing is a lot of fun, the real horror of the genre comes from the lengths people are willing to go to in order to survive. Dead Meat brings this terrifying struggle to the tabletop.

The theme of personal horror goes beyond the game’s look and feel. The rules set has been crafted as a zombie survival game from the ground up, ensuring that each game has elements of drama, tension, and action that you have come to expect from the zombie genre.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination

name: DIG (Second Edition)
description:
The hill hides many treasures, and all it takes to collect them is to grab your shovel and dig!

Well, maybe not as these aren't the only things the hill hides; creatures and traps await, so the tunnels that you create might lead to either wealth or despair. Delve into the hill and gather ten gems to win the game! Take some risks, press your luck, hire recruits to dig deeper and win favors of companions such as the knight, wizard, scout or hunter to protect your collections from the many creatures — thieves, skeletons, orcs, and more — and traps hidden in the hill.

DIG finds its path between adventure, strategy, luck, and resource management. In this card-driven game for 2 to 4 players ages 10 and up, fun meets strategy, luck meets role-playing and fantasy meets pixel art design within 20 to 45 minutes.

name: Fates of Madness
description:
Fates of Madness is rules-lite cooperative card game with challenging playability. This horror themed adventure is based on the Gothic Campaign Compendium project and is the first joint project between Legendary Games and Mythica Gaming.

This diceless game is varied by the use of Fate cards and skill level to determine success or failure.

You'll find seven scenarios and six monsters that four adventures will have to succeed using skill checks, combat, and spells. Fate cards and madness can have surprising outcomes. Will any of the players survive or will the game end in a total party kill?

Dozens of equipment, potions, and treasure cards allow the adventurers to prepare for the ultimate battle with the boss monster!

A selection of sinister boss monsters awaits the party in an ever-harrowing destiny!

—description from the publishers

NOTE: this game also has an RPG (Fates of Madness) and an RPG item (Fates of Madness) on RPGGeek. It is listed in the RPGG and BGG Merge List.

name: FLAUTZ!
description:
Exchange the right spells, summon magical creatures and win the secret contest of the wizards’ apprentices - the FLAUTZ!

As a panicking apprentice 2-10 players attempt to get hold of appropriate scrolls to summon their familiars. Through exchanging cards in hand with spell cards in the center of the table, players gather either spell cards of the same color with consecutive values or spell cards of different colors with the same value.

The purpose is to have the highest rated spell with the most summoned familiars by the end of the last game round. A so called FLAUTZ! promises the best chance of winning a match and may end it prematurely. In the end, the winner of the competition is the player with the most points or the most magic crystals, depending on the mode of play.

FLAUTZ! can be played in two game modes. The first one is played in several matches until a player has collected a specific amount of magic crystals. The second ends after a predefined number of matches and the winner is the player with the most points in total.

-description from designer

name: Best Act
description:
In Best Act everyone at the table has to say the same thing in a different way - and you have to figure out which is which!

Each round you draw a theme card, which has what you'll say - for example, "I'm fine". On the theme card is an enumerated list of situations where you'd use that phrase - "when you're upset", "politely refusing sugar in coffee", "reassuring someone after you tripped", "at a funeral". Each player gets a card telling them what situation to use and they have to perform the theme as best they can. After that everyone tries to guess what situation everyone else was acting out - you get points for correctly guessing what other people were doing and when other people correctly identify your situation.

"Best Act" is re-release of the doujin game "はぁって言うゲーム".

-- user summary

name: Billions Below
description:
Billions Below is the Ultimate Game of Chance and Discovery! Each player gets $500 Million to actively Bid against each other for control of Oil and Mining Explorations across (17) countries Worldwide!

Players Roll Dice and Draw Cards to Bid, Make Discoveries, and Earn Royalties (Money)!

Players also encounter Political Hurdles (War, Taxes, Corruption) that can destroy their investments.

The Richest Player after 60 Minutes Wins!

—description from the designer

name: O Que O Quê
description:
What is this? You know what it is?

Find the pair and speak loudly before the other players!

O Que O Quê is a quick game that will test your concentration and visual perception.

—description from the publisher (translated)

O que que é isso? Você sabe o que é?

Encontre o par e fale alto antes dos outros jogadores!

O Que O Quê é um jogo rápido que vai testar sua concentração e percepção visual.

—description from the publisher

name: An Evening of Murder: Love & Marriage
description:
One in the series of "Max Haines Invites You To An Evening of Murder (tm)" party games. Plays like the "How to Host a Murder" series. This particular edition is Love & Marriage. From the box...

Crime Scene: After ten years of marital bliss, Tom and Elaine Stryker were planning a celebratin. Family and friends gathered at a quaint country chapel to witness the happy couple renew their wedding vows. Suddenly the lights went off, a gunshot rang out and the father of the bride, slumped to the floor, dead. The honeymoon is over and you may be one of the suspects.

The Suspects:

Reverend Black: A popular TV Evangelist...what sins has he committed lately?

Dr. Ingrid Swenson: A renowned sex therapist who knows everyone's intimate secrets.

Tom Stryker: A major league baseball player...was his pitching career just a shot in the dark?

Elaine Stryker: The perfect wife and mother...was she capable of the perfect murder.

Colonel West: A cunning and dangerous soldier...trained to shoot first and ask questions later.

Eve Thornton: A beautiful divorcee with enough money to hire a hundred hitmen?

Zach Lawrence: A reporter for a trashy news tabloid. Was a poison pen his only weapon?

Chelsea: The world's newest singing sensation. How far will she go to shock her diehard fans?
publishers: Canada Games Company Lmt., Hodin, Pentalpha Game Corporation, Spear's Games

name: Camerone
description:
A small game that pits the légion étrangère (Foreign Legion) against the Mexican juaristas on 30 April 1863 (the text says 1963!) at the Camerone hacienda. The legionnaires are condemned to lose, but the point is to last as long as possible. The players should play both sides, and that who lasts longer with the French legionnaires wins.

The game is offered as a testimonial to foreign soldiers who have, in recent centuries, fought for France. It also aims to provide a view of the events that took place at Camerone.

name: Herocard Champion of New Olympia Ferrion Expansion Deck
description:
From the back of the box:

FERRION EXPANSION DECK
Ferrion crushes evil with techno armor, advanced weapons, and maverick piloting skills.

Ferrion is a HeroCard Expansion Deck for HeroCard Champion of New Olympia, the ultimate fight for glory. Ferrion can compete in any HeroCard game or be combined with other decks to create a customized character.

CONTENTS
33 Character Cards
1 Figure

Expands

HeroCard Champion of New Olympia
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game

name: Kings Keep
description:
Kings Keep is a card-based strategy game for 2-8 players where they wrestle over lands, form alliances, trade for vitally needed cards and go for full-on conquest.

Try to hold the best land cards at the end of the hand while fending off archers, knights and peasants with your own carefully prepared defensive lines.

Walls can protect you somewhat but watch out for siege engines. There are also spies about.... If attackers create a gap in your defenses your lands are sure to be captured.

Simple design with enough strategy to keep you guessing and plotting. With a limited hand size, good timing and clever placement is essential.

name: Agent 299
description:
Deceptively Simple. Deceptively Tricky.

Each player begins the game with little information. Gradually, they will gain clues on to the location of valuable documents and tools. The challenge is timing the game's end when you have the most favorable cards in front of you.

This is a 9 card game. Each player has 2 cards face down in front of them that they are not allowed to look at. One card is placed in the middle of the play area.

INTERROGATION
The First player will peek at 1 card and must swap 1 of the 2 cards in front of the player they just "interrogated" (either swapping the card they just looked at or the other card in the player's possession).
OR they may peek at the card in the middle of play and swap it with ANY card.
DISCLOSURE
After each player has Interrogated, the first player must flip over 1 card so that it is face-up.

The first player card is passed to the left and play continues.

END GAME: The game ends when one of the players is unable to make a legal move.

SCORING: Each player will add their face-up card point values (and the value of the blackmail card face-up or face-down) The highest point total wins. Ties - 1) The player with the Top Secret folder 2)The Player with the Secret folder 3)the player with blackmail.

name: LUCRE
description:
LUCRE is a trick taking card game for 4 players. The nameless Guilds care about one thing: coins. Each player controls a single Guild, and will play cards from their Guild deck (13 cards, each with a Value of 1-13 and worth 1-3 coins, each with no Value and 1 coin on the back) in an attempt to acquire more coins.

Each game, the 8 Purse cards are seeded randomly from each player’s Guild deck, meaning that every game, the Purse cards and the Guild cards available to each player will be different. At the end of 8 rounds, the player with the most coins wins.

name: Roll Out!
description:
Wexler Studios has rolled out a new dice game where the player who removes all the checkers wins!

Players roll two dice and turn over their or an opponent's labeled checkers marked 1-9. Similar to shut the box except that only the specific numbers on the dice or the combination total can be used on a player's or an opponent's checkers. (example: a player rolls double 6. He can only turn over his 6 and an opponent's 6 chip. If unable due to the chip having been collected, he has rolled out and his turn ends.) Players can stop their turn after their first play or press their luck and continue rolling and turning over checkers.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Lose a Turn, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking

name: Survivalistic
description:
~ Introduction ~
Ever wondered if you could survive the Apocalypse? Test out your survival strategies in the most realistic Post-Apocalyptic card game ever created, Survivalistic! Set in a modern day Post-Apocalyptic era, Survivalistic lets a player embark on an epic journey with fellow survivors. While on this journey, survivors will unite with one another to form clans. A player's clan must outlast and outwit all opposing clan members in order to win. Survivalistic is sure to thrill any gamer on any level. Please feel free to check out the brand new card game Survivalistic!

~ Family Friendly ~
Don't be mistaken by the theme, this game makes for a great family game! No violence, no explicit images, and no brutality. This game focuses on survival strategy by using moral methods instead. These methods include: farming, cultivating, pillaging, adapting to new environments, purifying water, communication skills, gathering resources, resource management, hunting, and scavenging. The youngsters will find the game very easy to learn and enjoy playing time and time again!

~ Player Interaction ~
The player interaction in Survivalistic makes it a great social game. Just the fact that you have so many opportunities to get back at your opponent makes it incredibly fun. Players may find themselves losing at one point and then winning the next! Because you are often stealing and battling other players for resources there is hardly a dull moment.

~ Game Play ~
The deck symbolizes the various paths in which one can take through the apocalyptic world. While on this path your prime objective will be to build a team of survivors. This team of survivors will be called your clan. You can find water, food, equipment, and fellow survivors along the way to enhance your clan. Your clan members will display many skills while on your journey and these events are represented through clan member abilities. There are many strategies to this game through all the different types of cards and there are countless number of ways you can arrange your clan. In order for your clan to reign supreme they must be nourished with food and water. Nourished clan members may battle opposing clans for valuable resources. In the end, the first clan to have three clan members fully nourished at the same time wins the game. These elements make up the basis of the game. You can use any combination of cards but one thing must happen, you must survive!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Sleepy Hollow
description:
In the town of Sleepy Hollow, Katrina Van Tassel, daughter of wealthy landowner Baltus Van Tassel, has two suitors vying for her hand in marriage: Brohm Van Brunt, a local burly townsman looking to improve his livelihood, and Ichabod Crane, a refined outsider whose intellect is rivaled only by his penchant for belief in the supernatural. Curiously, the inception of this love triangle also marks the genesis of much paranormal activity in Sleepy Hollow. Tales of a mysterious "Headless Horseman" have rattled the community, and the whispers imply that he seeks to head off any engagement to Katrina,,, literally. The object of the game is to successfully marry Katrina to one of her suitors, or to thwart the impending marriage by reuniting the Horseman to his Head.

Game Play:

Shuffle cards and deal 2-4 players one card each. After each turn player keeps only 1 card in-hand. During a turn, player draws a card and does one of the following:

Makes no play and discards one of their two cards face-down in the discard pile.

Plays a Character Card by placing it in front of them. (Players are only allowed 2 Character Cards in front of them unless they have an Innkeeper played, see Special Situations.*)

Plays a Townsfolk Card by reading it aloud and following the instructions.

A player wins the round when they have Katrina and either Brom or Ichabod played in front of them, and the minister card is played (barring the subsequent play of the Bishop). Alternately, any player who holds both the Head and the Horseman in their hand may play them at any time for an instant win (barring the subsequent play of the Blacksmith). First Player to win 2 rounds wins Sleepy Hollow!
categories: Age of Reason, Card Game, Deduction
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Take That

name: Hrady
description:
Czech game with large board full of castles and paths.
Players recruit one knight every turn, position of new knight is controlled by dice. After that players can move to consolidate power of knights to groups or fight for castles or other groups/knights or avoid conflicts etc. If someone wins battle for castle chooses carefully hidden defense power of castle (becouse it is limited per player).
Game ends when there is only last free castle. Players sum their castle points and player with the most wins.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Hannibal: The Italian Campaign
description: Hannibal is a medium complexity strategic simulation of the Carthaginian General's campaign in Italy during the Second Punic War. The game is played in a series of turns composed of a number of phases. Field combat, sieges, siege combat, recruitment, and Roman elections are all taken into account.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Guerre et Frontiere
description:
The setting of this French game is a world populated with orcs, trolls and humans who fight to dominate the board.

Although the main mechanisms are quite ordinary, there are two outstanding features :
- all peoples build up hatred toward each other after each war. If too many clashes occur, before long war spreads everywhere.
- when fighting one of the two Evil Empires, a player must eat a treat called... the Troll's Dung ! This horrendous stuff was sold in-box, along with the recipe to cook more. So be cautious when you're looking for a fight !

name: Clovis
description: In CLOVIS players represent hunter-gatherer bands of North America in 12,000 B.C. Players send out hunting parties to kill big game. This earns players points. Players may increase the numbers in their bands thus allowing them to kill more big game. There are specialty cards that modify the regular flow of things as well. The big game grow extinct as the game progresses. The game starts with 8 big game cards available in round 1 and only 1 big game card available for the final (8th) round.

name: Word Wars I.II.III
description:
Each card in the Word Wars deck represents one of two letters. Orient the card one way for one letter, or rotate it 180 degrees to use the other letter. The letters may have different point values.

Each player is dealt ten cards and uses them to make three words. Each player adds up the values of the letters in each word and then ranks his words in order from lowest total to highest total. The lowest total words of all the players are compared, and the player whose word has the greatest total scores. The same is done for the other two words. Play an agreed-upon number of rounds.
publishers: INversionGAMES LLC, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Wettstreit im Hexenwald
description: In the atmospheric game world of Wettstreit im Hexenwald, players participate in the great contest of witches, collecting ingredients and brewing potions. Whoever can most skillfully use her goblins and collect the most ingredients will become champion apprentice. Be careful, though, as not all the witches are good...

name: Dark Darker Darkest: Heli Escape Expansion
description:
In this expansion the team has an extra mission to accomplish in order to win the game. After defeating the Nemesis, they must safely reach a helicopter that's circling above in order to escape the doomed house of Doctor Mortimer.

As soon as the team has defeated the Nemesis, the Darkness track is reset and the team is given 4 turns to reach the helicopter. For the team to win, at least half of the survivors must escape the house.

name: Invasive Species
description:
From Ares Magazine issue 2:
Invasive Species is a game about a crisis aboard the CFS Quicksilver, a Terran Commonwealth Corvette on an exploration mission. On a routine close survey of an unexplored garden planet, the crew comes under Attack by ferocious local fauna. Some of the crew is killed before the crew makes it back to the ship and the ship boosts into orbit.

Invasive Species is a two-player game. One player controls the Human crew of the Quicksilver and the other player controls an alien predator loose aboard the ship. The game is played in a series of turns, each composed of activity taken by the Human crewmembers and the Alien.

name: Ghost Train
description:
(from the box)

A 3-Dimensional fearful fun game - but watch out! The ghosts are out to get you.

Turn the wheels and run the gauntlet of ghastly ghouls! Get caught in the spookey spider's web! Sit with skeletons in the haunted waiting room!


Ghost Train is a British game based on those haunted amusement park rides.

The gameboard simulates the inside of a 'Ghost Train' complete with lurking ghosts, bats, skeletons and spiders, etc.

The mechanics (spinning tracks which change direction of movement) are the same as those in the Walt Disney Haunted Mansion Ride Game.

The game simulates many of the 'quirks' of such rides including sudden and jolting changes of direction, dead stops, being 'stuck' at one of the exhibits, and mechanical moving spooks.

Game Play:

Players enter the Ghost Train form the outside in little buggies and navigate the ride while being subjected to detours, directional changes, dead ends, delays and all sorts of creepy monsters.

Players can occasionally spin the turntables to either change a buggies direction (inside the circle) or have an attacked spook knock over an opponents buggy back (outside track) sending it to the 'waiting room'.

There is also a giant swinging spider guarding the exit!

name: Dreadbound
description:
Description from the publisher:

A cooperative sci-fi survival game. Groups of 2-4 players will attempt to defend the lab's shared pool of health from increasingly difficult waves of Enemies. Allowing too many Enemies or any one of three bosses to break through your defenses will end the game. Defeat three bosses, however, and you will be able to call in your drop ship and escape with your lives.

How to play

Advance Phase
Every turn begins with enemy movement. Be cautious, as not all of the creatures move at the same pace! In this phase, any enemies advancing past the first row will cause damage to the players before being discarded.

Spawn Phase
In the second phase, enemies that were beyond the battlefield now become visible! Similar to their varied movements, not all enemies will spawn into the fight at the same distance from the heroes. Additionally, these monstrosities can crowd spaces, stacking their damage and moving as a group, changing player priorities in a single phase.

Action Phase
It’s time to deal some damage. Emulating the limited access to and repurposing of supplies that would occur during the ambush, player action begins by drawing a small number of cards from the supply deck. Supplies range from energy sources and offensive weapons to traps and support items. A lucky draw in Dreadbound may not directly benefit you, but it could be just what your teammates need. Following the resupply, players may then make one of two combinations of actions: Attack (deal direct damage to the enemy) and Support (repurpose or gift supplies to teammates), or two Support actions. Plan carefully with the rest of the crew to make the most effective play.

Boss Phase
Take caution with your kills in Dreadbound, as destroying specific enemies eventually leads to the appearance of one of the game’s six boss creatures. Each of these sports one or more abilities unique to their card, with a variety of effects that can damage players, as well as disrupt their plans and reset their priorities.

name: Mighty Mice
description:
Mighty Mice can be accommodate 2-5 players as a competitive game and 2-8 players as a co-operative game

To start, place an elephant in the center of the table and divide the mice evenly among the players. The first elephant is the base on which all mice or other elephants will be piled. Throw the dice, then add one or several mice or an elephant on top of the previous element. A steady hand, strategy and luck are definitely your best assets! Any mice that fall while you are adding to the structure become yours. Be the first player to dispose of all your mice to win!

In the co-operative game, players pick 15-24 mice dice (depends on the age of the players) and try to place all of the mice on top of the structure while the elephants try to interfere. All players win together when all of the mice are placed.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Party Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Advance Games Co., FoxMind, FoxMind Israel

name: Ultimate Troll Episode 1: Dawn of the Voyaging Troller
description:
Description from the publisher:

Trudge through your opponents' hoards. Dig deep for shiny loot and get out with whatever you can! Bury your spoils and line the walls with tricksy trinkets, traps (and the occasional Goblin). Because when you're a Troll, there's no time for playing nice.

Ultimate Troll is a quick and chaotic party game for 2-4 Trolls looking to ruin someone's day. If you like games with the same flamboyant and manic attitude as Fluxx, Smash Up or Munchkin, then it's time to get your Troll on!

Stealing, bluffing, plotting and back-stabbing are a given. But get ready to slam your brain into reverse, because Ultimate Troll is unique in that cards are not played from your hand. Instead, they are placed face down, creating a treacherous cavern of ludicrous loot and dastardly traps that your opponents will attempt to steal from.

Ultimate Troll is a great, compact game that's fast to set up and play. It's perfect for when you have limited time or space, or as a warmup game to an epic evening of board gaming!
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval, Memory, Party Game
mechanics: Memory, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Play It By Ear: Volume 2
description:
Play It By Ear 2 is the second volume in the Play it by Ear series of audio trivia games.

As in the first, players select a trivia categories from which they must answer a question. Each question is complemented by an audio clip on the cd. The board is the same as the first version where players can select their category in beginning positions, but opponents select the category near the end. Players answering questions correctly will move around the circular board, working their way towards the "winner's circle".

In this edition, the sounds bites are updated from the previous version and 3 new categories were added: Earobics, Grab Bag and At the Races. Some categories were also removed.

The first the "winner's circle" is the victor.
categories: Electronic, Memory, Party Game, Trivia, Word Game

name: Battle of 4 Armies
description:
From designer Nathan Hansen comes a quick paced, deep decision rich, abstract strategy BattlessonTM game, Battle of 4 Armies. Match your skills against up to three opponents, for your goal is the Crown of Chip! Through the judicious use of unit placement and maneuver, you struggle to capture opposing units to knock them out of play, or hold the majority of named spaces on the board. With pressure for the center of the map and maneuver around its edges, players have myriad ways to approach every turn of this absorbing game. Make your move in the Battle of 4 Armies!

Game Data:

Complexity: 1.5 on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 2 on a 9 scale
Scale: Each unit represents a single troop of fantasy warriors.

Game Components:

• One 8.5” x 11” color game map
• One 2-page, color instructions sheet
• One BattlessonTM sheet
• 20 color, die-cut 1” mounted game pieces

name: Flotter Otter
description:
Flotter Otter (a.k.a. Otter Dam) is a pattern recognition game with multiple right answers per card, each of which translates to differently stacked colorful bricks.

Each round you reveal one new card for all players. You can order the objects shown on each card in two different ways, e.g. clocks might have varying sizes and display different times of the day. Since your bricks correspond with the unique colors of the objects on the card you can show one of the two possible solutions by stacking your bricks. The faster you are, the better — so long as you don't make a mistake. This also means that it is smart never to give up early, even in rounds when you seem to be lagging behind.

name: Valhalla Lemmings
description:
In legendary Svervegia, clans of Lemmings clash to gain access to Valhalla! Clash with the other Lemmings but try to get out ... defeated! Only the defeated have access to Valhalla! The winners will return to their village and attract the attention of a local Legend.

Will you be able to lose the battles and send all your Lemmings to Valhalla?

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Destined Legends
description:
Destined Legends features all of your favorite RPG elements in a fun and strategic card game. In Destined legends, you take on the role of heroes better known as Legends. These Legends are entrusted by the Dragon Guardians of the elements to guide humanity throughout the ages, and to protect them from the evils of the world.

Destined Legends features a fresh take on the table-top card game by putting you in control of 3 heroes, or Legends. You spend the game leveling up your party of Legends. As you level you acquire new items and equipment, all in a effort to gain a strategic advantage against your opponent. Your goal is defeat your opponent before they defeat you.

Destined Legends features all original artwork from renound artists Scott Ferguson and Cari Corene. Scott is responsible for some of the best webcomics on the web including Nerf This and Scout Crossing. Cari is a super-talented painter, responsible for such visual treasures such as Story of the Door.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: XOBrainer
description:
XOBrainer is advanced type of five-in-a-row that can be played by two persons or two teams in which the object of the game is to get five-in-a-row in either shape (Xs or Os) or color (green or red), using both your pieces and those of your opponents.

One team has 24 green Xs and 8 pink Xs, while the other team has the reverse: 24 pink Os and 8 green Os. Each team places four of their pieces in the line-up area: three of their main color and one in the opponent's color. Each team then takes turns playing the pieces from their line-up area in numbered order (1-4); when the line-up area is empty, the team refills it as before.
When you achieve five-in-a-row, you earn points based on the placement of the row on the game board. In each square are dots, as on a die, that indicate how many points you score from that square. When a team reaches 20 points, they win a set. The game is won when a team has won three sets. Alternatively a team can win instantly by building a five-in-a-row that passes through one of four "knock out" squares on the game board. Only pieces that both teams can benefit from — pinkXs and green Os — can be played in a knock out square.
XOBrainer comes with four game variations that can be added and combined freely;


Random: Instead of playing with the standard color order, play with randomly selected pieces, either by drawing four pieces randomly from the X- or O-bags or using a free WebApp.



Map: Start the game from a new starting point; each team draws a card and places four pieces as depicted on the card – this way there is a new starting point in each round.



TimeBomb: Set a time limit for each move with the free WebApp.



Mission: Using the map/mission cards, each player has a secret mission to place pieces as depicted on the card. Each piece a player succeeds in placing gives the player extra points (if they also achieve five-in-a-row).
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Personality Game
description:
Based on the NBC TV show.

Players secretly write an answer to a "loaded" question in their Secret Answer Cover. The Master of Ceremonies then reads these answers aloud.

The object is to score points by guessing correctly who wrote each answer.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Sue You!
description: Sue You! was invented by a law student in the fall of 1991. He was intrigued -- and troubled -- by society's apparent fascination with lawsuits, and set out to create a game that would capture the essence of that fascination . . . The object of the game is to become the wealthiest player by successfully suing other players. The game ends when one of the players runs out of money. The player with the most money at that time is the winner."

name: Momox
description:
Each player gets a pawn and numbered game tokens of the same color. The pawn is placed on the corner starting space of the matching color, and the number tokens are placed on their corresponding spaces near the player’s start space. Six yellow tokens—numbered 1 to 6—are shuffled and placed face-down on the black circles in the middle of the board. All but the middle one are then covered with caps.

Object: Players try to collect the numbered tokens of their own color and to assemble them into the highest possible number (i.e., 4321). As the first token is collected, it the must be placed on the ones column, the second on the tens, the third on the hundreds, and the last on the thousands column.

Play: Chose a start player and play clockwise. The active player takes one cap of his choice and places it over the one yellow token that lies free (for the first player, this will be the one in the middle of the board). The number token just freed is turned face up (if not already face-up). The number on it determines how many spaces the player moves his pawn. If he lands on a yellow space, he repeats the procedure (i.e., transfer a cap, reveal a number, move pawn). If he does not land on a yellow space, his turn ends and it is the next player's turn.

Obviously, a player who remembers which number is under which cap may plan his moves accordingly. He cannot, however, use the same movement number in two successive moves because the cap must always be placed on the free token. If a player lands on a yellow space three times in succession, he reshuffles the yellow tokens, places them face down, and covers them as was done at the start of the game.

Winning: The first player to complete a 4-digit number wins and ends the game. If additional rounds are played, a running tally should be kept of each player’s numbers, which are totaled at the end of the game. The player with the highest total is the overall winner.

name: Leyte Gulf Naval Chess Game
description:
LEYTE GULF NAVAL CHESS GAME is a relatively fast and simple combined operations game about the decisive Allied offensive in the Pacific: the liberation of the Filipino people from Japanese occupation in October 1944. This was a dramatic, decisive battle of annihilation, particularly at sea.

Thanks to the Japanese Navy's brilliant plan tailored to Allied -- specifically, Admiral "Bull" Halsey's -- aggressiveness, the Imperial Japanese Navy was on the brink of massacring General Douglas MacArthur's Liberation forces ... until valor and determination (and superb training and equipment) prevailed over the skill and savage ruthlessness of our enemy ... which we were compelled to match ... to win and survive.

This is an excellent 3-player game -- 2 Allied players (who are not allowed to communicate with each other after the game begins) and 1 Japanese player.

Beautifully printed (under license) in Japan's Game Journal No. 11.

(Designer's blurb)
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Alexander
description:
From the manual:

A Module for Ancient Empires: A Simulation of the Wars of Antiquity.

Alexander the Great stirs the imagination of almost all of us. He is without doubt, one of the greatest conquerors of all time. His victories fused two great cultures and provides the wargaming historian with many imponderables and possibilities.

In Alexander the Great, the Wars of Philip and Alexander, we provide for you the great armies of this period so that you, the historical wargamer, can recreate the various armies and battles of this great period in military history. The armies of Philip at Chaeronea and the Greeks he fought; the invasion army of Alexander as he crossed the Hellespont and the army of the 'Great King' Darius III; the new army of Alexander that he took into India, as well as the armies of Porus and even Cangdragnupta, are all detailed here for you to study and recreate.

Within the framework of this module and 'Ancient Empires', now you can become Alexander at the head of his Companions at Issus or Gaugamela. As Porus, now you can attempt to end the conquests of the invincible Macedonian conqueror! All of the great campaigns of Alexander are listed here within the covers of this module for you to study, analyze and recreate.

This module is the fourth released for use with 'Ancient Empires'.

Expands:

Ancient Empires: A Simulation of the Wars of Antiquity
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Trafficking
description:
From the new Trafficking web site:

TRAFFICKING is a role-playing board game that spoofs the cannabis trade. The game features eight dealers - Reefer T. Johnstone III, Janet Planet, Zerox Roachoid, Sonny Sgurd, Stephie "Honey Oil" Slick, Biff Spliff, D.J. Stoner and Fast Eddie Toke c pitted against a dedicated, hard-nosed Narcotics Officer, Lieutenant Dick Gumshoe. The object of the game for the dealers is to become the "Traffic King", that is to be the first dealer to sell a kilo of marijuana (36 ounces or "lids") before being BUSTED by the Narc. Should the Narc succeed in busting all the dealers before any sells a kilo, the Narc wins the game.

This classic was originally released in 1983 but is now back to get another generation of gamers high on fun!
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Tina, Tim und Wambolo
description: Tina, Tim and Wambolo - on Berry Island in the Crocodile River is excitement till the very last move. Stranded on an island surrounded by crocodiles players have to collect berries and build a boat in order to escape - but this just works if they help each other....2-6 players ages 5+
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Lost Treasures
description:
Lost Treasures is a "Print & Play" game where each player must hire a party of adventurers to retrieve the treasure from a forgotten dungeon. One player recruits his adventurers from the noble worthy races, the other from the dregs and evil denizens. Unfortunately, due to the rush to try to get to the treasure first, sometimes the parties are not as well equipped as they could be. . . .

Adventure Party Recruitment is done via a simple card system, and the Dungeon board is created randomly, using room tiles.
Combat, magic, and other actions are resolved by dice.

All the pieces required to play (except for the dice) are available from the following website:

http://lost-treasures.tripod.com/
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Print & Play

name: Empire
description:
H.G. Wells Awards for "Best All-Time Napoleonic Rules" and "Hall of Fame

Gold Hot-Stamped Imperial Green Leatherette 3-Ring Binder
Over 100 pages of rules and designer notes with numerous pages of reference material specifying leader ratings, troop-types, and much more.

Colorful die-cut counters for orders, unit status and terrain aids.

6 color-coded reference charts for easy access to important tables of play.

1 fold-out elan chart

name: A Master Stroke: The Battle for Meiktila, March 5-14, 1945
description:
A Master Stroke: The Battle for Meiktila deals with the British offensive to the railroad town of Meiktila in Burma and the subsequent Japanese counterattack. This was a fight characterized by the bold move made by the 17th Indian Division to abandon their supply lines to take Meiktila, unhinging the Japanese defense line. Relying on air supply to hold out against Japanese attacks, the 17th Indian Division ultimately prevailed.

Scale: Battalion
Game Turn: 1 day/turn
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Power * Prestige * Politics
description:
As a US Senator, you amass power and votes, gaining the support of various lobbying groups and building up prestige in your bid to become powerful and famous enough to run for President. But politics is a dirty game. Can you make it to the top without too many scandals and ethics investigations? Will someone else take the lead by slinging mud at you... or will you sling it back?

Power, Prestige, Politics is a fast-paced card game of political negotiation.

name: Tall Bird, Short Bird
description:
In this children's game, players compete to create either the tallest or shortest birds, adding cards that show either a bird's head or its feet to the bird bodies on the gameboard.

To start, each player receives three cards. Each player chooses one card and places it face down in front of him. The first player calls out either "Tall bird!" or "Short bird!" That sets the criterion for the round. Each player then places the card he chose on the board, and the players determine who has the tallest or shortest bird, depending on which was called. The winning player gets an "egg," one of the cardboard counters used to keep score. Each player then draws a new card.

Play proceeds in the same way to the next player to the left, and cards are played on top of each player's existing cards on the board.

The game ends when the last card is drawn. The player with the most eggs wins.

This game is marked as "Piatnik Item No. 328," and probably was originally published in German in Austria. This summary is based on an English version printed in Austria but distributed by Discovery Toys of Martinez, Calif.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection
publishers: Discovery Toys, Milton Bradley, Parker Brothers, Piatnik

name: Book of Mormon Who?
description:
A guessing game similar to Guess Who? in which players try to identify a Book of Mormon character based on unique characteristics.

From the publisher: In this fun guessing game for the whole family, each team represents a “scripture sleuth” and must try to be the first team to identify the Book of Mormon character on the “Who?” card held by the other team. The first team to collect three of their opponents’ “Who?” cards wins the game.

name: Kraśnik 1914
description: Game about Austrian offensive from August 1914. Over 400,000 soldiers from both sides (Austro-Hungarian and Russian) fought in fierce battle near Kraśnik (now in Poland) on 23-35 September. In the battle, a decisive role was played by manoeuvre and the power of artillery.

name: Bitwa na Morzu Wiatrów
description:
Bitwa na Morzu Wiatrów ("Battle of the Sea of Winds") is a nautical wargame set in about XVII century however with no historical scenario. Each player (green and red) owns an identical set of 10 ships varying number of man and guns on the deck. Task of the game is to reach the enemy harbor with the transport ship (without the guns).
