Both the wind direction and the battles between ships are resolved using card decks. During the battle each player draws a card which determines the result of gunfire or boarding. There are several damages the ships can receive - the damaged sails, the lost sails, the lost sails and 1 or 2 guns and the fire.

The game was edited in Poland in the mid-eighties.

name: Tobakueiyuuden Seven
description:
It is a gambling anthology that can be enjoyed by 3-5 player.
Seven original gambling games are collected to this game. Batting Porker, Mind Roulette, Roto 7, Your Order, Between Bet, Black or Red and Three Seven.
"Carry-over session" that plays continuously is recommended two or more gambling though it is possible to enjoy even if playing single gambling, too.
The money on hand at the end of gambling is carried over and Player challenges the next gambling.

name: Lost Puppies
description:
The object of the game is to find and bring home all of the lost puppies before night falls. Be careful, the road is blocked and night is falling! To start the game, mix all the cards and place them face down on the spaces and homes on the board. Players take turns turning over cards one at a time to find the puppies and open a path home. If a night card (card with a star on it) is turned up, place it on the space on the board with the corresponding number. If a flashlight light or take-a-peek card is turned up, take it off the board to be used at a later time. Flashlight cards remove night cards and open the path! Take-a-peek cards allow players to peek under a night card. Strategy is key to this game, but a little bit of luck never hurts! Includes 3 instruction versions for a variety of play levels.

Components:

1 game board
12 night cards
6 flashlight cards
4 take-a-peek cards
6 puppy cards

name: Zeppelin Conquest
description: Zeppelin Conquest is a fun 2-player card game in which two evil masterminds from the Spirit of the Century Role-Playing game: Rocket Red and Princess Cyclone, duke it out across the globe using their soldiers and zeppelins to claim an inevitably short-lived victory as queen of the world! The game utilizes a distinctive majority-control mechanic, which requires players to add set combinations of majority control resources against 3 different targets with each play.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Print & Play

name: Mensch ärgere Dich nicht: ...noch mehr ärgern – Kartenerweiterung Rot
description:
Mensch ärgere Dich nicht: ...noch mehr ärgern – Kartenerweiterung Rot is an expansion deck of 55 cards that can be used in conjunction with Mensch ärgere Dich nicht or any Pachisi clone. With these cards even more trouble is guaranteed for the players.

After a player rolls the die and moves their pawn, they can draw a card and on a future turn, instead of rolling, they can choose to play a card from their hand. Cards allow, for instance, moving a pawn twelve spaces, passing everyone on the board, swapping two pawns, or taking other actions sure to frustrate their opponents. Of course they'll turn around and do the same to them. All's fair!

The Kartenerweiterung Rot deck can be combined with the Kartenerweiterung Blau deck for more variety and fun.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Solar Senate
description:
Humanity is about to join galactic society. You are an alien trying to convince the Solar Senate to ally with your civilization. Influencing from interstellar distances, you must rely on sympathetic Senators to convert their comrades. Through cunning manipulation and the occasional political sacrifice, you can win the Solar Senate!

Solar Senate is a 2-player abstract game of spatial strategy and conversion. Each player has their own deck of Senators, whose influence is ranked from 1 to 5 with 1s being most common and 5s most rare.

On your turn, you play one of the two Senators from your hand onto the play area. This represents your Senator entering the Senate chambers. If you flank a line with one or more of your opponent's senators with two of your senators, those opposing senators might be converted to you under two conditions:

PRESSURE: Your flanking senators' total influence is greater than the opposing senators' total influence.
CONSPIRE: Your flanking senators each have identical influence, regardless of the opposing senators total influence. If conspiring, the most recently played senator is removed from the game. (He or she has resigned in disgrace.)

The game continues until all but one Senator from each deck has entered the chambers. Earn 1 point for each senator aligned to you. You also earn bonus points if you achieve certain endgame agendas.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Butim: Mar de Sangue
description:
Mar de Sangue ("Sea of Blood", in Portuguese) is a Butim expansion.

Cyclones reveal ancient relics attracting thirsty pirates by this Blood Sea. This expansion includes new pillages, streetwises, equipment as well as new types of letters (relics and privateers) that bring to the game a new dynamic.

name: Be My Valentine
description: Be My Valentine is a love decipher for more-than-friendly encounters. The players can game themselves into happiness through letter delivery to gauge whether the messages you are receiving from the guy who likes you. Basically, the players can get/lose love points via a series of love actions— sending letters sending letters, confessing love or being a matchmaker. After the end of the game, the player(s) with the most love points is the best lover and wins the game!

name: Ten Cats
description: Every player has ten tiles in his bag. One with four cats, two with three cats, three with two cats and four with one cat. On your turn you draw a tile from your bag and place it on the table with the goal being having ten of your cats in a row.

name: Uruk II: Promokarte Tribute
description: The Tribute promo card for Uruk II is yet another of the rare black cards, making it ever-so-slightly easier to play other black cards.
categories: Card Game, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: SHOOTERZ
description:
SHOOTERZ Hockey Card Game is fast-paced, head-2-head fun!
Players pick through a special deck looking for combinations to shoot for a goal, while trying to keep their players out of the sin bin. Big goals and big saves!
There are two teams, red vs. blue. The jerseys are centres, wingers and defence. Your team must collect one of each position to shoot for a goal. However, your opponent might be able to block the shot if his/her team jerseys have a higher total number. There are special shooting and goalie cards for each shot. Do you know your opponent's tendencies?

Each time through the deck is a full period, with OT and shootout rules. GAME ON!

name: Cluedo: Doctor Who – The Hunt for Gallifrey
description:
The Doctor may have defeated Missy and stopped the Cyberman army released from the Nethersphere, but his old friend continues playing her twisted games, toying with the Doctor’s mind. In her final moments, she reveals that she knows a secret he cannot resist…the location of Gallifrey.

But the coordinates she gives him just lead to empty space and in Cluedo: The Hunt for Gallifrey, you play the part of the Doctor, visiting nine recent locations, with six inventions to meet six recent enemies and uncover the true coordinates of your lost home.
categories: Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Mandalas
description:
A board game in which each player will form his own Mandala using chips with 3 original geometric designs and 4 sets of colors to combine them into thousands of unique figures scoring points adding points for each similarity between adjacent pieces


Un juego de mesa en donde cada participante formará su propio Mandala usando fichas con 3 diseños geométricos originales y 4 conjuntos de colores para combinarlas en miles de figuras únicas, sumando puntos por cada similitud entre las piezas adyacentes.

name: A Town Called Nowhere
description:
"Howdy, stranger, I'm Ma Johnson. I used to run a lodging house back east. Ran a couple more in different towns on route out here, too. Seems to be the way, that once a town starts gittin' big it starts attracting the wrong sort. That's why I'm here talking to you now. The last town I was in turned bad once some mean critters started calling the shots. I knew it was time to move on when the mayor appointed the town drunk as marshal. We're way out in the middle of nowhere here, so hopefully the bad seeds will fall short."

In A Town Called Nowhere, you take the role of a pioneer settling a new town in the Old West. There'll be business opportunities aplenty for folks with an eye on the main chance and pitfalls too for those who don't cover their tracks. As you'd expect, there’ll be saloons, gambling, and gunfights. There'll be a jail, a bank, and a gunsmith. There'll be a marshal, a schoolteacher, and a lady called Ruby; the bank will get robbed, the corral will burn down, and some big shot will run you out of business so he can build a grand hotel where your wash house stands. Once the dust settles, that same big shot will paint his name on the town sign and say, "If anyone has any objections, they should speak up now". Will you say anything? Course not, you'll head back to your washboard and eke out a meagre existence scrubbing miner's socks. Of course, it doesn't have to turn out that way. I mean, no one's even driven a stake yet.

The game takes place on the grid map of the Town of Nowhere, which is empty at the start of the game. As players take their turns and the game progresses the map will become populated with all the buildings and businesses you'd expect in the Old West. Each player controls the movements and actions of their gang of associates as they move about town taking care of business and business can be anything from manning the counter at the dry goods store to gunning down the marshal.

The player with the greatest prestige at the end of the game wins and gets to name the town after themselves.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Push Your Luck, Take That, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Three Kingdoms, modern naval battles
description:
Japan-China-Korea; Three Kingdoms Modern Naval Battles is a board simulation game that depicts the possible conflict between the Japanese Maritime Self-Defense Force, the Chinese Navy and the Korean Navy that could be fought in 202x.

In this simulation, each surface ship/submarine is one unit, and each unit has anti-ship, anti-air, anti-submarine power, and technical level. In addition, wide area anti-air power must be set for Aegis warship. The character of each individual ship and each weapon is reproduced.

As a result, various modern naval battles including ship-to-ship, ship-to-air, ship-to-submarine, air-to-submarine, and air-to-air combat are reproduced with a simple game system, enabling you to play a three-dimensional modern naval-air battle.

In addition to four introductory scenarios that can be played in a short period of time, a campaign scenario that requires a plan of operations combining surface, submarine, and aircraft units on a wide scale is also included.

198 counters
1 full map
Time scale: 16 hours to 3 days (depending on scenario)
Unit scale: 1 ship /Several aircrafts
Game area: West Japan Sea and East China Sea

Scenarios:
・Dokdo ship, sortie! (Introduction scenario: Japan vs Korea)
・Senkaku offshore carrier battle (Introduction scenario: Japan vs China)
・Jeju Island Defense War (Introduction scenario: China vs South Korea)
・Aircraft carrier Izumo (Introduction scenario: Japan vs ?)
・Sakishima Islands Campaign (Main scenario: Japan vs China)

(translated and adapted from publisher's Japanese description)


Issue game of Game Journal #74.

name: Quem Vai?
description:
Find who will go in this fast and fun game.

Quem Vai? (Portuguese for "Who go") is an accessory game that will help you make the most important decisions of your life!

Know that super nice game that you will play in 2 minutes? Who will be the first player? Use Quem Vai? to decide this and other things:

Who will order the pizza?
Who will do the dishes?
Who will get the last piece of cake?
Who will make popcorn?

Quem Vai? is fast and simple: simply shuffle the cards, pull one of them and done: you already have a criteria as to use to make the decisions about who will do something.

The game is quick and fits for two up to whoever many players are deciding.

Use Quem Vai? to decide the most important things in your life.

name: UNO: Masters of the Universe
description:
The UNO card game everyone loves gets a powerful look with He-Man and the Masters of the Universe. Featuring dynamic graphics of MOTU characters from powerful heroes to deadly sorcerers, it also includes a unique rule -- the Power of Greyskull Card. To use it, the player must hold it above their head and say, "By the power of Greyskull, I have the power!!" All other players then draw 3 cards.

Game play is like classic UNO: players match cards by color or number in a race to get rid of all the cards in their hand. When down to one card, they must shout triumphantly like He-Man "UNO!"
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Number

name: American Pandemic: The Party Card Game
description:
American Pandemic is a hilarious party card game of survival when ordinary U.S. citizens face too much free time during quarantine.

Play as American neighbors competing for the most bad luck as a pandemic suddenly sends everyone into lockdown when the U.S. declares a national state of emergency.

Players must hoard and steal stereotypical American essentials from each other, overcome the endless awkward quarantine scenarios created from 2020 memes, and stop the impending world disasters by using the rarest, most valuable commodity of the pandemic… Toilet Paper.

Just like Americans competing over the worst 2020 story, players compete for bad luck points. Every round a Headline card is revealed as a new crisis strikes the American public. Each headline builds on the last - creating more and more bad luck for everyone. The only way to stop them… toilet paper, of course. Player turns are comprised of three phases: Escape, Hoard, and Quarantine.

Players begin their turns by drawing from the Escape Draw Pile to “escape” the active Headline cards.
Players next must hoard as much as they can by drawing from the Hoard Draw Pile. Hoard cards include all the stereotypical American essentials needed to survive like toilet paper, frozen dinners, cbd gummies, essential oils, coffee, chocolate, wine, gloves, tv, computers, puppies, guns, masks, and much more. Finally, players end their turn as they are forced into quarantine by drawing from the Quarantine Draw Pile. Inspired by the countless 2020 memes, players read out-loud the embarrassing and awkward scenarios while their opponents enjoy a good laugh at their expense.

Throughout the game, bad Luck is stored in a player’s Crazy Stash or Sick Stash. The Crazy Stash represents a player’s declining mental state while the Sick stash represents their failing health. The player with the most bad luck points at the end of the game wins.

-description from designer
mechanics: Bribery, End Game Bonuses, Events, Negotiation, Trading

name: Indommus: Reyes Destronados
description:
GAME SYSTEM



This entry is to allow for discussion/rating of the game system as a whole. It is not for a specific product or release. Versions will appear on the individual item pages.





Put yourself in the shoes of a monarch, who must dethrone another king to ensure his power and conquer.

Indommus is a collectible card game where you will have different types of cards to build your deck and develop a strategy that leaves your opponent out of the game.

Each player has 40 life points, and will achieve victory by leaving his opponent at 0 life points. However, it is also possible to win the battle by leaving your opponent with no cards in his deck.

The Indommus card system modifies the current standards of Trading Card Games, by not having a rarity system, allowing all players to easily get their cards.

Defeat your opponent and become the most powerful monarch on the continent.

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Medieval
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Interrupts, Take That

name: The Living Infinite
description:
In The Living Infinite, players work together as scientists gathering materials from the ocean floor to repair their ship, while one or two players move as creatures, hunting the scientists down through the inky depths. With asymmetrical, one-versus-many play, it’s an undersea adventure of quick wits and strategic social prediction. Can you rebuild your ship in time to escape, or will your wily predator find you first?

There are two teams, Scientists & Creatures, both teams draw cards to determine movement. Scientists acquire resources and oxygen to fix their damaged submarine so they can escape. Creatures to acquire all the oxygen they can.

Scientists Win: If all the submarine parts are repaired, the scientists win the game! After the last submarine part has been repaired, the game immediately ends.
Creature(s) Wins: If the creature(s) take all the available Oxygen tokens from the oxygen reserves, they win the game!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Set Collection, Team-Based Game

name: Momiji: Metal Leaf
description:
The Metal Leaf lets you pay one less Acorn when performing the “take leaf cards” action and revealing 4 new cards from the deck, or when activating an Objective token.

During Set-up, give the Metal Leaf to the last player. The owner gets the Acorn discount when they pass the Metal Leaf to the player on their right.

name: Almanac: Tom's Hat Promo Card
description:
Originally available as part of Pack E from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

"The ground begins to shake as a hat-wearing giant emerges from a nearby canyon. In a booming voice, he says, "Hey everybody. who wants to play a game?" Tom the giant challenges the merchants to a toss of the dice."

Can be used with Almanac: The Crystal Peaks and Almanac: The Dragon Road

name: Tannhäuser Field Ops
description:
Tannhäuser Field Ops is a table top card game where the cards move on the table (like in Wings of War and Battleground) to represent various units in the 1949 Tannhäuser U-Chronic Universe where WWI never ended and the Reich has uncovered eldritch horror and the forces of the Union under President Edison are benefitting from alien technology from the Roswell UFO crash.

The player each secretly set up their orders and then play out the turn. Troops are assisted by various gear and special powers and are affected by different terrain cards on the table. Defeat the enemy troops or complete a scenario conditions to win.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Super Blockhead!
description:
A different game than Blockhead!, Super Blockhead! includes 30 oddly-shaped wooden pieces and a cardboard base. Players take turns choosing a block to place on the tower, in "any position on any block," somewhat different from the original game.

Players get two chances to allow the tower to tumble; the third time results in being out of the game.

name: Gan Deng Yan
description:
Gan Deng Yan is a traditional climbing/shedding card game from China. Players attempt to be the first person to empty their hand of cards. Like many climbing/shedding games, players can play single cards, pairs, and runs. What makes Gan Deng Yan different is following players play singles, pairs, and runs that are sequentially higher than the cards played before them. After everyone has passed, players then draw a card from the talon.

Hands end when a player has emptied their hand of cards. Each card left in opponents’ hands scores one point for the first person to go out. After a pre-determined number of rounds, the winner is the person who has the most points.

—user summary

name: Gezanke auf der Planke
description:
The ship swings, the gold lies on the planks, and underneath the sharks are circling.

Gezanke auf der Planke is played on a real 3D ship that lies rocking in the waves. All pirates want to get as close as possible to the prey, but most of the coins can be found only on the most tricky plank sites on the ship's exterior. With each move, one of the six planks is pushed sideways over the deck, and a pirate on the ship is moved. This always puts some pirates out of balance...

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Slide/Push, Three Dimensional Movement

name: Head Quarter
description:
Each player sits on opposites of a large silouhette head with empty space in the middle. Each player draws cubes from a bag (two colored cubes glued together, making more of a rectangle--much like three-dimensional short Tetris pieces) and places their piece in the empty space in the head (the empty space is two cubes deep). They can orient the blocks in any fashion they like.

Play continues until one player fills their side (later rules contradict this and that usually dictates whether someone will like the game or not). Then players score by tallying up the different chunks of color on their side of the head (larger areas of the same color score more).

At least in the first edition, the head is mighty wobbly.
publishers: The Really Useful Games Co., Theta

name: Timeline
description:
Timeline is a trivia board game about an exciting journey through Switzerland.
Players answer the questions and if these are correct place that card in front of their teammates with a series of eight cards. The cards must be arranged so that the numbers increase from left to right annually.
The game consists of important events in Swiss history, politics, entertainment, business, traffic, sports, personalities, and inventions.

name: Quarto
description:
The game consists of two phases, a placement phase followed by a movement phase. The two players White and Black each have twelve pieces.

PLACEMENT PHASE:
Beginning with White, the players alternate placing one of their twelve pieces on one of the 37 crossing points on the board.
Once all pieces have been placed, the movement phase begins. A piece can be captured during this phase (see below).

MOVEMENT PHASE:
The players alternate moving one of their pieces to an adjacent and empty crossing point. A piece can be captured during this phase (see below). If a player has only 4 remaining pieces, they are allowed to move their piece to any empty crossing point.

QUADRATES:
A quadrate occurs when a piece is placed such that the 4 corners of a square are occupied by that player's pieces. Quadrates come in 6 different sizes. To form a quadrate, a player must have their pieces on all 4 corners of a square composed of either 2,4,8,16,18, or 32 triangles.

The table below indicates the number of possible quadrates composed of a given number of triangles:

No. of Triangles/No. of Quadrates
2 - 24
4 - 12
8 - 13
16 - 5
18 - 4
32 - 1

For any of the larger quadrates (8,16,18,32), the quadrate is invalid if there is an opposing piece on any position along the side.Only friendly or empty positions are allowed along the edges (sides) of a quadrate.

CAPTURE:
If after placing a piece, a quadrate is formed, the player can remove an opponent piece which does not itself form a quadrate with 3 other pieces.

Once a player has only 3 remaining pieces, they lose the game. If the same position occurs 3 times, then the game is declared a draw.

Notes:
o In rare cases, all of a player's pieces may be trapped thus requiring the player to pass.
o Danish Quarto has some similiarities to the Morris family of European board games, but also shares important features of a Chinese game named `Fang`

name: One Piece Card Game
description:
A collectible card game with the characters from the successful manga series "One Piece". Nice artwork and easy rules make this game a good entry into the world of CCGs.

Two players build their own deck with 32 cards and fight each other with pirates, special abilities and nasty tricks.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Pirates

name: UNO Party!
description:
Your goal in UNO Party! remains the same as in the original UNO game — empty your hand of cards first — but special rules and cards make the game playable with up to sixteen people at a time:


​The "Drawn Together" rule links two players who must draw cards at the same time.
The "Point Taken" rule has all players pointing at other players, then each player must draw as many cards as there are fingers pointing at them!
​"Speed Play" lets players play a card out of turn — if they're fast enough...


A direction tracker card helps keep track of the direction of game play.

name: MAUW: Reactions
description:
MAUW: Reactions adds three new creatures to the game, with different effects:

The Kiwi lets you steal a cat Warrior from your opponent, and use it right away.
The Ninox lets you take a Spirit cat from an opponent's stack, and place it flipped to the Mauw side in your area.
The Tuatura lets you ward off an attack from an opponent trying to take one of your Warriors, and you get the attacking card in your hand.


Each card has 4 copies in this expansion, adding 12 cards to the game.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Nuked
description:
Nuked is a card game for 2 - 8+ players that pits your post apocalyptic settlement against other players as you try to collect enough settlers to win the game. In the process, you can play cards to ruin other settlements or try to protect your own.

It's a fairly simple game to learn, it doesn't have attack point vs. defense system, there’s not a ton of stats to keep up with, it's more like paper rock scissors.

The other element is the Fate Cards, which might make you switch hands with another player, or allow you to play any settler card in your hand for example. Those cards can be pulled by any player once per round, and in any order, so it doesn’t have to be their turn to pull the card. It can really change the dynamic of a game and make for some pretty hilarious and fun moments. The game can be measured and tactical or chaotic and crazy, it all depends on the player.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Push Your Luck, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Set Collection, Team-Based Game

name: When Cutie Met Patootie
description:
In When Cutie Met Patootie, we meet Cutie, the residents of Kodiak Harbor, and the ten alien visitors who have just arrived on nearby Alaskan shores. Cutie has been in the care of her grandmother while her archeologist parents are on a dangerous expedition. However, after their being gone for six months, Cutie and the residents of Kodiak Harbor fear the worst. Join Cutie as she travels into the forest with Amelia, one of the visitors, to discover the truth of her parents' whereabouts.

At the beginning of the game, players take a secret Citizen card and three path cards, then they randomly assemble the Alaskan shore visitor cards in a row of ten and place the corresponding Visitor pieces on their card.

Players then take turns playing a path card each turn. Path cards can be used in multiple ways: build the growing map, help visitors collect sprite gems, or spend those sprite gems to advance visitors along the built map. When building the map, players can connect only to the existing path to create a pyramid shape, ever tightening the forest path!

The end of the game is triggered when one visitor reaches the top. To determine a winner, players reveal their secret roles, each detailing specific sprite gems for which they earn points. Players tally points based on the location of visitors holding their designated sprite gems. The person with the most sprite gem points wins!

When Cutie Met Patootie is the first game of The Entanglement Series by The Daniel Zayas Company. This game ships with a mini-expansion titled The Man Who Moves the Water, which allows for solo play.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Adventure, Card Game, Exploration, Science Fiction, Travel
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Pattern Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement

name: Startropolis: Nova Box
description:
This expansion to "Startropolis" adds three optional features to gameplay: new advanced modules, alien factions, and secret missions.

There are six new module types, each with its own components, capabilities, and advanced modules card. Each of these are meant to be substituted for one of the basic module types in the core game to make for many possible variations.

Alien factions make for an asymmetric game, with each player having both a special permanent ability and single use ability. Secret missions add a hidden information element making it harder to estimate the progress of other players.

WHAT’S IN THE BOX?
● 24 Advanced Modules (in 6 types)
● 54 Advanced Module Cards
● 12 Advanced Faction Cards
● 15 Mission Cards
● 100+ Credit Tokens and Player Revenue Markers
categories: City Building, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: UNO Showdown
description:
UNO Showdown is the matching card game everyone loves but with the unexpected excitement of a card-shooting smackdown! When the lightning sounds and the UNO Showdown unit signal goes off, be the first to push down on the paddle. The quickest player wins the showdown and sends cards flying out of the UNO Showdown unit at their opponents! Players race to get rid of all their cards by matching them to the card shown on top of the deck. When players are down to one card, they must remember to yell "UNO!" Fun for kid, family or adult game night and a great gift for players ages 7 years and older.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Electronic, Real-time

name: Épica
description:
From the website:

Épica is a collectible card game where you embody a powerful hero of the Shadowlands, wielding a Celestial Weapon that allows you to run wild in battle, pushing your abilities to the limit.

Your mission is to protect the supremacy of your Clan, defeating the rival heroes. But Épica is not only about battling, it's a unique gaming experience, an authentic author's game, perfectly worked and developed for over 2 years.

In "Épica: Dark Ages", the first installment of the game, you'll find a booklet describing the game rules and an innovative History Mode, where you'll be submerged into an adventure story playable by one or more players, telling of the outcome of the battles that happen across the Shadowlands during these tragic times.

There are two additional types of game: Battle Mode, where a single deck makes possible to engage up to 10 players, each embodying a different hero of this shadowy world. And, of course, Tournament Mode, where you can combine many sets of the game and upcoming expansions to build your own playing deck and participate in the many events and contests that will be arranged across all Spain.

In the box, you'll also find more than 100 finely illustrated cards that will amaze you for their quality and realism. Think of each card as a little gem, fully tested and developed.

War has begun, the Oni hybrid warriors, crossing of demons and humans, are willing to conquer the Shadowlands. Only a few humans stand before their ruthless advance. Will you be able to stop them?


De su página web:

Épica es un juego de cartas coleccionable, en el cuál encarnas a un poderoso héroe de las Tierras de las Sombras capaz de blandir un arma celestial que le permite desatarse en batalla. Llevando sus habilidades más allá del límite.

Tu misión fundamental es proteger la supremacía de tu clan derrotando a los héroes rivales. Pero Épica no es sólo lucha, es algo más, es una experiencia única de juego, perfectamente trabajado y desarrollado durante más de 2 años, un auténtico juego de autor.

Dentro de Épica, Edades Oscuras, encontrarás un libro que te explicará las reglas del juego, así como un novedoso modo historia, el cual te sumergirá en una auténtica novela auto jugable por uno o varios jugadores, en ella se narra el desenlace de las batallas que ocurren en las Tierras de la Sombra durante esta terrible época.

Existen otros 2 tipos de juego adicionales: el modo Batalla, en el cual con un solo mazo podrás realizar combates de hasta 10 jugadores encarnando a uno de los héroes de este sombrío mundo. Y por supuesto, el modo Torneo, en el cuál combinando varios sets de juego y las sucesivas ampliaciones, podrás crearte tu propio mazo de juego temático con el cuál podrás competir en las distintas competiciones y eventos que se realicen por toda la geografía.

También en el interior de la caja, encontrarás más de 100 cartas excelentemente ilustradas que te sorprenderán por su realismo y calidad. Cada una de ellas es como una pequeña joya desarrollada y testeada al más mínimo detalle.

La guerra ha comenzado, los Oni guerreros híbridos nacidos del cruce entre humanos y demonios, están dispuestos a conquistar las Tierras de la Sombra. Sólo una pequeña defensa humana podrá detener su imparable avance. ¿ Podrás detenerlos ?

name: The Necessary Conditions for John H. Watson
description:
In ワトソンの条件 ("The Necessary Conditions for John H. Watson"), the players are assistants to a famous Victorian era detective, searching out clues in order to capture criminals.

In this anime-styled worker placement game, there are two phases, the plot and action phases. In the plot phase, players place their action tokens one at a time clockwise then counterclockwise. In the action phase, tokens are moved to one of two actions adjacent to the token, possibly taking the action from others. Players will collect clues and money to let gain renown or discover keys, which allow them to catch one of the three criminals at large.

The game is over when someone has caught the mastermind, or after 10 rounds. The player with the most renown wins!

name: Banco Imobiliário
description:
Brazilian version of Monopoly from 2020 (product code 2000) with free app available for smartphones and tablets with Android and IOS.

This is a physical product with optional app to increase the experience. Can be played with the classic rules or adding the app.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Loans, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Track Movement, Trading

name: Line of Battle (Second Edition)
description:
Line of Battle - Tactical simulation between capital ships. The game covers the period 1914-1924

Line of Battle recreates naval battles during the era of the Dreadnought battleship. A unique combat system simulates shell strengths, immune zones, armor placement, gun ranges and the angle of incoming shot without resorting to complex calculations. Take command of a squadron of dreadnoughts to duel for domination of the seas.

This is the updated by Omega Games (i.e. Second Edition). It features all new artwork, revised and re-edited rules and several playing aids not found in the originals.

Re-implements:

Line of Battle: Tactical Capital Ship Combat, 1914-1924

name: Weather Wars: Battle for the Guzunganator
description:
In Weather Wars, you recruit wacky animals to your cause. Once you reach one hundred power worth of animals, or your team reaches 150 power in team play, you take control of the weather machine and win the game. Early on, only small power creatures can be played, but as the game progresses, larger, more powerful creatures come online. Each creature has an ability that triggers when it comes into play, helping your cause or causing mayhem for other players. The season card indicates what season the weather machine has forced on the world. Gather more summer creatures in summer, or more winter creatures in winter, and you'll earn a big season bonus – but watch out! At any time a Season Change Card can flip the season and ruin all your careful planning.

Weather Wars features an unusual hand mechanic - rather than drawing a card each turn, cards are played until a player only has two left in hand. These last two are then discarded and replaced with a 5-card hand. This creates subtle strategic depth - which cards should be played now, which later, and which not at all? It also gives additional meaning to any card ability that allows you to draw extra cards.

Other game features include a catchup mechanic in the form of the Season Change card, game acceleration via prerequisites for playing larger animals, and opportunities for collaboration in team play. The game plays quickly, to allow for frequent replays.

Weather Wars is a family-friendly card game for 2-4 players ages 8 and up, and takes about 20 minutes to play.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Humor, Print & Play

name: Texas Showdown
description:
Texas Showdown is a game of strategy and skill that provides the thrill-a-minute excitement of an Old West Showdown at the saloon card table.

In Texas Showdown, players must simultaneously consider the money bet against the Pot and the moves the cards will allow them to make around the board. The object is to acquire certain combinations of board properties or to break your opponent(s) either with your skillful play at the Two Card Poker table or by charging outrageous rents when they visit your gambling establishments. But watch your play--you may end up in Judge Roy Bean's Court where you will be fined for such things as "relieving yourself on his horse's leg" or "not sharing your chickie at the Texas Chicken Ranch."

Texas Showdown uses original statistical combinations that make each Wild West Showdown different from the last and provide a never-ending source of entertainment for two to five players, aged twelve to adult. Average game time is thirty minutes.

The properties of Texas Showdown represent infamously crooked gambling houses of the Nineteenth Century, where the only sure bet was the loss of your money. Relive the stories that have come down to us from this romantic era of great gamblers and famous suckers.

(Description above is from side of box.)
categories: American West, Bluffing, Card Game, Economic

name: Australian Menagerie: Red Centre Expansion
description:
Adds a new habitat - The Red Centre, 4 new animals - Mala, Bilby, Princess Parrot and Throny Devil and new threat and management strategy cards for the Fox.

Expands:

Australian Menagerie
categories: Card Game, Educational, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game

name: Poland, 1939: The First Battle
description:
This is a wargame set during the German invasion of Poland in 1939. In addition to the historical scenario, it has a number of hypothetical changes that can be made to each side's forces. The game is primarily for two players, but it is possible to play with a third player controlling the Soviet forces.

The game was originally published in 1973, with a revised version published in 1974 and a further revision published in 1976.

name: Turm & Wächter
description:
Turm & Wächter (Tower & Guard) is a simple abstract 2-player game that is played on a 7x7 grid. Each player starts with 7 Tower-stones and 1 Guard-stone. The aim of the game is to use these stones to capture your opponent's all important Guard-stone, or to occupy the starting position of this stone with your own Guard.

Each turn a player can move one stone, or one stack of stones. How far (forwards, backwards or sideways, but never diagonal) is determined by the height of the stack. It is possible to move only a part of a stack if you don't want to move the full possible distance, but it is not allowed to jump over any other stones in this path. A move can end on a friendly Tower-stone or -stack, but Guard-stones can never become part of a stack.

It is possible to capture enemy stones by landing on them, under certain conditions. Guard-stones can always land on any enemy stone or stack and likewise, anything can land on the enemy Guard-stone. A tower-stone or stack can capture enemy stones or stacks only when it at least matches the height of the opposing stack. All Tower-stones that are captured are removed from play and as stated before, taking the enemy Guard-stone is one way of two ways to win the game.
publishers: Clemens Gerhards, Spiel & Autor, W. Nostheide Verlag GmbH

name: Monopoly: Manchester United Football Club
description: The classic boardgame takes on a new shape in this Manchester United edition. Featuring stars from the current squad alongside heroes from United's glorious past and two of football's greatest ever managers, this version of Monopoly requires players to accumulate wealth by aquiring stands and stadiums. Community Chest and Chance cards are replaced by Home and Away cards. It's an absolute must for all Reds fans!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Hasbro, Parker Brothers, Waddingtons, Winning Moves UK Ltd.

name: Taiwan: Assassin's Mace, Scorpion Sting
description:
Taiwan: Assassin's Mace, Scorpion Sting is a two player game simulating a hypothetical People's Republic of China's invasion of the Republic of China (Taiwan).
Features the problems of a sea/air invasion against a hostile foe.

A print and play, hex and counter wargame available for free.
Available as a single PDF from http://www.mmiparchive.papermakeit.com/28%20-%20Boardgames.h...

name: City of Guilds: The Dice Game
description:
The Great City of Andalanshar is once again leaderless. In-fighting amongst the members of the Council of Andals has led to a breakdown in the running of the city, and the guilds are once again flexing their muscles, trying to gain power however they can.

Seeing an opportunity to regain the power they once lost, the great families are rallying support to try and win control of the city.

Each player represents the head of one of the great families, travelling around the city to try and influence the populace, whilst bribing the guilds in order to gain their support.

Players roll dice to gain influence and gold, whilst travelling around the city and using their gold to bribe the guilds. The guilds allow them to change the dice they've rolled.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Lignum: Spiele-offensive Exclusives
description:
A mini expansion of six cards, released exclusively to backers of the spiele-offensive crowdfunding campaign.

This contains three Planned Work cards, and three Order cards.
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Worker Placement

name: Twin Stars: Adventure Series I – Scenario 01: Escape the Brig
description:
Two cosmic adventurers are in a tricky scenario and must work together. By rolling and manipulating dice for special abilities and combos, you can be the one that guides them to victory.

The guard tosses you into the dark cell and you hear the bolt clank into place. Your cries of "Come back!" are answered only with laughter, and heavy footfalls receding down the long corridor.

As your eyes slowly adjust to the darkness, you realize you are not alone. "We have to escape," the prisoner says, "Now."

In Twin Stars: Escape the Brig, two of you are locked up together and need to break free. You can dig a tunnel, but you need to watch out for the guard. There's also a pick that you can use to assist in your escape, but you need to be careful! You must escape to win. If the guard reaches the tunnel you lose.

Escape the Brig is a scenario in the Twin Stars solo system by Jason Tagmire and Mike Mullins. The game consists of just 3 cards and players will provide their own dice and coins/tokens. Each scenario comes with 2 all-new characters and can be interchanged with others for a very different gaming experience.

This is the first scenario in the Twin Stars family and was originally offered as a stretch goal for Button Shy's Pod-X Kickstarter.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: A Gate of Hell: The Campaign for Charleston, July-September 1863
description:
During the summer of 1863, in the aftermath of the Gettysburg and Vicksburg campaigns, battles on land and sea were fought over control of the birthplace of the Confederacy, Charleston, South Carolina. A Union victory here would send an unmistakable signal to the states in rebellion as well as the rest of the world that the Confederacy’s cause was lost and further fighting a waste of lives and effort.

A Confederate victory in the face of the tremendous Union host, that included every Union Ironclad on the Atlantic and Gulf coasts, as well as some of the most seasoned regiments that numbered among them the first formations of all Black soldiers (free US citizens as well as former slaves), would signify the war would go on and that two nations, not one, could be the result of this “second” American Revolution.

Players in A Gate of Hell: The Campaign for Charleston, July-September 1863 are cast in the roles of the historical commanders of the campaign; Pierre Gustave Toutant Beauregard for the Confederate defenders of Charleston, or Admiral Dahlgren and General Quincy Adams Gillmore of the Union. Can you do as well or better than they?

A Gate of Hell uses an interactive design to portray this decisive battle of the American Civil War. Players use “military support points” (MSPs), representing the logistical and political support for the campaign, to mobilize and support their forces (ground and naval) on one of the most inhospitable battlegrounds of the war. Both sides have a variety of military assets to deploy, but the planning and effective use of MSPs throughout the game will determine in large measure who is the victor. Units represent mostly regiments for the ground units, and each ironclad for the naval units. All of the famous batteries and forts, including Sumter and Wagner, are portrayed.

Rules cover Assault and Bombardment combats, multiple activations, the effects of battles elsewhere that can influence the actions at Charleston, the Union’s “Swamp Angel”, as well as the early completions of the Confederate ironclad Charleston and submarine Hunley.

Three scenarios are in included. One is on the April 1863 naval offensive by all of the Union ironclads that sought to defeat the rebels' fortresses and is an excellent single-turn introduction to the game’s naval combat rules. A second is another single-turn scenario on the initial Union assault on Morris Island and Battery Wagner. These single-turn scenarios take under an hour to game, and are well-suited for tournament play. The third covers the entire campaign and that takes about 6 hours to complete.

—description from the publisher

name: Confederate Rails: Railroading in the American Civil War 1861-1865
description:
Annual 2016 Issue

In the spring of 1861 the American Railroad Journal predicted that the majority of the railroads would be unaffected by the Civil War, a mistaken prophecy, indeed.

Confederate Rails, designed by Richard H. Berg, is a unique type of railroad game. Players operate the historical railways of the Confederate States of America during one of the "hottest wars" of the 19th Century – the American Civil War - which ends up turning it into a kind of an "anti-railroad" game. Not only do players have to deliver goods, supplies and military loads during a difficult time, but they have to adjust to a dwindling rail network.

Yes, paradoxically each player's rolling stock and rail net are at their absolute finest on the first turn. From there on in the players (representing the South's various railroad companies) battle Union military advances, each other, Confederate government decrees (and neglects), the rapidly inflating and worthless money, plus wear and tear on irreplaceable equipment.

The system also contains far more “outside events” than most rail games... thanks to the war. As the tagline on the cover suggests, it becomes an increasingly against the odds situation to stave off hunger and defeat among the South's armies.

Maps - One full color 22" x 34" mapsheet
Counters - 280 full color die-cut counters
Cards - 24 full color cards
Rules length - Around 12 pages
Charts and tables - 2
Complexity - Low
How challenging is it solitaire? - Poor
Playing time - Up to 3 to 4 hours for each game

Designer - Richard Berg
Development - Lembit Tohver
Graphic Design - Mark Mahaffey

—description from the publisher website
categories: American Civil War, Economic, Negotiation, Trains, Transportation, Wargame

name: Treasure Island: Cat Token
description:
A promotional chest token containing a cat icon on one side and text on the other side: "Steal an item already used by a pirate"

This token has been given as an extra for purchasing the base game at Spiel/Essen 2018.
categories: Bluffing, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Novel-based, Pirates
mechanics: Line Drawing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Les Gens Qui
description:
Les Gens Qui is THE party game to judge all the people who annoy us every day. It's a simple, fast and interactive card game.

The aim of the game? Try to guess what your friends think of these people.

Each player chooses a set of hand cards which will allow them to choose from 4 different sanctions: Heart On You, Just a Finger , One Year of Gulag or Death Sentence.

One the players is the judge. He takes 3 situation cards, reads them at loud and puts them face up in the middle of the board.

For example :

People who sniff instead of blowing their nose,
People who say "I'm not a racist, but...",
People who are ALWAYS late.


The judge gives his opinion by placing cards face down on the board. The other players do the same and vote, face down, trying to guess what the Judge has voted. The player who have the most answers in common with the Judge score 1 point for each correct answer!

—description from the publisher

name: The Boer War
description:
The Boer War is the first entry in this new series from Joseph Miranda and Canvas Temple Publishing. Boer War is based on the conflict between the British Empire and the Boer Republics of the Orange Free State and the Transvaal, which started in 1899 (generally known as the Second Boer War). The game covers the first year of the war; the conventional phase when the Boers could have gained a conventional victory. The latter part of the war was primarily a guerrilla conflict that did not officially end until 1902 and by which point a British victory was pretty much inevitable. In the game, each player is trying to seize an early victory: the British, in order to forestall the aforementioned guerrilla war, the Boers to gain sufficient support in Europe for their claims to full independence.

The game has three scenarios. Two of them begin with the commencement of hostilities in October 1899 and the initial Boer successes. The third begins with Lord Roberts taking command of British forces and launching the counteroffensive which took the major Boer towns.

Boer War Game Scale. One hexagon = approximately 90 kilometers. Each turn represents one month of operations. A corps represents two or three divisions plus corps echelon troops. A field force (division group) represents one or two reinforced divisions. A commando, brigade, or group represents 1-4000 fighting men.

name: Fabula Rasa: Seemannsgarn
description:
In Fabula Rasa, players take turns telling a constantly changing story as is typical of oral traditions. The motifs on the cards provide visual bullet points for people, objects, and locations that are central to the action, things that must be remembered in the correct order, with cards disappearing and new ones being added each round. Those who, as a narrator, manage to present their version of the story without errors will be rewarded accordingly.

In Fabula Rasa: Seemannsgarn, players slip into the role of sea dogs who tell each other all sorts of fantastic stories in the harbor bar about sunken ships, treasure maps, pirates, mysterious islands, dangers, and adventures at sea.

name: Rotten Plots
description:
Description from the publisher:

Rotten Plots is the Obscene Movie Making Party Game.
Create Ridiculous Movie Plots with Your Terrible Friends.

Rotten Plots, the newest creation from Dead Ends Entertainment, is a party game for sick and twisted people. This is a game for those who sit around and think, “Wow, that would be a hilarious and ridiculous idea for a movie.” With The Rotten Plots card game, you and your friends can compete to see who can create the most entertaining and humorous movie plot. You can win awards, and if you win enough of them, you can make your way to the top (or bottom) of the charts of the movie-making industry.

Rotten Plots was created to take the absurdity, vulgarity, and ridiculousness of card games to the next level. We are confident that this game will hurt people's feelings, and we're more than okay with that.


3-10 People can play this game. It's a perfect game for parties of all kinds.
30 - 60 Minutes is how long it will take you to decide to go do something else.
Must be 17+ to Play. Please don't show this game to your kids. Jesus Christ, please don't.


How to Play:

Each player grabs three cards of each option (PROTAGONIST, TRAIT/OBJECT, FIRST ACTION, ANTAGONIST, FINAL ACTION).
The "Executive Producer" Chooses Genre Card.
Players Create Plots in Selected Genre and Read Them Aloud.
The Plot That the Executive Producer Deems Best Wins the Award for That Round.
The First Person to Get Five Awards Wins the Game.

name: Late Night Alias
description:
Alias, but with "adult", sometimes even naughty words.

From the publisher:
Describe the words you CAN NOT say, by saying things you SHOULD NOT! Team up with friends and use the clues you heard to guess rude words. Get as many as you can in just one minute... Late Night Alias is ideal for fully-grown adults who want to act like naughty-little children!

With some very adult themes, and laugh-out-loud content, you should give rude clues if you don’t want to lose! But do you dare? The team with the most points wins. Includes card vault, game board, 6 colourful pieces, sand timer, pencil and 1800 words on 300 cards. Also has 100 BLANK cards so you can fill in your own filth!

name: Meteoropatici
description:
A weather board game that uses a voice assistant.
Meteoropaths are demanding travelers whose mood changes according to the weather: their goal is to live the ideal holiday by traveling in 7 different locations with the climatic conditions they prefer.
The meteoropaths available for each player are: the tan fanatic (look for places with a temperature of 25-35 degrees Celsius), the ecological backpacker (15-25), the decadent poet (10-20), the yeti (0-10).
Meteoropaths move on the board asking the voice assistant for information on the local weather: if the temperature is ideal for them, they earn a day off. Players are helped by souvenirs and baggage cards that they can conquer during the game.
The meteoropathic who first completes his 7-day vacation wins, also collecting 3 selfies in 3 different continents.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: Zagami
description:
Zagami is a game of Martian microbial life for four players. It requires a standard chessboard and a set of Icehouse Pieces.

Each player controls a single-colored colony of microbes, which moves and expands across the small meteorite in search of food. Multicolored stacks begin to form - microbes eating microbes eating microbes. As the game progresses, each colony evolves "enzymes" which allow it to metabolize other microbes into energy to be used for growing, sporing, attacking, and escaping. Only one colony will survive the long journey from Mars to Earth. Will it be yours?

name: Minigolf
description:
Tinplate golf game.

The board consists of six golf holes, not the normal kind but the holes you will expect on a Crazy Golf course.

In turn, each player must use the golfer to whack the ball up the course. This is done, by twisting him away from the ball and then move him back quickly to send the ball up the 'course'. After the six holes are finished, the player who took the least number of shots, wins.

name: Cul-De-Sac Conquest: NSFW
description: A 51-card expansion deck for Cul-De-Sac Conquest, featuring new adult-oriented (NSFW) cards.

name: Licht und Schatten
description:
Theme: The game has a fairy tale background story in which the young queen of the prosperous and happy "Sonnenland" ("Sunvale" in the English description) was flattered and seduced by her shadow via her dreams to tear apart her necklace of sun pearls. As she did so, the shadow became independent and ruled over the land, drainig life and colors from it. An old bard's song tells her that she needs to cross the country, aided by some companions (the players). So, it is a heroic prophesy fairy tale of saving a cursed land.

Goal: The game is semi - co - operative as the players share the goal of moving the queen from one corner of the board to the opposite corner. And all players lose if the shadow lands on the same tile as any other piece or if a player can't pay sun pearls when required by the game. However, players can give each other pearls at any time If the queen reaches the corner, all players are considered winners, but the player with the most pearls is considered the most successful.

Gameplay: The game is played on a modular board made up of 5 x 5 tiles which are turned upside down and upside up during play. Players take turns. During a turn, two special dice are thrown to determine the movement of pieces on the board: depending on the result, either the player moves their figure and the shadow in opposing directions or the players get a chance to move the queen one tile towards the goal. In order to move the queen, players draw a task card asking them for some kind of word (e.g. "name a tool") the letters of which are restricted by the current state of the tiles on the board using an hour glass as a time limit. The task cards come in three levels of difficulty.

The game has a strong element of luck as an unfortunate die roll can easily cause the players to lose with no means of direct protection against it. Player decision/influence is limited to the word game and deciding the path the queen figure takes (although that is also restricted so as to forbid detours).

Important: While the game comes with a 4 - language rules booklet, the task cards are monolingual in German, so at least one person needs to be able to understand that language. In addition, the background story is simplified in the translations and the element of the player with the most sun pearls at the end of the game being the most successful is missing.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Team-Based Game

name: Wikinder
description: Together with his father Leo, 12-year old Federico Colovini has developed the children's game Wikinder (Vikids). As the captains of Viking boats, the players sail from island to island and load barrels - either from the island or from an opponent's boat that happens to be moored there. The goal is to be the first player to bring a certain number of barrels back to his home island. On a player's turn, he rolls three coloured dice. They decide how many islands further his boat may sail - but it's different than what many players are used to. If the player's own colour is rolled, then his movement is reduced by one. If he has barrels on board, then none of those colours may be rolled either. The more colourful the load, the greater the chance of not moving very far and losing the load instead. An innovative idea.

name: The Shock Of Impact: Rules for Ancient Period Wargames
description:
Ancients wargames rules written out of frustration with the WRG and other existing rule sets in the late 70s and early 80s.

Heavily based upon troop morale and with the basis that tactics should replicate those used in real life.
Spans the period 1600 B.C. - 1066 A.D.

name: Labyrinth
description: The Felsberger Labyrinth is a beautifully made game that plays very well. The high-quality board houses a set of movable channels and, as expected, the goal is to get the ball to flow the way you want it to. The board sits on a stand that allows it to tilt in any direction.

name: UNO MASTER
description:
UNO version with time remaining for take cards.

The rules are the same that basic UNO game -- players play cards to a central pile if they can match color or number, or use a special card. However, there is a timer machine for a non-stop match. There are 3 skill levels: an easy level with 8 seconds, a medium level with 6 seconds and a hard level with 4 seconds.

Throw or take a card and switch on the red button before ends your time. If you do it later, you must take 4 additional cards!

name: Arcane Legions: Booster Pack
description:
These come in several different series without a clear indication.
Each League Booster Pack seems to contain miniatures painted differently than those in the booster packs but with no gameplay differences. Each includes a unique painted flag with no gameplay function (does not currently fit any unit cards).
categories: Ancient, Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Mythology

name: Steam Pirates
description:
In the vast world of Materia, two factions are fighting to seize power over the people who wish to live peacefully in their cities. The Pirate Syndicate is a business-driven corporation that vies to gain as much power by exploiting the "honest" merchants. Their Queen Pirate loves to use the fastest vessel in all of Materia, The Dreadnought, to dominate the sea of clouds. The Great British Empire is a monarch regime that controls most of the known city-islands. The king's hand, the Governor of the seven seas, is the most dominant person who loves to enforce his laws by lashing out his fearsome Flying Fortress after contraband dealing pirates.

In Steam Pirates, each player builds their own trading network of piracy by dealing in four types of goods: coal, rum, firearms, and automatons. Your goal is to capitalize the "open" market by selling your goods while maneuvering your frigate to explore new markets and new resourceful allies.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Economic, Exploration, Pirates
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building

name: Board Royale: The Island – Missions Expansion Pack
description: Ha veyou ever thought about why you have been stranded on this Island ? Everything is part of a big sinister plan set in motion by K.R.A.K.E.N. Industries. They bought you here for ... Job Application.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Board Royale: The Island – Skills II Expansion Pack
description: The Island is so popular now. It is full of new faces. Skills 2 Expansion comes with brand new 6 unique playable character classes. Like our previous Skills Expansion, each class has their unique set of skills that will change the way you play the game entirely.

name: Careful
description:
Careful is a dexterity game similar to Villa Paletti and Jenga. In the set-up, players build a bell tower five levels high using the plastic colored support posts and floors provided, as dictated by the color dots on the floor levels. Supports are not placed on the top floor; a heavy plastic-enclosed bell structure is placed in the centre of this level, which sounds when the tower becomes unstable. Then comes the deconstruction.

A turn consists of spinning the spinner and removing a pillar of the color spun from any floor of the tower. The floor levels have channels cut in them that makes the movement and removal of the support posts a challenge. Players may manipulate the tower as necessary to remove the pillar, but all pillars removed on a turn that are not the spun color must be replaced before removing the objective support post. Play continues until the tower falls; the player causing this to occur receives no points for the round whilst all other players receive points based on the color and number of supports taken on their turns.

Players play a number of rounds equal to the number of players playing. The player who accumulates the most points is the winner.

name: The Art of Conversation
description:
"The time has come," the Walrus said, "to speak of many things.."
- Lewis Carroll

Designed to revive the art of conversation, The Art of Conversation is a fabulous way to make all get-togethers of Families and friends memorable.

The Art of Conversation can even help revive relationships! And get the whole family talking again!

With 300 fascinating, conversation building questions, plus 4 blank cards on which to write your own The Art of Conversation questions, this game is for everyone.

The only knowledge needed to successfully contribute
to The Art of Conversation is your own life experiences, interests and ideas.

Ages - Adult to children - may be played at various levels.

The Art of Conversation is also a wonderful therapeutic, educational and corporate resource.

Each time The Art of Conversation is used, new and harmonious outcomes evolve.

There are 9 ways to play. There are competitive/scoring options included.

name: BN1: A Board Game All About Brighton
description:
"Welcome to Brighton - a place where individuality is a competition, self- consciousness is an art form and nobody can hear the real world over the hum of cafetieres. In short, the perfect setting for a day out."

You and up to four friends must travel the length and breadth of the city looking for interesting things to do and see. And adventure can be found in the most unlikely places.

From the South Downs to Black Rock,the day is yours to spend as you please. You could explore the obvious sights or uncover hidden corners. You could stalk local celebrities or stumble upon resident legends. You could go busking or shopping, gambling or picnicking. You could be mugged in broad daylight or handed a flyer for the best party ever.

But you won’t know till you dive in, so what are you waiting for?

HOW TO PLAY

Starting at Brighton train station, each player takes a coloured pawn and their first Destination card. This is where they're supposed to visit first to score the associated points, but there's nothing to say they can't just explore off the beaten track and find adventure that way as well. Either approach will score Anecdote Points, which are the currency and aim of the game - score 50 Anecdote Points and get back to Brighton station, and you've won.

Moving around the board either on foot or using public transport such as trains, buses and taxis, players can discover local characters, eccentrics, celebrities and city events - some of these are activated immediately, others act as subquests for the players to compete for. As well as these encounters, players can also go shopping for a variety of items that will help them or protect them from the dastardly tricks that'll be played on them through the course of the game via the Sneak cards deck players can accrue.

For instance, if you meet a local celebrity there's every chance another player will play a Lookalike card on you, so that celebrity was just a close likeness and therefore worth no points. If you trawl across the city to a destination miles away, a player may decide it's been closed for repairs. You might get a taxi only to be at the mercy of someone who doesn't know north from south, and end up streets away from where you intended.

Combining the skills of maze orientation, inventory and money management, player interaction and risk assessment, BN1 also relies on a healthy dose of luck. And with over 100 different encounters, 40 odd unique destinations, a brace of shop items and a couple of dozen different Sneak cards, it's an expansive adventure with a high replay value.


The first edition of BN1, released at the start of November 2012, was a limited run of 500 hand-numbered copies. It's available from shops around Brighton, and also the Bedsit Games website). It is now in its 3rd edition.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Exploration, Humor, Maze

name: Les Cent-Heures de Waterloo: La Campagne de Belgique, 1815
description:
Les Cent-Heures de Waterloo: La Campagne de Belgique, 1815 (The Hundred Hours of Waterloo) is an Operational level two-player board-wargame that brings into play Napoleon's dramatic and final campaign in Belgium in June 1815.
One player controls the Army of the North (hereafter called the French player) and the other the Anglo-Dutch and Prussian factions (hereafter called the Allied player).

Players are moving 1/2 corps on a "point to point" map.

(source: rulebook and user's description)

name: Länder Europas
description:
The bus is crisscrossing Europe, passing through 51 countries. No wonder the tourists are gradually becoming disoriented. Can you figure out what country you are in?

In Länder Europas', the sooner a country is correctly identified, the more points will be awarded. The player who knows the map of Europe best and can get their tourist around the board first wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Snake Oil
description:
From the publisher (edited):

Snake Oil - The medicine show card game! Step right up, ladies & gents! Make fantastic medical claims for your bottled elixir. Slander your opponents and steal their secrets! Avoid angry mobs and law enforcement while weaseling the highest price possible for your Snake-Oil!

3-4 players is ideal, but can be played by 2-8.

From the rules:

The Setting: In the latter part of the 19th Century and well into the 20th, an industry boomed across the American Midwest. That industry was the Medicine Show, where any entrepreneur with a questionable recipe and plenty of business savvy could pull his wagon up to the center of town and hawk his medicinal wares for a few cents per bottle. You and your opponents are these peddlers of “Snake-Oil”.

The Object: In Snake-Oil, the object is to achieve the highest per bottle price for your elixir. To do this, you may have to hire thugs, slander your opponents and plant ringers in the crowd. But it’s all in good fun and, hey, you always have the next town for your opponents to get revenge.

Game Length: A game of Snake-Oil can last is little as 5 minutes or as long as an hour, depending on how many towns you and your opponents decide to hit. Each hand of Snake-Oil constitutes a town. The game includes a score sheet with room for the name of your product and a running tally for three towns. When you’ve played the number of hands you’ve agreed upon, add up the totals for each town and the winner is the player with the highest total value.

Setup: Each player is dealt 7 cards face down (if there are more than 4 players, deal 5 cards each). This constitutes his hand at the start of the game. The remaining cards are placed in the middle of the table, and the discard pile will go next to it. The player to the dealer’s left goes first.

Play: A player must first play a Cure if he has one. This goes directly in front of him in his playing area. He may then play any other card (except for another Cure). If he doesn’t have a Cure to play first, he may go directly to playing his second card. [Cards that are not Cures modify the value of the Cures or may cause Cures to be switched or discarded, etc.] He may opt not to play a second card. At the end of the player’s turn, he may draw as many cards from the deck as necessary to ensure he ends the turn with 7 cards in his hand. A player may opt to discard his entire hand and draw an equal amount of cards from the deck in lieu of playing any cards on his turn. This simply indicates his wagon has burned down and he’s buying new ingredients.

Ending the Hand: The hand ends when the player who draws the last card from the deck finishes his turn, or when a hand-ending card is played successfully. There are 2 such cards: Rain! and Bust!. There is also a counter (or negating card) for each of them. A player may not end the hand by this method unless he has a value of at least 20¢ in front of him. Ending a hand by this method does not affect any cards already in play.

Added Hype: There is a quick table included to randomly determine the name of your product (handy if you’re playing a four town Medicine Show). Snake-Oil is fun to play, but it’s a lot MORE fun when players start getting into the spirit of the game and hyping their products with zeal. Loosen up, have fun and enjoy your game of Snake-Oil!

name: Nubes
description:
How many times did you watch the sky thinking about the shape of the clouds?

Nubes is a game in which you have one minute to guess and build more shape of the clouds than your opponents.

The player in turn takes one card from the deck. Then he/she must build the object in the card using 16 clouds of 8 different shapes/sizes.

The other players must guess which object it is. No speaking or sounds are allowed.

The player who says the correct object keeps the card (one point) and the active players takes another card until time is up.

Active player receives one point for each guessed object.
categories: Children's Game, Deduction, Party Game, Puzzle

name: Cross-City
description: This is a Wild West game. Welcome to Cross City, build a saloon or perhaps a Sheriffs department. This game has a little bit of Monopoly, but just a little, the rulebook is 30 pages long.

name: Squirrel Squabble
description:
In Squirrel Squabble, a player must outguess, outmaneuver, and outsmart his opponent to be the first squirrel to gather five nuts and return home.

This free print-and-play game consists of just a single page of components to build. Nine double-sided tiles are used to form a tight, 3x3 playing grid on which the squirrels move to try to gather nuts. Each player also has six double-sided action tiles, which are used to simultaneously program three actions per round. These actions allow the players not only to move, but also to change the makeup of the board, battle the opposing squirrel, and even change the opponent's actions!
mechanics: Action Queue, Pick-up and Deliver, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Trek 12: de la Saint Valentin
description:
Trek 12 de la Saint Valentin is an official print and play mini-expansion, offered by the publisher in february 2021.

It consists in a new player board to play in duo. Play secretly, without looking at the board of the other. Start where you want, then follow the classic rules but with the specific INTENSITY and HARMONY rules and ways to score.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play

name: Panic!
description:
Panic! is a card game of commodity trading between the wealthiest of gentlemen. Players attempt to corner the market for the scarcest commodities while dumping or trading the least valuable. Gameplay is fast and entertaining as the market is constantly shifting and your opponents and continually changing the dynamics of the trading floor.

Panic! includes three games in one box. Bull Market is a bidding game designed by James Ernest, Greg Parsons and Mick Sullivan in which secret information can make or break your day's excursion to the trading floor. Bear Market, designed by James Ernest, is a fast-playing drafting game in which making the best of what comes your way is key. Inside Traders, designed by Jeff Horger, is a trick-taking variant using the same basic concepts.

All of the games rely on a Panic! stage where there is a flurry of dumped commodities when players begin to see what direction the current hand is going.

The box includes ninety commodity suit cards, a value tracking board, and nine commodity tokens.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Set Collection, Trading, Trick-taking

name: Starships
description:
This is really a tile-laying game using cards. An improved version of Up the Creek (a.k.a. Ogallala) transposed to a Science Fiction context.

In a "space dock" you build up starships. Cards represent prows and poops, and everything in between --missile launchers, laser turrets, shuttles...Special "prizes" appear as pairs of cards; should you be lucky enough to draw both halves and play them side by side, it is worth more. Each of these prizes is worth even more if played in the same starship as a specific accompanying card.

At any point, you have to choose between closing a starship (and scoring) or building it up some more. In addition, complete starships can attack the other player's starships...

There is little control in this game, as the players simply draw then place cards - but there's still some reasonable amount of strategy in the placements. The simplicity makes it accessible to children, whilst it remains enjoyable by adults as a light, quick game.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Science Fiction

name: Wasserdrachen
description:
Water dragons from HABA is an exciting board game for children from 5 years. When the water dragons emerge from the depths of the ocean, the children help them swim into the dragon bay and lay their eggs there. With the right tactics, luck in rolling the dice and a joker card at the right moment, the respective dragon reaches its destination particularly quickly. But beware: dangerous sharks cross the path to the sea bay! The first to reach the bay with his water dragon wins.

—description from the publisher

name: 11th Hour Dungeon
description:
You have the treasure in your hands. Now you need to escape! This is a solo print-and-play game where you play as an adventurer trying to escape a dungeon. But both Time and a wide array of Creatures are not on your side!

Equipped with a set of 7 dice, a pencil, and an eraser you will attempt your escape. On each turn, depending on the roll of dice, you will move, combat creatures, and loot the dungeon for equipment and spells that will aid you in your escape. However, with each turn you will also roll to track the passage of time. Escape, and you win! But first you must survive the treasure-guarding creatures, and make it to the exit to the dungeon before the clock fills up.

-description from designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Cloudbusters
description: A wargame set on a world where only high plateaus are habitable. The only way that people can get around is by airships. Each players starts with a small fleet of airships on a plateau in the corner of the map, and attempts to expand and conquer as many other plateaus as possible. Each captured plateau provides additional income (used for building more airships, and possibly also for buying extra movement dice) and a special ability token.

name: Fields of Honor: The American War for Independence
description:
An introductory level wargame, using a simplified version of the Fields of Honor miniatures rules for playing the American War of Independence on a regimental scale.

Several individual battle scenarios are included (Bunker Hill, Brandywine, Monmouth, Freeman's Farm, Bemis Heights (Saratoga) and Guilford Court House), plus a campaign game covering the entire conflict. Maps and counters are provided for playing all six scenarios, but the game can also be played with miniatures.
