categories: Age of Reason, American Revolutionary War, Miniatures, Wargame

name: As the World Turns
description:
"As played by the Hughes family on the Television Show As The World Turns."

The game mechanics are very similar to the "shortened game" version of Monopoly. Players are dealt Passport and Travel cards at the beginning of the game and pay the Customs Fund (bank) the value of those cards. Players then take turns moving their pawns around the board. If they land on a city space, they pay the indicated amount to the owner(s) of the passport(s) for that city. Landing on other types of spaces results in various actions like drawing a Customs card, spinning the world spinner, and moving off-course.

The winner is the person with the most money when the game ends. The game ends when a player completes both legs of the course and lands on the "home" space. Triggering the end of the game is optional: if a player doesn't think he/she has enough money to win the game, they can pass the home space and continue along the second half of the course.
categories: Adventure, Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Travel

name: Tower of Druaga
description:
Based off of Namco's arcade fantasy game that had a twingle of an RPG feel to it.

This game plays very very loosely like Dungeon! but is even more basic. You move through each level of the dungeon to get a key. You roll a die for movement, take the shortest route towards the key, and after every roll (the game does not even have rooms or such), you have an encounter with a monster that you must fight. You get a treasure for each victory, and once you have the key, you can open the door that leads to the next level, and continue doing so on each level until you get to the 6th level where the princess is.

name: Ultraman
description:
Part of Bandai's Game for Adult -"IF" series.

Game for Adult meaning aimed at older players, not anything with objectionable content.

"If" just refers to the their gimmick of setting up each game in the series as a "What if... (insert game scenario)"

Complexity 2 on Bandai's 1-7 scale (1=easiest)

Includes many small figures for various creatures. There are a number of scenarios include to recreate different battles from the TV show(s).
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Monster Maker School
description:
Alternate name: Monster Maker Gakuen

Side-story to the main Monster Maker series, this is the 1st in a series of card games featuring the Monster Maker characters in a still-fantasy high school setting.

In this one, try to match up characters to make them fall in love, but there are such things to worry about like having an ex-girlfriend Succubus.

name: Le Camino
description:
In this game the players (2 or 4 playing as partners) are trying to connect two opposite corners of the board with a road. Unlike in many connection games, the players' roads may cross each other and even run contiguously. In addition to the roads, there are rivers and railroad tracks which interfere with placement. Players score based on the length of their roads (shorter is better) and the number of rivers and railroads crossed over (fewer is better). There are a number of rules which together can cause significant numbers of forced placements in a way vaguely reminiscent of Fresh Fish.

The game won l'Oscar du Jouet 1974 in the Jeux Senior category.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Power Play
description: Played according to regular hockey rules. It has a chess like style to the game play. Be the person to score the most goals in the three periods.

name: 21 Freeze Out
description:
The game's objective seems rather simple - collect 5 cards which equal 21. But with Wild cards, Freeze cards, Defrost cards, Anti-Freeze cards and a Blizzard card, the road to victory is not always easy. Variations include Partner play & Multi-Board play.

Difficult (but not impossible) game to find.
INCLUDES: 6 colored Play boards, 126 Numbered cards (21 each of 6 colors --- 2 cards each color of numbers 1, 2, 3, 7, 8 & 9 and 3 cards each color of numbers 4, 5 & 6), 21 Chill cards (4 Wild, 4 Defrost, 6 Freeze, 6 Anti-Freeze & 1 Blizzard) & instructions.
